headlines: Airbus to stop producing world's largest passenger jet A380
text: European planemaker Airbus has announced it will make its last deliveries of its A380 jet, the world's largest commercial passenger plane, in 2021. The decision comes after Emirates, the largest customer of the A380, reduced an outstanding order for 53 planes to only 14. The cancellation will affect the jobs of as many as 3,500 Airbus staff.

headlines: Priyanka among front-row attendees at Michael Kors NYFW show
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra was among the front-row attendees at American designer Michael Kors' Fall 2019 show at New York Fashion Week. Sharing a picture with the designer on Instagram, Priyanka wrote, "Congratulations Michael Kors on another successful NYFW show!" Hollywood actresses Kate Hudson and Kerry Washington were also seen seated with Priyanka in the front row at the event.

headlines: Google to invest $13 billion in US in 2019: CEO Pichai
text: Google aims to invest $13 billion in offices and data centres in the US in 2019, CEO Sundar Pichai revealed. This will enable Google to hire "tens of thousands of employees" alongside creation of over 10,000 construction jobs, Pichai said. "2019 marks the second year in a row well grow faster outside of Bay Area than in it", he added.

headlines: Twitter testing 'profile preview' feature on iOS app
text: Micro-blogging platform Twitter is testing a new 'profile preview' feature on its iOS app to check user profiles without leaving the timeline. The feature lets users see a card with information including options to follow or mute an account after tapping on the account's '@' handle in a tweet. This will encourage people to check profiles before responding, Twitter said.

headlines: Can't believe a CM is using such language for SC: BJP on Kejriwal
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called the Supreme Court ruling in the Delhi government vs Lieutenant Governor case unconstitutional, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said, "We cannot believe a democratically elected CM can use this type of language for the Supreme Court." Patra added, "He's always been an anarchist, tampering with rules while putting the Constitution at stake is his method."

headlines: Delhi's power isn't unlimited: Former CM Sheila on SC ruling
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called the Supreme Court judgement in the Delhi government vs Lieutenant Governor case unconstitutional, former CM Sheila Dikshit said, "The Constitution has defined the power Delhi has, it is not unlimited." Sheila added, "Centre, Lieutenant Governor and Home Ministry handle a lot of things... Power doesn't depend on the number of seats you have."

headlines: Congress has virtually ruled out alliance with AAP: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said the Congress has "more or less" ruled out an alliance with the AAP. His comments came after he had participated in a meeting with opposition leaders, including Congress President Rahul Gandhi. Asked whether the AAP was more eager for an alliance with the Congress, he said the BJP would benefit in a three-cornered contest.

headlines: Kejriwal, Congress just want to rule and loot: Kiren Rijiju
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called the Supreme Court judgement in the Delhi government vs Lieutenant Governor case unconstitutional, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju claimed, "Kejriwal and Congress do not trust any constitutional body." Rijiju added, "They criticise Election Commission, CAG, Supreme Court... Anarchy is in their scheme of things... They just want to rule and loot."

headlines: Philippine news site Co-founder, critical of govt, arrested
text: Maria Ressa, Co-founder of online news startup Rappler, critical of Philippine President Duterte's government, was arrested on Wednesday for a seven-year-old report on a businessman's alleged ties to a former judge. The award-winning journalist has since been freed on bail after her arrest, which drew international condemnation. Ressa had been named among TIME magazine's Person of the Year 2018.

headlines: Punjab woman strangled with wire, husband & in-laws arrested
text: The police have arrested the mother-in-law, father-in-law, brother-in-law and husband of a 23-year-old woman after her body was recovered from their home in Lehragaga, Punjab. The deceased, Sukhjit Kaur, had married the main accused, Lovepreet Singh, three years ago. Stating that the couple quarrelled often over petty issues, the police said Lovepreet had strangled Sukhjit with a wire.

headlines: Iranian journo criticises Trump for using her pic against Iran
text: Iranian photojournalist Yalda Moayeri has criticised US President Donald Trump for using her photo without permission to denounce Iran's leadership on the 40th anniversary of the Iranian Revolution. "(H)aving Trump use (the picture)...is a great shame for me and causes me deep sorrow", she said. She further criticised Trump's policies and sanctions which she claimed are "devastating our lives".

headlines: Dog named 'Donald Trump' killed in US
text: A dog named 'Donald Trump' was shot and killed in Minnesota, US, with the authorities saying the person who shot the dog was "legally protecting their livestock" on private property. The dog's owner, Randal Thom, is a supporter of US President Donald Trump. Authorities further dismissed rumours that Thom's neighbour, believed to be a Democrat, intentionally killed the dog.

headlines: Who Alia is dating not relevant to my equation with her: Katrina
text: Katrina Kaif, while appearing on 'Famously Filmfare', was asked about her equation with Alia Bhatt after she started dating Katrina's ex-boyfriend Ranbir Kapoor. Katrina answered, "Who she was dating was not relevant to the equation...I shared with her. So why should that...change?" She earlier said there's a lot of "enjoyment and comfort" when she and Alia are together.

headlines: Ex-hockey captain booked for getting job with fake SC certificate
text: An FIR has been filed against ex-India hockey team captain Mukesh Kumar and his brother for allegedly obtaining fake Scheduled Caste (SC) certificates from a Secunderabad Tehsildar and securing jobs in the Indian Airlines in 2007. Mukesh, an Arjuna awardee, said he had been having the SC certificate from Class I. The brothers belong to BC 'A' Nayee Brahmin community.

headlines: Nehwal refuses to play national c'ships match due to poor surface
text: Defending champion Saina Nehwal refused to play her opening singles match of Senior National Badminton Championships in Guwahati, citing a "poor playing surface". Saina was scheduled to play Shruti Mundada in a pre-quarterfinal clash. "The wooden planks came out at a couple of places after Sindhu played her match. So they are now going to fix it," Parupalli Kashyap revealed.

headlines: Why are you smiling at me, Do you like boys? WI bowler asked Root
text: Windies pacer Shannon Gabriel has issued "unreserved apology" for his comments to England captain Joe Root in the third Test, which led to him being banned for four ODIs. Gabriel revealed he had asked Root, who was looking at him "intensely", "Why are you smiling at me? Do you like boys?" He added he initially thought it was "inoffensive taunt".

headlines: Martin Guptill gets interviewed by wife after his 15th ODI ton
text: New Zealand opener Martin Guptill was interviewed by his wife and TV presenter Laura McGoldrick after he won Man of the Match award for smashing his 15th ODI hundred, against Bangladesh on Wednesday. The 32-year-old scored an unbeaten 117 off 116 balls including four sixes and eight fours. Guptill also received a bottle of champagne from Laura for his award.

headlines: Unki umar ho gayi hai: Rabri Devi on Mulayam praising PM Modi
text: After SP supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav praised PM Narendra Modi in Lok Sabha, ex-Bihar CM Rabri Devi said, "Unki umar ho gayi hai." Rabri added, "Yaad nahi rehta hai kab kya bol denge. Unki boli ka koi mayene nahi rakhta (His memory is failing him. His words aren't valid)". Yadav had said he hopes PM Modi comes back to power.

headlines: My hug finished PM Modis hatred for me, says Rahul Gandhi
text: Referring to his act of hugging Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Parliament during the no-confidence motion, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "Modiji had hatred for me. I went and hugged him and finished that hatred." Rahul, who was addressing Congress workers in Rajasthan, added, "If the BJP and the RSS abuse us, we must fight them with love."

headlines: Beaten by police, ABVP workers: SP youth leader
text: SP youth leader Richa Singh has claimed the police and members of RSS' students' wing ABVP "brutally attacked" her during a protest at Allahabad University. Accusing the police of framing false charges, Singh tweeted, "I am suffering jaw and head injury and admitted in hospital." The protest was organised after SP chief Akhilesh Yadav was stopped from flying to Prayagraj.

headlines: Cong trolls PM, BJP leaders with their cartoons on Valentine's Day
text: Congress tweeted caricatures of PM Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders trolling them on Valentine's Day. The party captioned PM Modi's caricature, "The Accidental Chowkidar: Chori chori, Chupke Chupke", while on Smriti Irani's cartoon, it wrote, "The Walking-Talking Meme: Main Tulsi, Yale ke garden ki!" "The Fast and Furious: Chal chhaiyya chhaiyya x2," read the caption on Piyush Goyal's cartoon.

headlines: Govt may relax FDI norms for single-brand retailers: Report
text: The Cabinet is reportedly considering a proposal to relax mandatory 30% local sourcing norms for foreign single-brand retailers. As per existing FDI norms, 100% foreign investment is permitted but with 30% of the value of the goods sourced from the country. The proposal also suggests that retailers may sell online before opening a physical store if they invest $200 million.

headlines: Wholesale inflation drops to 2.76% in January, lowest in 10 months
text: India's annual wholesale price inflation eased to a 10-month low of 2.76% in January, helped by a smaller increase in prices of manufactured goods and fuel products, government data showed on Thursday. It was 3.8% in December last year. Data also showed a decline in India's retail inflation to an 18-month low of 2.05% in January.

headlines: IIT student stabs classmate over proposing same girl on Valentine's
text: A second-year IIT Madras MTech student named Manoj allegedly stabbed his classmate Pramod inside the campus on Wednesday. Hailing from Haryana, both were reportedly in love with the same girl and the fight was over who would get to propose to her on Valentine's Day. Police have detained Manoj for questioning while Pramod is recovering at a local hospital.

headlines: Don't make a 12th pass person PM again: Arvind Kejriwal
text: Addressing AAP's 'Tanashahi Hatao, Loktantra Bachao' rally on Wednesday, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said, "Last time you made a 12th pass person the Prime Minister. Don't do it again." Kejriwal added, "The post of PM is very important... Find someone educated." He further claimed, "A 12th pass person lacks the understanding of where he puts his signature."

headlines: Why isnt PM instructing banks to take money I'm offering: Mallya
text: Talking about PM Narendra Modi's speech in Lok Sabha in a series of tweets, fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya said, "I noticed that he (PM) referred to an unnamed person who 'ran away' with 9,000 crores." "I respectfully ask why the Prime Minister is not instructing his banks to take the money I have put on the table," he added.

headlines: 62-year-old Punjab man wanting to marry daughter-in-law kills son
text: A 62-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing his 40-year-old son in Punjab's Faridkot after rift over the accused's alleged affair with his son's wife. The man killed his son with a sharp weapon, cut his body into pieces and dumped them in a sewer in plastic bags. Police said the accused was planning to marry the victim's wife.

headlines: Apple tech exploited to put hacked apps on iPhones: Reuters
text: Illicit software distributors are exploiting technology made by Apple to distribute hacked versions of iPhone apps including Spotify, Angry Birds and Pokemon Go to block ads or bypass fees and game rules, Reuters has revealed. The software pirates used digital certificates meant for corporations to skip App Store for their staff-only apps. "We're...prepared to take immediate action," Apple said.

headlines: Mulayam praised PM to distract from corruption charges: Amar Singh
text: Rajya Sabha MP Amar Singh accused SP supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav of praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Lok Sabha to divert attention from corruption charges against Mulayam and BSP chief Mayawati. Singh said Mulayam was trying to "create confusion" and ensure that "Modiji gets neutralised." Mulayam had said he wished for another term for PM Modi.

headlines: Poor Akhilesh: Omar Abdullah after Mulayam praises PM Modi
text: After SP supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav claimed he wanted Prime Minister Narendra Modi to become PM again, former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah tweeted, "Poor Akhilesh!" SP, which is led by Mulayam's son Akhilesh Yadav, has entered into an alliance with BSP to defeat BJP in the Lok Sabha polls in Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: BJP set Northeast on fire, we'll conquer it with love: Rahul
text: In an apparent reference to the protests that took place due to the proposed Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, Congress President Rahul Gandhi today said, "They (BJP) set the entire Northeast on fire, however, we will make sure we conquer it with love." He added, "They spread hatred, abuse me and my family, and the Congress president... hugs them in the Parliament."

headlines: OYO raises $100 mn from Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing
text: OYO Rooms has raised $100 million from Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing, according to documents filed with the Registrar of Companies. This marks the closing of the $1-billion financing round that OYO had announced last year at a valuation of $5 billion. OYO had raised $800 million in September 2018 led by SoftBank's Vision Fund.

headlines: Pak sends back Indian teenager who crossed border by mistake
text: Pakistan has sent back a 16-year-old Indian boy who had crossed the border by mistake and entered Pakistan in August last year. The teenager, identified as Bimal Narjee from Assam, was handed over to the Border Security Force via Wagah Border on Tuesday after the completion of all legal requirements and the verification of his identity.

headlines: US asks its citizens to reconsider travel to Pak due to terrorism
text: The US State Department has issued an advisory to its citizens to reconsider travelling to Pakistan mainly due to terrorism and risks to civil aviation operating within or near the country. It asked its citizens not to travel to the provinces of Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, including the former Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA).

headlines: Ex-US Air Force intelligence agent charged with spying for Iran
text: Monica Witt, a former US Air Force counterintelligence agent, has been charged with spying for Iran, sharing information about her colleagues and US intelligence operations. Witt served in the US Air Force from 1997 to 2008 and worked as a contractor from 2008 to 2010. She allegedly defected to Iran in 2013.

headlines: World court to rule on Iran's $1.75 bn case against US
text: The International Court of Justice has ruled it has jurisdiction over a case filed by Iran to recover $1.75-billion assets frozen by the US. The US Supreme Court had ruled that the money must go to the victims of attacks blamed on Iran. Iran says freezing of the funds violates terms of a 1955 treaty it signed with the US.

headlines: upGrad's TVC with Vicky aims to break myths about online learning
text: upGrad's first TVC with Vicky Kaushal aims to break the myth of online learning being ineffective. It showcases its impact and how it is as good as traditional offline education. It further intends to establish the fact that in this fast-changing world of technology, theres massive demand for new-age skills and that one needs to upskill for a better career.

headlines: ACB to fall under L-G & electricity dept under Delhi govt: SC
text: In Delhi government vs Lieutenant Governor case, the Supreme Court ruled that Anti-Corruption Bureau and inquiry commission fall under Lieutenant Governor's jurisdiction. Delhi government will have control over electricity and revenue departments and revision of minimum rates of agricultural land, the court stated. A larger bench will decide on who'll have jurisdiction over 'services' in Delhi.

headlines: Guy tried on me 10yrs ago, threw me out of shoot on opposing: Gautam
text: Actor and Bigg Boss 8 winner Gautam Gulati, while revealing he faced sexual harassment in the industry when he was 21 years old, said, "Somebody tried on me...ten years ago." "I completely went against that guy...I was thrown out of the modelling shoot but I didn't care," he added. Gautam further said one should have the courage to say no.

headlines: A female fan once shared her room number with me at a hotel: Vicky
text: Actor Vicky Kaushal, while appearing on 'Famously Filmfare', revealed a female fan once shared her room number after taking a selfie with him at a hotel. "She was like, 'Okay, I'm staying in this room and I'll see you at the bar'," he said. "I...thought to myself ki yaar itna confidence toh mujhme bhi nahi hai," Vicky added.

headlines: If Shastri can't be a part of IPL then Ponting shouldn't too: Warne
text: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne has said if India coach Ravi Shastri cannot be a part of an IPL team then Ricky Ponting shouldn't too. Ponting, who is Delhi Capitals' head coach, was recently appointed Australia's assistant coach for the World Cup. Notably, Shastri and other Team India support staff members can't join IPL teams due to 'conflict of interest'.

headlines: Smart bed that changes temperature at night for better sleep made
text: American company Eight Sleep has unveiled a smart bed called 'The Pod', which changes its temperature throughout the night to improve the user's sleep. "Body temperature changes during the night," said the company's CEO. The bed also uses its AI and biofeedback sensors to determine the best temperature for sleep between 55 to 115 degrees Fahrenheit throughout the night.

headlines: Puducherry CM stages dharna, sleeps outside LG Kiran Bedis house
text: Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy began a dharna with state ministers on Wednesday and spent the night outside Raj Nivas after blocking its entrances, in protest against Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi. Demanding that Bedi accord sanction for 39 government proposals, he accused her of stalling development projects and said, "She is being encouraged by PM to create problems for our government."

headlines: You're like sisters: K'taka Speaker withdraws rape victim remark
text: After disapproval from women MLAs for comparing himself to a "rape victim", Karnataka Assembly Speaker Ramesh Kumar said he has directed his office to remove his remark from the records. Adding he had no intention to cause pain to women, Kumar asserted, "All of you are like mothers and sisters." He also blamed media for "adding masala" to the issue.

headlines: His son should also accept truth: Yogi on Mulayam praising PM
text: After Samajwadi Party supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav claimed he wanted Prime Minister Narendra Modi to become PM again, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said, "His son (Akhilesh) should also accept this truth." Yogi added, "Truth always wins. What Mulayamji said in Parliament is the truth." Akhilesh-led SP has entered into an alliance with BSP to defeat BJP in Lok Sabha polls.

headlines: NASA declares Opportunity rover dead after 15 years on Mars
text: NASA on Wednesday declared its longest-running Mars rover 'Opportunity' dead after over 800 failed attempts to make contact with it. The solar-powered rover went into hibernation in June 2018 after being hit by a planet-wide dust storm that blocked sunlight. Launched in 2004, Opportunity travelled over 45 km despite being designed to travel only 1 km and last 90 days.

headlines: IPS officer keeps dad's dead body for 1 month, says being treated
text: IPS officer Rajendra Kumar Mishra claimed his 84-year-old father, who was declared dead by a hospital in MP in January, was responding to Ayurvedic treatment. Several staff members working for him said tantriks were called to resurrect the body, although the officer denied this. The MP DGP said, "This is a situation without precedent...Some senior officer will talk to him."

headlines: BJP MLA beaten by 1st wife, mother on birthday over 2nd marriage
text: Maharashtra BJP MLA Raju Narayan Todsam's second wife Priya Shinde was beaten by his first wife Archana and mother on Tuesday, videos of which have gone viral. When Todsam attempted to shield Priya, he was also attacked by his mother and the mob, demanding justice for Archana. Todsam was celebrating his 42nd birthday with party supporters at a Kabaddi event.

headlines: 6 US police officers shoot dead 20-year-old rapper sleeping in car
text: Six police officers in US' California fired multiple rounds at 20-year-old rapper, Willie McCoy, who was sleeping in his car outside a Taco Bell, following which he died. McCoy had a handgun on his lap when the officers fired out of "fear for their own safety" on Saturday, police said. Police didn't disclose the number of bullets that hit McCoy.

headlines: Reviewing Jet Airways' flights schedule every 15 days: DGCA
text: Aviation regulator DGCA on Wednesday said it is reviewing the schedule of Jet Airways' flights every 15 days. This comes after the cash-strapped airline had to ground some of its aircraft due to non-payment of lease rentals as well as other operational reasons. Jet Airways is currently working with lenders to restructure its debt as well as raise fresh funds.

headlines: Sachin Mehra to take over as MasterCard CFO from April 1
text: Global card payments company MasterCard on Wednesday said Martina Hund-Mejean will be retiring as the company's Chief Financial Officer (CFO), following which Sachin Mehra will succeed her. Mehra, who currently serves as the company's Chief Financial Operations Officer, will take over the position on April 1. He has been working at MasterCard for over eight years.

headlines: Man Utd charged by UEFA after beer bottles thrown at Di María
text: UEFA has opened disciplinary proceedings against Manchester United after beer bottles were thrown from the stand towards their former player Ángel Di María during PSG's 2-0 victory at Old Trafford on Tuesday. Di María picked up a beer bottle and pretended to drink from it. UEFA said it will look at a charge of "throwing of objects" on February 28.

headlines: Blogger sues Twitter over ban on tweets against transgenders
text: Canadian blogger Meghan Murphy has filed a lawsuit against Twitter after being permanently banned from the platform last year for her tweets against transgender people. Murphy was banned for violating Twitter's hateful conduct policy when she referenced a transgender woman as "him". Twitter had previously locked Murphy's account for tweeting, "Men aren't women" and "How are transwomen not men?".

headlines: Dubsmash, MyFitnessPal among 16 apps to suffer leak: Report
text: As many as 617 million online accounts from 16 websites and platforms including Dubsmash and MyFitnessPal have reportedly been leaked online and are for sale on the dark web for less than $20,000 in Bitcoin. The report claimed all the databases are up for sale by a single hacker. The information is said to have been stolen in 2018.

headlines: Artificial leaves to convert CO2 to fuel 10 times more efficiently
text: University of Illinois, Chicago researchers have proposed a design solution for present artificial leaves to convert carbon dioxide to fuel at least 10 times more efficiently than natural leaves. They will function like natural leaves after being enveloped inside a special membrane, researcher Meenesh Singh said. Present artificial leaves only work using pressurised carbon dioxide from tanks.

headlines: Govt to divest 100% stake in Air India's ground handling arm
text: The government has offered to sell its 100% stake in cash-strapped Air India's ground handling arm Air India Air Transport Services (AIATSL). It has proposed to offload 98% stake through strategic sale and offer the remaining to the subsidiary's employees. AIATSL has been providing services to more than 40 airlines including Emirates, Qatar Airways and Lufthansa.

headlines: Russia 'playing with the West's minds', says Putin advisor
text: "Russia is playing with the West's minds," Russian President Vladimir Putin's advisor Vladislav Surkov has said, adding that they "don't know how to deal with their own changed consciousness". Calling "the Putinist system of government... the ideology of the future", Surkov added that it would last for decades because it is native and "organic".

headlines: EU adds Saudi Arabia to dirty money blacklist
text: The European Commission has added Saudi Arabia, Libya and Nigeria, among other nations, to a blacklist of countries that fail to tackle money laundering and the financing of terrorism. The EU's banks will have to carry out additional checks on financial operations involving entities from the blacklisted countries. The list needs approval by all 28 EU member states.

headlines: GoAir CEO Cornelis Vrieswijk quits within nine months
text: Budget carrier GoAir on Wednesday said its Chief Executive Officer Cornelis Vrieswijk has resigned from the post within nine months, citing personal matters. The Dutch national had joined GoAir last June following the departure of Wolfgang Prock-Schauer. Managing Director Jeh Wadia will be discharging additional responsibilities of the CEO till it finds a successor to Vrieswijk, GoAir added.

headlines: R Venkataramanan quits as Managing Trustee of Tata Trusts
text: Tata Trusts on Wednesday said its Managing Trustee R Venkataramanan will step down by March 31 as his term ends. Noel Tata, half-brother of Tata Sons' Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, has been appointed Trustee of Sir Ratan Tata Trust, it added. Notably, Venkataramanan is under scanner in a money laundering case involving AirAsia India, which is being probed by CBI.

headlines: Survive a week in B'wood: Vicky to troll calling him out on nepotism
text: Vicky Kaushal, during his appearance on 'Famously Filmfare', reacted to a troll who said he "doesn't have a hero face" and he's in Bollywood only because he has a "filmy background". Agreeing to the first comment, Vicky said, "I don't have a filmy face." However, he added, "Sir, you are most welcome in Bollywood and try and survive a week."

headlines: Did you meet real stars? Michelle Obama shares mom's texts on Grammy
text: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama has shared texts sent by her mother from the Grammy Awards night where Michelle made a surprise appearance. "Did you meet any of the real stars or did you run right after you were done," Michelle's mother had texted. "When your mom doesn't think you're a 'real' celebrity," Michelle reacted to her mother's text.

headlines: Vidarbha spinner Karnewar bowls with both hands in Irani Cup
text: Vidarbha's spinner Akshay Karnewar bowled using both his arms on first day of Irani Cup against Rest of India on Tuesday. The 26-year-old dismissed right-handed Shreyas Iyer with a left-arm delivery before bowling right-arm off-spin to left-handed Ishan Kishan. Akshay had started as a right-arm off-spinner but batted and threw left-handed, after which his coach convinced him to bowl left-arm.

headlines: Pant opening batting with Rohit could be pretty cool: Shane Warne
text: Ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne has said that wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant should play for India in ODIs along with MS Dhoni. "I can't see why...Pant can't play as a batsman, he is outstanding," he added. "I know Shikhar Dhawan does a great job but Rishabh Pant opening the batting with Rohit Sharma could be pretty cool too for India," he added.

headlines: Players need to speak up on domestic cricket's state: Sandeep Patil
text: Former Team India chief selector Sandeep Patil has said that the importance of domestic cricket has gone down drastically and the players should say something about the current state of domestic cricket. Adding that it is tough to revive tournaments like Irani Cup and Duleep Trophy, Patil said, "These days, the players save themselves for the IPL."

headlines: Man Utd fans throw beer bottles at ex-player, he pretends to drink
text: Several Manchester United fans threw beer bottles in the direction of ex-Manchester United and current PSG winger Ángel Di María during the second half of the teams' Champions League Round of 16 first leg. Di María, who was constantly booed at Old Trafford, picked a bottle and pretended to drink it. The 30-year-old provided two assists as PSG won 2-0.

headlines: WI pacer Gabriel banned for 4 ODIs for 'abusing' Eng captain Root
text: Windies fast bowler Shannon Gabriel has been banned for four ODIs by the ICC over "personal abuse" of England captain Joe Root during the third Test. The 30-year-old's remarks were not aired but Root was heard telling him, "Don't use it as an insult. There's nothing wrong with being gay." Gabriel has also been fined 75% of his match fee.

headlines: IndiGo to cancel nearly 30 flights daily for the rest of February
text: IndiGo, which cancelled 49 flights on Wednesday, announced it will cancel around 30 flights daily for the rest of February in an effort to stabilize operations and adjust crew rosters. "The cancellations on 13 February were caused by several factors including anticipated weather conditions on 14 February," said IndiGo. Flight operations would be normalised completely by March 31, it added.

headlines: Congress allies with local outfit 'Mahan Dal' in UP
text: Congress on Wednesday announced an alliance with a local outfit 'Mahan Dal' in Uttar Pradesh for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. Mahan Dal claims support from the OBC voters of western UP. "I welcome Keshav Maurya Ji (Mahan Dal chief). We will fight the elections jointly," Congress General Secretary for eastern UP, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said.

headlines: Govt that came into power in 2014 not of 'Congress gotra': PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that after Independence, a government of complete majority which was not of "Congress gotra" came into power in 2014. The PM added the 16th Lok Sabha will be remembered for having the most women representatives ever in the house. It was PM's last address in the LS ahead of the upcoming general elections.

headlines: Everyone afraid of 2 'Gabbar Singhs', Shah and Modi: Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that everyone was afraid of two "Gabbar Singhs", Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah. Addressing a rally organised by the AAP, she added that democracy has become 'Namocracy'. She asserted that opposition parties will fight unitedly at the national level to oust the NDA from power.

headlines: Mayawati drops 'Sushri' from Twitter account after criticism
text: Bahujan Samaj Party supremo Mayawati dropped 'Sushri' from her Twitter handle and changed it to just @Mayawati from @SushriMayawati after receiving criticism for the same. Mayawati, who debuted on Twitter earlier this month, was criticised by many for using the title alleging she was praising herself. 'Sushri' is a title used before the name of a woman to express respect.

headlines: The world is a greener place than it was 20 years ago: NASA
text: After analysing satellite data from 2000-2017, NASA has said, "The world is literally a greener place than it was 20 years ago." "China and India account for one-third of the greening, but contain only 9% of the planet's land area covered in vegetation...a surprising finding," NASA revealed, adding it was mainly due to ambitious tree planting programs and intensive agriculture.

headlines: Levi Strauss files for $100mn IPO to go public again after 35 yrs
text: Levi Strauss & Co, which made the first blue jeans in 1873, filed to go public on Wednesday. The paperwork was filed with a $100 million initial public offering, seeking a listing on the New York Stock Exchange as "LEVI". The company first went public in 1971, but descendants of founder Levi Strauss took the denim maker private in 1984.

headlines: Akash, Shloka's wedding card out; has note by Mukesh and Nita Ambani
text: Akash Ambani and Shloka Mehta's wedding card carries a note written by Mukesh and Nita Ambani. "As Akash and Shloka turn their childhood friendship into eternal love, they also turn our friendship with Mona and Russell into loving bonds of family," it says. The invite mentions events like Mangal Baraat, Mangal Parv and Mangal Ashirwaad with their respective dress codes.

headlines: No mainstream voice for urban youth: Zoya on 'Gully Boy'
text: While speaking about what drew her to the story of her upcoming film 'Gully Boy', filmmaker Zoya Akhtar said, "There is no voice in the mainstream that represents the urban youth." "There are youngsters who are...frustrated because they're not even allowed to pursue their dreamship-hop resonates with them," she added. 'Gully Boy' is scheduled to release on February 14.

headlines: Instagram confirms bug after celebs lose millions of followers
text: Instagram on Wednesday confirmed a bug is causing the number of account followers for some users to change. The bug reportedly caused celebrities including American reality TV personality Kylie Jenner and American singers Ariana Grande and Katy Perry to lose millions of followers collectively on Instagram. "We're working to resolve this as quickly as possible", the photosharing platform tweeted.

headlines: I haven't proved myself at all in Bollywood: Arshad Warsi
text: Arshad Warsi, while speaking about his acting career, revealed that he felt he hasn't proved himself "at all" in Bollywood. "I think there's a lot more that I can do and I am capable of doing a lot more. Sooner or later, it might happen," he added. Arshad further said he tries to play all his characters "very differently".

headlines: Suicide attack kills 20 members of Iran's Revolutionary Guards
text: At least 20 members of Iran's Revolutionary Guards were killed in a suicide bombing on Wednesday, the Iranian state media said. The attack, which took place near the Pakistan border, targeted a bus carrying the personnel. Jaish al-Adl, a militant group operating in southeast Iran, claimed responsibility for the attack.

headlines: All flights in and out of Belgium cancelled for 24hrs amid strike
text: All flights in and out of Belgium have been cancelled for a 24-hour period from 10 pm local time on Tuesday amid a national strike by three major trade unions. They are demanding an increase in wages, benefits and pensions as well as an improved work-life balance. Around 60,000 travellers are expected to be affected by the strike.

headlines: Neymar-less PSG hand 10-man Man Utd their 1st loss under Solskjær
text: PSG, playing without forward Neymar, defeated 10-man Manchester United 2-0 in Champions League Round of 16 first leg at Old Trafford on Tuesday. The defeat was Manchester United's first since Ole Gunnar Solskjær took charge as caretaker manager in December. Further, this is the first time ever that United lost a European home match by more than a single goal.

headlines: TCS executive writes to Kerala CM for separate Ministry for AI
text: Roshy John, Global Head for Robotics and Cognitive Systems at TCS, wrote to Kerala Chief Minister requesting for a Ministry exclusively for Artificial Intelligence (AI). "It was a huge setback that both Union and State budgets had no adequate allocations for AI," said Roshy. Notably, the UAE in 2017 became the first nation to have a minister dedicated to AI.

headlines: Lufthansa airlines sues passenger for missing flight
text: German national airline, Lufthansa has sued a passenger for missing the last leg of his plane journey under 'hidden city ticketing' practice which involves passengers leaving their flight at a layover instead of the final destination, likely saving money. The passenger had booked a return flight from Oslo to Seattle via Frankfurt, but left his journey in Frankfurt during return.

headlines: US warns India against buying oil from Venezuela
text: US National Security Advisor John Bolton has warned India against buying Venezuelan oil, saying countries that support President Nicolás Maduro's "theft of Venezuelan resources will not be forgotten". Bolton issued the warning sharing a news story about Venezuelan Oil Minister Manuel Quevedo visiting India to sell more oil. The US last month sanctioned Venezuela's state-owned oil firm PDVSA.

headlines: S Korean man dies during paragliding event in Maharashtra
text: A 45-year-old South Korean man was killed during a paragliding event near Panchgani in Maharashtra's Satara district, police said on Wednesday. The deceased glider after taking off from Rajpuri, had strayed away and slid down into the forest areas, the police added. The glider was rushed to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries, the police said.

headlines: CBI filed corruption cases against 4,123 govt employees in 3yrs
text: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Wednesday said that 4,123 government employees were charged in corruption cases registered by the CBI in the last three years. He added the CBI has informed that 1,767 corruption cases have been registered against 4,123 public servants during 2016, 2017 and 2018. He said, of the 1,767 cases, chargesheets were filed in 900 cases.

headlines: Ashwani Lohani appointed Air India CMD for second time
text: The government on Wednesday appointed former Railway Board Chairman Ashwani Lohani as the Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Air India. This will be his second tenure as Air India chief. Lohani, who retired from the Railway Board in December 2018, has also served as the Chairman of India Tourism Development Corporation (ITDC).

headlines: Burger King worker clones customers' debit cards at Noida mall, held
text: A Burger King employee working at Noida's The Great India Place mall has been arrested for cloning the debit cards of customers and selling the data to a gang. The accused, working as a sales manager, swiped the cards on a skimmer device he'd kept with himself. He also used the CCTV footage to access the PIN of the cards.

headlines: Request all CMs to put ban on liquor in all states: Bihar CM
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has requested the CMs of all the states to completely ban alcohol in the wake of recent deaths of more than 100 people due to consumption of illicit liquor in Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand. He claimed, in many states, many groups were agitating for a complete ban on liquor. Kumar banned liquor in Bihar in 2016.

headlines: I want to live many lives on-screen as actress: Vaani Kapoor
text: While speaking about her career in the film industry, Vaani Kapoor said, "As an actress, I want to live many lives on-screen. So, I hope people can see me in a different avatar. "I want to show my versatility as an actress in my...films," the actress added. She further said her upcoming films offered "very different" roles and stories.

headlines: Director Bryan Singer's film shelved amid sexual abuse row
text: A remake of the 1985 film 'Red Sonja' which was to be directed by Bryan Singer, has been put on hold by its producers amid accusations that Singer sexually assaulted minors. Singer signed the project in September 2018 after he was dropped as director of the Oscar-nominated film 'Bohemian Rhapsody'. The director has denied all allegations of sexual misconduct.

headlines: Will keep fearless approach: Maker confirms Thackeray sequel
text: Producer Sanjay Raut has confirmed that there will be a sequel to the Nawazuddin Siddiqui starrer 'Thackeray', a biopic on Shiv Sena Founder Bal Thackeray. "We will maintain our fearless approach in making a movie that does justice to [Bal Thackeray] in the true sense," Raut said. Shooting for the film will commence this year, Raut further revealed.

headlines: Felt terrible: Actor Aziz Ansari on sexual assault claims
text: Opening up about the sexual assault allegations which were levelled against him last year, actor Aziz Ansari said, "I just felt terrible this person felt this way." "It made me think about a lot, and I hope I've become a better person," he added. A 23-year-old photographer had accused Ansari of sexual misconduct while they were on a date.

headlines: Being a single parent is really daunting and scary: Karan
text: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who became a father to twins via surrogacy in 2017, said being a single parent is "really daunting and scary". "I think it takes a mother and a father to complete the upbringing of a child. In many ways...having [the twins]...is also a selfish decision," Karan added. "It's because I want that love for myself," he explained.

headlines: Gay Muslim comics account deleted after Indonesia protests
text: An Instagram account which posted comics on struggles of being a gay Muslim has been deleted after protests by Indonesia. Indonesia's communications ministry said it had threatened a nationwide ban on Instagram if the account wasn't removed, which was categorised as 'pornographic' and allegedly breached regulations. However, Instagram said it did not delete the account.

headlines: Twitter apologises as bug changes 'Like', 'Retweet' count
text: Twitter suffered a bug worldwide including in India, which caused the number of 'Likes' and 'Retweets' on some users' tweets to fluctuate. Confirming the issue, Twitter on Wednesday said, "We're working on resolving this and will follow up soon. We apologise for the inconvenience." Earlier, Twitter suffered a bug, largely affecting Android users, that showed mislabeled 'Retweets' to users.

headlines: Rare black leopard photographed in Africa after 100 years
text: British photographer Will Burrard-Lucas photographed the rare black leopard in Kenya's Laikipia Wilderness Camp, which scientists claim is the first picture proving its existence in nearly 100 years in Africa. The leopard's black colour is a result of melanism, a gene mutation that causes an over-production of pigment. It was photographed with camera traps that included wireless motion sensors.

headlines: Delivery startup DoorDash partly pays driver wages with tips
text: American food delivery startup DoorDash states in its FAQ page that "for each delivery, drivers receive at least $1 from DoorDash plus 100% of the customer tip." If amount falls short of guaranteed amount, DoorDash compensates the difference, the FAQ page adds. This comes after US grocery delivery startup Instacart's CEO Apoorva Mehta apologised for paying its drivers using tips.

headlines: Tim Cook-backed startup unveils $499 water-saving shower
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook-backed shower startup Nebia has unveiled a cheaper version of its $649 water-saving shower head, which "saves 65% more water than a regular shower". Priced at $499, the unit is claimed to produce 29% warmer water. Nebia has raised funds from Cook, Google ex-CEO Eric Schmidt, Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia, and Fitbit Co-founder James Park, among others.

headlines: Amazon reduces commission charges post new FDI rules: Report
text: E-commerce major Amazon has reportedly reduced commission charges to add more independent sellers post revision in the FDI rules in e-commerce, which came into effect on February 1. Commission has reportedly been cut by about 35% for prominent fashion sellers and by over 50% on certain FMCG categories. Further, ratings-based commission system for fashion vendors has reportedly been set up.

headlines: NASA makes last attempt to contact dust storm-hit Mars rover
text: US space agency NASA on Tuesday made the last attempt to contact Mars rover 'Opportunity', which sent its last signals to Earth around eight months ago before getting caught in a Mars dust storm. The solar-powered rover will be declared 'dead' if there is no response by Wednesday, NASA revealed. Opportunity had landed on Mars 15 years ago in 2004.

headlines: Jharkhand villagers sue Adani Group over 'illegal' land deal
text: Sixteen residents of four villages in Jharkhand's Godda district have moved Jharkhand High Court asking it to strike down the acquisition of fertile land for the Adani Group. The deal is "marked by illegalities and irregularities", they have alleged. The Gautam Adani-led group had asked Jharkhand government to acquire 2,000 acres of land in 2016 to build a power plant.

headlines: Uber celebrates Valentine's Day with #LoveMovesForward movement
text: After Section 377 was decriminalized last year, Uber India is celebrating the first Valentine's Day for all with an inclusive symbol of love  the Pride Heart. It has launched a change.org petition to get the Pride Heart emoji. Users can sign the petition and join Uber's #LoveMovesForward movement by using the hashtag on Twitter to prompt a Pride Heart.

headlines: Censor Board trims 'Gully Boy' kissing scene by 13 seconds
text: The Censor Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has trimmed a kissing scene between Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt in the film 'Gully Boy' by thirteen seconds, besides making it a wide shot instead of a close-up of the two actors. Additionally, the name of a liquor brand has also reportedly been removed from the list of brand partners.

headlines: Students play cricket in Dhoti-Kurta with commentary in Sanskrit
text: Sampurnanand Sanskrit University in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi organised a cricket match on the occasion of the platinum jubilee celebrations, which saw Sanskrit scholars and students play the match wearing Dhoti-Kurta. Interestingly, the commentary of the match was done in Sanskrit. Former Ranji cricketers Sanjeev Tiwari and Dhiraj Mishra officiated the match.

headlines: Would give myself a C: Twitter CEO on handling online abuse
text: In a recent live Twitter interview, CEO Jack Dorsey admitted the social media platform failed in handling online abuse and put "most of the burden" on "victims of abuse". Dorsey added fixing the issue and promoting healthy conversations was their "first priority". Dorsey further said he feels "terrible" when people take a break from Twitter when they don't feel good.

headlines: FB allows finding female friend pics, hides males: Researcher
text: Belgium-based security researcher Inti De Ceukelair has pointed out that Facebook lets users search for pictures of their female friends but hides those of male friends. On typing "photos of my female friends" in search bar, Facebook shows female friends' photos. However, it displays a broken link or suggests female friends' photos on searching male friends, the researcher tweeted.

headlines: India's fastest train to serve donuts, dinner from 5-star: Report
text: India's fastest train Vande Bharat Express or Train 18, set to be flagged off on February 15, will reportedly be serving patties, muffins and donuts for breakfast. "For breakfast, we won't be serving the regular breakfast of cutlet and bread," an IRCTC official said. The lunch will be from a high-end Prayagraj restaurant and dinner from a 5-star Kanpur restaurant.

headlines: BJP Twitter accounts post against Modi govt after doc modified
text: Several BJP Twitter accounts including that of Union Minister Pon Radhakrishnan posted tweets criticising PM Narendra Modi and his government. Many people suspected that their accounts were hacked, however, Alt News co-founder Pratik Sinha claimed that this happened after they edited a shared Google doc used by the party's members. BJP members allegedly copied and pasted tweets from the doc.

headlines: I want Narendra Modi to become PM again: Mulayam Singh in Lok Sabha
text: Speaking on Budget session's last day in Lok Sabha, Samajwadi Party supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav said, "I want to congratulate PM Narendra Modi for trying to take everyone together." "It's my wish that all the MPs win again, and you (Modi) become PM again," Yadav added. This comes after his son Akhilesh Yadav recently criticised BJP and the Centre.

headlines: No sir you cannot feel like a rape victim: Mufti to K'taka Speaker
text: Criticising Karnataka Assembly Speaker Ramesh Kumar for his 'feel like rape victim' remark over the audio clip controversy, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti said, "No sir you cannot feel like a rape victim." "Clearly you have no idea what a woman who is assaulted has to endure. This twisted analogy is bizarre and sick," she added.

headlines: Not joining NDA, will stay with grand alliance: Manjhi
text: Former Bihar CM and Hindustani Awam Morcha leader Jitan Ram Manjhi on Wednesday said his party will not join the NDA and will remain in the grand alliance. He added his party must get seats that are not less than what would be offered to Upendra Kushwaha's Rashtriya Lok Samata Party. He further said, "We're no less than anyone".

headlines: Rajasthan government passes 5% quota bill for Gujjars
text: Rajasthan government on Wednesday passed a bill in the Assembly to give 5% quota in jobs and educational institutes for Gujjars and four other communities. The move comes amidst the agitation by the Gujjar community for the last five days. Deputy CM Sachin Pilot said the next step would be to approach the Centre, seeking an amendment in the Constitution.

headlines: SC criticises UP government over Taj Mahal maintenance
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday criticised the Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government for the poor maintenance of the Taj Mahal. The court asked the government to file a fresh vision document within four weeks with respect to the steps it wanted to take in this regard, reports said. The court said it was very serious about the preservation of Taj.

headlines: Govts change, we'll keep an eye on you: Sibal to officials
text: Congress leader Kapil Sibal has warned government officials, stating, "We'll keep an eye on officials who are overenthusiastic and trying to show loyalty to the PM. They should remember that the Constitution is bigger than anything." He added, "Officials should know that elections come and go, sometimes we're in the opposition and sometimes we are the ruling party."

headlines: Family was 30 min away from leaving hotel; 3 members died in fire
text: A 13-member family hailing from Kerala was 30 minutes away from checking out of Delhi's Karol Bagh's Arpit Palace hotel when fire erupted and killed three family members. The family had attended a wedding in Ghaziabad and planned to visit various parts of north India before returning home on February 15. The three victims were aged 84, 59 and 53.

headlines: China firm faces US trial over stolen chemical secrets it can't see
text: The documents listing US chemicals company DowDuPont's secrets for making a pigment are so sensitive that the US prosecutors aren't allowing them to be seen by China's Pangang Group accused of stealing it. Pangang is accused of seeking patent protection for a chemical using the stolen secrets. The secrets were stolen by an ex-DuPont engineer and a US consultant.

headlines: Film on triple talaq premieres at Berlin Film Festival
text: Actress and director Aleena Khan's film 'Code Blue', which is based on triple talaq and its impact on women, had its world premiere at the Berlin Film Festival. "I want every woman to rise and find her true self. 'Code Blue' should inspire millions," Aleena said. The filmmaker also features in the film along with actor Alok Nath, among others.

headlines: I want to set my journey as an example to others: Vicky
text: Speaking about his acting career, Vicky Kaushal said, "I want to set my journey as an example to others and not...follow anybody else's journey." "I've not really been stuck up with the kind of work that people around me are doing," the actor added. Vicky further said he's tried to "follow his heart" and pursue good projects with "great" directors.

headlines: 'Call of Duty' owner reports $7.5 bn revenue, to fire 775 workers
text: 'Call of Duty' videogame publisher Activision Blizzard has said it will lay off 8% of its staff (around 775 employees). CEO Bobby Kotick made the announcement in an earnings call to investors after revealing that Activision had "once again achieved record results in 2018". Activision reported a net revenue of $7.5 billion in 2018 compared to $7.02 billion for 2017.

headlines: VFEmail says a hacker deleted entire data of 20 years in US
text: Email provider VFEmail has said that a hacker has destroyed all data of nearly two decades in the US from both primary and backup systems. VFEmail revealed not all VMs shared the same authentication but all were destroyed. "I never thought anyone would care about my labor of love so much that they'd...completely...destroy it," VFEmail owner Rick Romero tweeted.

headlines: Macedonia officially changes its name
text: Macedonia officially changed its name to the Republic of North Macedonia on Tuesday. The name change clears the way for the country to join military alliance NATO. Greece had argued that the name 'Macedonia' implied a territorial claim on its own province of the same name and had thus vetoed Macedonia's entry into the NATO and European Union.

headlines: Thai Princess apologises after being disqualified as PM candidate
text: Thai Princess Ubolratana Rajakanya Sirivadhana Varnavadi, disqualified by the Election Commission from running for Prime Minister, has apologised for causing "problems" for the Thai people. The Election Commission said members of the royal family should stay out of politics. The commission is seeking the dissolution of the Thai Raksa Chart party that nominated Princess Ubolratana as PM candidate.

headlines: 10 students injured in blast at private school of Jammu and Kashmir
text: At least 10 students have been injured in an explosion at a private school in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Wednesday. All the injured are reported to be the students of Class 10 in Falah-i-Millat School. They have been rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment, while the police is probing the nature of the blast.

headlines: Hollywood actor Richard Gere becomes father for 2nd time at 69
text: Hollywood actor Richard Gere has become a father for the second time at the age of 69, his representative told CNN on Monday. This is his first child with third wife Alejandra Silva. The couple got married last year after dating since 2015. Gere already has a 19-year-old son from his marriage to Carey Lowell.

headlines: Man gatecrashed my wedding reception, kissed me on stage: Kapil
text: Kapil Sharma has revealed a fan gatecrashed his Amritsar wedding reception and kissed him on the cheek while he was on stage with his wife. Kapil added he kept wondering if he knows the man. He said as soon as he was sure he didn't know him, he nudged the man on his elbow, after which he wasn't seen there.

headlines: I'll die in Australia: Refugee footballer returns after detention
text: Refugee footballer Hakeem al-Araibi returned home to Australia on Tuesday after spending over two months of detention in Thailand. "This is my country. I didn't (get) citizenship yet, but my country is Australia. I will die in Australia and I love Australia," Hakeem said after returning. He was freed after his home country Bahrain withdrew its extradition request.

headlines: Several Bengaluru flights disrupted for next 11 days over airshow
text: Several flights in and out of Bengaluru from February 14-24 have been cancelled or rescheduled. The city's Kempegowda International Airport will be shut for a few hours on these 11 days for the Aero India 2019 airshow and its rehearsals. This comes as several flights from Mumbai airport have been disrupted between February 7 and March 30 over runway repairs.

headlines: Learning more about Congress' structure: Priyanka Gandhi
text: Eastern Uttar Pradesh Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday said that she was learning a lot about the organisation of the Congress party and how it is structured. She added that she was getting views on how to fight the elections. On her meeting with party workers, Priyanka said she was happy to see the enthusiasm of the workers.

headlines: Soldier shoots himself in Jammu and Kashmir
text: A soldier allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself with his service rifle inside an Army camp in Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Wednesday. The 30-year-old, a resident of Punjab, was on guard duty when he shot himself in the head, the police added. His colleagues rushed to the scene and found him dead on the spot, it said.

headlines: Defence sales with India at an all-time high: US
text: The defence sales between India and the US are at an all-time high, Admiral Philip Davidson, Commander, US Indo-Pacific Command said. The inaugural 2+2 Ministerial dialogue and signing of the COMCASA were crucial moments in the bilateral relationship, he added. The US and India have an increased agreement on cooperation in several fields including counterterrorism, he further said.

headlines: Victoria Beckham bans fur and exotic skins from fashion line
text: Fashion designer Victoria Beckham has banned the use of fur and exotic animal skins from her fashion line. Though her line never used fur, they made accessories out of animal skin like alligators, snakes and lizards, which will be discontinued. "This decision reflects the wishes of not only the brand, but also that of our customers," said a spokesperson.

headlines: Ford 'smart bed' prototype keeps people on their side of bed
text: American automaker Ford has created a "smart bed" prototype which uses pressure sensors and a conveyor belt to roll people back to their side of the bed. The 'smart bed' was developed to highlight its lane-keeping driver-assist technology, which automatically "nudges" the steering wheel in the correct direction. Ford has not clarified if the bed would be made commercially available.

headlines: Former Bihar Congress chief Ramjatan Sinha joins JD(U)
text: Former Bihar Congress President Ramjatan Sinha joined JD(U) on Tuesday, in the presence of party leaders Bashistha Narain Singh and Prashant Kishor. Sinha, who fought the 2015 Assembly elections as an Independent candidate, is expected to be fielded against RLSP MP Arun Kumar in the Lok Sabha elections. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "JD(U) will benefit from his work style."

headlines: TDP MPs protest in Parliament for Andhra special status
text: TDP MPs protested on Parliament premises on Wednesday over their demand for special category status for Andhra Pradesh. TDP MP RN Kinjarapur raised the issue in Parliament, stating, "Every time we ask for special status, we are misguided." A day earlier, a delegation led by Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu submitted a memorandum to President Ram Nath Kovind over the demand.

headlines: Rahul has worked tirelessly, brought fresh energy: Sonia
text: During a meeting of the Congress Parliamentary Party, UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi praised her son, Congress President Rahul Gandhi, for "working tirelessly" and bringing "fresh energy" into the party. She said, "Our new president has put together a team which blends experience and youth well. He has also reached out to other political parties who share our vision of India."

headlines: Prayed to Bapu to remove BJP, Modi babu: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said she, along with TMC MPs, offered prayers to the statue of Mahatma Gandhi inside the Parliament on Wednesday to save India and remove PM Narendra Modi. She said, "It is the last day of the Parliament so we prayed to Bapu to remove BJP and Modi babu, and to...keep everyone safe."

headlines: Shivraj Chouhan takes holy dip in Ganga at Kumbh Mela
text: Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, along with his wife, took a holy dip in the Ganga on Tuesday at the Kumbh Mela. BJP President Amit Shah and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath were among other leaders who took a holy dip at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj on Wednesday.

headlines: Sacked Nissan Chairman Ghosn's lead defence lawyer resigns
text: The lead defence lawyer for ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn, and his associate have submitted their resignations to the Tokyo District Court, their law firm said on Wednesday. There was, however, no explanation as to why they were quitting Ghosn's defence team. The former Nissan executive has been in detention since November 19 over allegations of financial misconduct.

headlines: Nandan Nilekani-backed ShopX acquihires e-tailer GabbarDeals
text: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani-backed assisted e-commerce platform for small retailers ShopX has acquihired Pune-based 'GabbarDeals.com', an electronics retail website. As part of the deal, GabbarDeals Co-founder Niraj Raka will head organised retail at ShopX. Founded in 2015 by Amit Sharma and Apoorva Jois, Bengaluru-based ShopX helps brick-and-mortar retailers set up their own online stores.

headlines: Girl raped by minor in school toilet during Saraswati Puja event
text: A class 8 girl was raped by a student of another school inside a toilet during Saraswati Puja celebrations last week in Mayurbhanj district, the Odisha police said on Wednesday. The girl was inside her school's bathroom when a student of class 10 jumped over the fence and raped her. She revealed the ordeal to her family the next day.

headlines: El Chapo lawyers had shared tequila bottle pic 'for after trial'
text: The lawyers for Mexican drug lord Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán last week shared a picture of a gun-shaped tequila bottle with the caption, "For after trial", purportedly referring to celebrating the verdict. Guzmán was, however, found guilty on all 10 charges after an 11-week trial. His sentence is yet to be announced.

headlines: 1 in 6 US adults own smartwatch, Apple biggest seller: Report
text: Nearly 16% or one in every six American adults now own smartwatches, with Apple being the "clear market leader", according to a report by NPD Group. The report added there was a 61% increase in US smartwatch sales in a 12-month span ending November 2018. Most smartwatches were reportedly purchased by American adults aged up to 34 years.

headlines: Senior IT professional learns Data science through upGrad
text: Kunwar Alok, an upGrad learner was thrilled to learn code at an age of 43 with the help of upGrad and IIIT-Bangalore's PG program in Data Science. The cutting-edge curriculum, 1-on-1 mentorship and career support is helping professionals make a transition with up to 200% salary hikes. The program was ranked among top 5 in India by AIM in 2018.

headlines: Edelweiss Tokio Life-Zindagi Plus provides cover for your spouse
text: Edelweiss Tokio Life-Zindagi Plus with the better half benefit provides an additional life cover for your spouse when you are not around, ensuring complete security for the entire family. Its new advertisement shows not one, but both the parents safeguarding their children against accidental situations. This aims to encourage the customers to secure their family with additional life coverage.

headlines: NDA's Rafale deal 2.86% cheaper than one negotiated by UPA: CAG
text: The Rafale deal signed in 2016 was 2.86% cheaper than the UPA's deal in 2007, revealed Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) in its report tabled in Rajya Sabha today. The report also stated that compared to the 126 aircraft deal, India managed to save 17.08% money for the India Specific Enhancements in the 36 Rafale contract.

headlines: Delhi hotel manager held, case sent to Crime Branch as fire kills 17
text: Delhi Police arrested Hotel Arpit Palace's manager and the general manager and transferred the case to the Crime Branch after a massive fire killed 17 people on Tuesday. A search is on for the owner who's on the run. Forensic experts, who took videos of the fire site on Tuesday, will visit the hotel again with the Crime Branch officials.

headlines: Justin Bieber receiving treatment for depression: Reports
text: Singer Justin Bieber is currently being treated for depression, as per reports. "Justin seems down and tired. He has been struggling a bit... This is just something [Justin] has to deal with. He is in outpatient therapy and getting help every day," said reports. The issues aren't related to his marriage with Hailey Baldwin, reports further said.

headlines: Hrithik's Super 30 to have no director credits after Bahl's exit
text: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30' won't have a director's name in the credit roll, after sexual harassment accused filmmaker Vikas Bahl was ousted from the film. The makers will reportedly consider putting his name back in the credit roll if he gets a court order clearing his name. Anurag Kashyap, who will oversee the post-production, will not take any credit.

headlines: Smile Didi, you are in a democracy: Posters on Mamata's Delhi visit
text: Several posters were put up in Delhi on Tuesday, ahead of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's visit for 'Tanashahi Hatao, Loktantra Bachao' rally of Aam Aadmi Party. "Didi, smile to your heart's content, you are in a democracy," read a message on one poster, while another read, "Welcome to Delhi, where democracy is alive and kicking, Didi!".

headlines: People were found dead in Delhi hotel fire holding each other's hands
text: Deputy Chief Fire Officer Sunil Chaudhary, while describing the scene inside Hotel Arpit Palace in Delhi's Karol Bagh after the fire, said, "Bodies were found on every floor. People were found dead holding each other's hands." "It looked like...hotel staff had abandoned the guests," he added. "There was no electricity...it was a stampede as everyone fought to escape," he added.

headlines: Bihar Governor's tent catches fire at Kumbh, officials rescue him
text: A third incident of fire took place at the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj on Tuesday night. The fire erupted at the tent in which Bihar Governor Lal Ji Tandon was staying. His spectacles, mobile phone and watch were burnt in the fire. There were no injuries or casualties reported and Tandon was shifted to the circuit house after the incident.

headlines: 3 artists from rural India win snow sculpting contest in Japan
text: Three Indian youths defeated 11 teams from eight countries to win the International Snow Sculpting Competition Japan Cup 2019. Team India Abhyuday's Ravi Prakash, Sunil Kumar Kushwaha and Rajnish Verma, whose winning sculpture was Lord Vishnu's Varaha Avatar, hail from villages in Bihar, MP and UP respectively. They pooled their resources and participated in the competition with an NGO's help.

headlines: 5-year-old twins kidnapped at gunpoint from school bus in MP
text: The five-year-old twins of a businessman in Madhya Pradesh were kidnapped at gunpoint from their school bus in Chitrakoot on Tuesday. Two armed men boarded the bus and held the conductor, the driver and two women attendants at gunpoint while abducting the twins. The kidnappers have not made a ransom call yet, the police said.

headlines: Minor girl beats up eve-teaser with help of schoolmates in Raj
text: A video has surfaced online, showing a group of schoolgirls in Rajasthan's Jodhpur beating up an eve-teaser after he allegedly attempted to molest their schoolmate. In the video of the incident, which took place on Tuesday, the bystanders could be heard saying, "maaro, maaro". The boy had allegedly been stalking the minor girl for the past few days.

headlines: CRPF jawan held for sexually harassing woman at Goa beach
text: A 43-year-old CRPF jawan was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly sexually harassing a woman in Goa, said the police. The woman accused Rajvir Prabhudayal Singh of using vulgar language and inappropriately touching her while she was bathing at Calangute Beach, as well as assaulting her husband. The incident occurred when she was at the beach with her husband and children.

headlines: Driver stops bus to save 50 passengers before dying of heart attack
text: A Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation bus driver suffered a heart attack while driving and stopped the bus on the side of the road to save around 50 passengers in the vehicle. The 47-year-old driver reportedly collapsed on the steering wheel after stopping the vehicle, following which he was rushed to the hospital, where he was declared dead.

headlines: Pak army drag unarmed man out of house, fire at him continuously
text: A video shared by an activist from the Free Balochistan Movement shows Pakistan army dragging an unarmed man out of his house in Balochistan and firing at him continuously. Man could be heard crying before several rounds were fired at him. "Have a look how Pakistani army killing a innocent Baloch in Balochistan," the activist wrote while tweeting the video.

headlines: Shell invests in Alphabet's power-generating kites project
text: Oil group Royal Dutch Shell has invested in power-generating kites project Makani, helping to make it an independent venture within Alphabet. The details of Shell's minority investment were not disclosed. Founded in 2006, US-based Makani has developed commercial-scale prototype kites that use a wing tethered to a ground station to efficiently harness energy from the wind to generate electricity.

headlines: Senior Congress leaders have a slave mentality: Arun Jaitley
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Tuesday appeared to call Congress President Rahul Gandhi a "dynast" and claimed that senior Congress leaders have a "slave mentality". Jaitley said the leaders' mentality "convinces them that they must only sing the song scripted by the dynast." Earlier, Rahul had accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of spilling defence secrets related to the Rafale deal.

headlines: Not affected, doing my work: Priyanka on ED probing Robert
text: When asked about the Enforcement Directorate questioning her husband Robert Vadra in connection with an alleged money laundering case, eastern UP Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said, "These things will keep on going, I'm doing my own work." Priyanka, who dropped Robert and his mother to the ED office on Tuesday, said she is "not affected" by the probe.

headlines: Scientist claims 100% cure for cervical cancer-causing HPV
text: Mexican researcher Eva Ramón Gallegos has claimed 100% cure for cervical cancer-causing human papillomavirus (HPV) after a 20-year research. Non-invasive photodynamic therapy (PDT) conducted on 29 Mexico City women and 420 patients during clinical phase was reported successful. The therapy removes damaged cells without affecting healthy structures, potentially reducing death rate, scientists said.

headlines: Neglecting social issues not myopic but dangerous: Rajan
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has warned that neglecting social issues is not just myopic, but dangerous. He further called for a return to empowering local communities to combat growing despair and unrest. Local community government acts as a shield against the policies of the federal government, thus protecting minorities against a possible tyranny of the majority, he added.

headlines: Woman gangraped and murdered, boyfriend attacked in Andhra
text: A 22-year-old pharmacist was gangraped and murdered in Amaravati while she was out with her boyfriend on Monday night, the Andhra Pradesh police said. Her boyfriend, who is battling for life in a hospital, was allegedly attacked by a gang when he tried rescuing her. An iron rod and empty beer bottles were found at the site of the crime.

headlines: Sri Lanka hiring executioners to hang drug traffickers
text: Sri Lanka has begun advertising for executioners as the country is set to resume the use of capital punishment for drug traffickers in the next two months. No one has been executed for any crime in Sri Lanka since 1976 as all death penalties have been commuted to life in prison since then.

headlines: El Chapo found guilty on all counts in US trial, faces life in jail
text: Mexican drug lord Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán, accused of trafficking billions of dollars worth of drugs into the US, was found guilty on all 10 counts against him. The 61-year-old, who's been standing trial in federal court since November, now faces life imprisonment in the US. He escaped twice from maximum-security Mexican prisons before his final capture in January 2016.

headlines: I was terrible, horrendous in 'Ladies vs Ricky Bahl': Ranveer Singh
text: Actor Ranveer Singh, while talking about taking risks with his film choices, said, "I was terrible in 'Ladies vs Ricky Bahl', I was horrendous." "After that, I developed a certain level of fearlessness because how bad can I be?" Ranveer added. "I like to play high risks because it excites me. Playing Khilji was a huge risk," he further said.

headlines: Unadkat suggests face masks for bowlers after Dinda gets hit on head
text: Saurashtra captain Jaydev Unadkat has suggested face masks should be introduced for bowlers' safety. This comes after Bengal pacer Ashok Dinda was hit on his head while attempting a catch off his own bowling. "About time...a "face-mask" for bowlers makes its way into all that has evolved in cricket...It's scary how this kind of incidents have become frequent," he tweeted.

headlines: Even Sachin has scored 50 runs in 150 balls: Pujara on batting slow
text: India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has said that he doesn't get worried about what people are saying with regards to his strike rate in Test cricket. Adding that he plays according to the situation, the 31-year-old added, "Even Sachin Tendulkar, when the situation demanded, has scored just 50 runs in 150 balls, so there is nothing wrong in that," he added.

headlines: India should include Pant in playing XI for World Cup: Azharuddin
text: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin has said India should include Rishabh Pant in the playing XI in the 2019 World Cup and he should bat at the number four position. Azharuddin, however, said that the 21-year-old wicketkeeper-batsman needs to improve his wicket-keeping skills in Test cricket. "India has all the talent and ammunition to win the Cup in England," he added.

headlines: If you don't get out, we'll need wheelchairs: Pujara on best sledge
text: India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has revealed that the best sledge he received from an Australian player was during a Test match in Ranchi in 2017. The 31-year-old said that he was batting on 170-plus when the player came and told him, "Now if you don't get out, we'll have to ask for wheelchairs."

headlines: TikTok causing cultural degeneration: Tamil Nadu to demand app ban
text: Tamil Nadu has requested a ban on lip-syncing video app TikTok, claiming that it is pushing the younger generation on the path of cultural degeneration. Tamil Nadu MLA Thamimun Ansari said the app creates law and order problems and many obscene activities happen on it. Tamil Nadu's IT minister said the state will request the Centre to ban the app.

headlines: Congress misleading people on Rafale issue: Rajnath Singh
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday accused the Congress of misleading people by raking up the Rafale fighter jet deal issue repeatedly. He said the issue has been discussed in detail in the Lok Sabha and the Supreme Court has also put the matter to rest. Speaking in the Lok Sabha, he added the Opposition should indulge in healthy politics.

headlines: Brother unmarried, so sister has come: Amit Shah on Priyanka
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Tuesday took a dig at the Congress saying 'since brother (Rahul Gandhi) hasn't married, sister (Priyanka Gandhi) has entered politics'. Addressing a party meeting, Shah criticised the Congress party over dynasty politics adding PM's post was reserved in the party. He said it was impossible for a Congress worker to ever occupy the top post.

headlines: 90 positive swine flu cases reported in a day in Rajasthan
text: One person died while 90 others were tested positive to swine flu on Tuesday in Rajasthan, reports said. Between January 1 to February 12 this year, 113 deaths and over 3,110 positive swine flu cases have been reported from across the state. Meanwhile, as many as 79 fresh cases of swine flu were detected in Rajasthan on Monday, reports added.

headlines: Groom's friends beat staff at Delhi hotel for serving cold food
text: The relatives and friends of a groom smashed crockery and beat staff of Piccadily Hotel in Delhi's Janakpuri on Sunday for being served cold food during the wedding, police said. The hotel's general manager, however, denied the allegations and claimed that the groom's friends misbehaved with the hotel's female staff. The party allegedly involved in the ruckus included 400 guests.

headlines: Man steals money meant for wife's cancer treatment from own house
text: A 50-year-old man was booked on Saturday for breaking into his house in Greater Noida and stealing his wife's jewellery and money kept for her cancer treatment. The woman revealed the incident took place on January 29, four days after police locked her husband up for assaulting her. She said the rift between the couple began after her cancer diagnosis.

headlines: Producer bullied me into silence: Nicki Minaj on Grammy snub
text: After a Twitter user pointed out that Nicki Minaj is yet to win her first Grammy, Nicki suggested she had been snubbed due to a dispute with Grammys producer Ken Ehrlich. "I was bullied into staying quiet for 7 years out of fear," Nicki tweeted. Nicki added that Ehrlich was the same man singer Ariana Grande had accused of lying.

headlines: U-certified Babri Masjid demolition film rated A on YouTube
text: Filmmaker Anand Patwardhan's National Award-winning documentary 'Ram Ke Naam', based on the Babri Masjid demolition, has been age-restricted on YouTube, the filmmaker revealed on Facebook. "Youtube is at it again, catering to Hindutva goons who want to kill all secular content," the filmmaker wrote. The 1992 documentary had been granted a 'U' certificate by the Censor Board, Anand further said.

headlines: No one can become the next Serena: World number one Osaka
text: World number one women's singles player Naomi Osaka spoke about her opponent in the US Open 2018's final, Serena Williams, saying, "I don't think anyone can become the next Serena." Osaka also praised Serena's elder sister Venus and called the sisters 'legends'. "I'm kind of more of a Serena person... Serena was, like, my number one," Osaka added.

headlines: After Twitter, parliament panel may call Google, FB heads: Reports
text: The Parliamentary Committee on IT may reportedly call Google and Facebook heads after asking Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey to appear before it to discuss ways to safeguard citizens' rights on social media. Many members have advised committee Chairman Anurag Thakur to summon platforms like Facebook and Google, reports said. "We're calling everyone. But...have to start with someone," Thakur said.

headlines: People could one day sell homes on Earth, move to Mars: Musk
text: SpaceX Founder Elon Musk has tweeted, "I'm confident moving to Mars...will one day cost less than $500k and maybe even below $100k." Musk added it will cost "low enough that most people in advanced economies could sell their home on Earth and move to Mars."
