Responding to the user inquiring about the estimated costs, Musk said, "Return ticket is free."

headlines: Dutch firm that offered one-way ticket to Mars goes bankrupt
text: Dutch non-profit organisation Mars One Ventures, which offered one-way tickets to Mars, had filed for bankruptcy in mid-January. It planned to establish first human Mars settlement in 2023 and shortlisted 100 people for it, which it later reduced to 24. Mars One Co-founder Bas Lansdorp has said Mars One Foundation continues to operate while he's working "to find a solution."

headlines: Maharashtra Cabinet approves veterinary van service for cows
text: Maharashtra Cabinet on Tuesday approved veterinary van services for cows injured in road accidents or in need of emergency medical care. The scheme will be implemented in phases, with 60 vans being operated initially. "The service is especially meant for farmers. To avail it, farmers have to drop a message to the department," state Animal Husbandry Minister Mahadev Jankar said.

headlines: AAP cancels Tuesday's 4th anniversary event over hotel fire
text: In the aftermath of the Karol Bagh hotel fire, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has cancelled Tuesday's event marking the fourth-anniversary celebration of AAP government in Delhi. Bollywood singer-composer Vishal Dadlani was supposed to perform at the event. "An alternate date for the event will be announced," Vishal said in a tweet.

headlines: It gives joy: Indian-origin Kamala Harris supports legalising weed
text: Indian-origin US Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who launched her presidential campaign last month, has supported legalising weed, saying, "I think it gives a lot of people joy, we need more joy in the world." Harris also admitted to smoking a joint in college. While several US states have legalised medicinal or recreational marijuana, it is still illegal under federal law.

headlines: Samsung reaches settlement over 'exploding' washing machines
text: Samsung Electronics on Tuesday said it has reached a settlement in a class-action lawsuit over 2.8 million "exploding" washing machines recalled in the US. The appliances were recalled in 2016 following reports that its top "can unexpectedly detach from the chassis during use", potentially causing harm. The appliances in question have long been off market, the South Korean company added.

headlines: We'll impose life ban on cricketer who assaulted Bhandari: DDCA Prez
text: Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) President Rajat Sharma said the association will ban aspiring cricketer Anuj Dedha for life for physically assaulting current Delhi selector and ex-India pacer Amit Bhandari. A group of 15 people led by Dedha beat Bhandari for not selecting him in Delhi's U-23 team. "Whatever he has done, he only deserves exemplary punishment," Sharma added.

headlines: Kid said 'Woh dekh heroine heroine': Madhuri on becoming 'popular'
text: Actress Madhuri Dixit, while recalling her "first public recognition" after 'Tezaab' released, narrated an incident wherein some children at the airport recognised her and asked her for an autograph. "One of them...started shouting 'woh dekh heroine heroine'," she added. Madhuri added when she signed the autograph with 'M', one kid said to the other, "Bola tha na, ye Mohini hai".

headlines: Sala's body identified via fingerprints, he died of head injuries
text: The body of 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala had to be identified by his fingerprints, an inquest has heard. The forward's body was recovered from the seabed wreckage last week after the plane he was in disappeared over the English Channel on January 21. The post-mortem report revealed that Sala died of head and trunk injuries.

headlines: World record of most wides bowled in a Test broken after 11 years
text: As many as 35 wide balls have been delivered in the ongoing third Windies-England Test, breaking the nearly 11-year-old record of most wides bowled in a Test. The previous record was set in the Test between Windies and Australia in June 2008, which witnessed 34 wides. Windies' bowlers have bowled 24, while English bowlers have bowled 11 wides so far.

headlines: Tripura minister denies she was groped by colleague at PM rally
text: Santana Chakma, Tripura's Minister for Social Welfare and Social Education, has denied the allegations against Tripura Minister for Youth Affairs and Sports Manoj Kanti Deb groping her during a rally of PM Narendra Modi last week. The allegations were levelled against Deb after a video showed him allegedly touching Chakma's waist. The BJP has dismissed the allegations as "character assassination".

headlines: World's oldest known wild bird hatches chick aged 68
text: A 68-year-old albatross named Wisdom, known as the world's oldest living wild bird, has hatched another chick at her nesting ground in the US Pacific island territory Midway Atoll. Wisdom, along with millions of albatrosses, flies thousands of kilometres each year to return home and lay a single egg. Wisdom is estimated to have raised over 30 offsprings so far.

headlines: Tiger spotted in Gujarat after decades: Government
text: The Gujarat government on Tuesday confirmed the presence of a tiger after several decades in the state. This came days after a man claimed he saw the tiger crossing a road in Gujarat's Mahisagar. "A tiger in the age-group of 7 to 8 years has been seen in Mahisagar district," State forest minister Ganpatsinh Vasava said.

headlines: 6-year-old Hyderabad boy electrocuted while playing
text: A six-year-old boy was on Monday electrocuted while playing in a residential township in Hyderabad, police said. The police added that the boy came into contact with a live wire near a lamp post and got electrocuted while no one noticed. The police have registered a case of negligence against the firm that maintains the residential complex, reports said.

headlines: India signs contract for 72,400 Sig Sauer assault rifles
text: Defence Ministry on Tuesday signed a contract to procure 72,400 Sig Sauer assault rifles under fast-track procedures for the Indian Army. Aiming to modernise the infantry, India has signed the contract with the United States for the assault rifles. The US firm will have to deliver the rifles within a year, Defence Spokesperson tweeted.

headlines: Bharat Ratna, Padma awards cannot be used as titles: Govt
text: The government on Tuesday said the Bharat Ratna and Padma awards are not titles and cannot be used as prefix or suffix to names of the recipient. Informing the Lok Sabha, Union Minister Hansraj Ahir said the awards can be withdrawn in case of misuse. The minister said, immediately after these awards were conferred, every awardee was communicated the rules.

headlines: TRAI extends deadline to switch DTH plans to March 31, 2019
text: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has extended the deadline for subscribers to change their DTH plans to March 31, 2019. The subscribers' old plan would continue until they make the choice before March 31. New pricing regime lets consumers choose the TV channels they want to watch and pay only for them at MRPs set by broadcasters.

headlines: IAF's MiG-27 jet crashes near Pokhran during training, pilot safe
text: A MiG-27 aircraft airborne for a training mission from Jaisalmer, Rajasthan crashed around 6:10 PM on Tuesday near the Pokhran nuclear test range. The Indian Air Force pilot ejected safely, as per ANI. This comes after a pilot died when his Mirage 2000 fighter trainer aircraft crashed due to technical issues at the HAL Airport near Bengaluru on February 1.

headlines: Telugu director Vijaya Bapineedu passes away aged 82
text: Telugu director and producer Vijaya Bapineedu passed away on Tuesday aged 82 due to age-related ailments. The filmmaker's last rites will take place in Hyderabad on February 14, as per reports. Bapineedu made his directorial debut in 1981 with the film 'Dabbu Dabbu Dabbu', and went on to direct and produce several films including 'Gang Leader' and 'Magadheerudu'.

headlines: Was told I should only do commercial films: Madhuri Dixit
text: Actress Madhuri Dixit has revealed that throughout her acting career people always told her that she should only work in commercial films. "You need to push the envelope. If it fails, its okay. If it works, it gives others the opportunity to do something different," Madhuri said. "People said I cannot do an art film but I did," she added.

headlines: I'd love to work with Vishal Bhardwaj again: Ruskin Bond
text: Writer Ruskin Bond has said he would love to collaborate with filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj for a project. "[Vishal] was interested to make something...from my book called 'Mr Oliver's Diary'. We've also discussed some other stories, of a very different nature," the writer revealed. Bhardwaj previously adapted two of Bond's stories for his films 'The Blue Umbrella' and '7 Khoon Maaf'.

headlines: Dhoni's experience can't be questioned: Lakshmipathy Balaji
text: Former Indian pacer Lakshmipathy Balaji praised his former Chennai Super Kings teammate MS Dhoni, saying, "MS Dhoni's experience can't be questioned. There are not many better than him when it comes to handling situations with maturity." "He has been a guiding force for the youngsters. India needs his experience to guide the middle-order batsmen," Balaji said.

headlines: Apple files patent for mobile biometric tech to unlock cars
text: A patent application by Apple has revealed a new mobile biometric system for unlocking cars. Apple said in the application that most key-based systems of today offer only a single layer of protection and are "vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks" and other security issues. The system may even personalise in-car technology settings after recognising the person, the application further suggested.

headlines: Debating champion Harish Natarajan defeats IBM's AI debater
text: Oxford and Cambridge alumnus Harish Natarajan defeated IBM's AI in a live public debate on Monday in San Francisco, US. Natarajan, who holds the record for most championship victories, debated 'subsidising preschools' with the six-year-old system named 'Project Debater', having a 10-billion sentence database. "There will come a point soon where AI will be better than humans," Natarajan said.

headlines: IndiGo cancels 30 more flights due to pilot shortage
text: Budget carrier IndiGo on Tuesday cancelled as many as 30 more flights due to a shortage of pilots. The carrier was reportedly forcing passengers to either buy last-minute fares or offering them alternate flights with one-stop connectivity with long transit time. This comes after the carrier had pulled out 32 flights from its network on Monday, as per reports.

headlines: Philippine President considers renaming country to 'Maharlika'
text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is considering changing the country's name to 'Maharlika'. Duterte said late dictator Ferdinand Marcos had demanded to change the country's name to 'Maharlika', noting the colonial origins of 'Philippines', named after Spanish King Philip II. The name change would require a new law and the public's approval in a referendum, the Presidential Palace said.

headlines: California to withdraw troops from US-Mexico border
text: Gavin Newsom, the Governor of the US state of California, has announced to withdraw more than two-third of the state's National Guard troops from the US-Mexico border. Announcing the withdrawal, Newsom called US President Donald Trump's claims of an illegal migration crisis at the border a "manufactured" problem and "political theatre". The remaining troops will combat drug smuggling.

headlines: Consumer retail inflation hits 19-month low at 2.05% in January
text: The consumer retail inflation in the country eased to 2.05% in January, the lowest level since June 2017, government data showed. The consumer retail inflation was recorded at 2.19% in December 2018. Additionally, the Index of Industrial Production (IIP) for the month of December 2018 stood at 133.7, 2.4% higher as compared to the month of December 2017.

headlines: Rohit, wife Ritika share first glimpses of newborn daughter Samaira
text: Team India batsman Rohit Sharma and his wife Ritika Sajdeh took to their respective Instagram pages to share first glimpses of their newborn daughter Samaira. Rohit shared an Instagram Story of himself playing with Samaira, while Ritika shared a video, wherein Samaira can be seen smiling. Samaira was born December 30 last year.

headlines: Never take Aussies for a joke: Hayden to Sehwag on babysitting ad
text: Reacting to Virender Sehwag's television commercial where he can be seen babysitting kids in Australian jersey, ex-Australia opener Matthew Hayden tweeted, "Never take Aussies for a joke Viru Boy...Just remember who's babysitting the World Cup trophy." The commercial for upcoming series between India and defending World Cup champions Australia was inspired from wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant's 'babysitting banter' with Tim Paine.

headlines: Mukesh & Nita Ambani fly to Chennai, invite Stalin to son's wedding
text: Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani flew to Chennai to invite DMK Chief MK Stalin to their son Akash Ambani's wedding. Stalin shared his pictures with the two and captioned them, "It was a pleasure to receive a courtesy call from Thiru Mukesh Ambani in Chennai." Akash Ambani's wedding to Shloka Mehta will reportedly take place on March 9 in Mumbai.

headlines: Where did 'lobbyist' Rahul get Airbus email from? RS Prasad
text: Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday called Congress President Rahul Gandhi "a lobbyist for competitive aircraft supplier companies". "From where did he get the email of Airbus? Airbus itself is under clouds for deals during UPA regime," the BJP leader said. Prasad further said the Airbus email shown by Rahul was about helicopters and not Rafale jet deal.

headlines: Women with 4 or more kids need not pay income tax for life: Hungary
text: Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orbán has announced a lifetime personal income tax exemption for women who have four or more children in an effort to increase the birth rate. The new tax measures also include subsidies for car purchases and the expansion of a loan programme for families with at least two children to help them buy homes.

headlines: Nissan discovers $84 mn under-reported payments to sacked Chairman
text: Nissan has recognised $84 million in charges related to under-reported compensation for former Chairman Carlos Ghosn, who was sacked last year. The company also slashed its annual profit outlook on weaker global sales. Arrested and detained in Tokyo since November 19, Ghosn has been indicted in Japan on charges of under-reporting his salary at Nissan.

headlines: Staying away from fashion of showing films to PM: Rakeysh
text: Director Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra has said while it's become "fashionable" to screen films for PM Narendra Modi, he won't be screening his upcoming film 'Mere Pyare Prime Minister' for India's PM. "I feel the film is made for the people of the country and...I dont want to dilute that," Mehra explained. The film is slated to release on March 15.

headlines: Ajay to feature in director Rajamouli's film 'RRR': Reports
text: Ajay Devgn will feature in 'Bahubali' director SS Rajamouli's upcoming period action film 'RRR', as per reports. The film will feature Telugu actors NT Rama Rao Jr and Ram Charan in lead roles. Ajay Devgn previously lent his voice for the film 'Makkhi', the Hindi-dubbed version of the Rajamouli directorial 'Eega', which released in 2012.

headlines: Boney Kapoor to produce remake of Egyptian film
text: Filmmaker Boney Kapoor will produce an Indian remake of the Egyptian film 'Hepta: The Last Lecture' in Hindi and several other Indian languages. "This is only the beginning and we shall soon be seeing films from Egypt and India being remade in their respective languages," Kapoor said. The film is based on a novel by writer Mohamed Sadek.

headlines: Osaka splits with coach weeks after winning 2nd Grand Slam
text: World number one Naomi Osaka has split with her coach Sascha Bajin weeks after winning the Australian Open to complete back-to-back Grand Slam victories. Osaka, who became the first Asian to hold the top spot in the women's singles rankings after beating Czech Petra Kvitova in Australian Open's final, had worked with Bajin for just over a year.

headlines: Windies' Shannon Gabriel warned for using offensive language
text: Windies pacer Shannon Gabriel was warned by the on-field umpires for using offensive language in the ongoing third Test against England. The incident involved England's Joe Root, who chose not to reveal the details of the incident during the media interaction after the end of the day's play. "Sometimes people say things on the field they might regret," Root said.

headlines: Won't retire earlier from int'l cricket to play T20s: Taylor
text: New Zealand batsman Ross Taylor said that he loves to play for his nation and that he won't retire earlier from international cricket just to play in the T20 circuit. "Playing for a different franchise every month is not something that appeals to me as much as playing in front of family and friends here in New Zealand," Taylor added.

headlines: Shastri wishes Viswanath, calls him 'greatest dodgy track player'
text: Indian coach Ravi Shastri wished former Indian cricketer Gundappa Viswanath on his 70th birthday, calling him his childhood hero and India's 'greatest dodgy track player'. Attached with a photo of Viswanath was a caption, part of which read, "He set Green Park ablaze in 1969... the one and only Gundappa Viswanath a happy 70th. God bless great man #GundappaViswanath."

headlines: CCI probing if Google abused Android to block rivals: Report
text: Competition Commission of India (CCI) is probing accusations that Google 'abused' its mobile operating system Android to block rivals, a report claimed. The case is reportedly similar to one where Google faced a $5.1-billion fine by the European Union in July 2018 for abusing its market dominance. CCI has reportedly been looking into the case for the past six months.

headlines: Sacked Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn remains director of Renault
text: French automaker Renault on Tuesday said ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn remains a director even though he has resigned as its Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. This comes after the company named Jean-Dominique Senard as its Chairman and Thierry Bolloré as CEO last month. Senard will represent Renault in its alliance with Japanese carmakers Nissan and Mitsubishi, Renault had said.

headlines: Bike sharing startup Mobycy raising $10 mn for e-scooters
text: Gurugram-based dockless bicycle sharing startup Mobycy, which recently pivoted to electric scooters, is raising $10-million Series A round to fund its new business. The startup expects to dilute 30-40% of its equity in the round, which will see participation from India, US, Southeast Asia-based investors, Co-founder Akash Gupta said. Gupta had founded the startup in 2017 along with Rashi Agarwal.

headlines: Tesla 'Dog Mode' to check on pet in car to release this week
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter confirmed that the automaker's 'Dog Mode' will roll out this week. In October last year, Musk had responded "yes" to a Twitter user's request to introduce a 'dog mode' that plays music and displays a message indicating a pet dog is safe while the electric car's owner is away.

headlines: Kerala launches app to clear investment proposals in 30 days
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday launched software application K-SWIFT (Kerala Single Window Interface for Fast, Transparent Clearances) to ensure clearance of investment proposals within 30 days of application. After 30 days, proposals will be deemed cleared if the application isn't processed by then, he added. The 30-day limit may be reduced to 15 days in future, he further said.

headlines: AgustaWestland accused Talwar's custody extended by 2 days
text: A Delhi court has granted ED two days extended custody of corporate lobbyist and AgustaWestland scam accused Deepak Talwar, in a money laundering case. Earlier, Patiala House Court had extended Talwar's remand to February 12. Last week, ED had told the court that Talwar had links with fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya in a money laundering case.

headlines: Ebola vaccine offered in return for sex in Congo: Reports
text: Women in the Democratic Republic of Congo are being asked for sexual favours in return for Ebola-related services such as vaccinations, several studies quoting respondents claimed. The reports further said there was a rise in stigma and violence targetting women following the latest Ebola outbreak. Women working on the Ebola response were reportedly given jobs in exchange for sexual favours.

headlines: I-T dept can't know if realty firms file ITRs regularly: CAG
text: A Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report has noticed in audit observations that no mechanism exists with the Income Tax Department to ensure that all registered companies in realty sector have PAN and are filing their Income Tax Returns (ITRs) regularly. Further, the system to ensure compliance of ITR filing by sellers of high-value immovable properties wasn't effective, it added.

headlines: 8 years since Wayne Rooney's bicycle kick goal won derby for Man Utd
text: With the derby match against Manchester City poised at 1-1 and 12 minutes remaining, the then Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney scored the winner with a bicycle kick on February 12, 2011. Rooney's back was facing the goal when he leapt five feet in the air and sent Nani's curling cross into the top right-hand corner of the goal.

headlines: Katy Perry pulls shoes criticised over 'blackface', apologises
text: Singer Katy Perry's line 'Katy Perry Collections' has pulled two pairs of shoes after facing criticism that they resembled 'blackface', wherein non-black people darken their skin using makeup or other products to imitate a black person. "I was saddened when it was brought to my attention that it was being compared to painful images reminiscent of blackface," Perry's statement read.

headlines: I worked my a** off: Cardi B quits Instagram after Grammy criticism
text: Rapper Cardi B has quit Instagram over criticism for her win at the 2019 Grammy Awards, held on Monday. "It's not my style for people to put other people down to uplift somebody else," she said in a video posted before she deleted Instagram. "I f***ing worked my a** off, locked myself in the studio for three months," she added.

headlines: E-mail cited by Rahul not related to Rafale deal: Reliance Defence
text: Reliance Defence rejected accusations of Anil Ambani being already aware of the Rafale deal made by Congress President Rahul Gandhi. Gandhi alleged a 2015 e-mail purportedly written by Airbus showed Ambani met then French Defence Minister. "Purported e-mail was a discussion between Airbus and Reliance Defence regarding Civil & Defence Helicopter Programs under 'Make in India'," the company said.

headlines: Britannia looking to set up an entity for startup investments
text: Britannia is looking to set up a new entity and a team in the next six months to invest in startups and emerging companies. "We will consider looking at infusing small investments in startups across platforms," Britannia Managing Director Varun Berry said. Notably, consumer goods makers Unilever and Marico have already been investing in startups through separate platforms or entities.

headlines: Bajrang Dal to shoot couples' videos on Valentine's Day in Dehradun
text: Bajrang Dal members in Dehradun have decided to shoot videos of the couples indulging in "indecent acts" at public places on Valentine's Day. They will also make the videos of harassers and stalkers and submit them to the police to prevent any "unethical" activity. The outfit claimed that the move is to counter harassment allegations against its members.

headlines: Efforts to revive Khalistan-linked terrorism in Punjab: Govt
text: Union Minister Hansraj Ahir on Tuesday said the NIA has registered seven terror-related cases in Punjab which were aimed at reviving the Khalistan-linked terrorism in the state. He added that the objective of these cases was to destabilise the law and order situation in Punjab. He said to avert such situation, intelligence and security agencies are working with effective coordination.

headlines: Emergency exit was locked at hotel where fire killed 17: Minister
text: Union Minister KJ Alphons has said the emergency exit of Arpit Palace hotel in Delhi's Karol Bagh, where 17 people were killed in a fire, was locked. "The police had to rescue people from the front...Also, the emergency door was too narrow. There was a violation of building rules," Alphons added. The cause of fire is yet to be ascertained.

headlines: Misdiagnosed as cancer-free 6 times, UK nurse dies aged 49
text: The family of a 49-year-old nurse, who worked with UK's National Health Service for 13 years, has called for a public enquiry after she was misdiagnosed cervical cancer-free six times by government doctors. Three days prior to her death, Julie O'Connor and her husband recorded a video saying, "The doctors, who had several opportunities to intervene, I hold them responsible".

headlines: Ranveer and I are mad enough to get lost in a shot: Alia
text: Alia Bhatt, who'll be seen with Ranveer Singh in their upcoming film 'Gully Boy', said, "Ranveer and I are mad enough to get lost in a shot and believe that we are 'Murad' and 'Safina'." "We've shown a real relationship. And for that to come across, both of us had to feel it...Hopefully, people will feel that connection," added Alia.

headlines: If 'Uri' was propaganda film, I wouldn't be in it: Vicky
text: Addressing critics who have called his film 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' a government mouthpiece, actor Vicky Kaushal said, "If it was a propaganda film, I wouldnt have been part of it." "Its not necessary to view everything through the political lens," Vicky added. He further said that he's happy the "emotional value" of the film is resonating with the audience.

headlines: Academy to present four awards during commercial breaks
text: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has confirmed that four Oscar presentations of the 91st awards ceremony have been set for commercial breaks. The awards in the categories -cinematography, film editing, live action short and makeup and hairstyling will be announced during the ads. The winners' walk from their seats to the stage will reportedly be removed.

headlines: Shraddha to return in Baaghi franchise opposite Tiger Shroff
text: Shraddha Kapoor, who starred opposite Tiger Shroff in 'Baaghi', has returned to the franchise and will be starring in the upcoming film 'Baaghi 3'. "The entire team of 'Baaghi' is very happy to have Shraddha back," confirmed the film's producers, Nadiadwala Grandson, in a statement. Tiger's rumoured girlfriend Disha Patani had starred opposite him in 'Baaghi 2'.

headlines: Women need more representation in film industry: Sonam
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor has said that she believes women need to have more representation in the film industry. "There should be more women representation in terms of...more thought and content for them," the actress explained. "There are talented women in the film industry...who've...achieved stardom and it all should be used in the right way," Sonam further said.

headlines: 18-yr-old Jemimah ranked 2nd in womens T20I batting rankings
text: India's 18-year-old cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues has reached the second spot in the women's T20I batting rankings. India's Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur occupy the sixth and seventh spots respectively in the rankings. Mandhana was last week crowned the number one in the women's ODI batting rankings. Windies allrounder Deandra Dottin grabbed the number one spot in the T20I allrounders' table.

headlines: PM Imran Khan not interfering in cricket affairs: PCB Chairman
text: Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ehsan Mani has said that former cricketer and current Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan is not interfering in cricket affairs of the nation. "He doesn't interfere at all. But he has made it clear that he wants to see a cricket system in Pakistan free of politicisation... and based on quality rather than quantity," Mani added.

headlines: Apple names 30-yr veteran Casanova as 1st AR marketing head
text: Apple has appointed 30-year veteran Frank Casanova as the company's first-ever head of marketing for augmented reality (AR). Casanova has helped Apple strike deals with carriers to promote its iPhones since launch and develop older Apple products like the QuickTime video player. This comes alongside reports that Apple is planning a 3D-based AR camera for its iPhones in 2020.

headlines: Jo bhrasht hai, usko Modi se kasht hai: PM Modi in Haryana
text: Addressing a rally in Haryana's Kurukshetra, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said, "Jo bhrasht hai, usko PM Modi se kasht hai (The corrupt have a problem with Modi)". "The faces of 'mahamilavat' are in a competition among themselves to threaten court, CBI, and abuse Modi," he added. "Today all honest people have faith in the chowkidaar," he further said.

headlines: Akhilesh's visit to Prayagraj could spark violence: Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said SP chief Akhilesh Yadav was prevented from flying to Prayagraj for an event at Allahabad University, as it was suspected it would spark violence on campus. "It was Allahabad University's administration which asked us to stop him from coming to Prayagraj," he added. Akhilesh was supposed to attend oath-taking ceremony of a student leader.

headlines: Saudi Crown Prince to make 1st visit to India on Feb 19-20
text: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will make his first state visit to India on February 19-20, the External Affairs Ministry said. He'll be accompanied by a high-level delegation, including ministers, senior officials and Saudi businessmen. The Crown Prince will meet President Ram Nath Kovind and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu, and hold bilateral talks with PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: Rahul a lobbyist for plane suppliers: BJP on Rafale remarks
text: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday said, "(Congress President) Rahul Gandhi is working as a lobbyist for competitive aircraft supplier companies." "Airbus itself is under clouds for deals during UPA regime," Prasad added. This comes after Rahul accused PM Narendra Modi of acting as "middleman" for Anil Ambani in the Rafale jet deal, citing an email by Airbus.

headlines: 1 woman dead in firing during idol immersion in Bihar
text: At least one woman was killed and several others were injured in a firing incident during Saraswati idol immersion in Bihar's Hajipur on Monday. According to eyewitnesses, two groups started fighting to dance first, after which they started firing bullets. The police have arrested 11 people in the case and further investigations are underway.

headlines: BJP leader Mukul Roy files bail plea in TMC MLA murder case
text: BJP leader Mukul Roy today filed an anticipatory bail plea in the Calcutta High Court in connection with TMC MLA Satyajit Biswas' murder case. Roy is among the four people named responsible for Biswas' murder. Earlier, he had claimed that the allegations against his party were levelled on the direction of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

headlines: US warships sail in disputed South China Sea
text: Two US warships sailed near the China-claimed Spratly Islands in the disputed South China Sea on Monday, as part of what the US calls "freedom of navigation operations". China said the US is trying "to provoke trouble and create tension to disrupt the peace and stability" of the sea. Nearly 90% of the South China Sea is claimed by China.

headlines: After Afghanistan, acting US Defence Secy makes surprise Iraq visit
text: Following his surprise visit to Afghanistan, acting US Defence Secretary Patrick Shanahan arrived in Iraq on Tuesday for an unannounced visit. His visit to Iraq comes after the country's President Barham Salih told the US to not overburden Iraq with its own issues. Earlier, US President Donald Trump said he would ask US troops stationed in Iraq to "watch" Iran.

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar's most home tons came at Chennai's Chepauk Stadium
text: Sachin Tendulkar smashed five of his 42 centuries in India at Chennai's MA Chidambaram or Chepauk Stadium, the most for him at a single Indian stadium. Sachin's first-ever international hundred in India also came at Chepauk, when he hit 165(296) in a Test against England on February 12, 1993. Interestingly, Sachin hit all five centuries at the stadium in Tests.

headlines: Mahesh Anand had stopped getting work for more than 10 yrs: Pahlaj
text: Filmmaker Pahlaj Nihalani has revealed that late actor Mahesh Anand, who was found dead in his apartment, had stopped getting work for more than ten years. "It's a fact that he was without work...I do not know his financial condition. But it must have been distressful," he added. Nihalani further said he didn't know if Mahesh had a drinking problem.

headlines: Mahesh married 2-3 times & had a son, but lived all alone: Pahlaj
text: Filmmaker Pahlaj Nihalani, while speaking about actor Mahesh Anand who was recently found dead in his apartment, said, "Though married 2-3 times and though he has a son, Mahesh lived all alone." "He had stopped getting work for more than ten years," Pahlaj added. He further revealed Mahesh himself had asked him for a role in his film 'Rangeela Raja'.

headlines: Nothing wrong with being gay: Joe Root to Windies bowler's taunts
text: After Shannon Gabriel taunted Joe Root during England's second innings in the third Test, the England captain was heard telling the Windies pacer, "Don't use it as...insult. There's nothing wrong with being gay." Gabriel's initial remarks were not aired but he was spoken to by umpires after his conduct. Root later suggested Gabriel may have said something he "might regret".

headlines: Young cricketer, brother held for assaulting ex-cricketer Bhandari
text: Aspiring cricketer Anuj Dheda and his brother were arrested for assaulting former India cricketer and current Delhi chief selector Amit Bhandari. As many as 15 people led by Anuj beat Bhandari with hockey sticks and iron rods at St Stephen's ground for not picking Anuj in the Under-23 team. Bhandari claimed that one man also threatened him with a revolver.

headlines: Banned in China, Reddit raises $300 million led by China's Tencent
text: US-based Reddit confirmed it has raised $300 million at a $3 billion post-money valuation, with $150 million from China's Tencent. This comes as several US-based services like Google and Facebook are blocked in China while Reddit has been banned since August 2018. Reddit users posted memes over the funding amid fears the online discussions platform would come under Chinese censorship.

headlines: AP CM submits memorandum to Prez over special status issue
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to President Ram Nath Kovind regarding the status of implementation of assurances made in the parliament during the passing of AP Reorganisation Act, 2014. He also undertook a protest march from Andhra Bhavan to Rashtrapati Bhavan in the morning. On Monday, Naidu had observed a day-long fast over the same.

headlines: Congress MP's car rams into Parliament barricade, sets off siren
text: A high alert was sounded in Delhi on Tuesday, after the car of Congress MP from Manipur, Thokchom Meinya, rammed into a barricade at the Parliament premises. The incident took place when the car got stuck on the security spikes and set off the security siren. Even though the car suffered some damages, no one was injured in the accident,

headlines: Akhilesh 'detained' while boarding plane to Prayagraj; tweets pic
text: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday claimed that he was stopped and "detained" at Lucknow airport by Uttar Pradesh police before boarding his flight to Prayagraj. "It's clear how frightened the government is by the oath ceremony of a student leader," Akhilesh tweeted, sharing pictures of the incident. Akhilesh was going to attend an oath-taking ceremony at Allahabad University.

headlines: Child marriages still prevalent in Bihar, WB, Raj: UNICEF
text: The UNICEF on Monday said the practice of child marriage was still prevalent in a few states like Bihar, West Bengal and Rajasthan. It added that there was nearly 40% prevalence of such practice in these states. A report 'Factsheet Child Marriages 2019' released by the UNICEF stated that in Tamil Nadu and Kerala child marriage prevalence was below 20%.

headlines: Where is your helmet: Puducherry Lt Guv Kiran Bedi scolds bikers
text: To spread awareness on traffic rules, Puducherry Lieutenant Governor and retired IPS officer Kiran Bedi on Sunday reprimanded bikers on streets for riding without helmet or with more than two riders. In a video, Bedi could be seen stopping and asking riders, "Where is your helmet?" She also directed defaulters with more than two riders to get down from two-wheelers.

headlines: Girl in 1972 Vietnam war photo receives prize for peace work
text: Kim Phuc, who was photographed running down a road in tears, naked and severely burned at the age of nine in 1972 during the Vietnam War, has received the Dresden prize for her work for peace. Now aged 55, Phuc was honoured for her support of UNESCO and children wounded in war, and for speaking out against violence and hatred.

headlines: N Korea may have made more nukes, but threat reduced: Stanford study
text: North Korea continued to produce bomb fuel while in denuclearisation talks with the US and may have added five to seven nuclear weapons to its arsenal, according to a study by Stanford University's Centre for International Security and Cooperation. However, the study stated that "North Korea is less dangerous today than it was at the end of 2017".

headlines: Kohli will be one of greatest, if not greatest ever: Sangakkara
text: Former Sri Lankan team captain Kumar Sangakkara praised Indian team captain Virat Kohli, saying, "[H]e will be one of the greatest ever cricketers, if not the greatest ever." "Everything about Virat's game stands out. I think he is head and shoulders above anyone else in world cricket today," Sangakkara said about the 30-year-old batsman.

headlines: Kohli hasnt been disrespectful to anyone: Cheteshwar Pujara
text: Speaking about Indian captain Virat Kohli's attitude, Cheteshwar Pujara said, "He can behave the way he wants to as long as he respects the game. He hasn't been disrespectful to anyone else." "Sledging is something which he likes at times. And there is nothing wrong in that," Pujara added about Kohli.

headlines: Russia may briefly cut internet to test cyber defence: Reports
text: Russia is reportedly planning to temporarily disconnect itself from the internet before April 1 to test its cyber defences. The test will help gather insight on a draft law introduced last year that requires Russian internet providers to route data within the country and not globally in case foreign powers act to isolate it online, reports said.

headlines: Facebook adds 5 partners to spot fake news ahead of LS polls
text: Social media giant Facebook has added five new partners to its third-party fact-checking programme in India, aimed at reducing the spread of fake news. Stories marked as false will be shown lower in the news feed, Facebook said. "We're committed to fighting spread of false news...especially ahead of the 2019 general elections," Facebook India News Partnerships Head Manish Khanduri said.

headlines: Vadra criticises govt for harassing 'senior citizen' mother
text: Ahead of appearing before the Enforcement Directorate with his mother, businessman Robert Vadra accused the government of "harassing a senior citizen" who has lost her husband and two children. He said, "Three deaths and all I did was to ask her to spend time with me in my office, so I can look after her... Now she is being accused."

headlines: Swiggy to now deliver products from local stores to users
text: Food delivery startup Swiggy in a blog post on Tuesday introduced a new in-app service 'Swiggy Stores', which lets users order products from local stores for delivery. It'll cover categories including pet care stores, baby care stores and paan shops. The beta version of the service has been launched in Gurugram where Swiggy has partnered with stores including Guardian Pharmacy.

headlines: NASA finds possible second impact crater under Greenland ice
text: NASA has detected signs of a new meteorite impact crater under northwestern Greenland ice-sheet. The new 36-km-wide crater site is around 183 km away from the previous 31-km-wide crater, the first to be found under one of Earth's continental ice sheets, which was discovered in November 2018. Researchers suspect the new crater site may be at least 79,000 years old.

headlines: Soldier martyred, terrorist killed in encounter in J&K's Pulwama
text: An Army soldier was martyred and a terrorist was killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmirs Pulwama district on Tuesday. Security forces had launched a cordon and search operation in Ratnipora area, and the encounter ensued after the militants fired upon them, as per reports. Another soldier was also injured in the encounter.

headlines: PM Modi condoles loss of lives in Delhi hotel fire
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the death of 17 people in a fire at a hotel in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Tuesday morning. His office tweeted, "Deeply saddened by the loss of lives due to a fire at Karol Bagh in Delhi. I convey my condolences to the families of those who lost their lives. May the injured recover soon."

headlines: Reached casting director's home dressed as Mr India for role: Ranveer
text: Ranveer Singh has revealed he once dressed up as Anil Kapoor's character from Mr India and visited casting director Shanoo Sharma's house. "During my struggling days, it was rumoured...Shekhar Kapur was making Mr India 2," he clarified. Ranveer added during his initial days, the kind of films he loved were the ones in which the hero was the king.

headlines: Couldn't afford Husain painting, used Madhuri's name to get it: Anil
text: Anil Kapoor revealed he once used Madhuri Dixit's name to get a painting by MF Husain for his house. "Back then, we couldn't afford...Husain saab's painting," he said. Anil added he learnt Husain had been trying to meet Madhuri and further revealed, "I said I could get him to meet her but...he'd have to give me one of his paintings."

headlines: Virat Kohli is a very big player, I am nowhere near him: Babar Azam
text: Talking about people comparing him to Virat Kohli, Pakistan's 24-year-old batsman Babar Azam said that he is nowhere near to the Team India captain. "I think Kohli is a very big player...I have just started while he has achieved a lot. I have to achieve and if I perform like that...you can compare but not now," he added.

headlines: Hoax has my family deeply disturbed: Raina denies death rumours
text: Indian batsman Suresh Raina took to Twitter to quash rumours of his death in a road accident, which have been circulating on the internet. Adding that the YouTube channels which reported the fake news have been reported, the 32-year-old added, "The hoax has my family & friends deeply disturbed...Please ignore any such news; with god's grace I'm doing absolutely fine."

headlines: Panama's Copa Airlines crowned most punctual in global survey
text: Panamas Copa Airlines SA has been crowned the most punctual airline of 2018 in a global survey conducted by UK-based data firm OAG Aviation Worldwide. Latvia's airBaltic was ranked second in punctuality, followed by Hong Kong Airlines, Hawaiian Airlines and Bangkok Airways. Tokyo's Haneda airport topped the mega airport list for the best airports for on-time performance.

headlines: PM acted like Anil Ambani's middleman: Rahul cites email
text: Citing an Airbus executive's email that claimed businessman Anil Ambani was aware of the MoU days before India and France signed the Rafale deal, Congress President Rahul Gandhi accused PM Narendra Modi of "treason" and acting as Ambani's middleman. Rahul added, "PM Modi is acting like a spy, giving out defence information, which under oath he's not supposed to."

headlines: Flipkart's Binny Bansal, Kalyan back fund Tanglin: Report
text: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal, CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy, Udaan Co-founder Sujeet Kumar, Facebook's Asia Pacific head Dan Neary and others have reportedly invested in fund Tanglin Venture Partners. Ravi Venkatesh and Edwina Yeo, who were executives at Tiger Global, started their own fund Tanglin Venture Partners. The new fund targets a corpus of $50 million to be distributed among 10-12 startups.

headlines: Owner of pen drive in leopard seal's frozen poop found in NZ
text: The owner of a USB stick, found in frozen faeces of a leopard seal in New Zealand, has been revealed as Amanda Nally, who helped collect the sample a year ago. The functioning USB stick contained footage of an unidentified person kayaking and filming seals. The device was likely eaten by a bird, which was then eaten by the seal.

headlines: Delhi hotel had 6 floors instead of permissible 4: Minister
text: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain has tweeted that Karol Bagh's Hotel Arpit Palace, where 17 people died in a fire on Tuesday morning, had six floors, including one temporary floor, instead of the permissible four floors. Stating that there were "visible violations of building bye-laws," Jain added that a fire inspection and enquiry has been ordered.

headlines: 5200 flats in Amrapali projects bogus, unsold: SC-appointed auditors
text: There are 5,200 flats in various Amrapali projects which are either bogus or unsold, court-appointed forensic auditors on Monday told the Supreme Court. Moreover, Amrapali's two properties couldn't be auctioned by Debts Recovery Tribunal as banks refused to finance buyers. The case pertains to petitions filed by homebuyers, seeking possession of around 42,000 flats booked under Amrapali projects.

headlines: Video: 2 hanging from hotel's terrace to escape fire that killed 17
text: A video of the fire at Hotel Arpit Palace in Delhi's Karol Bagh shows two people hanging from the top floor of the burning building in a bid to escape the blaze. It later shows one of them falling down to the ground. The cause of the fire, that killed at least 17 people, is yet to be ascertained.

headlines: Robert Vadra, mother Maureen at ED office for questioning
text: Businessman Robert Vadra and his mother Maureen Vadra appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in connection with an alleged land scam in Bikaner district, Rajasthan. The duo was accompanied to the Jaipur ED office by Robert Vadra's wife Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Senior ED officials reportedly prepared a set of 55 questions for Vadra in connection with the case.

headlines: NZ flight turns back midair over no permission to land in China
text: An Air New Zealand flight flying from Auckland to Shanghai was forced to return after nearly five hours into the journey as it didn't have permission to land in China. The plane was new to the company's fleet and did not have the correct paperwork to land in China, Air New Zealand said. The plane was carrying around 270 passengers.

headlines: 5 trucks with Saudi prince's amenities reach Pak ahead of visit: Report
text: Five trucks full of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's personal amenities have reportedly reached Pakistan ahead of his visit to the country. His security team has also arrived. While the Saudi Crown Prince himself is expected to stay at the Prime Minister House, two of the top hotels in Islamabad have been booked fully for members of his staff.

headlines: US man enters abandoned house to smoke weed; finds tigress inside
text: A US man, who entered an abandoned house to smoke marijuana, found a caged overweight female tiger inside the property. The man, who thought he was hallucinating when he first saw the tigress, then called animal control. The officials asked the man if he was under the effect of marijuana or if he actually saw the animal.

headlines: Anurag to replace Vikas for post-production of 'Super 30'
text: Anurag Kashyap has confirmed that he will replace Vikas Bahl for the post-production of Hrithik Roshan's upcoming film 'Super 30'. Anurag reportedly said that he won't take any credit for the work he will be doing in 'Super 30'. Hrithik had earlier said that it is impossible for him to work with Vikas who has been accused of sexual harassment.

headlines: Some names shocked me but I can't be judgmental: Ajay on #MeToo
text: Ajay Devgn, while talking about #MeToo movement, said, "Some names did shock me but then I can't be judgmental completely till somebody proves someone guilty." "A couple of things came out and some people are like this but everybody is not like that," he added. Ajay further said that the new generation thinks differently and won't accept any "bullshit".

headlines: Aamir and Madhuri's 'Dil' to have sequel titled 'Dil Again'
text: Aamir Khan and Madhuri Dixit starrer 1990 film 'Dil' will have a sequel titled 'Dil Again'. Director Indra Kumar, who is yet to find the lead actors for the sequel, confirmed the news and said, "I had been planning to make the sequel to...'Dil' for some time now. We have cracked a script." The original film also starred Anupam Kher.

headlines: Amit Shah launches campaign to hoist BJP flag at 5 cr houses
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Tuesday launched the "Mera Parivar, Bhajapa Parivar" campaign which aims to put the party flag at 5 crore houses of its workers and supporters. Shah began the campaign by hoisting the flag at his residence in Gujarat. "This BJP flag is a symbol of development, belief and nationalism," Shah said.

headlines: Sec 144 in Imphal ahead of Citizenship Bill tabling in RS
text: Prohibitory orders under Section 144 have been imposed in East and West Imphal districts ahead of the tabling of Citizenship (Amendment) Bill in the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. The order has been imposed because of intense agitation launched by various civil society organisations against the passing of the bill. The Bill was passed by the Lok Sabha on January 8.

headlines: Principal, VP quit after college trust cancels Guj MLA event
text: The principal and vice principal of Ahmedabads Shri HK Arts College on Monday resigned after the management cancelled an event where Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was invited. The college trust refused to provide the college hall for the event, citing opposition to Mevani from a section of students. The principal termed the trust's move "curbing of rights of speech".

headlines: Dalit policeman's wedding procession attacked in Rajasthan
text: The wedding procession of a Dalit policeman was allegedly attacked by some members of the Rajput community in Rajasthan's Dugar village on Saturday. The groom, Sawai Ram, accused the perpetrators of assaulting him and attacking his wedding party with sharp weapons. The police have registered a case and detained several people in connection with the incident.

headlines: Missing Pune RTI activist found dead; police suspect murder
text: A 32-year-old RTI activist, Vinayak Shirsat, who went missing last month, was found dead in Pune on Monday. It is suspected that the deceased, a Pune resident, was murdered, a police official said. Shirsat's family suspects that he might have been abducted as he had raised voice under the RTI Act against illegal constructions in the city, he added.

headlines: 9 dead as fire breaks out at Delhi hotel; people jump from balcony
text: At least nine people have been killed in a fire that broke out at Hotel Arpit Palace in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Tuesday morning. "A couple of staff members jumped from the balcony of the hotel...We're not certain if they made it out alive," a fire official said. Around 20 fire engines were rushed to the spot.

headlines: Delhi hotel that caught fire was booked by a wedding party
text: Hotel Arpit Palace in Delhi's Karol Bagh, where at least 17 people have died in the fire that broke out on Tuesday, was booked by a wedding party. Most of the people were asleep when the fire broke out. Reportedly, a woman and a child died while trying to escape by jumping through the window of the five-storey hotel.

headlines: Actor Purab Kohli becomes father for 2nd time, shares newborn's pic
text: Purab Kohli and his wife Lucy Payton were blessed with a baby boy in January, the actor revealed on Instagram on Sunday. Sharing a picture of himself with the newborn, Purab wrote, "Balls of hair fuzzing up together. Hello #OsianNur #MySon." This is the second child of the couple, who already have a daughter named Inaya.

headlines: Tanushree pens letter for Kangana, calls her A++ list actress
text: Tanushree Dutta has penned a letter for Kangana Ranaut, in which she called Kangana an "A++ list actress" and added, "She is the only one who made it to the top...in Bollywood without the nagging support...of A- list male stars." "Kangana, they don't support you because they are intimidated by your talent," Tanushree added.

headlines: Was under house arrest after 'wink' video went viral: Priya Varrier
text: Actress Priya Prakash Varrier has revealed she was on house arrest after her 'wink' in the song 'Manikya Malaraya Poovi' went viral. "I wasn't allowed to go out because my parents were tensed. The media people would turn up at my door without even informing," she added. "Everything was new to me as well as my family," Priya further said.

headlines: Unborn baby removed from womb for surgery in UK, then put back
text: An unborn baby in the UK was removed from its mother's womb for a surgery before being put safely back inside. Surgeons performed the operation at 24 weeks' gestation after scans revealed the foetus had spina bifida. The condition can leave sufferers with walking difficulties and even paralysis because the spinal cord does not fully develop during pregnancy.

headlines: On way to marry boyfriend in Delhi, 15-yr-old raped by 2 in Punjab
text: A 15-year-old girl, who wanted to reach Delhi to marry her boyfriend, was allegedly raped by an auto driver and his friend at a hotel in Punjab's Amritsar. The girl filed an FIR after the accused made her board a bus back to her hometown Ludhiana. She had eloped to marry the boy she met a year ago.

headlines: Man finds blood-stained bandage in food; Swiggy suspends eatery
text: A man in Chennai allegedly found a blood-stained, used bandage in the food he had ordered through Swiggy. The man, in his Facebook post, wrote, "Contacted restaurant and they aren't sensitive and offering replacement...Who again wants to eat such contaminated food!" Apologising for the incident, Swiggy said it has suspended the restaurant "pending further investigation by an external agency."

headlines: Rules followed in giving license to Delhi hotel: Hotel body
text: Delhi Hotel and Restaurant Owners' Association Vice-President Balan Mani said all norms were followed while issuing a license to Karol Bagh's Hotel Arpit Palace, where 17 people died in a fire. He added, "Mishaps can occur in a house as well." However, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain said the hotel violated building bye-laws and had more than the permissible four floors.

headlines: Russian islands declare emergency over polar bear 'invasion'
text: A remote Russian region has declared a state of emergency over the appearance of dozens of polar bears in its human settlements. Authorities in the Novaya Zemlya islands, home to around 3,000 people, said there were cases of bears attacking people and entering residential and public buildings. Russia classes polar bears as endangered and shooting them is prohibited by law.

headlines: US lawmakers reach tentative deal to avoid fresh govt shutdown
text: US congressional negotiators said on Monday they reached a tentative deal on border security funding to avert a fresh partial government shutdown due to start on Saturday. However, an aide said the deal did not include the $5.7 billion President Donald Trump demanded for a border wall. The last government shutdown was the longest in the country's history.

headlines: Vodafone Idea makes IIT alumnus Suresh Vaswani independent director
text: India's largest telecom operator Vodafone Idea on Monday said its board has appointed Suresh Vaswani, an IIT Kharagpur alumnus, as an independent director for three years. The 59-year-old is currently acting as an external global advisor to US-based Bain & Company, it added. Vaswani has also previously worked at IBM Global Technology Services, Dell India and Wipro.

headlines: I was offered Vicky Kaushal's role in Lust Stories: Badshah
text: Singer-rapper Badshah, who will be making his acting debut opposite Sonakshi Sinha, has revealed that he was offered Vicky Kaushal's role in 'Lust Stories' which he had declined. "'Good News'...the one that Diljit Dosanjh is doing with Akshay Kumar, was offered to me," he added. Badshah further said that he got more offers but his focus was on his album.

headlines: Blessed to have told this story: Karan on 9 yrs of My Name Is Khan
text: On the occasion of his film 'My Name Is Khan' completing nine years of its release on Tuesday, Karan Johar wrote, "I feel so blessed to have been able to tell this story." He also thanked Shah Rukh Khan "for living the role of 'Rizwan' so beautifully and brilliantly". "Thank you Kajol for your eyes...silences and more," Karan further wrote.

headlines: Best time to be in industry, females are dominating: Tisca
text: Tisca Chopra has said this is the best time to be in Indian cinema as female actors are dominating the industry. She added, "Earlier, the audience used to go to cinema halls to see heroes on-screen but now they go to theatres to watch our powerful heroines." Tisca further said that the filmmakers have started making strong roles for women.

headlines: Naidu is back to theatrics, lost his credibility: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday said, "The Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader N Chandrababu Naidu is back to theatrics and histrionics." Shah added that Naidu has lost "complete credibility" among the people of the state. Shah's remarks come after Naidu sat on a day-long fast in Delhi, demanding the Centre to give special category status to Andhra Pradesh.

headlines: K'taka CM orders SIT inquiry into audio clips of Yeddyurappa
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Monday announced an inquiry by a Special Investigation Team (SIT) into the audio clips he had released last week. Kumaraswamy claimed that the clips proved the poaching of JD(S) MLA by BJP state chief BS Yeddyurappa. Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar has ordered the probe to be finished within 15 days.

headlines: AAP invites Rahul Gandhi for opposition rally in Delhi
text: The AAP has invited Congress President Rahul Gandhi to attend its mega "Tanashahi Hatao, Loktantra Bachao" rally in Delhi on Wednesday, said AAP leaders. "Sharad Pawar, Sharad Yadav, Tejashwi Yadav, Akhilesh Yadav, Mayawati, Mamata Banerjee, MK Stalin and Chandrababu Naidu are among others invited for the rally," they added.

headlines: Days after TMC MLA's murder, another party leader found dead
text: After TMC MLA Satyajit Biswas was killed on February 9, TMC leader Ritesh Roy was found dead in West Bengal on Monday. The police said, "There are two external injury marks on Roy's throat and eye. Post mortem report said he was killed by strangulation." Purba Medinipur TMC secretary Kanishka Panda accused BJP of killing Roy, although BJP denied this.

headlines: Ex-Google engineers' driverless delivery startup Nuro gets $940M
text: Silicon Valley-based driverless delivery startup Nuro, co-founded by two former Google self-driving car project engineers, has raised $940 million from SoftBank Vision Fund. The new funding values the startup at a reported $2.7 billion. Founded in 2016 by Dave Ferguson and Jiajun Zhu, Nuro offers self-driving vehicles designed to transport and deliver goods.

headlines: Mobile wallet transactions rose 40 times in last 5 yrs: Govt
text: National Cyber Security Coordinator in the PMO Gulshan Rai on Monday said, "Mobile wallet transactions have increased 40 times in the last five years." He added that the digital economy in India was growing 1.5 times faster than the global average. He further said that the digital economy is likely to increase up to 30% of GDP in 2025.

headlines: SC refuses to monitor CBI probe in Saradha case in WB
text: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to monitor the CBI probe into the Saradha chit fund scam in West Bengal. The matter was brought by a group of investors, who said the CBI probe had not led to any conclusion. This comes after the top court ordered Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar to appear before the central agency for questioning.

headlines: Grammys misspell winner Kacey Musgraves' name during intro
text: The producers of the 61st Grammy Awards misspelled singer Kacey Musgraves' name as 'Kasey Musgraves' when she was introduced as one of the performers towards the beginning of the show. "The Grammys just spelled KACEY Musgraves' name wrong. I'm livid," a Twitter user commented. However, her name was spelled correctly throughout the rest of the show.

headlines: Never talked about sex in our family, we still don't: Actress Kirti
text: Actress Kirti Kulhari who acted in films like 'Uri: The Surgical Strike', 'Pink' and 'Blackmail', said that she comes from a family where they never talked about sex. "We still dont. Relationships were looked down upon," she added. The actress said that not discussing this with her family affected her and she had to learn things from her own experiences.

headlines: Singer-rapper Badshah to make his acting debut opposite Sonakshi
text: Singer-rapper Badshah is making his acting debut opposite actress Sonakshi Sinha in debutant director Shilpi Dasgupta's yet to be named film. In the film, Badshah will be playing the role of a Punjabi boy who goes on to become a famous singer. "I'm extremely nervous, however, I have taken the leap. This year I have undertaken many firsts," said Badshah.

headlines: Ex-IPS officer Ghosh moves SC for protection from WB police
text: Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, who joined BJP last week, has moved the Supreme Court seeking protection from any coercive action by the West Bengal police in new corruption cases registered against her. Ghosh has claimed police has registered seven FIRs against her including one lodged last week. An SC bench will hear her application on February 19.

headlines: 'Chowkidar Chor Nahi, Pure Hai': Rajnath Singh
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday took a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi, who criticises PM Narendra Modi by calling him "Chowkidar Chor Hai", saying "Chowkidar Chor Nahi, Pure Hai". Addressing an event, he added PM Modi was the only "cure" to the problems of the nation. He further said PM Modi is "sure" to be the next PM.

headlines: HP CM loses temper at Congress leader in state Assembly
text: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Monday lost his temper in the state Assembly when Congress leader Mukesh Agnihotri taunted him. Thakur was replying to a question on expenditure incurred on Jan Manch Programmes (JMPs) when Agnihotri said such a scheme was also taken up during the Congress' rule. "No member can intervene like this," Thakur said addressing Deputy Speaker.

headlines: Congress posts Telangana pic to show turnout at Priyanka's UP rally
text: Congress spokesperson Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday tweeted four photos to show the turnout at roadshow held by newly-elected eastern Uttar Pradesh General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. However, one of the photos shared by her was a two-month-old picture from a party rally in Telangana. Following the goof-up, she deleted the tweet and posted correct images.

headlines: Cheap politics has become Congress' identity: Nitin Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday took a dig at the Congress party saying that the cheap politics has become the identity of the oldest party of the country. He added, "Congress' politics is now restricted to spewing falsehoods and twisting statements." He further said Congress is breaking its own record of indulging in politics of "hatred".

headlines: Chimpanzees use branch as ladder to escape UK zoo enclosure
text: Chimpanzees used a branch to escape from their enclosure at a zoo in the UK in the second breach by animals in recent weeks. Zoo officials said trees in the enclosure had been weakened by the storms, allowing the chimps to break them and use them as a ladder to escape. Earlier, a red panda cub escaped from its enclosure.

headlines: Ex-Man Utd player Scholes appointed manager of Oldham Athletic
text: Former Manchester United player Paul Scholes has been appointed as the manager of Oldham Athletic, the club announced on Monday. This is the 44-year-old's first managerial job and he has signed a contract for one and a half years. Oldham are placed 14th in the League Two, which is the fourth tier competition in English football.

headlines: BCCI questions use of Dravid's name in India A coach appointment
text: BCCI's acting secretary Amitabh Choudhary has questioned whether former India international Rahul Dravid's name is being used in the process of appointing Vikram Rathour as India A's batting coach. Choudhary also pointed out that Rathour is a British passport holder and questioned whether there had been deliberation about appointing a foreign coach for the India A side.

headlines: Cummins pays tribute to Lillee after winning Allan Border Medal
text: Australian pacer Pat Cummins paid tribute to former Australian pacer Dennis Lillee after winning the Allan Border Medal at the 2019 Cricket Australia Awards. Cummins credited Lillee for supporting him and helping him with his game. Cummins, aged 25 years and 279 days, is also the youngest Allan Border Medal-winner since Steven Smith won in 2015.

headlines: PM vindictive leader, Shiv Sena also unhappy with him: Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Monday called PM Narendra Modi a 'vindictive' leader with whom even BJP's ally Shiv Sena is unhappy. "Uddhav Thackeray is best friend of mine...Bal Thackeray was very affectionate towards me," he added. "I took the principal stand to protect democracy...[But] if there's no democracy...[no one] will be able to talk anything," he further said.

headlines: Zomato's 40% delivery fleet to have power-assisted bikes by 2021
text: Gurugram-based online food delivery startup Zomato in a blog post on Monday said it aims to convert 40% of its delivery fleet to power-assisted bikes by 2021. The startup said it's adopting the method to reduce its carbon footprint. It added it has partnered with bicycle entities including Mobycy and Zoomcars PEDL to provide e-cycle fleet to delivery executives.

headlines: Govt may exempt DPIIT-certified startups from 'angel tax'
text: The government is reportedly considering giving complete exemption from 'angel tax' to startups certified by Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). This comes as startups raised concern on receiving 'angel tax' notices, impacting their businesses. Currently, funds raised by startups above the "fair market value" is deemed as income from other sources and taxed at 30%.

headlines: CPI(M) leader P Jayarajan charged with criminal conspiracy
text: The CBI has charged senior CPI(M) leader P Jayarajan and Kerala CPI(M) MLA TV Rajesh with 'conspiracy to commit murder' in connection with the killing of activist Abdul Shukoor in 2012. Shukoor, a Muslim Youth League activist, was reportedly murdered in retaliation as he was involved in blocking and attacking a vehicle in which Jayarajan and Rajesh were travelling.

headlines: Hazarika's family turns down Bharat Ratna to protest Citizenship Bill
text: Bhupen Hazarika's family has decided to turn down Bharat Ratna that was conferred to the Assamese singer posthumously, to protest Citizenship (Amendment) Bill. The Bill seeks to make minorities from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan who entered India before December 31, 2014, eligible for citizenship. It is said to impact over one crore tribal people in Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram.

headlines: 20-year-old woman gangraped at farmhouse in Ludhiana
text: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped in Ludhiana on Saturday. The victim and her male friend were in their car when five men allegedly attacked and took them to a farmhouse, where they raped the woman. The woman alleged that the five attackers called seven other men to the farmhouse, who also sexually assaulted her.

headlines: Reliance Realty to build fintech centre in Navi Mumbai
text: Reliance Realty, a subsidiary of Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications (RCom), on Monday said it will develop Smart Fintech Centre in Navi Mumbai. The site will be developed at Dhirubhai Ambani Knowledge City, which is spread across over 132 acres, under the state government's new Fintech Policy. The centre is set to be the first of its kind in Maharashtra.

headlines: B-town & sneakerheads unite for PUMAs exclusive RS-X launch
text: PUMA India hosted an exclusive launch event for the RS-X series of sneakers featuring first-of-its-kind experiential pop-up space in Mumbai, on 9th February. The who's who of B-town and sneakerheads of the country came together to celebrate the year's most-awaited sneaker series drop. The RS-X series goes back in time and reinvents the 80s PUMA Running System (RS).

headlines: Death toll due to hooch tragedy crosses 100 in UP, Uttarakhand
text: The death toll in the twin hooch tragedies in Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand has risen to 108, with many people still recovering at hospitals, officials have said. The victims from UP had visited Uttarakhand for a funeral after which they consumed hooch (liquor) which was poisonous. Uttar Pradesh has constituted a special investigation team to probe the deaths.

headlines: Player who attacked Bhandari should be banned for life: Gambhir
text: Reacting to ex-India cricketer and current Delhi selector Amit Bhandari being assaulted by a group of men for allegedly not selecting a player in Under-23 team, ex-cricketer Gautam Gambhir said the player should be banned for life. "Disgusted to see this happen right in...heart of the Capital. This can't slip under the carpet and I'll...ensure it doesn't," he added.

headlines: Young cricketers thrash ex-India pacer Bhandari with hockey sticks
text: Ex-India fast bowler and current Delhi selector Amit Bhandari was thrashed by a group of men led by at least two aspiring cricketers with hockey sticks, during Delhi Under-23 team trials at St Stephen's ground today. Bhandari was attacked after one of the cricketers wasn't selected in the team. Bhandari has been admitted to a hospital in North Delhi.

headlines: PM would be main accused in Rafale if Lokpal was there: Cong
text: Congress leader Veerappa Moily on Monday claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi would have been "number one accused" in the Rafale deal had Lokpal been implemented. Criticising the Centre in the Lok Sabha over Rafale, Moily alleged the deal has become a "household scandal". He said, "When bullet of corruption is hit, his (PM Modi's) broad shoulders cannot bear it."

headlines: 'Chowkidar' PM failed to provide jobs to UP youth: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Monday took a dig at PM Narendra Modi saying 'Chowkidar' failed to provide jobs to youth in Uttar Pradesh. While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh, Rahul added Congress party will fight to transform UP and the nation. "I have given...responsibility of strengthening Congress party in UP to Priyanka (Gandhi) and Jyotiraditya Scindia," he said.

headlines: 'Aa Dekhe Zara': Scindia tweets on Congress' UP roadshow
text: During Congress' General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's first roadshow in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, party leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday tweeted "Aa Dekhe Zara Kisme Kitna Hai Dum, Jamke Rakhna Kadam Mere Saathiya." He also thanked the people of the city for "historic" public support to the party. He further tweeted that UP was ready to take a resolution for change.

headlines: Humans caused over 25% of vertebrate deaths on land: Study
text: A study conducted by scientists in the US has found humans directly caused over 25% of terrestrial vertebrate deaths. Scientists examined about 42,000 deaths, between 1970 and 2018, which were reported in over 1,000 published studies and found that 72% died due to natural causes. "This is...one more example of the effect we're having on the planet," a scientist said.

headlines: Will not leave without getting 5% reservation: KS Bainsla
text: Gujjar leader Kirori Singh Bainsla has threatened the Rajasthan government saying people will leave the protest only after getting 5% reservation. Bainsla requested the Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government to not do anything to provoke people of the state, adding that they are waiting for his instructions. He added, "Let's sort it out in a peaceful manner. The earlier the better."

headlines: Hum subah kha ke aaye the: Girl to PM Modi after lunch served late
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday visited Uttar Pradesh's Vrindavan and served food to children to mark the three billionth meal offered by Akshaya Patra Foundation. While interacting with the schoolchildren, he asked a schoolboy, "The PM arrived late and delayed your meal, right?" Soon after, a schoolgirl sitting next to the boy responded, "Hum subah kha ke aaye the."

headlines: Nathan Lyon named Australia's Test player of the year
text: Australia's fourth-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Nathan Lyon was named the men's Test Player of the Year at the 2019 Australian Cricket Awards. Glenn Maxwell and Marcus Stoinis won the men's T20I and ODI cricketer of the year awards respectively. The 25-year old Pat Cummins who made his international debut in 2011, claimed the Allan Border Medal.

headlines: England's Mark Wood picks 5 wickets in 46 balls vs Windies
text: England's Mark Wood picked up five wickets in a span of 46 balls in the ongoing third Windies-England Test. Wood said that his figures of 5/41 in the third Test against Windies trumped his Ashes-winning wicket against Australia in 2015. Notably, England have already lost the three-match series after having lost the first two Tests.

headlines: Ronaldo accidentally hits teammate Khedira on the face
text: A misdirected shot from Cristiano Ronaldo accidentally hit his Juventus teammate Sami Khedira in the face following which Khedira had to lie down on the pitch. Khedira, who scored a goal in Juventus' 3-0 win over Sassuolo, later thanked Ronaldo for a 'headache' in his tweet. Khedira was substituted five minutes later by Juventus boss Massimiliano Allegri.

headlines: Mistakes can happen, RR will welcome Smith with love: Rahane
text: Speaking about former Rajasthan Royals skipper, Steve Smith, current skipper Ajinkya Rahane said, "Mistakes can happen... Definitely, we will welcome Steve Smith with love because he is our player and he is one of our own." "It is good to have him and I'm sure his inputs and experience will benefit us," Rahane added about the former Australia captain.

headlines: Barcelona held to a draw by Athletic Bilbao
text: Barcelona were held to a 0-0 draw by Athletic Bilbao on Sunday. The draw makes it three games without a win for Barcelona, who are six points clear at the top. "We were first last week and we are still first, and if my maths is right, we will be again next week," Barcelona manager Ernesto Valverde said.

headlines: 'GTA V' game cheat tool creator ordered to pay $150,000
text: A US court has ordered Jhonny Perez to pay $150,000 in damages for creating and sharing paid cheating tool Elusive for video game 'Grand Theft Auto V'. The game makers parent company said the tool, that lets players generate infinite in-game currency, undermined its sale of legitimate virtual currency. Elusive creates in-game features that could harm legitimate players, it added.

headlines: Congress started in UP, can't remain weak here: Rahul Gandhi
text: Speaking at Lalbagh during Congress' mega roadshow in Lucknow, party President Rahul Gandhi said, "Congress started in UP and can't remain weak here." "Lok Sabha polls are approaching and I told them (Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi and Jyotiraditya Scindia) that we should perform better in it and our government should be formed here too," he added.

headlines: Smart lock making startup OpenApp raises $1.3 million
text: Smart lock-making startup OpenApp has raised $1.3 million in pre-Series A funding round from Unicorn India Ventures and KARSEMVEN Fund, backed by Karnataka government. Axilor Ventures also invested in the Bengaluru-based startup's funding round. Founded by Gotama Gowda, Rajshekar Jenne and Siddhesh Keluskar, OpenApp offers Bluetooth and GSM-enabled smart locks to enterprises.

headlines: Insects could vanish within a century at current rate: Study
text: A study by international researchers has suggested that insects could vanish within a century at their current rate of decline. After analysing 73 historical reports of insect decline from across the globe, researchers found there was a 2.5% rate of annual loss over the past 30 years. Researchers said insect decline was caused by factors including increased use of pesticides.

headlines: Created half of 25 lakh jobs promised: Kerala CM Vijayan
text: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said the state government has created at least half of the 25 lakh jobs promised when it assumed office in 2016. "We will achieve the target before the term is over [in 2021]", he added. The state is seeing good reception on investments from startups, IT and tourism sector establishments, he further said.

headlines: SC adjourns plea against clean chit to PM Modi in 2002 riots
text: The Supreme Court on Monday adjourned the plea challenging clean chit given by Special Investigation Team to PM Narendra Modi in the 2002 Gujarat riots, till July. The plea was filed by Zakia Jafri, wife of former MP Ehsan Jafri who was killed in the riots which took place when PM Modi was the Chief Minister of Gujarat.

headlines: SEBI looks into share sale of Anil Ambani's Reliance Group's firms
text: Market regulator SEBI on Monday said it's looking into allegations related to sale of pledged shares of Anil Ambani-led Reliance Group's three listed firms by L&T Finance and Edelweiss Group. This comes after Reliance Power requested SEBI to ban the lenders from trading, alleging "market abuse". The group alleged the sale of shares by the creditors was "illegal" and "motivated".

headlines: Twitter CEO told to appear before Parliamentary Panel, given 15 days
text: Parliamentary Committee on Information Technology has summoned Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and other officials to appear before it on 25 February over perceived bias against right-wing Twitter handles. Twitter India representatives had arrived to appear before the panel today. However, the committee passed a resolution that they won't meet any officials until senior members or CEO appears before it.
