headlines: Potato chips to keep phones grease-free while eating made in Japan
text: Japanese company Koike-ya has launched 'One Hand Chips' which come pre-smashed in a packet with a small opening so that consumers can essentially 'drink' the chips without getting their hands dirty. Koike-ya said these chips can also keep the snackers' phones grease-free. The company said the idea originated from the desire to eat crumbs at the bottom of the packet.

headlines: We can't wait forever to play vs India: Pakistan Cricket Board MD
text: Pakistan Cricket Board Managing Director Wasim Khan has said they can't wait forever to play against India. "We keep on asking [India] to play us but let's create a situation where they ask us to play," he added. Adding it's sad that they are not playing against India, Khan said, "Life continues. We need to move forward and carry on."

headlines: Differently-abled who came to Delhi for Naidu's protest kills self
text: A differently-abled man from Andhra Pradesh committed suicide by consuming poison outside Andhra Bhawan in Delhi on Sunday night. The 40-year-old had come to the national capital to participate in the day-long hunger strike by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu. A suicide note was recovered, wherein the man had cited financial crisis as the reason behind his suicide.

headlines: Please keep her safe: Robert Vadra's FB post on wife Priyanka Gandhi
text: As Priyanka Gandhi Vadra started her campaign for the Lok Sabha elections today in UP's Lucknow, her husband Robert Vadra wrote in a Facebook post, "Now we hand her to the people of India. Please keep her safe." Vadra also wished her luck and described her as "my best friend, a perfect wife and the best mother".

headlines: PM Modi treats opposition states as if he's Pak PM: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday took a dig at PM Narendra Modi saying the way he treats opposition states, it seems like he is Prime Minister of Pakistan and not India. Kejriwal's comment came while he was attending Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu's day-long dharna demanding special status for AP. Congress President Rahul Gandhi also extended support to Naidu.

headlines: Court orders FIR against Arnab, Republic TV over Tharoor e-mail hack
text: On the complaint of Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, a Delhi court has ordered registration of an FIR against news channel Republic TV and its Editor Arnab Goswami. Tharoor alleged theft of confidential documents pertaining to the probe into his wife Sunanda Pushkars death through hacking of his e-mail account. Tharoor also accused Goswami of making malicious and defamatory remarks.

headlines: Kerala woman booked for raping 9-yr-old boy for over a year
text: A 36-year-old woman was booked for allegedly raping a nine-year-old boy in Kerala's Thenhippalam, police said. The accused is a close relative of the boy and was sexually abusing the victim for more than a year, reports said. The incident reportedly came to light last week after the boy narrated his ordeal to a local doctor during consultation.

headlines: Thailand Election Commission disqualifies Princess as PM candidate
text: Thailand's Election Commission has disqualified Princess Ubolratana, the sister of King Maha Vajiralongkorn from running for Prime Minister. The Election Commission released official list of parties' candidates for PM without the name of the Princess, saying that royalty should be "above politics". The King had said it's "inappropriate" for members of the royal family to enter politics.

headlines: Ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama makes surprise appearance at Grammys
text: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama made a surprise appearance during the opening address at the 61st Grammy Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday and was met with a standing ovation. "Music helps us share ourselves, our dignity and sorrows, our hopes and joys...It allows us to hear one another, to invite each other in," she said.

headlines: MS Dhoni has done a lot for the team: Vijay Shankar
text: Indian cricketer Vijay Shankar praised MS Dhoni, saying, "I try and learn from watching each and every player... especially Dhoni, who has done a lot for the team. I definitely look up to him." Speaking about his role in the T20I team, the 28-year-old said, "I look to be flexible and give my best to my team."

headlines: Ronaldo reaches 20-goal mark for the 13th consecutive season
text: Cristiano Ronaldo reached the 20-goal mark for the 13th consecutive season after scoring in Juventus' 3-0 win over Sassuolo on Sunday. Ronaldo, who reached the mark thrice for Manchester United and then nine times for Real Madrid, scored his side's second goal in the 70th minute. Juventus are 11 points clear at the top of the Serie A table.

headlines: Red Bull's F1 driver completes public service punishment
text: Red Bull's Formula One driver Max Verstappen has completed the public service punishment imposed on him after last year's Brazilian Grand Prix by attending a gathering of international race stewards in Geneva. The 21-year-old Dutchman had been given the punishment after he was involved in an altercation with Force India's Esteban at Interlagos last year.

headlines: UK to question Tinder, Grindr on age checks after rape cases
text: The UK's digital secretary Jeremy Wright plans to question dating apps Tinder and Grindr about "measures to keep children safe from harm" including age verification. This follows a report that police investigated over 30 child rape cases since 2015 where victims evaded age checks on dating apps. Wright said he may take action if he wasn't satisfied with apps' response.

headlines: Xiaomi-backed electric toothbrush startup Soocas raises $30M
text: Xiaomi-backed Chinese electric toothbrush-making startup Soocas has raised nearly $30 million in a Series C funding round from a clutch of investors. It had reportedly raised nearly $14 million in a Series B funding round in March last year. Founded in 2015, the Shenzhen-based startup Soocas offers its users digital products for personal healthcare.

headlines: ITC pilots e-comm store for FMCG products in major metros
text: FMCG major ITC has announced it is piloting its e-commerce store in major metros including Delhi-NCR, Mumbai and Chennai. The company's executive director B Sumant said the portal will sell both food and non-food products from its label, initially starting with its gourmet chocolate line, Fabelle. ITC also runs e-commerce operations for its lifestyle apparel business, WLS and John Players.

headlines: No one can repay the debt of gau mata's milk: PM Modi
text: Speaking at the Akshaya Patra Foundation programme in Vrindavan, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said no one in India can repay the debt of gau mata's (cow) milk. "Cow is a vital element of our tradition and culture," he added. He further said his government has taken several steps to improve cattle's health and also started the Rashtriya Gokul Mission.

headlines: Indonesia police use snake to scare suspected thief, apologise later
text: Indonesian police have acknowledged officers scared a suspected thief with a snake after a video of the incident circulated online showing the man screaming in fear while the officers laughed. The police later apologised but also attempted to justify the officers' actions by saying the snake was not venomous and that they hadn't resorted to beating the man.

headlines: Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya gets married, 1st photos out
text: The first pictures of Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya Rajnikanth's wedding to actor Vishagan Vanangamudi have surfaced online. The wedding took place on Monday at The Leela Palace in Chennai and was attended by their family, friends and celebrities including Kamal Haasan. The wedding will be reportedly followed by a cocktail party in the evening.

headlines: AR Rahman attends Grammy Awards with daughter, shares pics
text: Singer-composer AR Rahman attended the 61st Annual Grammy Awards, held today, with his daughter Raheema. He shared several posts from the award ceremony, including a tribute to Dolly Parton and a video of Lady Gaga's performance. Notably, Rahman won two Grammy awards in 2010 for his work in 'Slumdog Millionaire'.

headlines: Thailand to free refugee footballer detained during his honeymoon
text: Refugee footballer Hakeem al-Araibi will be freed by Thailand and return to Australia after his home country Bahrain withdrew its extradition request. Hakeem, who fled to Australia in 2014 and was granted a refugee status in 2017, was arrested in Bangkok on November 27, 2018 when he arrived for honeymoon. He was accused of vandalising a police station in Bahrain.

headlines: Studies important than campaigning: SC upholds WB loudspeaker ban
text: The Supreme Court has rejected a petition by the BJP in West Bengal against a 2013 order by the CM Mamata Banerjee-led government which banned the use of loudspeakers during February and March. Children's studies are more important than election campaigning, the SC ruled. The prohibition on use of loudspeakers applies in residential and institutional areas because of school exams.

headlines: Posters depicting Priyanka Gandhi as Durga surface in Lucknow
text: Ahead of her visit to Lucknow on Monday, posters depicting eastern Uttar Pradesh Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra as Goddess Durga surfaced in the city. A Hindi slogan accompanying her picture read, "Sister Priyanka Gandhi is the form of Mother Durga". Priyanka is holding a roadshow named 'Mission UP' in Lucknow with her brother and Congress President Rahul Gandhi.

headlines: Amazon puts Biyani's Future Group stake buy plan on hold: Report
text: In wake of new FDI policy in e-commerce, Amazon has reportedly decided to put its plans to buy a stake in Kishore Biyanis Future Group on hold. Amazon won't go ahead until it gets more clarity to expand its offline presence. Amazon had signed a term sheet with Future Group to buy a 10-15% stake for up to $700 million.

headlines: 2-week-old Yemeni conjoined twins die without treatment abroad
text: Two-week-old conjoined twin boys who were in urgent need of treatment abroad have died in Yemen, which has been hit by a civil war that has killed over 10,000 since it began in 2015. The airport in Houthi-controlled Sanaa, where the twins were being treated, has been closed to civilian flights because the Saudi-led coalition has control over Yemeni airspace.

headlines: Hiring at India's top 10 IT firms rises fourfold in 2018: Report
text: Hiring at India's top 10 IT firms saw more than a four-fold increase from the previous year in 2018, according to an analysis by Mint. The top 10 companies added 1,14,390 engineers to their workforce in 2018, it added. The top five IT firms, TCS, Cognizant, Infosys, HCL Technologies and Wipro, added 99,010 employees last year.

headlines: It surprised me when they asked me to bat at 3: Vijay Shankar
text: Indian cricketer Vijay Shankar said that he was surprised when he was asked to bat at the number three position in the final match of the recently-concluded T20I series against New Zealand. "I was focussed on playing the situation. You need to be open anyway if you are playing for a team like India," Shankar said.

headlines: Aguero equals PL hat-trick record as City thrash Chelsea 6-0
text: Manchester City's Sergio Aguero equalled Alan Shearer's record of 11 Premier League hat-tricks as his side routed Chelsea 6-0 at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday. Aguero, already City's all-time leading goalscorer, also became the club's leading scorer in the league on Sunday. With the win, Manchester City climbed back to the top of the English Premier League points table.

headlines: Dating platform OkCupid users complain of account hacking
text: Several users of online dating platform OkCupid have complained their accounts have been hacked, as per TechCrunch. An affected user said he was unable to reset his password post hack after the hacker changed his account's email address. "All websites constantly experience account takeover attempts. There has been no increase in account takeovers on OkCupid," an OkCupid spokesperson said.

headlines: Jet cancels over 10 flights over operational issues: Reports
text: Jet Airways on Sunday cancelled reportedly more than 10 flights due to operational reasons. Affected guests have been re-accommodated while those seeking refunds have been compensated as per appropriate guidelines, Jet Airways said. This comes after the cash-strapped airline had last week said four of its aircraft have been grounded due to non-payment of lease rentals.

headlines: BJP must run with its workers' money, not black money: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday said that the party must run with contributions from its workers and not on donations of "moneybags, builders, industrialists and those with black money". Urging party workers to make donations, he said, "The NaMo App is an easy way to do so." He further said that he has also made his contribution.

headlines: PM Modi stole from Andhra and gave it to Anil Ambani: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Monday said, "PM (Narendra Modi) has stolen from people of Andhra Pradesh and...given that money to Anil Ambani." Expressing support for Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu's day-long fast, Rahul added, "PM Modi...he goes to Andhra Pradesh, he lies about special status." Naidu went on a fast on Monday demanding special category status for the state.

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi joins Twitter, gets 65,000 followers with no tweet
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi's sister and Congress General Secretary for UP East, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, joined Twitter on Monday, hours before mega roadshow in Lucknow. Within hours of joining, Priyanka gained over 65,000 followers without posting a tweet. Priyanka followed seven people including Rahul, Ashok Gehlot and Sachin Pilot among other Congress leaders.

headlines: Over 100 cows die in UP villages in 2 days, probe ordered
text: Over 100 cows have reportedly died in villages of Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh over the last two days, officials said. Sub-Divisional Magistrate Vijay Kumar said that an inquiry has been ordered into the incident. The cows died in pastures and were suspected to have either eaten poisonous grass or consumed polluted water, he added.

headlines: India will be world's 2nd largest economy by 2030: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said India would continue to be the fastest-growing large economy and could be the world's second-largest economy by 2030. The IMF and World Bank project the same trend to continue in coming years, he added. "In an uncertain global economic environment, India has shown tremendous resilience as an anchor of world economy," he further said.

headlines: Man shot for opposing molestation of female friend in Delhi
text: A man was shot at by two unidentified assailants allegedly after he opposed the molestation of his female friend by the two men in Delhi on Sunday. Following the incident, the miscreants fled the scene with the victim's car. Later, the police caught and arrested the two assailants and also recovered weapons from their possession.

headlines: Acting US Defence Secretary makes unannounced visit to Afghanistan
text: Acting US Defence Secretary Patrick Shanahan made an unannounced visit to Afghanistan on Monday to meet US commanders and Afghan leaders amid a push for peace with the Taliban. He said it was important the Afghan government is involved in the peace talks. Shanahan added he has not received any direction to reduce the nearly 14,000 US troops in Afghanistan.

headlines: Drake's 'God's Plan' wins Best Rap Song at Grammy Awards 2019
text: Drake's 'God's Plan' was named the Best Rap Song at Grammy Awards 2019. Other songs nominated in the category included 'King's Dead' by Kendrick Lamar, Jay Rock, Future and James Blake and 'Lucky You' by Eminem ft Joyner Lucas. Kacey Musgraves' 'Golden Hour' won Album Of The Year and Childish Gambino's 'This Is America' was named Record Of The Year.

headlines: 'This Is America' 1st rap track to win Song Of The Year at Grammys
text: Childish Gambino's 'This Is America' won Song Of The Year award at Grammy Awards, becoming the first rap track in the history of the Grammys to get the award. It won over nominations including Black Panther's single 'All The Stars' and Drake's 'God's Plan'. 'This Is America' also won Record Of The Year, Best Music Video and Best Rap/Sung Performance.

headlines: Ariana Grande wins her 1st Grammy after boycotting the 2019 Awards
text: Singer Ariana Grande, who boycotted this year's Grammy Awards, won her first Grammy in the Best Pop Vocal Album category for 'Sweetener'. Grande was supposed to perform at the Grammys but pulled out, saying she won't attend over a disagreement with Grammy producers over her set list. She beat artistes including Camila Cabello and Taylor Swift to win the award.

headlines: Who won what at the 2019 Grammy Awards held today?
text: Kacey Musgraves' 'Golden Hour' was named Album Of The Year and Childish Gambino's 'This Is America' won Record Of The Year as well as Song Of The Year at 2019 Grammy Awards. The award for Best New Artist went to Dua Lipa. Meanwhile, Drake's 'God's Plan' won Best Rap Song and Cardi B's 'Invasion of Privacy' won Best Rap Album.

headlines: I used to stay in 2-bedroom apartment with 11 boys: Kartik
text: Kartik Aaryan has revealed that he used to stay in a two-bedroom apartment with 11 boys during his struggling days in Mumbai. "There were four people in the living room, four in one and four in the other one," he added. Kartik also revealed all of them wanted to be actors while further saying, "We were like a happy family."

headlines: Been in 1 relationship, was dumped as I wanted to be actor: Kartik
text: Actor Kartik Aaryan has revealed he has been in one relationship and the girl dumped him because he wanted to be an actor. He said this during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan'. The actor further revealed that he used to live in a two-bedroom apartment with eleven boys during his struggling days in Mumbai.

headlines: Bollywood actor Mahesh Anand's body was found rotting at his home
text: The body of Bollywood actor Mahesh Anand, who was found dead in his Mumbai flat on Saturday morning, was in a decomposed state. He is suspected to have died at least two days ago. The police have not ruled out suicide, even though no suicide note has been recovered. The actor was reportedly facing financial constraints for many years.

headlines: Imagine there's no Dhoni: ICC reimagines John Lennon's classic song
text: The ICC took to Twitter to share a cricket-inspired reimagined version of John Lennon's classic song 'Imagine'. "Imagine there's no Dhoni, It's so very hard to do. No one to catch or stump you, And no banter, too," part of the version's lyrics read. "You may say I'm a seamer, but I'm not James Anderson," another line read.

headlines: She doesn't have brains: MLA caught on camera insulting woman IAS
text: CPI(M) MLA S Rajendran was caught insulting a sub-collector on camera after she questioned an unauthorised construction in Kerala's Munnar. "She doesn't have brains. Just because she is an IAS, she is trying to act smart," he was heard saying in the video. Responding to the video, CPI(M) said it will seek an explanation from the MLA.

headlines: Have nothing to do with reports of Jeff Bezos' affair: Saudi Arabia
text: Saudi Arabia said it has "nothing to do" with tabloid National Enquirer's reporting of an extramarital relationship involving the world's richest person, Jeff Bezos. Bezos accused the tabloid's owner, AMI, of blackmailing him with the threat of publishing "intimate photos". He also mentioned Saudi Arabia's displeasure over the coverage on Jamal Khashoggi's murder by Washington Post, owned by him.

headlines: Man who stole cars to replace parts in his cabs held after 20 years
text: A 65-year-old Mumbai man, who runs a taxi business and had been stealing cars for 20 years in order to replace parts in his taxis that needed repair, has been arrested. Mohammad Kamil Noor Mohammad Ansari stole the cars using a master key, police said. They added that after removing the parts, he sold the stolen cars to scrap dealers.

headlines: Army helps pregnant woman stuck in snowfall; she delivers twins later
text: A pregnant woman stuck in heavy snowfall delivered twin girls after the Indian Army came to her aid and took her to a hospital in Kashmir's Bandipore. Soldiers carried her on a stretcher for two and a half kilometres on foot in waist-deep snow. She was then taken in an army ambulance to the hospital and later shifted to Srinagar.

headlines: Woman unable to walk after doctors perform surgery on 'wrong' leg
text: Doctors in an Odisha hospital operated on a woman's right leg while she had visited the hospital for treatment of a wound on her left leg. The woman's husband revealed that when he questioned the doctors about the wrong operation, they told him to not worry and operated on her left leg. The woman is now unable to walk.

headlines: Hanif Syed, sentenced to death over 2003 Mumbai blasts, dies
text: Mohammad Hanif Syed, one of the three convicts sentenced to death in the 2003 Mumbai twin bomb blasts and currently lodged in the Nagpur Central Jail, has died at a hospital. Syed, his wife Fehmida and third conspirator Ashrat Ansari were convicted by a POTA (Prevention of Terrorism Act) court in 2009 over the blasts that left over 50 dead.

headlines: Rajasthan Royals name Shane Warne as team's brand ambassador
text: Rajasthan Royals have named their former title-winning captain and coach Shane Warne as the team's brand ambassador. Warne, who led Rajasthan Royals to its first and only IPL title in 2008, was the mentor of the side last season. "I'm very happy to be back with the Royals and I'm grateful to the team and the fans," Warne said.

headlines: PM Modi left his wife, does he respect family system: Naidu
text: Talking about PM Narendra Modi, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Sunday said, "You have estranged your wife. Do you have any respect for the family system?" "Since you have referred to my son, I am mentioning your wife," he added. This comes after PM Modi referred to Naidu as "father of Lokesh" at a rally on Sunday.

headlines: Election Commission has turned into BJP office: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday tweeted that the Election Commission has been converted into BJP office. This comes after the poll panel asked Delhi Police to investigate "misleading" calls claiming deletion of names from electoral rolls. The BJP on Friday met the Chief Election Commissioner and alleged that AAP had been making such phone calls.

headlines: 50 students fall ill after consuming 'prasad' in Jharkhand
text: At least 50 students of a school fell ill after consuming 'prasad' in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district on Sunday. The students had started vomiting after eating the 'prasad' at a Saraswati Puja celebration, district Civil Surgeon Vijay Kumar said. The students had suffered food poisoning and are now out of danger, Kumar added.

headlines: Reliance Group blames L&T Finance, Edelweiss for stock fall
text: Anil Ambani's Reliance Group blamed L&T Finance and Edelweiss Group for the 55% drop in market capitalisation of group companies in four trading days. The group alleged that the sale of pledged shares by the non-bank lenders was "illegal, motivated and unwarranted". Creditors including L&T Finance and Edelweiss sold around 31.9 crore shares of four of the group's companies.

headlines: Didn't do anything for such reaction: Alia on 'Johar's puppet' remark
text: After Kangana Ranaut said she doesn't consider Alia Bhatt successful if she's just Karan Johar's "puppet", Alia responded, "I didn't do anything to get a reaction like this." "I'd like to react to her personally...I don't want to talk about it in media," she added. Earlier, Kangana said she reached out to Alia and suggested her to "grow some spine".

headlines: Rajinikanth's daughter shares mehendi pics with fiancé, dad, son
text: Rajinikanth's younger daughter Soundarya on Sunday took to Twitter to share pictures of herself with her father, to-be-husband Vishagan Vanangamudi and her son from her first marriage, Ved. "Blessed & grateful beyond words!!!! The three most important men in my life...my darling father...my angel son...and now you my Vishagan," she wrote. Soundarya and Vishagan will tie the knot on Monday.

headlines: Get off my Instagram: Sammy to user calling Pakistanis 'terrorists'
text: Ex-Windies captain Darren Sammy asked a user to get off his Instagram page after the latter called Pakistanis "terrorists" on the cricketer's post. Sammy, who is PSL side Peshawar Zalmi's captain, had shared a picture of himself being welcomed by Pakistanis, writing, "Nothing but love for the people of Pakistan." The troll responded to the post, saying, "They r terrorists."

headlines: Ashwin is still the best off-spinner in the world: Muralitharan
text: Former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan has said Ravichandran Ashwin is still the best off-spinner in the world. On being asked about Ravi Shastri's remark that Chinaman Kuldeep Yadav is India's number one overseas spinner, Muralitharan said, "Kuldeep has been bowling really well, but it's not for me to comment whether he should be India's number one spinner or Ashwin."

headlines: Rahul Gandhi has 'Rafale phobia', says Ravi Shankar Prasad
text: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Sunday took a dig at the Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying he has "Rafale phobia". He added the kind of language Rahul was using against the Prime Minister does not behove him. Prasad further said, "Rahul Gandhi in the most irresponsible manner is playing with the security of India."

headlines: Mayawati's main purpose was to build own statues: Paswan
text: Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan on Sunday took a dig at BSP supremo Mayawati saying her main purpose in erecting statues of several Dalit icons when she was the Uttar Pradesh CM was to build her own statues. His comment came after the Supreme Court's observation that Mayawati may have to return the money spent on the building of statues.

headlines: Delhi Traffic Police shows mirror to helmetless woman, video viral
text: A Delhi Traffic Police officer approached a helmetless woman on a scooter on a busy road and showed her a mirror, a video of which was shared by Delhi Traffic Police. The officer, who was wearing a helmet, then flipped placards carrying messages for helmetless riders. "The mirror doesn't lie. My helmet, my safety. What about you?" the placards read.

headlines: Hailstorm, rain expected in Delhi on Valentine's day
text: Light rain accompanied by strong winds and hailstorm is expected to make a comeback from Wednesday and intensify by Thursday, making it a rain-drenched Valentine's Day for the people of Delhi, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. The minimum temperature is expected to rise by 3-4 degrees Celsius, it added. Rains might improve the air quality after February 14, IMD said.

headlines: Man who killed 6 at mosque jailed for life with no parole for 40yrs
text: A Canadian man who gunned down six members of a Quebec City mosque in 2017 was sentenced to life in prison on Friday, with the judge saying he would be eligible for parole after serving 40 years behind bars. Alexandre Bissonnette pleaded guilty last year to six counts of first-degree murder and six counts of attempted murder for the attack.

headlines: Australia refuse to play in Pakistan, PCB announces ODIs in UAE
text: Australia have refused to play an ODI series in Pakistan due to security concerns and as a result the two teams will now play a five-match ODI series in the UAE. "The PCB was optimistic that it will be able to convince Cricket Australia to send its side for some matches," PCB's Director Cricket - International, Zakir Khan said.

headlines: Australia can win WC with Smith and Warner in team: Ponting
text: Australia's World Cup-winning former captain Ricky Ponting has claimed that Australia can win the ICC World Cup 2019 if Steve Smith and David Warner return to the side ahead of the tournament. "Conditions in England will suit our style of play. I think Australia will be the one of the main contenders for sure," Ponting added.

headlines: We will take action against Twitter on Feb 11: Anurag Thakur
text: BJP leader Anurag Thakur has said "appropriate action" will be taken against Twitter on February 11 after CEO Jack Dorsey and senior officials declined to appear before a parliamentary panel. The Thakur-headed panel was to discuss issue of "safeguarding citizens' rights on social and online news media platforms." "It can be an issue of breach of parliamentary privilege," Thakur said.

headlines: My respect for him is gone: K'taka Cong chief on SM Krishna
text: Talking about former Karnataka CM SM Krishna, Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee President Dinesh Gundu Rao on Sunday said, "Even that 1% of respect I had for him is gone." He said this in reference to Krishna's statement that he left Congress because of party President Rahul Gandhi's "constant interference". "No BJP person is going to remember SM Krishna," Rao added.

headlines: Voice on K'taka CM's recording mine, but edited: Yeddyurappa
text: Karnataka BJP President BS Yeddyurappa on Sunday said that voice recorded on the audio tapes released by CM HD Kumaraswamy was his, but the clips were doctored. Yeddyurappa also admitted to meeting JD(S) MLA Naganagouda Kandkurs son Sharanagouda. However, he clarified that luring Kandkur away from JD(S) was not what he spoke to Sharanagouda about.

headlines: If Modi is failure, why form alliance: PM Modi to opposition
text: Speaking at a rally in Tamil Nadu, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the opposition calls him a failure but still needs "big alliances" to defeat him. "The opposition is very funny...Nobody knows their agenda because their guns are aimed at Modi," he added. "The previous Congress governments helped brokers. Every middleman caught had...link with some...Congress leader," he further said.

headlines: Airbnb faces $14 mn fine over 1,000 illegal rental ads in Paris
text: Short-term tourists home-rental startup Airbnb has been sued by Paris over 1,000 illegal rental ads and faces a fine of $14 million, Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo said. France had passed a law in 2018 which makes companies punishable by fines of 12,500 euros per illegal posting. "The goal is to...end these uncontrolled rentals which taint some Parisian districts," Hidalgo said.

headlines: Virgin Galactic donates record-making rocket motor to museum
text: Billionaire Richard Branson-led aerospace company Virgin Galactic has donated the hybrid motor of its SpaceShipTwo (VSS Unity) rocket to the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum. The motor is recognised by the Guinness World Records as the most powerful hybrid rocket to be used in manned flight. The motor had powered the SpaceShipTwo to suborbital space on December 13, 2018.

headlines: Marks & Spencer to open 6 stores in India in next 60 days
text: British retailer Marks & Spencer (M&S) will open six more stores in India over the next two months, Managing Director James Munson has said. The company, which opened its first store in the country in 2001, signed a joint venture with Reliance Retail in 2008 to form Marks & Spencer Reliance India. It currently has 71 stores in the country.

headlines: Dhoni saves Indian flag from touching ground as fan touches his feet
text: An Indian fan carrying the tricolour invaded the pitch and rushed towards MS Dhoni to touch his feet during New Zealand's innings in the third T20I at Hamilton on Sunday. As the fan kneeled down to touch Dhoni's feet, Dhoni noticed that the Indian flag was about to touch the ground. Dhoni immediately took the flag from the fan's hands.

headlines: Rajasthan Royals to don pink jersey in Indian Premier League 2019
text: Rajasthan Royals, who wore a blue jersey in the nine IPL seasons they played, will don pink jersey in IPL 2019 season. "This comes as a response to the fantastic reaction from the fans to our training kit and Cancer Out jersey last year, as well as of course Jaipur being the Pink city," Royals' lead owner Manoj Badale said.

headlines: Passengers will not be able to opt out of meals on Train 18
text: The meals on board the Vande Bharat Express or Train 18 will not be optional for passengers, officials have said. However, passengers travelling the last leg on the train's route, Prayagraj to Varanasi, will have the choice of opting out of the meals. The semi-high speed train will run between Delhi and Varanasi on its maiden journey on February 15.

headlines: Got 10% EWS quota without altering reservation system: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said his government brought the 10% reservation bill for Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) of the general category without altering the existing reservation system. Addressing a Tamil Nadu rally, he dared the Opposition to give him "one instance" where the BJP had altered the social justice system. He also unveiled several development projects in the state.

headlines: Mehbooba Mufti praises Pak PM Imran Khan, criticises Centre
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti has praised Pakistan PM Imran Khan for taking steps to name a forest reserve after Guru Nanak Dev. Mufti also criticised the Centre saying its "top priority" seems to be renaming ancient cities and building Ram temple. Khan on Saturday expressed desire to name a forest reserve and university in Guru Nanak's name.

headlines: Cong ignored nation's security, indulged in defence scams: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday criticised the Congress party saying it ignored the nation's security during its tenure and alleged it was associated with several scams in the defence sector. Addressing a rally in Tamil Nadu, he added the Congress didn't bother about India's defence sector. He further said the NDA government had a different approach to national security.

headlines: A failed student always hates class topper: Jaitley to Rahul
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Sunday said, "Rahul Gandhi's speeches on Rafale are based on personal hatred for PM emanating from envy. A failed student always hates the class topper." "The context of the speeches points more to college-level lumpenisation in content," he added. This comes after Rahul accused PM Narendra Modi of holding 'parallel negotiations' with France on Rafale.

headlines: Groom falls in drain as bridge falls due to baraat dance in Noida
text: As many as fifteen people who were part of a wedding procession (baraat), including the groom, fell into a drain after the bridge they were dancing on collapsed in Noida on Saturday. Built over a drain, the bridge connected the wedding banquet hall's gate to lawn. The procession was dancing for over 10 minutes on the bridge, an eyewitness said.

headlines: Fiji Water countersues viral Fiji Water girl for alleged extortion
text: Viral Fiji Water girl, whose real name is Kelly Steinbach, has been countersued by Fiji Water days after she sued the bottled water company for using her image on cardboard cutouts without her authorisation. The company accused Kelly of attempting to extort nearly $5,00,000. It added that Kelly wanted a better deal than the original $90,000 accepted by her.

headlines: India is blessed to have a captain like Kohli: MSK Prasad
text: Indian selector MSK Prasad praised Indian captain Virat Kohli, saying, "India is blessed to have a captain like Virat. He shares a healthy relationship with head coach Ravi Shastri, which is very important for the team's success." Prasad also spoke about KL Rahul, saying, "His form has become a big cause of concern. I am sure he is working hard."

headlines: Arjun included in Mumbai U-23 squad for BCCIs One Day League
text: Arjun Tendulkar was included in the Mumbai U-23 squad for BCCI's One Day League and Knockout, which is set to begin on February 14 in Jaipur. Mumbai U-23 coach Amit Pagnis praised Arjun, saying, "He... bowled well in the two trial matches, claiming two wickets in each game. Yorkers, bouncers and slower ones are his main strengths."

headlines: Decline of Sri Lankan cricket saddens me: Muralitharan
text: Speaking about Sri Lankan cricket, former spinner Muttiah Muralitharan said, "The decline of Sri Lankan cricket saddens me. For a team that had reached the World Cup final three times... it is a worrying sign." "In the 90s, there wasn't much money. Our passion was to take wickets and score runs. That passion has changed a bit," Muralitharan added.

headlines: England Lions draw 1st unofficial Test against India A
text: England Lions and India A played out a draw in the first unofficial Test that ended on Sunday. In India A's innings, KL Rahul scored a 192-ball 89, Priyank Panchal made 206, while KS Bharat scored 142. The match was called a draw when England Lions were ahead by 14 runs and the teams decided a result was not possible.

headlines: Apple sued over 'time-taking' authentication process: Report
text: A class-action lawsuit has reportedly been filed against Apple over its 'time-wasting' two-factor authentication process. The lawsuit has accused the technology giant of not seeking user consent before enabling the process, further pointing out that it can't be rolled back after 14 days. It added Apple's e-mail after enabling the process was insufficient to warn users that it was irrevocable.

headlines: California University to get gene-editing tech CRISPR patent
text: The US patent office has filed a document to grant patent on pioneering the revolutionary gene-editing technology known as CRISPR to the University of California. "The issued patent will encompass use of CRISPR-Cas9 technology in any cellular or non-cellular environment," lead patent strategist for the university on CRISPR matters said. The university had applied for the patent in March 2013.

headlines: Lord Ram is 9th 'paigambar', Muslims revere him: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Vinay Katiyar on Saturday said Lord Ram is the ninth 'paigambar' and is revered by Muslims. All Muslims were Hindus before they were converted to Islam, he added. Talking about religious leader Swami Swaroopananda's scheduled visit to Ayodhya for 'Bhoomi Pujan,' he said, "Foundation stone for Ram temple has already been laid. There's no need to redo it."

headlines: 9 cr homes with TV migrated to new tariff regime: TRAI chief
text: Telecom regulator TRAI's Chairman RS Sharma has said 9 crore of the 17 crore homes with television have made channel preferences under the new tariff regime. "The speed [of onboarding] has increased... we expect the rest... to register their choice of channels soon," he added. TRAI is constantly monitoring the situation to ensure consumers don't face inconvenience, he further said.

headlines: Shoplifter extortion case against Walmart, 6 others dismissed
text: A US federal judge has dismissed a shoplifter extortion case filed against US retail giant Walmart and six other retailers as no conclusive proof was found. The lawsuit alleged the retailers forced the accused shoplifters to take expensive "restorative justice classes" or be reported to the police. The lawsuit's three plaintiffs were accused of shoplifting at Walmart stores in 2017.

headlines: Should my script be censored before I speak? Palekar asked at NGMA
text: Veteran actor-director Amol Palekar, who was interrupted during a speech at National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) in Mumbai for criticising the government, had asked, "Should my script be censored before I speak?" "Director was present there...she said I should've spoken to her before speaking this here," he added. Palekar was asked to "stick to the topic" during the speech.

headlines: Dhoni takes just 0.099 sec to stump NZ opener in Kuldeep's 1st over
text: Team India wicketkeeper Mahendra Singh Dhoni reacted in just 0.099 seconds to stump New Zealand opener Tim Seifert in Chinaman Kuldeep Yadav's first over in the third T20I on Sunday. The 24-year-old Kiwi couldn't pick Kuldeep's googly and got beaten on the outside edge before Dhoni flipped the bails off immediately. It was Dhoni's 191st stumping in international cricket.

headlines: NZ Women beat India Women by 2 runs, complete 3-0 T20I whitewash
text: New Zealand Women defeated India Women in the third T20I at Hamilton on Sunday to register a 3-0 series whitewash. Chasing 162, India needed 16 runs from the final over for a win but fell short of two runs. India Women opener Smriti Mandhana slammed 86 runs, the highest individual score in an unsuccessful run-chase in women's T20I cricket.

headlines: Time to fly away to Mars: Mahindra on Gmail autocompleting e-mails
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Sunday remarked on Gmail's 'Smart Compose' feature to autocomplete entire e-mails and tweeted, "Time to fly away to Mars". "I was writing a mail on Gmail when this feature popped up offering to complete my sentences," said Mahindra. "This is sci-fi horror movie: first, emojis to abbreviate emotions, & now entire messages," he added.

headlines: UP CM criticises Samajwadi Party over illicit liquor trade
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday criticised the Samajwadi Party over illicit liquor trade saying stern action would be taken against the guilty. He added, "In past too such type of mischievous acts by SP leaders had come to fore." He further said SP leaders were found involved in past hooch tragedies and the conspiracy can't be denied now.

headlines: Quit Congress over Rahul's constant interference: SM Krishna
text: Former Karnataka CM SM Krishna on Saturday claimed he quit the Congress in January 2017 because of the party President Rahul Gandhi's "constant interference". Krishna said he left the Congress as Rahul had issued an order saying that leaders who reached 80 years shouldn't hold any ministry. Krishna joined the BJP in 2017, after giving 46 years to the Congress.

headlines: BJP leader Mukul Roy booked for TMC MLA's murder
text: BJP leader Mukul Roy on Sunday was booked in connection with the killing of Trinamool Congress MLA Satyajit Biswas in West Bengal's Nadia district, police said. "In Bengal, there is huge infighting in TMC and on Mamata Banerjee's direction, they are putting blame on the BJP," Roy said. He added the politics of "killing" is not "BJP's style of politics".

headlines: Tesla fired delivery staff over low Model 3 orders: Report
text: Tesla fired 150 employees out of around 230 from its Las Vegas facility which makes deliveries to US and Canada over low Model 3 demands, a Reuters report claimed. "You don't need a team because there aren't that many cars coming through," a former employee said. Tesla fired over 3,000 workers, reducing its 45,000-strong workforce by around 7% in January.

headlines: Abu Dhabi includes Hindi as third official court language
text: Abu Dhabi has included Hindi as the third official language used in its courts, alongside Arabic and English. The language's inclusion is aimed at helping Hindi speakers to learn about litigation procedures, their rights and duties without a language barrier, the Abu Dhabi Judicial Department said. Notably, the Indian community in the UAE constitutes 30% of the total population.

headlines: Five militants shot dead by security forces in J&K's Kulgam
text: At least five militants were killed on Sunday in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, the Army said. Weapons and war-like stores have been recovered from the encounter site, an Army official said. The encounter broke out after the militants opened fire on a search team of the security forces, the official added.

headlines: Pak govt not to remove Nawaz Sharif's name from Exit Control List
text: The Pakistan government has rejected former PM Nawaz Sharif, his daughter Maryam Nawaz and son-in-law Mohammad Safdar's requests seeking removal of their names from the Exit Control List (ECL), which prevents them from flying abroad. The decision to place the names of the trio on ECL was taken in August last year during a meeting chaired by PM Imran Khan.

headlines: Party that chose Thai Princess for PM faces ban after King's rebuke
text: The political party that nominated Thai Princess Ubolratana Rajakanya Sirivadhana Barnavadi as its candidate for Prime Minister could be banned from March general election after an activist said he would file a petition seeking its dissolution. King Maha Vajiralongkorn, the Princess's younger brother, had earlier said it was "inappropriate" for members of the royal family to enter politics.

headlines: Created 3.79L jobs in 3 yrs, says govt amid unemployment row
text: The government has claimed to have generated 3.79 lakh jobs between 2017-2019, according to Interim Budget 2019-20. This comes amidst a leaked report by NITI Aayog which claimed India's unemployment rate reached a 45-year high in 2017-18. The government said it generated 2,51,279 jobs in central government establishments between 2017-2018 and this is estimated to rise to 36,15,770 by March.

headlines: Networked freezers in stores, hospitals at hack risk: Report
text: Researchers have reportedly found vulnerabilities in internet-enabled refrigerators at supermarkets and hospitals which enable hackers to achieve tasks like adjusting temperatures and changing alarms. The security breach was discovered in over 7,400 devices manufactured by Scotland-based Resource Data Management (RDM). RDM has reportedly said the issue is related to the use of default passwords.

headlines: Worried for Gadkari as he is being shown as PM face: Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said he is "worried" for Union Minister Nitin Gadkari as he is being projected as an alternative prime ministerial face to PM Narendra Modi. "Gadkari is my friend. We've worked together," Pawar added. Talking about him being an alternative PM face, Gadkari had said, "No chance...I'm happy with where I am".

headlines: Ex-PM Nehrus great-grandson damaged Parliament: Jaitley
text: Hitting out at Congress President Rahul Gandhi, Union Minister Arun Jaitley said, "History will record that (former PM) Jawaharlal Nehrus great-grandson...singularly damaged Indias Parliament...more than anyone else." "It's...time that India and its institutions are protected from these institution wreckers," he added. He further alleged that the Congress sheds "crocodile tears for democracy".

headlines: PM Modi govt a 'textbook case of moral bankruptcy': Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has said the PM Narendra Modi government is a "textbook case of moral bankruptcy". He further said that "incompetence coupled with arrogance" was responsible for this. Rahul said this while referring to a media report which quoted an Uber driver as saying that the government has not given jobs and he found one after investing lakhs.

headlines: Naidu 'senior' in switching sides, betraying: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu is senior in switching parties, he is a senior in betraying his father-in-law NT Rama Rao." "He is senior in praising someone at sometime and despising him the next moment," he added. This comes after Naidu said that Prime Minister Modi was his "junior in politics".

headlines: Over 7,000 bottles of smuggled liquor seized in UP, 2 held
text: Two people were arrested after over 7,000 bottles of smuggled liquor were seized from a truck in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, police said on Saturday. The accused told police that the consignment of 655 cartons was to be delivered in Agra. This comes after nearly 100 people died in Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand after consumption of spurious liquor.

headlines: 7-year-old missing girl found dead in Delhi park
text: A seven-year-old girl, who had gone missing, was found dead at Nihal Vihar park in Delhi on Sunday morning. The girl had gone missing on Saturday evening, following which her family had filed a missing person complaint at the local police station. The body of the deceased has been sent for postmortem, a police official said.

headlines: US considers withdrawal of zero tariffs for India: Reports
text: The US may reportedly withdraw the Generalised System of Preferences (GSP) from India, under which the country enjoys zero tariffs on $5.6 billion of exports to the US. This comes amidst India's revised FDI norms for e-commerce firms and data localisation of global card payments companies like MasterCard and Visa. Notably, India has been the world's largest beneficiary of GSP.

headlines: India lose a T20I series for the first time after 30 months
text: New Zealand defeated India by four runs in the third T20I at Hamilton on Sunday to win the three-match T20I series 2-1. With this, India suffered their first series defeat in T20I cricket after 30 months. Before the New Zealand series, India were unbeaten in 10 consecutive T20I series (of two or more matches) dating back to January 2017.

headlines: Actor Amol Palekar interrupted during speech for criticising govt
text: Veteran actor-director Amol Palekar was interrupted during his speech by National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) members in Mumbai when he criticised the government on Friday. During the speech, he called an apparent decision by the Ministry of Culture "disastrous". Soon after, he was interrupted by an NGMA member on the stage and was asked to "stick to the topic".

headlines: Typed keywords like 'actors required' on Google for auditions: Kartik
text: Actor Kartik Aaryan has revealed that he used to type keywords like 'actors required' and 'casting call' on Google and Facebook to look for auditions as he didn't know anyone. "I think social media has helped me out to become an actor," he added. Kartik further revealed he faced many rejections at auditions and was told he is "not fit".

headlines: Dedicated my time to someone who doesn't deserve it: Neha on breakup
text: Singer Neha Kakkar, who recently broke up with actor Himansh Kohli, said, "I dedicated all my time and energy to that person who doesn't deserve it." "When I was in a relationship, I wasn't being able to give time to my family and...friends," she added. Neha further said with this bad experience, she is "not open to love again."

headlines: Stokes recalled from dressing room after being dismissed on no-ball
text: England's Ben Stokes was recalled to bat from dressing room after being dismissed off a no-ball during the third Windies-England Test on Saturday. The 27-year-old was caught-and-bowled by Alzarri Joseph, and recalled soon after third umpire discovered Joseph had overstepped. Stokes benefitted from a rule allowing batsmen, who have walked off in "misapprehension" of being given out, to be recalled.

headlines: My new hero: Arnold on athlete with cerebral palsy deadlifting 90kg
text: Hollywood actor Arnold Schwarzenegger took to Twitter to share a viral video of a weightlifter with cerebral palsy deadlifting 90kg and captioned it, "I've a new hero." Miles Taylor had shared the video on Instagram, writing, "200lb deadlift at 99lb!! More than double me bodyweight!!! HECK YEAH! A huge thank you to my coach...for always being by my side."

headlines: Rival fans make aeroplane gestures to mock Sala's death, arrested
text: Two Southampton fans were arrested for mocking the death of 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala by making aeroplane gestures towards Cardiff City supporters during the teams' Premier League match on Saturday. It was Cardiff City's first match since Sala's death was confirmed on Thursday, over two weeks after his plane vanished. Sala was travelling from France to join Cardiff City.

headlines: Priyanka wears jeans, top in Delhi but visits UP in saree: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Harish Dwivedi has said that Congress General Secretary for Uttar Pradesh (East) Priyanka Gandhi wears jeans and top in Delhi but turns up in a saree whenever she visits Uttar Pradesh. Earlier, BJP leader and Bihar minister Vinod Jha commented on Priyanka's entry into politics and said that "votes cannot be won on the basis of beautiful faces".

headlines: This time when we go to the Moon, we will stay: NASA head
text: Calling on American companies to help design and develop human lunar landers, reusable systems for astronauts to land on the Moon, NASA administrator Jim Bridenstine said, "This time when we go to the Moon, we will stay." He further said that from the Moon "we'll take the next giant leap in deep space exploration".

headlines: Face recognition tech reunites MP teen with family after 8 months
text: A 14-year-old mentally unsound boy from Madhya Pradesh was reunited with his family with the help of the Darpan Face Recognition Tool developed by Telangana police. The teenager had left his residence in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain in June last year. He was traced at a government ashram in Bengaluru on December 25 last year, police said.

headlines: Pakistani journalist critical of government seized outside home
text: Rizwan Razi, a Pakistani journalist critical of the government was seized outside his home, his son said. Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency said he was being investigated for "obnoxious" comments about the judiciary, government and intelligence agencies on his Twitter account. Razi was arrested under the cybercrime law which is believed to give overreaching powers to law enforcement agencies.

headlines: Newlyweds get divorced in 3 minutes after man calls wife 'stupid'
text: A Kuwaiti couple got divorced just three minutes after their wedding as the man called his wife "stupid" when she accidentally tripped inside a court hall. The couple was leaving the hall after signing the marriage contract when the wife tripped. Reacting to the couple's divorce, a social media user wrote, "Note to self, never get married."

headlines: Canadian man given 8 life sentences for murdering, dismembering 8 men
text: A 67-year-old Canadian man who killed eight men in Toronto and dismembered their bodies has been given eight concurrent life sentences. He will not be eligible for parole until he is 91. Bruce McArthur's behaviour was described as "pure evil" by the court, which also said he would've kept killing if he hadn't been apprehended by the police.

headlines: Pregnant woman carries dying baby to term, donates organs after death
text: Krysta Davis from US carried her baby to term to donate the organs, even after she was told the baby wouldn't live for more than 30 minutes after birth. Her to-be-born daughter was diagnosed with anencephaly, a rare condition. After the baby died, her heart valves were given to two children and her lungs were given to a research hospital.

headlines: UK Prince Philip gives up driving licence after crash injured women
text: UK Queen Elizabeth II's 97-year-old husband Prince Philip has given up his driving licence over three weeks after his car overturned following a collision with another vehicle. Two women in the other car, which also had a nine-month-old, suffered injuries. There's no legal age in Britain to stop driving, but drivers over 70 must renew their licences every three years.

headlines: Hackers using Google Translate to steal information: Report
text: Hackers are exploiting a Google Translate loophole which enables hiding fake website addresses resembling genuine existing ones to steal user information, a report has claimed. The fake addresses are preceded by 'www.translate.google.com' making them appear legitimate, the report revealed. It added the trick isn't too effective on desktops as multiple signs may warn users that something is wrong.

headlines: Meghalaya CM threatens to quit NDA over Citizenship Bill
text: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Saturday said that National People's Party (NPP) will break ties with NDA if the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill is passed in the Rajya Sabha. He added that a resolution has been passed in this regard which will be submitted to the Narendra Modi government. The Bill was passed in Lok Sabha on January 8.

headlines: It seems an Olympics is going on to deride me: PM Modi
text: Talking about the Opposition, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said, "It is as if an Olympics is on to deride Modi." "The job of 'Mahamilawatwalas' is only to heap abuses and more abuses on Modi," he added. He further said that the Opposition leaders are only involved in "holding each other's hands in meetings in Delhi and Kolkata for photographs".

headlines: Gandhi family has made corruption a 'sanskar': Smriti Irani
text: Taking a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi's brother-in-law Robert Vadra, Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said, "The Gandhi family has made corruption a 'sanskar'." "Such shameless gestures cannot be done by any other person," she added. This comes after Vadra was questioned for the third time this week by the Enforcement Directorate over allegations of money laundering.

headlines: FDA accuses JUUL of undermining efforts to curb teen vaping
text: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has accused e-cigarette startup JUUL and Marlboro owner Altria, which recently bought a $12.8-billion stake in JUUL, of undermining efforts to prevent vaping among teenagers. "[Altria's] newly announced plans with JUUL contradict the commitments [they] made," FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb said. A joint meeting with both JUUL and Altria has also been called.

headlines: Not ousting nuns over rape protest: Jalandhar Diocese Administrator
text: Current Apostolic Administrator of Jalandhar Diocese, Bishop Agnelo, in an email said that there will be no move to oust the five Kerala nuns who protested against rape-accused Bishop Franco Mulakkal. He added that the transfer orders would stand revoked as long as the case was in court. Four of the nuns were earlier asked to leave the Kuravilangad convent.

headlines: ED files money laundering case against Hafiz Saeed's charity
text: The Enforcement Directorate has registered a case of money laundering against 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed-led charity, the Falah-e-Insaniat Foundation (FIF). ED's case is based on an FIR registered by NIA, which last year arrested Mohammad Salman. He allegedly received funds from FIF operators through hawala channels to carry out terrorist activities and to create unrest in India.

headlines: Lata Mangeshkar criticises remix of her sister Usha's 'Mungda' song
text: Singer Lata Mangeshkar has criticised makers of Total Dhamaal for their remix of 'Mungda' which was originally sung by her sister Usha for 1977 film Inkaar. "We aren't asked if we approve or not. Nobody seeks our consent before using our songs. Is that right?" she said. Meanwhile, Usha said, "To rip them off in this arbitrary manner isn't correct."

headlines: Thought it was about us: NASA to Ariana after her song 'NASA' trends
text: After 'NASA' began trending on the internet over singer Ariana Grande's new song titled 'NASA', space agency NASA tweeted, "Hey Ariana, we saw 'NASA' trending and thought it was about one of our new discoveries." "But we realised that you might need some space," NASA said. The song's lyrics include "It's like I'm the universe and you'll be N-A-S-A."

headlines: Looks like free wines working fine: Styris on wife distracting him
text: Commentator Scott Styris took to Twitter to share a picture of his wife and sister-in-law trying to distract him during the New Zealand-India T20I on Friday. "When you're just trying to do your job and your *idiotic* wife...and equally mad sister-in-law are trying to put you off! Looks like...free wines in...[New Zealand hospitality box] are working just fine," he wrote.

headlines: Proud of you big bro: Hardik after Krunal named Man of the Match
text: After Team India all-rounder Krunal Pandya was named Man of the Match in the second T20I against New Zealand, his brother Hardik took to social media to share a picture of the duo. "Proud of you big bro, Krunal," he captioned the picture. The 27-year-old left-arm spinner produced bowling figures of 4-0-28-3 to help India equalise the three-match series 1-1.

headlines: BBL team chases 157-run target in 60 balls without losing a wicket
text: Brisbane Heat chased down a 157-run target against Melbourne Stars in just 60 balls without losing a wicket in BBL on Friday. Max Bryant and Ben Cutting slammed 71*(30) and 81*(30) respectively, with Bryant hitting 6 fours and 5 sixes, and Cutting hitting 4 fours and 8 sixes. Heat scored 94 runs in powerplay, the most ever in BBL history.

headlines: Iqbal slams 141*(61) as Comilla Victorians win their 2nd BPL title
text: Opener Tamim Iqbal smashed an unbeaten 141 off 61 balls including 11 sixes and 10 fours to help his team Comilla Victorians defeat Dhaka Dynamites in the final to win the Bangladesh Premier League 2019. Tamim's score is the second highest score by a batsman in a T20 tournament final. Comilla Victorians have now won two Bangladesh Premier League titles.

headlines: IKEA forgets to show New Zealand in its world map, apologises
text: Swedish furniture chain IKEA has apologised after Reddit user 'Jibbles666' pointed out it didn't show New Zealand in its world map. "We regret this mistake...the product is being phased out from our stores," said IKEA. Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Hopefully IKEA wont be using their own map to find us when they open their first store in New Zealand".

headlines: Fatima Sana Shaikh to star with Saif in 'Tantrik': Reports
text: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh will star in the upcoming horror comedy film 'Tantrik', which will also feature actor Saif Ali Khan in a lead role, as per reports. Saif was reportedly approached by the film's makers after Abhishek Bachchan turned down the role. The film will be directed by Pawan Kripalani, reports further suggested.

headlines: Bollywood actor Mahesh Anand passes away aged 57
text: Actor Mahesh Anand, who was known for his roles as a villain in several Bollywood films of the 90s, passed away, aged 57. The actor was reportedly found dead at his Mumbai home and his body has been sent for postmortem to ascertain the cause of death. Anand last featured in the Govinda starrer 'Rangeela Raja', which released this year.

headlines: Non-film music reaching more people than film music: Kanungo
text: Speaking about new trends in the music industry, singer Arjun Kanungo said that 'non-film music' is now reaching more people than 'film music'. "I was one of the first few people to start this trend...it feels good to be a part of a wave that started this trend," Kanungo added. It's easier for independent artistes to succeed, he further said.

headlines: Tokyo 2020 gets $3mn of gold, silver for medals from e-waste
text: Tokyo's Olympics planning committee has revealed it is close to achieving the goal of making 2020 Olympic medals from recycled electronic waste. Around 48,000 tons of collected waste, which includes over five million unwanted used phones, has produced over $3 million worth of gold, silver and bronze, the committee said. The medal design will be revealed in the summer.

headlines: Sprint sues rival AT&T over 5G E label, 'false advertising'
text: US-based telecom operator Sprint has sued rival AT&T over "false advertising", saying its '5G E' (5G Evolution) label is misleading consumers into believing that it offers the fifth-generation wireless network. Earlier, T-Mobile mocked AT&T with a sticky note showing '9G' on top of their iPhone's LTE icon. "We will fight this lawsuit while continuing to deploy 5G Evolution," AT&T responded.

headlines: Amazon including drivers' tips in their base pay: Report
text: E-commerce giant Amazon is using customer tips towards the base pay of its fast-delivery program Flex's contracted drivers, a report claimed. Drivers are promised a base pay of $18-25 an hour under Flex. This comes after US-based grocery delivery startup Instacart's CEO Apoorva Mehta recently apologised after a class-action lawsuit accused the startup of including tips in workers' base salaries.

headlines: Free electricity to Haryana farmers if we win: Sukhbir Badal
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal has said that if SAD is voted to power in Haryana Assembly elections, it will provide free electricity to farmers. He added the party will ensure 100% water supply and sewerage system in Haryana. He further urged people to create awareness about SAD's social welfare initiatives in the state.

headlines: Party doesn't want any alliance with TMC: WB Congress Prez
text: West Bengal Congress President Somendra Nath Mitra on Saturday said nobody from the party wants an alliance with TMC. Further, he quoted Congress President Rahul Gandhi as saying, "If there's an alliance with dignity, it'll be there, otherwise there won't be one." Mitra added Rahul also ruled out an alliance with TMC in a meeting.

headlines: We're muslims by choice, ancestors weren't forced: Owaisi to Ramdev
text: After yoga guru Baba Ramdev said Lord Ram was the ancestor of both Hindus and Muslims, AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi said, "We're Muslims by choice, nobody forced our ancestors". "Would like to tell him (Ramdev) that keep your beliefs to yourself. Imposing your beliefs is wrong," he added. "RSS and Sangh Parivar make such statements every time," he further said.

headlines: Memorials, parks in UP give regular income to govt: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday said the memorials and parks built in honour of Dalit and OBC leaders provide regular income to Uttar Pradesh government. She further called the memorials "grand identity" of UP and a "tourist attraction". This comes a day after the Supreme Court observed that Mayawati should reimburse public money spent on her statues.

headlines: UK bars export of 17th century Indian tray
text: The UK has barred the export of a 17th-century tray designed in Bidar, Karnataka, to provide an opportunity to keep it in the country. While most of the tray's ownership history is unknown, it is recorded as having been acquired by antique dealer Bashir Mohamed from 1974 to 2017. It was priced at an estimated £75,000, plus VAT, last month.

headlines: Pakistan revises FY18 GDP growth from 5.79% to 5.22%
text: The Pakistan government on Friday revised downward the GDP growth rate for 2017-18 from 5.79% to 5.22%. When the original estimate was reported in April last year by the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) government, it claimed that the 5.79% GDP growth rate was the highest in the last 13 years.

headlines: YouTuber writes names to thank subscribers, gains 3.8mn in a week
text: A 73-year-old Portuguese YouTuber has gained 3.8 million subscriptions in just a week after he posted videos thanking his subscribers by writing down their names. Nilson Izaias Papinho had less than 2,000 subscribers towards January end before his videos went viral. Papinho's channel has 29 videos which show him doing daily activities, which have garnered over 30 million views.

headlines: Narangi Mausambi Wala: Arjun Kapoor makes fun of Ranveer's clothes
text: After actor Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share pictures of himself wearing colourful clothes under a tree, his compatriot Arjun Kapoor commented, "Narangi Mausambi Wala." Reacting to the pictures, other users wrote, "Bhai tum kapde kaha say silate," and "Such colours and designs only Ranveer Singh can carry off with ease n elegance."

headlines: Rahman shares daughter's pic for magazine in niqab after niqab row
text: Singer-composer AR Rahman has shared a picture of his children posing for 'Hello' magazine, where daughter Khatija is seen wearing a niqab. Earlier, Khatija was criticised for wearing the veil at 10-year celebrations of Slumdog Millionaire's Oscars win. Rahman then shared a family picture captioned '#freedomtochoose' showing Khatija with veil and wife Sairaa and daughter Raheema without it.

headlines: Woman flashes 'Pandya Aaj Karke Aaya Kya?' banner at NZ-India T20I
text: A female spectator trolled all-rounder Hardik Pandya by displaying a banner reading 'Pandya Aaj Karke Aaya Kya?' during the second New Zealand-India T20I at Auckland's Eden Park on Friday. The banner was in reference to Pandya's appearance on 'Koffee With Karan', wherein he revealed that when he lost his virginity, he told his parents, "Aaj mai karke aaya."

headlines: Dhoni's presence important in World Cup for decision-making: Yuvraj
text: All-rounder Yuvraj Singh, who was named Player of the 2011 World Cup, has said that MS Dhoni's presence will be important for India in decision-making in the 2019 World Cup. "I think Dhoni has a great cricket brain. And as a wicket-keeper, you're in the best position to monitor the game...He is with...young players and guiding...Kohli...all the time," he added.

headlines: Doctors leave forceps in woman's abdomen, discovered after 3 months
text: Doctors at a hospital in Hyderabad mistakenly left a pair of forceps inside a woman's abdomen during a surgery for hernia in November. The mistake came to light when the woman returned to the hospital on Friday with severe stomach pain. An X-ray of her abdomen revealed that a pair of artery forceps was embedded in her abdomen.

headlines: Don't publish pics of women bathing at Kumbh: Allahabad HC to media
text: Allahabad High Court has directed media houses to not publish photographs of women taking a bath or a dip in the river Ganga during the Kumbh Mela. It further said it will take action against publications violating the order. The court also asked organisers why the ban on photography within 100 metres of ghat is not being enforced strictly.

headlines: Area of Germany's new spy HQ equivalent to 36 football fields
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Friday inaugurated the new headquarters of the Federal Intelligence Service (BND) which covers an area equivalent to the size of 36 football fields. Situated in the capital Berlin, the BND headquarters has been built at a cost of over 1 billion. Germany "needs a strong and efficient foreign intelligence service more than ever," Merkel said.

headlines: N Korea will become 'economic rocket' under Kim Jong-un: Trump
text: Ahead of his second summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that the reclusive regime will become an 'economic rocket' under the leadership of Kim. "He may surprise some but he won't surprise me, because I have gotten to know him and fully understand how capable he is," the US President tweeted.

headlines: Was worried as 'Ek Ladki...' wasn't usual Bollywood debut: Regina
text: Regina Cassandra has revealed that she was concerned before joining the cast of 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga' as it wasn't "your quintessential Bollywood debut". "I'd liked the story when I heard it...[but] had to think about it...because it was my first Hindi film," the actress explained. Regina played Sonam Kapoor's love interest in the film.

headlines: British rapper Cadet dies in taxi crash on way to concert
text: British rapper Blaine Johnson, who went by the name Cadet, died while on his way to a concert after his taxi collided with a van. While the drivers of both vehicles were taken to a hospital with severe injuries, the 28-year-old rapper died at the scene. Cadet was to perform at a university in Staffordshire, UK when the accident occurred.

headlines: Sonam Kapoor's 'Ek Ladki Ko...' to be part of Oscars library
text: The screenplay for the Sonam Kapoor starrer 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga' will soon be included in the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences' Core Collection at its Oscars library. Rajkumar Hirani's 'Sanju' and Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial 'Guzaarish' are also part of the collection. The library is completely open to the public.

headlines: I love doing all my stunts myself: Shreyas Talpade
text: Actor Shreyas Talpade has revealed that he loves to do all his stunts himself. "It's always fun shooting action...Just like you need good timing in comedy, you need precise timing in action as well. One wrong move can sometimes cost you a lot," the actor said. Shreyas added that action sequences have always been a "tremendous learning experience" for him.

headlines: Apple, Google host app that tracks Saudi women, criticised
text: Apple and Google have been criticised for hosting an app called 'Absher', which reportedly lets Saudi men track women and sends an SMS when a woman uses her passport at the border. Rights activists have sought reconsideration over hosting the app. They've accused the technology giants of "facilitating the most archaic misogyny" and helping the Saudi government enforce "gender apartheid".

headlines: Planning to bring double-decker buses that can fly: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday said that there are plans of operating double-decker buses that can fly in India. He added that these buses will solve the problem of traffic jams and are cheaper than the metro. "I'm bringing an airboat from Australia that can land in water...This airboat will operate from Varanasi to Prayagraj," he further said.

headlines: Send me hot pics, I'll be right over: Musk tweets to 'Mars'
text: Elon Musk has replied to a Twitter account named 'Mars', saying, "Send me hot pics and I'll be right over" on being asked, "When are you coming over babe?" The account then replied by tweeting an image of Mars' Gale Crater, to which Musk answered, "Thank goodness it's not November." Musk is planning SpaceX's first manned Mars mission for 2024.

headlines: UP CM Yogi inaugurates computerised mobile bus classroom
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath inaugurated a computerised mobile bus classroom in Varanasi on Saturday. The classroom will feature technologies like mobile devices, 3D printers, digital blackboard, computer workstation among others. The move aims to bring educational programs to regional, rural and remote areas of Varanasi by offering students fully equipped digital tools.

headlines: 82 dead after consuming spurious liquor in UP, Uttarakhand
text: As many as 82 people have died in Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand after consuming spurious liquor. The incident happened after most of the victims consumed the liquor, hooch, after a mourning ritual of a relative in Haridwar on Thursday. In the wake of the incident, Uttar Pradesh government has suspended at least 14 officials.

headlines: 15 killed in arson, knife attack on Chinese New Year
text: As many as seven people were killed in China on the night of the Lunar New Year earlier this week after a man set fire to his brother's house, while another stabbed eight people to death, authorities said. The two incidents took place in the Chinese cities of Baoji and Baiyin. Seven other people were injured in the knife attack.

headlines: US willing to send its sons, daughters to die in absurd war: Maduro
text: Amid the ongoing tension between the two countries, Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro said that American leaders are "willing to send their country's sons and daughters to die in an absurd war". In an open letter to the American people, Maduro demanded that the US stop its attempts to "suffocate our economy" and "the serious and dangerous threats of military intervention".

headlines: Glenn McGrath once dismissed Sachin 'shoulder-before-wicket' for 0
text: Former Australia pacer Glenn McGrath, who turns 49 today, once dismissed Sachin Tendulkar LBW for zero after the ball hit his shoulder in front of the stumps. The dismissal happened in 1999 Adelaide Test when Tendulkar tried to duck an intended short ball which didn't bounce as much as he expected. The dismissal led many to term it 'shoulder-before-wicket'.

headlines: BJP, Cong share 'Gully Boy' inspired rap videos to attack each other
text: Congress and BJP on Friday shared videos inspired by raps from upcoming Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt-starrer movie 'Gully Boy', both asking the voters to seek "azadi" from the other. While BJP focuses on alleged scams under previous Congress-led UPA government and 'dynasty politics', Congress highlights issues like mob lynching, JNU protests, alleged Rafale scam under the BJP-led government.

headlines: Salman was the first outsider to tell me DDLJ was great: Shah Rukh
text: Shah Rukh Khan on talk show 'Signature Masterclass' said, "The first person outside the production to tell me that 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' is a great film was my friend Salman Khan." Shah Rukh also revealed that a friend told him, "If you weren't in this movie, it would do really well." "I felt very sad," the actor added.

headlines: Mat pucho, next question: Khaleel as journo asks if Kohli is missed
text: After a reporter asked Khaleel Ahmed if Team India is missing Virat Kohli who is presently on a vacation, the 21-year-old fast bowler appeared to have no answer and burst into laughter. "Miss toh rehta hai ki achcha...lekin...arey yaar...Mat pucho...Next question please," Khaleel responded. Reacting to it, a Twitter user wrote, "Arey Khaleel bhai...reporter is not asking about your girlfriend."

headlines: Mandate 2-child norm for candidates: BJP leader's plea in SC
text: BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay has filed a plea in the Supreme Court seeking a direction that disallows political parties from fielding candidates who have more than two children. The plea, likely to be listed for hearing next week, seeks a declaration of the two-child norm as a mandatory criterion for government jobs, aids and subsidies.

headlines: One of Tesla's biggest investors buys $32 mn shares for 0.07% stake
text: Tesla's second-biggest institutional shareholder, investment management firm Baillie Gifford, has increased its stake from 7.64% to 7.71% by purchasing nearly 1,09,000 Tesla shares worth over $32 million. The UK-based firm now owns 13.2 million shares of Tesla stock, a regulatory filing stated. The entire stake of the firm now translates to more than $4 billion worth of Tesla.

headlines: Heavy rain and hailstorm bring Delhi's air quality to 'moderate'
text: The overall Air Quality Index in Delhi has improved to 'moderate' category after heavy rains and hailstorm on Thursday washed away pollutants in the air, the authorities said. The overall Air Quality Index (AQI) of the city was at 142 on Friday, which falls in the 'moderate' category. On Wednesday, Delhi's air quality was in 'very poor' category at 349.

headlines: Maoist camp busted in Odisha, 5 tiffin bombs recovered
text: A Special Operation Group recovered arms and ammunition including five tiffin bombs weighing five kg each from a Maoist camp in Patdhara reserve forest, Odisha earlier this week. The seizure also included gun powder, electric wire bundles, grenade springs and a detonator. However, the Maoists managed to escape into the forest.

headlines: Arunachal our integral part: India after China opposes PM's visit
text: After China opposed PM Narendra Modi's visit to Arunachal Pradesh, India said Arunachal Pradesh is an integral and inalienable part of it and Indian leaders visit the state as they visit other parts of India. China said it has "never recognised the so-called Arunachal Pradesh" and "urged India to refrain from any action that may lead to escalation of disputes".

headlines: Boy found alive 2 days after Turkey building collapse
text: A teenage boy was pulled alive from the rubble of an eight-storey building in Turkey's Istanbul on Friday, almost two days after it collapsed.
