Officials said at least 14 people have died as a result of the collapse. The city's governor has said that three of the building's top floors were built illegally.

headlines: Blaming Crown Prince for journo murder 'a red line', warns Saudi
text: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman didn't order the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi and blaming him would be crossing "a red line", Saudi Foreign Minister Ahmed Al-Jubeir said. His warning came after a report claimed that before Khashoggi's murder, the Crown Prince had said he would use "a bullet" on the journalist, who was a critic of the government.

headlines: Kangana is a rockstar, I applaud her courage: Anupam Kher
text: Responding to a Twitter user who asked Anupam Kher to tweet in support of actress Kangana Ranaut, Kher wrote, "Kangana is a rockstar." "I applaud her courage and performances. She's also the real example of women empowerment," his tweet read. This comes after Kangana revealed in an interview that she believed the film industry has ganged up against her.

headlines: I fear losing relevance, not stardom: Bipasha Basu
text: Actress Bipasha Basu revealed that she was more afraid of losing relevance than she was of losing stardom. "I've never been a desperate person. I've been a lucky girl and I have always lived by my own rules and not the industry norms," the actress added. "I was called a bohemian because of the way I was," Bipasha further said.

headlines: I am not just an actor, acting is a part of my life: Sushant
text: Sushant Singh Rajput has said that he's not just an actor, adding that acting is a part of his life. "I've plenty of things I like doing and acting happens to be one of them. Im grateful for that because I have always loved performing," the actor added. "It never means that I dont take it seriously," Sushant further said.

headlines: Facebook buys IITian's AI startup that helps shop using pics
text: Social media giant Facebook has acquihired visual search startup GrokStyle that lets users search and shop for products online by clicking their pictures, with the help of artificial intelligence. The startup, which began as a research paper in 2015, was co-founded by IIT Bombay alumnus Kavita Bala. Bala is presently the Chair of the Computer Science Department at Cornell University.

headlines: Twitter CEO declines to meet parliamentary panel: Reports
text: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and other senior officials have reportedly declined a call by a parliamentary panel, headed by BJP leader Anurag Thakur. The panel was to discuss issue of "safeguarding citizens' rights on social and online news media platforms" on February 11. Twitter cited "short notice of the hearing" despite having 10 days to travel, reports said.

headlines: Was Rafale deal meant for IAF or an industrialist, Sena asks PM
text: The Shiv Sena today asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi whether the Rafale deal was meant to strengthen the Indian Air Force or a financially-troubled industrialist. Referring to a media report claiming the Defence Ministry had objected to "parallel negotiations" conducted by PMO, Sena said the PM had a "personal interest" in the deal and called the report a "black page".

headlines: NCP wants me to contest polls from Maharashtra's Madha: Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party president Sharad Pawar on Friday said some of his senior party leaders are insisting that he contest the 2019 elections from Maharashtra's Madha. "I haven't taken any decision yet...I have no desire [to contest elections]. But [they]...said...I should respect their decision," he added. Pawar further said that he will take the demands of his colleagues into consideration.

headlines: BSP calls off alliance with INLD, forms alliance with LSP
text: The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) on Saturday called off its nearly nine-month alliance with Indian National Lok Dal (INLD). It further announced to forge ties with Loktanter Suraksha Party (LSP), a party floated by rebel BJP MP Raj Kumar Saini. This comes days after INLD was defeated in the recently conducted Jind bypolls.

headlines: NASA shares last pic of Kepler space telescope's 10-year journey
text: US space agency NASA has shared the "last light" image taken by the planet-hunting Kepler telescope, which was shut down in 2018 when it ran out of fuel after 9.5 years in space. Kepler's last field of view overlapped with its successor, planet-hunting TESS, which has enabled astronomers to compare data, NASA said. "Last light" was taken on September 25.

headlines: Case against ex-Bihar minister Manju Verma transferred
text: A Bihar court has transferred a case against former minister Manju Verma to a special court for cases against MPs and MLAs. Verma is lodged in jail in connection with ammunition found at her house during an investigation into the Muzaffarpur shelter home case. She had resigned after reports claimed her husband had close links with prime accused Brajesh Thakur.

headlines: ETMONEY offers 100% interest cashback on loan for Valentine's Day
text: Personal finance app, ETMONEY seeks to aid your mid-month cash crunch or shortage of budget this Valentine's Day to help you fulfil your gifting plans. It is offering 100% interest cashback on the first personal loan taken from their app. With ETMONEY, everyone can now afford the perfect gift or romantic dinner date with their special one.

headlines: I forget my dialogues when I see Ranbir perform: Alia Bhatt
text: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she never forgets her lines while performing a scene but when she watches her boyfriend and actor Ranbir Kapoor perform at sets, she forgets her dialogues. "I have never seen a more natural actor...When Ranbir is emoting, he does it with so much ease," she added. "He has the most honest...eyes," she further said.

headlines: Babar drove old Honda, sends every penny of income home: Pak coach
text: Pakistan head coach Mickey Arthur has revealed batsman Babar Azam sends every penny of his income home and drove a beaten up Honda until last year. "Then one night, his father [during a family dinner] made a short speech saying how much honour Babar had brought to the family...and gave him a set of...keys...to a brand-new white Honda," he added.

headlines: Govt panel favours lowering GST on under-construction flats to 5%
text: A seven-member ministerial panel led by Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel favoured the lowering of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on under-construction flats to 5% without credit for taxes paid on raw materials. Currently, GST on under-construction properties is 12% after allowing for the cost of land. Properties, where the construction is completed, attracts only stamp duty, not GST.

headlines: Man kills lover, buries her in grave he dug 2 days earlier
text: A 44-year-old married Mumbai man named Sunil Shirke and his two friends have been arrested for allegedly murdering his 28-year-old lover because she was pressuring him for marriage, said the police. Rohini Ghorpade was hit in the head with a spade and smothered to death with her own saree. Shirke had dug her grave two days before her murder.

headlines: PM lays foundation stone for Greenfield Airport in Arunachal
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday laid the foundation stone for the construction of Greenfield Airport at Hollongi in Arunachal Pradesh's Papum Pare district. He also inaugurated an upgraded airport at Tezu in Lohit district. On his two-day Northeast tour, PM Modi also inaugurated DD Arun Prabha Channel, 110 MW Pare hydroelectric project and 50 health and wellness centres.

headlines: Man arrested on way to 3rd marriage, sends brother to marry bride
text: A Jharkhand man named Karim, who was on his way to his third wedding, was arrested by the police on the complaint of his two wives on Friday. Karim then sent his brother, Rahim, to marry the bride in his place, police said. When Rahim arrived for the wedding, the bride's family became angry and held the groom's party hostage.

headlines: Gurugram policewomen to wear artificial jewellery to trap snatchers
text: Police Commissioner KK Rao has said women police officers wearing artificial jewellery, will be deployed on snatching prone stretches in Haryana's Gurugram to trap snatchers. Around 200 women officers will receive special training for the task. This comes after the Gurugram Police announced plan to catch vehicle thieves by leaving cars unattended on isolated road stretches.

headlines: If criminal attacks, police won't recite Hanuman Chalisa: Bihar DGP
text: Bihar DGP Gupteshwar Pandey on Friday said, "I have told the police force that if an absconding criminal being surrounded by policemen fires at them instead of surrendering, then the policemen will not sit there and recite Hanuman Chalisa." While defending an encounter that recently took place in Muzaffarpur, Pandey said, "Encounters are not done; they happen".

headlines: 72-year-old Jain woman saint dies after 7 days of fast for samadhi
text: A 72-year-old Jain woman saint attained sallekhana samadhi on Thursday evening, seven days after she began fasting unto death by renouncing food and water. Sri Sugunthanmathi Mathaji began fasting on February 1 at Arihanthagiri Digambar Jain Mutt in Tamil Nadu. Doctor pronounced her dead after due examination of the functioning of vital organs, an administrator of the Mutt said.

headlines: Lawyer attempts suicide to demand special status for Andhra
text: A lawyer named Anil Kumar allegedly attempted to commit suicide by consuming pesticide at a court in Kurnool district to press for Special Category Status for Andhra Pradesh. Kumar wrote "special status is the right of Andhraites" on his forehead and recorded a video of the act. He is undergoing treatment and is said to be in critical condition.

headlines: US man held minutes before catching flight to Pakistan to join LeT
text: United States' federal prosecutors on Friday announced they have arrested 29-year-old New Yorker, Jesus Wilfredo Encarnacion, who was about to catch a flight to Pakistan to join militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba. An FBI official said Encarnacion expressed desire to "execute and behead people". In Texas, FBI charged an 18-year-old boy for using social media to recruit people on behalf of LeT.

headlines: Thai King opposes sister's PM candidacy; party withdraws support
text: The Thai Raksa Chart party has withdrawn its support to Princess Ubolratana Rajakanya Sirivadhana Varnavadi as the PM candidate following opposition by her brother, Thai King Maha Vajiralongkorn. The King called his sister's candidacy "highly inappropriate" and against "royal traditions". The party said it accepts the King's statement and would abide by election regulations and royal tradition.

headlines: Trump, Kim to meet for 2nd summit in Vietnam capital Hanoi
text: US President Donald Trump's second summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un will take place in Vietnam's capital, Hanoi, later this month. "I look forward to seeing Kim and advancing the cause of peace!" Trump tweeted. Trump met Kim for the first summit in Singapore, where the North Korean leader agreed to "work toward complete denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula."

headlines: Plane touches runway, takes off in seconds amid 112 kmph storm in UK
text: A British Airways flight at Heathrow Airport near London aborted landing amid winds at 112 kmph caused due to Storm Erik on Friday. The video of the incident shows the plane swaying in the air before touchdown and taking off just after it hits the runway. The airline said the plane went on to land safely after circling the airport.

headlines: RBI should not treat every default as NPA on 90th day: Piyush Goyal
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said, "Law cannot be blind, wherein in 90 days arithmetically it (borrower) becomes an NPA (Non-Performing Asset). We will discuss this and we hope to resolve it quickly." Goyal's comments come a day after the Reserve Bank of India said it is not having a relook at a circular about recognising of bad assets.

headlines: Google admits bug that can hack Android devices with 1 image
text: Google has acknowledged a bug that could allow a remote attacker using a specially crafted 'PNG' image file to run malicious codes on Android. The photo, when opened, provides 'privileged access' to run the codes. The bug reportedly affects devices running on the recent Android versions, Android 7.0 Nougat, Android 8.0 Oreo and Android 9.0 Pie.

headlines: Never again let BJP's two & a half men rule us: Akhilesh to voters
text: Seemingly referring to PM Narendra Modi, BJP chief Amit Shah and UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav tweeted, "Let us vow that we will #NeverAgain... let two and (a) half men rule us." He further asked voters to promise not to "let people be killed for their beliefs" and "allow farmers to kill themselves" ever again.

headlines: Ram Temple issue of faith, Sabarimala about customs: Chidambaram
text: The Ram Temple issue is about "faith" while the Sabarimala temple issue is about "customs...opposed to modern constitutional values," former Union Finance Minister P Chidambaram said on Friday. He added, "I don't think we can mix up customs and faith." He further said he accepts the Supreme Court's Sabarimala verdict but cannot stop other Congress workers from expressing their views.

headlines: Ex-PDP leader Irshad Rasool Kar joins National Conference
text: Former Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Baramulla district president Irshad Rasool Kar on Friday joined the National Conference in presence of party president Farooq Abdullah. Welcoming him to the party, Abdullah said, "We hope just like his father, he will work dedicatedly for the welfare of people." Kar is the son of Congress stalwart late Ghulam Rasool Kar.

headlines: Domestic help gangraped, filmed & blackmailed in Delhi
text: A 28-year-old female domestic help was allegedly repeatedly raped by 10 people including her employer in a Delhi neighbourhood since October 21, the police have said. The accused blackmailed the woman by taking videos of the crime. Her employer has been arrested and a case of gangrape has been registered under the IPC and sections of the anti-human trafficking act.

headlines: Gujjars demand 5% reservation, block train tracks in Raj
text: Several members of the Gujjar community on Friday blocked railway tracks at Sawai Madhopur in Rajasthan, demanding implementation of 5% reservation promised to them by the state government. The 'rasta-roko' dharna has also affected train movement on the Delhi-Mumbai line. Currently, the community gets 1% reservation in educational institutions and government jobs.

headlines: Flash mob dances to 'London Thumakda' for cancer survivor in US
text: Members of 'Around The World In 80 Dances' recently danced to Bollywood song 'London Thumakda' during a flash mob in Costco store in US' California. The group said the motive was to fulfil a wish of a cancer survivor "who loves all things Bollywood". The video of the dance has gone viral and has over 3 lakh views on Youtube.

headlines: Rape accuser didn't go to Ronaldo's hotel room to play cards: Mother
text: Cristiano Ronaldo's mother Dolores Aveiro publicly defended her son over the rape allegations against him, saying that accuser American Kathryn Mayorga did not go to Ronaldo's Las Vegas hotel suite in 2009 to play cards. Mayorga has accused Ronaldo of raping her and paying her $375,000 in hush money. The 34-year-old forward has rejected the claims, saying sex was consensual.

headlines: Didi eyeing Delhi, has left West Bengal to middlemen: PM Modi
text: Claiming West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee hopes to lead a government in New Delhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said, "Didi is worried about moving to Delhi and she has left West Bengal... to be looted by the alliance of middlemen and syndicates." He added, "In West Bengal... Didi is the CM but someone else is doing 'dadagiri'."

headlines: If you take 'panga' with me, I'll become 'changa': Mamata to PM Modi
text: Taking a dig at PM Narendra Modi, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "If you take 'panga' (fight) with me, I will become 'changa' (better)." "During the election, he (PM Modi) becomes 'Chaiwala'. He becomes 'Rafalewala' once election is over," she added. The CM's remarks come after PM Modi's rally in the state's Jalpaiguri on Friday.

headlines: US not seeking action against Andaman tribe for killing missionary
text: The US isn't seeking any action against Sentinelese tribe members who allegedly killed missionary John Chau in the Andamans last year, Samuel Brownback, US Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom said. "It's a tragic situation and a tragic case of what's happened", he added. Chau had illegally travelled to the North Sentinel Island to convert the tribe to Christianity.

headlines: Videos of couples kissing in Hyderabad Metro stations lifts leaked
text: At least three videos of couples kissing in elevators of Hyderabad Metro stations have been leaked over the last 24 hours. The videos were taken from CCTV footage obtained from the Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited's control room. Hyderabad Metro's spokesperson said the leak is being investigated and appropriate steps will be taken to prevent "such kind of misuse of elevators."

headlines: Family gets elephant during house-warming event; it kills 2 guests
text: An elephant, named Thechikkottukavu Ramachandran, trampled two guests to death and injured at least seven others during a house-warming ceremony in Kerala's Guruvayur on Friday. A businessman had sponsored the elephant for a temple festival but before that, he brought it to his home, where the ceremony was taking place. Ramachandran, in the past, has reportedly killed 11 more people.

headlines: 6-year-old US girl battling cancer made honorary police officer
text: A 6-year-old girl battling cancer had her dream of becoming a police officer fulfilled after she was sworn in as an honorary police officer in Freeport in the US state of Texas. Abigail Rose Arias is suffering from Wilms tumour. "She took an oath to continue fighting the 'bad guys' until she is cancer free!" the Freeport Police Department said.

headlines: Video streaming services don't need govt licence: Govt to HC
text: The Centre has told Delhi High Court that online video streaming platforms including Netflix and Amazon Prime don't need licences from the government to run their programmes. This comes as the High Court was hearing the plea filed by an NGO, which sought to regulate "vulgar" and "morally unethical" content on online platforms. The High Court has rejected the plea.

headlines: Found success in choices that weren't safe: Shahid Kapoor
text: While speaking about his career in the film industry, actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I've always found success in choices that weren't safe." "The struggle always is to understand what people want to see and at the same time trying to cater to yourself as an artiste," the actor added. Shahid further said he gradually discovered himself as an actor.

headlines: Nick posts pic of his wax statue after Priyanka gets her own
text: A day after Priyanka Chopra unveiled her wax figure at the Madame Tussauds museum in New York, her husband Nick Jonas shared a picture taken in 2009 with his own wax figure at the museum. "Weird flex but okay," the 26-year-old American singer wrote in his caption. Priyanka's statue will be launched in the United Kingdom later this year.

headlines: Takes intelligence to make people laugh: Ajay Devgn
text: Actor Ajay Devgn has said that he doesn't understand why comedy films are often labelled as "brainless" as making people laugh requires intelligence. "Today in our country...comedians are the biggest stars....you just cant make faces and make people laugh," the actor added. Another merit of comedy films is that they can be watched several times, Ajay further said.

headlines: 965 cases of sexual harassment at workplace filed in 2018: NCRB
text: As many as 965 cases of sexual harassment at workplace were filed with the National Commission for Women in 2018, as per the records with National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB). The data further indicates a 69.2% rise in number of cases filed in 2018 as compared to 2017. NCRB has been collecting data on sexual harassment at workplace since 2014.

headlines: Microsoft discourages using its Internet Explorer as default
text: Microsoft has discouraged using its web browser Internet Explorer as the default one, saying that it is not modernising anymore. "We're not supporting new web standards for it," cybersecurity expert Chris Jackson wrote in a blog post pointing out the "perils" of using it. Microsoft had previously announced it will end support for Internet Explorer 10 on January 31, 2020.

headlines: Former Gujarat Congress MLA Asha Patel joins BJP
text: Former Congress MLA from Gujarat, Asha Patel, joined the BJP on Friday in the presence of Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar and BJP state unit chief Jitu Vaghani. Dismissing reports of Patel joining BJP as part of a "deal", Vaghani said, "BJP never indulges in horse-trading." Patel had resigned from Congress on February 2.

headlines: Probe Robert Vadra, but give answers on Rafale too: Rahul
text: Claiming he has "no problem" if the government investigates his brother-in-law Robert Vadra or Congress leader P Chidambaram, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "Whatever inquiry you want to do, you do it... But you also give answers on the Rafale matter." In separate cases, the Enforcement Directorate questioned Chidambaram on Friday and is expected to question Vadra again on Saturday.

headlines: BigBasket to become unicorn with $150 million funding: Report
text: Bengaluru-based grocery delivery startup BigBasket is reportedly raising $150 million at a pre-money valuation of $1 billion, giving it the tag of a 'unicorn', or a billion-dollar startup. The round is reportedly being led by existing investor, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba. Founded in 2011, BigBasket has raised over $885 million till date.

headlines: Lord Ram ancestor of Hindus as well as Muslims: Ramdev
text: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev on Friday said that Lord Ram was the ancestor not only of Hindus but also of Muslims. "This issue of Ram Temple...has nothing to do with vote bank politics," he added. "It's undisputed that Ayodhya is Lord Ram's birthplace...It's obvious that [Ram Mandir] will not come up at Mecca, Madina or Vatican City," he further said.

headlines: Andhra Cabinet approves construction of 2 new universities
text: The Andhra Pradesh Cabinet on Friday approved the construction of two new universities in the state. The Gurajada Apparao University would be set up in Vizianagaram while the JNTU Amaravati University would be set up in Amaravati. The Cabinet also approved a minimum time scale for contract employees and contract lecturers hired at Andhra Pradesh residential schools and universities.

headlines: Kejriwal's car attacked in Delhi by 100 men, none injured
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's car was allegedly attacked in Delhi's Narela on Friday, an official in the CM's office said. "A group of about 100 men tried to stop Kejriwal's car and attacked it with sticks. Nobody was hurt," he added. The incident took place when Kejriwal had gone to the outer Delhi locality to inaugurate developmental works.

headlines: 179 Kashmir students appearing for GATE airlifted to Jammu
text: As many as 179 students from Kashmir, scheduled to write Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) examination in Jammu on Sunday, were airlifted in an Indian Air Force (IAF) plane on Friday. "Due to heavy snowfall, the valley was cut off...due to closure of national highway and cancellation of flights...[following which] state authorities with IAF...airlifted the students," officials said.

headlines: 5 killed in blast at South Africa mine owned by India-born Guptas
text: At least five people have been killed and around 20 others are feared trapped following a gas explosion in an abandoned coal mine owned by India-born Gupta brothers in South Africa. Some people had gone into the mine to steal copper wires when a gas pipe exploded. The mine was shut down after corruption allegations were levelled against the Guptas.

headlines: Rajinikanth hosts pre-wedding reception for daughter, pics out
text: Actor Rajinikanth hosted a pre-wedding reception for his younger daughter Soundarya and her fiancé Vishagan Vanangamudi at Raghavendra Kalyana Mandapam in Chennai on Friday. Soundarya, who is a producer and a filmmaker, will tie the knot with actor-businessman Vishagan on February 11. It will be a second wedding for both Soundarya and Vishagan.

headlines: After 'No means No', #MeToo posters shown during NZ-India T20I
text: During the second New Zealand-India T20I, #MeToo posters directed at New Zealand all-rounder Scott Kuggeleijn, who was found not guilty of rape following a trial in 2017, were displayed by various members of the crowd. A banner read, "Wake up, NZ Cricket, #MeToo." During the first T20I, New Zealand Cricket was criticised for removing a poster reading "No means No".

headlines: What records did Rohit Sharma break in the 2nd T20I vs New Zealand?
text: Rohit Sharma became the first batsman to score 20 fifty-plus scores in T20I cricket after scoring 50(29) against New Zealand today. He also became the first Indian batsman to smash 100 sixes in T20Is and overtook MS Dhoni to record most international sixes by an Indian (349). Rohit also became the highest run-scorer in T20I cricket history, with 2,288 runs.

headlines: Rohit has now hit most sixes in international cricket by an Indian
text: Rohit Sharma has broken MS Dhoni's record for hitting most sixes in international cricket by an Indian, achieving the feat by slamming four sixes in the second T20I against New Zealand. Rohit has now smashed 349 sixes in international cricket, while MS Dhoni has hit 348 sixes. The world record (476) is jointly held by Chris Gayle and Shahid Afridi.

headlines: Kolkata police raids firms related to former interim CBI chief
text: Kolkata police on Friday conducted raids at companies related to former interim CBI Director M Nageswara Rao. "One location is in Kolkata and the other at his wife's company Angela Mercantile at Salt Lake city," ANI reported. Earlier, CBI officers tried to raid Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar's residence after which CM Mamata Banerjee protested by sitting on dharna.

headlines: 5 policemen among 7 dead after avalanche in J&K, 2 rescued
text: Seven bodies including those of five policemen have been recovered from a police post which was hit by a snow avalanche in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. While two cops have been rescued, another was reported as missing. The avalanche had hit the north portal of Jawahar Tunnel on Thursday evening and had trapped a total of 10 persons.

headlines: Bangladesh seeks India help with return of Rohingyas to Myanmar
text: Bangladesh has sought India's support with the early repatriation of the Rohingya refugees to Myanmar. Bangladesh's Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen made the request during his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Thursday. More than 7 lakh Rohingya Muslims crossed into Bangladesh, fleeing the military crackdown in Myanmar's Rakhine State in August 2017.

headlines: Reporting on Bezos' affair legal, says tabloid accused of blackmail
text: National Enquirer tabloid's owner AMI on Friday said it acted "lawfully" in reporting on world's richest person Jeff Bezos' affair with ex-TV host Lauren Sanchez. AMI added it will "investigate" allegations of extortion made by Bezos. Bezos had alleged AMI wanted him to drop an investigation into how it obtained his private messages by threatening to leak his nude pictures.

headlines: US prisoner falls through ceiling while trying to escape from jail
text: A prisoner in the US state of Indiana fell through the false ceiling while he was attempting to escape from a county jail. Jail officers were taking the 28-year-old to his holding cell when he ran into a medical room and locked the door. He then climbed up in the ceiling before falling through it while crawling.

headlines: 'Abolition of civil rights' America's great achievement: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump accidentally told a gathering of primarily religious leaders that one of America's greatest achievements is the "abolition of civil rights". The transcript released later showed Trump was supposed to say America's successes range "from gaining independence, to abolition [of slavery], to civil rights". He also hailed extending the vote for women as America's achievement.

headlines: Uganda minister suggests 'using curvy women' to attract tourists
text: Uganda's tourism minister Godfrey Kiwanda has suggested showcasing the country's curvy women to attract more tourists. Kiwanda launched the 'Miss Curvy Uganda' beauty pageant, with the finalists to be selected in June, as part of a campaign to attract foreign visitors. The tourism ministry also proposed to add "sexy and curvy women" to Uganda's list of tourist attractions.

headlines: SoftBank announces share buyback, mcap rises $15 bn overnight
text: SoftBank Group added $15 billion to its market capitalisation on Thursday after CEO Masayoshi Son unveiled a plan for the company's biggest-ever share buyback worth $5.5 billion. Further, Son's networth rose $2.6 billion, bringing his fortune to $16.6 billion. Son argued the company's 25 trillion yen assets minus 4 trillion yen debts didn't reflect its 9 trillion yen market value.

headlines: Deepa Mehta to receive Canadian Lifetime Achievement Award
text: Oscar-nominated Indo-Canadian filmmaker Deepa Mehta will be given the Lifetime Achievement Award by the Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television. "Thank you so much The Canadian Academy. You made my day, hell, my year!" the filmmaker wrote on Twitter. In 2012, Mehta received the Governor General's Performing Arts Award for Lifetime Artistic Achievement, Canada's highest honour in performing arts.

headlines: My mood dictates my fashion choices: Shahid Kapoor
text: While speaking about his fashion choices, actor Shahid Kapoor revealed that his mood dictated his wardrobe. "I hope I've evolved in my fashion from when I started. Initially, I made...mistakes in fashion and when you do that, you can do nothing but get it right, Shahid added. "Being fashionable is about being comfortable with who you are," he further said.

headlines: Gowariker to make film on women's cooperative Lijjat Papad
text: Filmmaker Ashutosh Gowariker is going to produce a film based on the story of the Indian women's cooperative Shri Mahila Griha Udyog Lijjat Papad. The film will be directed by Gowariker's assistant directors Ankush and Glen. The organisation, which provides employment to over 43,000 women across India, is known to manufacture a variety of consumer goods, including spices and detergent.

headlines: 5-time Oscar nominated actor Albert Finney dies aged 82
text: British actor Albert Finney, who had been nominated for five Oscars during his career, has died at the age of 82. He passed away peacefully after a short illness, his family announced. While Finney earned his first Oscar nomination for his performance in the 1963 film 'Tom Jones', he was last nominated in 2001 for the film 'Erin Brockovich'.

headlines: Apple to pay 14-year-old who found FaceTime privacy bug
text: Apple has said it will compensate 14-year-old American, Grant Thompson, for finding the FaceTime bug which let users hear audio from people before they answered their video calls. Apple further said it will give an additional "gift" by contributing to his education. The technology giant has also credited Grant in notes of its latest software update, which fixes the bug.

headlines: Facebook to add disclaimers on political ads before LS polls
text: Facebook has said that political advertisements in India will carry "Published by" or "Paid for by" disclaimers ahead of 2019 Lok Sabha elections with the feature going live from February 21. Ads without disclaimers will be removed from News Feed and placed in Ads Library. Users can report ads if they feel an ad is missing a disclaimer, Facebook added.

headlines: Mamata can be Putana, not Jhansi ki Rani: Union Minister
text: After TMC hailed West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee as 'Jhansi ki Rani' of modern times, Union Minister Giriraj Singh said Banerjee can be "Putana" (demoness) but not 'Jhansi ki Rani or Padmavati'. "She can be (North Korean leader) Kim Jong-un," he added. Singh further said that one who supports illegal immigrants can never be compared to Jhansi ki Rani.

headlines: Far from truth: Yeddyurappa on audio released by K'taka CM
text: Karnataka BJP President BS Yeddyurappa on Friday said the audio clips shared by CM HD Kumaraswamy, which claimed poaching of JD(S) MLA by BJP, were "far from truth". "It is a fake audio...I haven't met anyone," he added. "Kumaraswamy himself is a film producer. He is an expert in voice recording....Whatever charge he has made is baseless," Yeddyurappa further said.

headlines: MIT testing insulin pills for diabetes to replace injections
text: MIT-led researchers have revealed they are testing blueberry-sized pills on pigs that could be used to orally deliver insulin, potentially replacing every day injections for people with type 2 diabetes. The pills contain a single needle with a nearly 100% insulin tip attached to a compressed spring, held by a dissolvable sugar disk, which gets injected into the stomach wall.

headlines: AgustaWestland accused Michel moves Delhi court seeking bail
text: AgustaWestland accused middleman Christian Michel has moved a Delhi court seeking bail in cases by CBI and ED, stating the chargesheet against him wasn't filed within the stipulated time of 60 days. "Probe is complete. I have been in custody since December 22, 2018," Michel said. Michel's plea will be heard on February 12 by Special Judge Arvind Kumar.

headlines: 'Death to America' directed at Trump, not Americans: Iran leader
text: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has said the slogan 'Death to America' is directed against US President Donald Trump, National Security Advisor John Bolton and State Secretary Mike Pompeo, not the American people. Calling the American "regime" an "embodiment of evil and violence", Khamenei added that as long as America continues its "wickedness", Iran will not abandon the slogan.

headlines: All 7 convicted in 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots case given life sentence
text: The seven people convicted of killing two cousin brothers in Uttar Pradesh's Kawal village have been sentenced to life imprisonment. The incident is believed to have triggered the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots that left over 60 people dead and displaced over 40,000. The cousins were murdered after allegedly stabbing to death a youth who had been eve teasing their sister.

headlines: Stadium released 432 balloons when Kapil Dev took 432nd Test wicket
text: As many as 432 balloons were released in the air from the stadium when Kapil Dev took his 432nd wicket and became the then world's leading Test wicket-taker on February 8, 1994. Dev surpassed Richard Hadlee's record of 431 wickets after dismissing Sri Lanka's Hashan Tillakaratne in Ahmedabad. Dev is the only Indian pacer to take 400-plus wickets in Tests.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra reveals she had a panic attack during her wedding
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra has revealed that she had a panic attack during her Christian wedding with American singer Nick Jonas in December last year. "I was standing right behind the curtains...and was about to walk [down the aisle]...I just started having a panic attack," she said. "Then the doors opened and I saw [Nick]...I cannot forget that moment," she added.

headlines: Delhi HC rejects plea to ban Netflix, Amazon Prime
text: The Delhi High Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking a ban on online platforms including Netflix and Amazon Prime until web-exclusive content is regularised. The petition claimed that such platforms were telecasting shows full of "vulgarity, religiously forbidden and morally unethical" content due to lack of regulations. It mentioned shows like 'Sacred Games' and 'Game of Thrones'.

headlines: 3rd umpire rules New Zealand batsman LBW out despite inside edge
text: Third umpire Shaun Haig adjudged New Zealand batsman Daryl Mitchell LBW out despite HotSpot showing an inside edge during the second T20I against India on Friday. Mitchell had opted for DRS after on-field umpire Chris Brown signalled him out on the bowling of Krunal Pandya. Snickometer was inconclusive and Haig went with Brown's decision despite naked eye also showing deviation.

headlines: Over reaction: Parrikar wrote in ministry note on PMO role in Rafale
text: A picture of Defence Ministry letter shows former Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar calling the ministry's objections to 'PMO's parallel negotiations' in the Rafale deal an "over reaction". In the note dating back to 2015, Parrikar wrote, "It appears the PMO and the French President's office are monitoring the progress of the issue which was an outcome of the summit meeting."

headlines: Retd judge moves HC against SAD chief for insulting panel report
text: Retired judge Ranjit Singh has moved the Punjab and Haryana High Court against SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal and Akali Dal leader Bikram Majithia for making "false...and defamatory" statements against him. Singh, who headed the Justice Ranjit Singh Commission that probed sacrilege incidents in Punjab, accused Badal of describing the report as "waste paper" and calling his law degree fake.

headlines: India, Pak agree to hold meeting on Kartarpur corridor in March
text: India and Pakistan agreed to hold the first meeting on the Kartarpur corridor on March 13, with a Pakistani delegation set to visit India to discuss and finalise modalities for facilitating the visit of pilgrims through the corridor, the External Affairs Ministry said. An Indian delegation may visit Pakistan on March 28 to finalise the draft agreement for the corridor.

headlines: Sierra Leone declares rape a national emergency
text: Sierra Leone's President Julius Maada Bio has declared rape and sexual assault a national emergency after cases of sexual and gender-based violence doubled last year. Those convicted of raping minors would be sentenced to life in prison. Bio announced the formation of a police division to investigate reports of sexual violence and a special magistrate court that would fast-track cases.

headlines: Tinder-like app for dog adoption made in Lithuania
text: Lithuania-based app makers have created a Tinder-inspired app GetPet to set up a meeting between shelter dogs up for adoption and potential owners. The app, presently available only in Lithuanian, also offers assistance from a personal GetPet mentor after a user decides on adopting a dog. "It's like Tinder, but with dogs," Vaidas Gecevicius, one of the app's creators said.

headlines: His normalcy is hard to find: Vaani on working with Ranbir
text: While speaking about working with actor Ranbir Kapoor for their upcoming film 'Shamshera', actress Vaani Kapoor said, "Ranbir is very cooperative, sweet, humble and so normal! That sense of normalcy is very hard to find." "Ranbir has been so kind and welcoming to me," the actress added. The film, directed by Karan Malhotra, is scheduled to release in 2020.

headlines: Pankaj to make H'wood debut with Chris Hemsworth: Reports
text: Actor Pankaj Tripathi will make his Hollywood debut with the upcoming Chris Hemsworth starrer 'Dhaka', as per reports. The actor will join the cast in Thailand to shoot for the film, in which he will play a pivotal role, reports further suggested. The film will also feature actors Randeep Hooda and Manoj Bajpayee.

headlines: Apple asks apps to disclose or remove screen recording code
text: Apple has asked app developers to either properly disclose or remove the use of analytics code which allows them to record iPhone screens while their app is open. Apple said these apps face removal from App Store otherwise. This comes after a TechCrunch report alleged such code was being used by some apps including 'Abercrombie & Fitch', 'Hotels.com' and 'Expedia'.

headlines: I have a relation of 'chai' with North Bengal: PM Modi
text: Addressing a rally in West Bengal, PM Narendra Modi on Friday said he has a special relationship of "chai" (tea) with North Bengal. "You grow tea, I make tea...And it makes me wonder...Why Didi (WB CM Mamata Banerjee) is not fond of chaiwallahs," he added. "WB government has defamed "maati" (soil) and has made "maanush" (people) helpless," he further said.

headlines: Cong to take action against 4 MLAs under Anti-Defection Law
text: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday said the party will initiate action against four MLAs under the Anti-Defection Law following a unanimous decision. The four MLAs had failed to turn up during the budget session despite Congress issuing a whip, and had also skipped the Congress legislature party meeting last month.

headlines: Don't let SP-BSP alliance rattle you: Shah to BJP workers
text: Referring to the SP-BSP alliance for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections in Uttar Pradesh, BJP chief Amit Shah told party workers, "You do not need to get rattled by the alliance." He added, "The BJP is ready for a battle for 50% vote share in Uttar Pradesh." He further claimed development was never a priority during SP and BSP rule.

headlines: Does PM Modi have dual personality, schizophrenia: Rahul
text: Talking about The Hindu's report claiming that Defence Ministry objected to "parallel negotiations" conducted by PMO in Rafale deal, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "This proves 'chowkidar' is a thief". Commenting on PM Narendra Modi's "ulta chor chowkidar ko dante" remark, Rahul added, "Does he have a dual personality? One day he becomes 'chowkidar', one day 'chor'...[is it] schizophrenia?"

headlines: Ola hires Puneet Bhirani as COO, Fleet Technologies CEO
text: Bengaluru-based ride-hailing startup Ola has appointed Puneet Bhirani as its Chief Operating Officer and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Ola Fleet Technologies. Bhirani previously worked with IT firm Mphasis for around 16 years and was CEO of its subsidiary Digital Risk. Current fleet business head Sandeep Divakaran has been shifted to lead a "new initiative" with Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal.

headlines: China researches may have used stolen prisoner organs: Study
text: A study published recently has called for retraction of over 400 English-language researches on Chinese organ transplantation amid fears the organs were obtained unethically. The study's authors said researches "may contain data obtained from prisoners...killed for the purpose of organ acquisition". A 2016 report had claimed number of transplants reported by government and hospitals did not match.

headlines: 14 children injured in fire in Uttar Pradesh madrasa
text: As many as 14 children were injured after a fire broke out at a madrasa in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Thursday. The fire started after a burning candle kept in the room came into contact with a refrigerator near it, police said. Ten of the 14 children were seriously injured and all of them were taken to hospital, police added.

headlines: BJP youth wing demands temple in AMU, sets 15-day deadline
text: Mukesh Singh Lodhi, BJP's youth wing Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha's district president, has written to Aligarh Muslim University Vice-Chancellor Tariq Mansoor demanding the construction of a temple on campus. Giving Mansoor 15 days to reply, Lodhi said thousands of BJYM workers will visit AMU for "murti sthapana" if the demand isn't met. The temple will strengthen Hindu-Muslim unity, he added.

headlines: We are obligated to fight Iran in Venezuela: US
text: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo has said that his country is "obligated" to fight Iran in Venezuela. "People don't recognise that Hezbollah has active cells  the Iranians are impacting the people of Venezuela and throughout South America," he added. The US considers Lebanon-based and Iran-backed Hezbollah, a terrorist organisation.

headlines: India win a T20I in New Zealand for the first time, level series
text: India defeated New Zealand by 7 wickets in the second T20I at Auckland on Friday to level the three-match series 1-1. This was the first time that India won a T20I on New Zealand soil, having lost each of their previous three T20Is in the country. The series decider will take place at Hamilton on Sunday.

headlines: Rohit Sharma becomes highest run-scorer in T20I cricket history
text: Team India stand-in captain Rohit Sharma has become the highest run-getter in T20I cricket history, achieving the feat in the second T20I against New Zealand at Auckland on Friday. The 31-year-old opener overtook New Zealand's Martin Guptill, who has scored 2,272 runs in 74 T20I innings. Rohit also became the first Indian batsman to slam 100 sixes in T20I cricket.

headlines: Is Rani of Jhansi my chachi? Kangana on silence over 'Manikarnika'
text: Speaking about the silence of Bollywood personalities on her film 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', Kangana Ranaut questioned, "Is Rani of Jhansi my chachi? Why are these people so scared or hesitant?" "Just because I spoke about nepotism and they are all shaken up due to that," she added. Kangana further said, "They have all ganged up against me."

headlines: I reached out to Alia, suggested her to grow some spine: Kangana
text: After actress Alia Bhatt said she will apologise to Kangana Ranaut if she has upset the latter, Kangana revealed, "I reached out to Alia...I suggested that she grows some spine and support an important film [Manikarnika] about women empowerment and nationalism." Earlier, Kangana had said actresses like Alia send her trailers of their films but don't support her work.

headlines: I don't consider Alia successful if she's Johar's puppet: Kangana
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while criticising Alia Bhatt for not supporting her film 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', said, "If she doesn't have a voice of her own and her existence is all about being Karan Johar's puppet then I don't consider her successful." "I told her if she's only focusing on earning bucks...then her success has no value," she added.

headlines: 10 people die in fire at football club's training centre in Brazil
text: As many as 10 people were killed and three others were injured after a fire erupted at a dormitory in Flamengo football club's youth training centre in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro. The club's players aged between 14 and 17 stayed in the dormitory, according to reports. The fire reportedly broke out when the players were sleeping.

headlines: Congress trying to provoke IAF, Army against govt: Sitharaman
text: After Congress chief Rahul Gandhi claimed PM Narendra Modi held "parallel negotiations" in the Rafale deal, Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Congress is trying to provoke the Indian Army and Indian Air Force against the government." She called this "unfortunate" and "dangerous". Rahul had cited a media report claiming the Defence Ministry had objected to negotiations conducted by PMO.

headlines: Man stabbed to death by drunk friends in front of his wife in Delhi
text: A 34-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by his two friends in front of his wife during a drunken brawl between them in Delhi on Thursday. The victim's wife said his friends, who were at their home for dinner, stabbed him after an argument and fled the spot. The deceased and his friends had previous criminal records, police stated.

headlines: Thai Princess Ubolratana becomes 1st royal to run for office
text: Thai Princess Ubolratana Rajakanya Sirivadhana Varnavadi will stand as a candidate for PM in the March elections, becoming the first member of the royal family to run for office. The 67-year-old relinquished her royal title in 1972 after marrying an American but is still considered part of the royal family. She has been nominated by the Thai Raksa Chart party.

headlines: Veterinary surgeon who smuggled heroin to US in pups jailed for 6yrs
text: A Colombian veterinarian who surgically implanted liquid heroin inside live puppies to smuggle the drug into the US was sentenced to six years in prison on Thursday. The 39-year-old will be deported to Colombia after his sentence. Notably, one of the puppies was later trained by the Colombian National Police to become a drug-sniffing dog.

headlines: ISIS leader Baghdadi fled coup attempt by his own fighters: Report
text: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of the Islamic State (ISIS) militant group, reportedly fled a coup attempt last month launched by foreign fighters in his eastern Syrian hideout. ISIS has since placed a bounty on the head of the coup's main plotter, the report said. It added the coup attempt was carried out by some of Baghdadi's most trusted people.

headlines: Jet Airways grounds 4 planes after failing to pay lease rent
text: Cash-strapped Jet Airways said it has grounded four planes from its 123-strong fleet after failing to pay its lease rentals amid debts worth $1.1 billion. Earlier, it was reported that the Mumbai-based carrier accepted a bailout plan from Etihad Airways under which Etihad would increase its stake from 24% to 40%, and Founder and Chairman Naresh Goyal would step down.

headlines: Saif Ali Khan to feature in Sushant starrer 'Dil Bechara'
text: Saif Ali Khan will feature in the upcoming Sushant Singh Rajput and Sanjana Sanghi starrer 'Dil Bechara'. The actor recently joined the film's cast in Paris to shoot for the film, which is a Hindi remake of the Hollywood film 'The Fault In Our Stars'. Originally titled 'Kizie Aur Manny', the Mukesh Chhabra directorial was recently renamed by its makers.

headlines: Deepika to star in Farah Khan's comeback film: Reports
text: Actress Deepika Padukone will reportedly star in Farah Khan's upcoming action comedy film, which will mark her comeback as a director. Deepika has previously worked with Farah in the 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om' as well as Farah's last film 'Happy New Year', which released in 2014. Farah earlier announced that the film will be produced by filmmaker Rohit Shetty.

headlines: AAP will contest Lok Sabha elections in Maha: AAP leader
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will contest Lok Sabha elections in Maharashtra and would also seek alliances with regional parties, AAP's state chief Brigadier (retired) Sudhir Sawant said. The party's seat-sharing formula will be finalised by February 15, he added. The party had earlier announced that it will contest Lok Sabha polls in Delhi, Punjab, Haryana and Goa.

headlines: BJP doesn't function on basis of dynasty but democracy: Shah
text: Addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj, BJP President Amit Shah said BJP doesn't function on the basis of a dynasty but on democracy. Taking a dig at SP chief Akhilesh Yadav and BSP chief Mayawati, he added, "During 'Bua-Bhatija' reign, Purvanchal was going through menace of mosquitoes and mafia." "After BJP...mafia has disappeared...encephalitis cases have decreased," he further said.

headlines: History repeated: Jaitley on Cong's promise on Triple Talaq
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Friday criticised Congress for promising to scrap Triple Talaq law if it comes to power, saying, "History has repeated itself...with a mindset of cruelty." Jaitley was referring to former PM Rajiv Gandhi's decision to overturn High Court's judgment on the Shah Bano case. "Thirty-two years later his son has taken another retrograde step," he added.

headlines: Charming leader: BJP's Shatrughan Sinha on Rahul Gandhi
text: BJP leader Shatrughan Sinha on Friday called Congress President Rahul Gandhi a "charming leader" who has "improved tremendously with maturity in a short span." Praising a speech given by Rahul, Sinha added, "His responses were with facts and quite impressive... He is high on confidence especially after his party won 3 states in the recently concluded elections."

headlines: Woman kills husband with lover's help, calls it heart attack
text: A Hyderabad woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her husband with the help of her lover and his three friends. The woman lied to authorities, claiming her husband had died of a heart attack. However, subsequent investigations revealed that, prior to his murder, her husband had found out about her lover and did not let her continue the relationship.

headlines: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif shifted back to jail from hospital
text: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was on Thursday shifted back to jail from hospital in Lahore. Sharif was taken back to jail on his request as the government was showing "non-serious attitude towards his health issues", Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz said. "If anything happens to him, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf government will be responsible for this," she added.

headlines: Evidence shows Khashoggi murder 'planned' by Saudi officials: UN
text: A UN-led inquiry into the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi has said that evidence pointed to a brutal crime "planned and perpetrated" by Saudi officials. It added that Saudi officials had "seriously undermined" and delayed Turkey's efforts to investigate the crime scene at its Istanbul consulate. Khashoggi was murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul on October 2, 2018.

headlines: upGrad learner switches to ML & IoT analyst with 150% salary hike
text: upGrad's PG program in Machine Learning and AI from IIIT-Bangalore was ranked the best by AIM in 2018. They provide 1-1 mentorship through mock interviews, placement drives and have helped professionals move into companies like Microsoft, KPMG, Swiggy, Flipkart and more. Himanshu, an upGrad learner, transitioned to ML and IoT analyst at a leading IT company with 150% salary hike.

headlines: Mayawati should pay back public money she spent on statues: SC
text: The Supreme Court has said, "We're of the tentative view that (BSP supremo and ex-Uttar Pradesh CM) Mayawati has to deposit the public money spent on her statues and party symbol (elephant) to the state exchequer." The bench headed by CJI Ranjan Gogoi was responding to a plea seeking direction to restrain her from spending public money on building statues.

headlines: Rohit Sharma becomes 1st Indian to smash 100 sixes in T20I cricket
text: Stand-in captain Rohit Sharma has become the first Indian and overall third batsman to smash 100 sixes in T20I cricket, achieving the feat during the second T20I against New Zealand on Friday. Windies' Chris Gayle and New Zealand's Martin Guptill have slammed 103 sixes each in T20I cricket. Rohit has slammed 347 sixes in international cricket so far.

headlines: Let's trade places for a day: Anushka's lookalike tells actress
text: Anushka Sharma's lookalike, American singer Julia Michaels, has told the actress, "Let's trade places for a day." Julia said this after Anushka tweeted, "I've been looking for you and the remaining 5 of our doppelgängers all my life." Julia had initially posted a collage of her and Anushka along with the caption, "Hi, Anushka...apparently we're twins lol."

headlines: Yuvraj tries trolling Parthiv over gym pic, gets trolled back
text: All-rounder Yuvraj Singh tried trolling wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel after the latter shared a picture of himself sitting on a treadmill following a gym session with the caption, "Done for the day." "Looks like was a great session! You're sweating a lot," Yuvraj sarcastically wrote. "I don't have...editing team which can show my 15-minute session into 2-hour session," replied Parthiv.

headlines: India Women's 100th T20I ends in a defeat as NZ win on last ball
text: India Women marked their 100th T20I with a defeat as New Zealand Women won the second T20I at Auckland on the last ball on Friday. With this, New Zealand Women took an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Out of their 100 T20Is, India Women have won 53 and lost 45, while two matches didn't produce a result.

headlines: Grand alliance govt can work: Ex-PM Gowda in his last LS speech
text: In what he called his last Lok Sabha speech, former PM HD Deve Gowda rejected BJP's claims that a "grand alliance government" will create chaos and said the coalition government led by him from 1996-97 had proved it can work. The 85-year-old JD(S) leader asserted that he has spent 57 years in public life in state and national politics.

headlines: Jeff Bezos accuses tabloid owner of blackmail over his nude photos
text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos has accused US tabloid National Enquirer's owner of "blackmail and extortion" over intimate pictures of him and ex-TV host Lauren Sanchez. Bezos said the tabloid's parent company wanted him to drop an investigation into how it obtained his private messages. Notably, National Enquirer had published reports about Bezos' affair with Sanchez along with their private messages.

headlines: Man jumps off train to chase thief, gets phone back in 5 hrs
text: A 29-year-old Mumbai man named Akshay Gaikwad managed to retrieve his phone within five hours after it was snatched on a local train, said Government Railway Police officers. Gaikwad jumped off the train to chase the thief but the latter managed to escape. Gaikwad's phone was retrieved after he approached the GRP and helped identify the thief via CCTV footage.

headlines: Man falls to Madhya Pradesh minister's feet; he walks on
text: A video of a man falling to Madhya Pradesh Minister Govind Singh's feet has surfaced online. The video shows Singh moving forward without listening to the man and getting inside a car. Reportedly, the minister was meeting people who were submitting their petitions in Bhopal and the man fell to his feet in an attempt to present his case.

headlines: 67-yr-old man marries 24-yr-old; HC asks police to ensure safety
text: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has directed Punjab Police to ensure safety of life and liberty of 67-year-old Shamsher Singh and 24-year-old Navpreet Kaur, who got married last month in Sangrur. The couple had approached the court after their pictures were circulated online. They claimed their lives are in danger from their families and relatives, their counsel said.

headlines: Saudi prince threatened to use bullet on murdered journo: Report
text: A year before Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi was murdered, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman reportedly told an aide he would use "a bullet" on the journalist if he did not return home and end his criticism of the government. The comments were intercepted by American intelligence agencies, the report said. Notably, Saudi has insisted Salman wasn't involved in the killing.

headlines: Longest-serving member of US Congress passes away aged 92
text: John Dingell, a Michigan Democrat who entered the US House of Representatives in 1955 to finish his late father's term and became the longest-serving member of Congress, passed away on Thursday aged 92. He was reportedly diagnosed with prostate cancer, which he had decided not to treat. "He was a lion of the US Congress," his wife Debbie said.

headlines: Tinder parent Match Group fully acquires dating app Hinge
text: Tinder's parent company Match Group has fully acquired dating app Hinge, after acquiring a majority 51% stake in it last year, as per its 2018 fourth-quarter report. The Match Group also operates online dating platforms including OkCupid and PlentyOfFish. Hinge's US downloads grew four times on a year-over-year basis in the same quarter.

headlines: Open to alliance in Haryana to defeat BJP, Cong, INLD: AAP
text: Haryana Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Naveen Jaihind on Thursday said, "To keep BJP, Congress and Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) out of power, we are open to talks with other parties." "Formal negotiations on tie-up for the forthcoming polls are yet to begin," he added. AAP had supported Jannayak Janta Party candidate Digvijay Chautala in the recent Jind bypolls.

headlines: Kamal Haasan's MNM to contest 40 LS seats in TN, Puducherry
text: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Thursday said his party Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) will contest all 40 Lok Sabha seats in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry in the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. "I cannot say at this moment from where I will contest, he added. He further said that he would not form an alliance with any "tainted group".

headlines: Those who looted nation will continue to fear me: PM Modi
text: Stating that his government will continue to have zero tolerance towards black money, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said, "I assure you, those who have looted the nation will continue to be scared of Narendra Modi." Further, in a veiled reference to liquor baron Vijay Mallya, PM Modi added, "You (Congress) allowed the loot, we are bringing them back."

headlines: Do not expect miracles: Rahul Gandhi tells Priyanka, Scindia
text: During a Congress strategy meeting ahead of the Lok Sabha elections, party president Rahul Gandhi told Priyanka Gandhi and Jyotiraditya Scindia not to expect "miracles" in two months. Stating that they should not feel any pressure, Gandhi asked them to spring into "mission mode" and focus on the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections.

headlines: Ghosn under scrutiny over $57,000 Versailles wedding bill
text: France-based Renault on Thursday said it has uncovered a transaction worth $57,000 involving its ousted chief Carlos Ghosn and the Palace of Versailles, where the executive's wedding reception was hosted in 2016. The arrangement was made through a sponsorship deal between the former royal residence and the carmaker, it added. Renault further said it would alert prosecutors about the discovery.

headlines: Andhra Assembly passes bill for 5% reservation for Kapus
text: The Andhra Pradesh Assembly on Thursday passed a bill to provide 5% reservation to the Kapu community and another 5% reservation to economically weaker sections. The bill will provide reservation in education and employment to Kapus, Ontari, Balija and Telaga sub-castes. In 2017, the assembly had proposed a bill for reservation for Kapu community, however, it did not materialise.

headlines: Woman killed in front of daughter for rejecting marriage proposal
text: A 45-year-old married woman was allegedly stabbed to death in front of her daughter by a man whose marriage proposal she had rejected, said the police on Thursday. The man, 18 years her junior, had started stalking her after she quit her job at the shoe factory where they both worked. A case was registered and the accused was arrested.

headlines: Over 28 lakh new voters added to Maharashtra electoral roll
text: As per the revised voter list of Maharashtra published on January 31, over 28 lakh new voters have been added to the electoral roll. Of these, 11.9 lakh are in the age group of 18-19 years, an official said. The total number of eligible voters for Lok Sabha elections in the state is now 8.7 crore, the official added.

headlines: Dinkar Gupta takes charge as Punjab's new DGP
text: Senior IPS officer Dinkar Gupta on Thursday took over as the new Director General of Police, Punjab. Fifty-five-year-old Gupta said that keeping the border state safe and secure would continue to be a priority of the Punjab Police under him. Gupta, who is from the 1987 batch, is married to Punjab Additional Chief Secretary Vini Mahajan.

headlines: Simultaneous elections a 'desirable goal': CEC Sunil Arora
text: Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora on Thursday said that simultaneous elections is a "desirable goal". For this, "the political systems of the country will have to take steps to align the life of a state assembly with the life of Parliament", he added. He further said that Election Commission officials recently met the law secretary to discuss electoral reform issues.

headlines: 4 held for pushing pillars at Hampi after video went viral
text: Nearly a week after a video of men pushing down pillars at Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, went viral, police have arrested four men in connection with the case. Three men were seen toppling the pillars, while another was filming the video. The men allegedly told police that they were not aware that the monuments are of importance.

headlines: Pak using social media to mobilise Kashmiri youth: Lt Gen
text: Lieutenant General Ranbir Singh on Thursday said that the Pakistani army has been using social media to mobilise youths of Jammu and Kashmir, and lure them towards militancy. He added that Pakistan is trying to develop narratives to alter public opinion in Kashmir and to disrupt peace and stability. However, he added, the Indian Army has developed effective counter-terrorism capabilities.

headlines: Train leaves with baby on board as father steps out to smoke in US
text: A video showing a train leaving with a baby whose father stepped out to smoke in US' Ohio has surfaced online. The footage shows the father, who can be seen chasing the train, putting the child's carrier down on a seat before getting off. A fellow passenger alerted the driver, who reversed course and reunited the baby with the father.

headlines: Mumbai bus driver uses bamboo as gear lever, arrested as bus hits BMW
text: A 21-year-old school bus driver named Raj Kumar was arrested after the bus crashed into a BMW car in Mumbai. When the car's owner confronted the driver, he discovered that the driver was using a bamboo stick as a makeshift gear lever to operate the bus. The driver said he had been using the bamboo stick for three days.

headlines: Freedom to choose: Rahman after daughter is criticised over niqab
text: Singer-composer AR Rahman, in a veiled reference to comments criticising his daughter Khatija for wearing a niqab, shared a picture showing his other daughter Raheema and wife Sairaa without the veil but Khatija covering her face at a party. "The precious ladies of my family... #freedomtochoose," he wrote. Khatija had recently made an appearance with Rahman at an event.

headlines: Banner on sexual consent removed from stadium during NZ-India T20I
text: New Zealand Cricket and Westpac Stadium removed a banner promoting sexual consent during Wednesday's New Zealand-India T20I. The banner reading, "No means No", was being displayed by a woman, who was escorted from her seat by security. The banner was directed at all-rounder Scott Kuggeleijn, who was found not guilty of rape following a trial in 2017.

headlines: Body recovered in plane wreckage identified as missing footballer
text: The body recovered from plane wreckage in English Channel was on Thursday formally identified as Cardiff City's 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala, police said. It was recovered late on Wednesday after the wreckage was found on Sunday. The aircraft, carrying Sala and pilot David Ibbotson, had vanished on January 21, while on the way from France's Nantes to Wales' Cardiff.

headlines: Barcelona salvage draw vs Real Madrid in Copa del Rey semi 1st leg
text: The first leg of Copa del Rey semi-final match between Barcelona and Real Madrid ended in a 1-1 draw on Wednesday. Real Madrid's 27-year-old forward Lucas Vázquez opened the scoring in the 6th minute, while Barcelona's 21-year-old Malcom equalised in the 57th minute. The second leg of the semi-final will take place on February 27.

headlines: People don't want a 'Mahamilavat' govt: PM Modi on Mahagathbandhan
text: Attacking the grand alliance of Opposition parties, PM Narendra Modi has said, "People have seen the work a government with an absolute majority can do. They do not want a 'Mahamilavat' government of those who recently gathered in Kolkata." "Modiji will frighten the people who are corrupt," PM Modi added during the Budget session in Lok Sabha on Thursday.

headlines: PM's reply demolished false slogans of Opposition: Jaitley
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Thursday said PM Narendra Modi's address in Parliament demolished false narrative and slogans of the Opposition. Taking a dig at the Opposition, Jaitley tweeted PM's reply in Parliament is a "report card" of the BJP government's five year performance. He further asked whether the Opposition had a reply to the data shared by the PM.

headlines: Scientists partially regrow mice limbs using just 2 proteins
text: Texas A&M University scientists have successfully stimulated growth of joint and bone tissue in damaged or amputated limbs of newborn mice using just two proteins. This proves treatment of growth factors can be used to engineer regeneration response from a non-regenerating amputation wound, researchers said. Around 60% of the bone stumps formed a layer of cartilage within 3 days.

headlines: Search on for Indian pilot as aircraft goes missing in Philippines
text: The Philippine Coast Guard is searching for a training aircraft that went missing with the instructor pilot and his student pilot, both of them Indian nationals. The aircraft is believed to have gone missing over the Bataan area on Monday. The plane took off from Plaridel airport and landed at Subic airport but went missing on its way back.

headlines: 10 policemen missing after avalanche hits J&K
text: At least 10 policemen have gone missing after a police post was hit by an avalanche in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam. Around 20 policemen were at the post when it was hit by the avalanche, 10 of whom came out safely, an official said. The avalanche hit a tunnel along the Srinagar-Jammu national highway, the official added.

headlines: Vadra questioned 9 hrs on day 2, Priyanka picks him from ED office
text: Robert Vadra was questioned for over nine hours by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case on Thursday after which his wife and Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi picked him up. This comes after Priyanka dropped Vadra to the ED office for Wednesday's session and told reporters, "I stand by my husband in this political witch hunt".

headlines: Newlyweds Justin, Hailey feature on March cover of Vogue US
text: Singer Justin Bieber and his wife and model Hailey Baldwin featured on the cover of fashion magazine 'Vogue US' for its March issue. While Hailey is seen in a cream-coloured Prada dress, the cover features Justin in dark blue Dior shorts. This marks the couple's first magazine cover together since they tied the knot in September, last year.

headlines: Daisy Shah to play football coach in debut Gujarati film
text: Actress Daisy Shah has been roped in to play a football coach in the upcoming Gujarati film 'Gujarat 11', marking her debut in the Gujarati film industry. "I feel lucky to have found a good project to work in and thats the reason I am doing a Gujarati film," Daisy said. Shooting for the film will reportedly commence this month.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra gets wax statue at Madame Tussauds museum
text: Priyanka Chopra on Thursday unveiled her wax statue at the Madame Tussauds museum in New York, US. Posting a series of pictures with the statue, Priyanka wrote, "Coming to other locations soon!" The wax statue of the actress will also be launched in the United Kingdom, Australia, Thailand, and Singapore, later this year.

headlines: I was inspired a lot after seeing Chahal bat, jokes Smriti Mandhana
text: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana, during her appearance in 'Chahal TV' show, joked she was inspired a lot after seeing India men's team spinner and host of the show, Yuzvendra Chahal, bat in the fourth ODI against New Zealand. "I felt like I have to develop my game," she jokingly added. Chahal top-scored for India with 18*(37) in fourth ODI.

headlines: Apple to remove Safari's 'Do Not Track' over privacy threat
text: Apple has removed support for "expired" 'Do Not Track' feature in version 12.1 of its Safari web browser, saying it may potentially be used to track users. The feature only submits a request to stop tracking, which websites can choose to overlook. However, Apple has added the 'Intelligent Tracking Prevention' to the new version with new limits for long-term tracking.

headlines: SpaceX Mars rocket engine achieves launch power levels: Musk
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to announce the Raptor flight engine has achieved the power levels needed for use in the Starship rocket designed for human Mars missions. The engine reached 172 metric tons of force, Musk said. He had earlier suggested nearly 31 Raptor engines could be attached to Starship's launch rocket Super Heavy.

headlines: IIT Mandi team uses diesel residue to filter oil from water
text: A team of IIT Mandi researchers has developed a method that uses soot, emitted by diesel engines, to remove oil and organic chemicals from water. The team incorporated diesel soot, which contains carbon known to absorb organic pollutants in water, into polymer sponges. They found that these recyclable sponges had a high absorption capacity of various oils without any pretreatment.

headlines: 193 Bangladeshis found locked up in shophouse in Indonesia
text: Indonesian police have found 193 Bangladeshis locked up in a shophouse in Medan on the island of Sumatra in a case of human trafficking. The victims had entered Indonesia as tourists and were promised work in Malaysia by the traffickers. Some of the people had been held by the traffickers for three months, according to reports.

headlines: Islamic State will be defeated 100% by next week: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said the Islamic State may lose 100% of its territory in Iraq and Syria by next week. "Rest assured, we'll do what it takes to defeat every ounce and every last person within the ISIS madness and defend our people from radical Islamic terrorism," he added. Trump has ordered the withdrawal of US troops from Syria.

headlines: France recalls ambassador to Italy amid worst tension since WWII
text: France has recalled its ambassador to Italy amid escalating diplomatic tension, saying the situation was "unprecedented" since the end of WWII. "For several months, France has been the target of repeated, baseless attacks and outrageous statements," the French Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Italian Deputy Prime Minister Luigi Di Maio met French 'yellow-vest' protesters near Paris.

headlines: Delhi, Noida hit by heavy rain, hailstorm; 18 flights diverted
text: Four international and 14 domestic flights were diverted from Delhi airport on Thursday as parts of the National Capital received heavy rainfall while areas in Noida witnessed hailstorms. The overall air quality index (AQI) was at 265, classified as 'poor'. Further, the minimum temperature on Wednesday in Delhi-NCR was recorded at 12ºC and the maximum was settled at 25ºC.

headlines: Woman throws cigarette butt on road, man throws it back into her car
text: A video of a man named Magnus confronting a woman who threw a cigarette butt out of her car's window at a signal in Australia has gone viral. Magnus picked up the cigarette butt and threw it back inside her car. "This poor lady's cigarette accidentally fell out of her hand...I kindly returned it to her...Chivalry still exists," Magnus joked.

headlines: If I've upset her, I will apologise: Alia Bhatt on Kangana's remark
text: After Kangana Ranaut claimed actresses like Alia Bhatt send her trailers of their films but don't support her work, Alia said she hasn't done anything "intentionally" to upset Kangana and if she has, she will apologise on a personal level. "I hope she doesn't dislike me. I've admired her a lot as an actor and as a person," she added.

headlines: Bowler gives away 17 runs off 1 legal ball in 1st over of BBL match
text: BBL side Hobart Hurricanes' fast bowler Riley Meredith conceded 17 runs off one legitimate delivery in the first over of Melbourne Renegades' innings. After conceding one run off the first three balls, Meredith bowled a no-ball before conceding five wides. He was then hit for two fours off two straight no-balls before conceding a single off the legitimate fourth delivery.

headlines: India have lost all their T20Is in which MS Dhoni top-scored
text: India on Wednesday suffered their worst defeat in T20I cricket, losing to New Zealand by 80 runs. The match witnessed MS Dhoni top-scoring for India in a T20I for the fifth time, hitting 39 runs off 31 balls including five fours and a six. India had lost the previous four T20Is as well, in which Dhoni top-scored.

headlines: My party will face Lok Sabha polls by itself: Kamal Haasan
text: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan on Thursday said his party Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) would contest the upcoming Lok Sabha elections on its own in Tamil Nadu. He added, "We are trying to keep our hands clean by not allying with any of the Dravidian parties." He said, "We are trying to serve good for the people with clean hands."

headlines: Cong-mukt Bharat not my slogan, fulfilling Gandhiji's wish: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday took a dig at the Congress saying 'Congress-mukt Bharat' was not his slogan but he was just fulfilling the wish of Mahatma Gandhi. Addressing the Parliament, the PM added that Mahatma Gandhi "had back then recommended the dissolution of the Congress party". He said that had to be done as a tribute to Gandhiji.

headlines: Delhi government launches bike ambulance services
text: The Delhi government on Thursday launched bike ambulance services to ensure timely health assistance in congested areas. The bikes will have a portable oxygen cylinder, first aid kit and dressing materials, air-splints, GPS and communication device, among others. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said 16 bike ambulances have been launched and the number will go up in the future.

headlines: India's oldest elephant 'Granny Dakshayani' dies aged 88
text: Asia's oldest elephant in captivity 'Gaja Muthassi' Dakshayani passed away aged 88 on Tuesday due to age-related problems. Also known as 'granny elephant', Dakshayani had been living in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala for the last 70 years. Dakshayani had entered the Universal Record Forum three years ago, which is one step below the Guinness World Records.

headlines: God help you: SC to CBI's Nageswara Rao in contempt of court
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday summoned CBI officer M Nageswara Rao in contempt of court, saying, "God help you as you have played with our orders". The top court summoned Rao over the transfer of officer AK Sharma, who was probing the Bihar shelter home cases. The apex court added, "We are going to take it very very seriously".

headlines: I've cried for days over hurtful things people said online: Kendall
text: America's 23-year-old supermodel Kendall Jenner in an interview said that she's cried endlessly for days because of "hurtful" things people said about her online. "I am not superhuman. I definitely feel," said Kendall. "When people say mean things...I'm like, 'I know I have a zit. I know I'm breaking out. You don't have to keep pointing it out'," she added.

headlines: Gucci criticised for racist sweater resembling blackface, apologises
text: Gucci on Thursday apologised and stopped selling its 'wool balaclava jumper' with immediate effect after the brand was widely accused of racism over the sweater resembling 'blackface'. 'Blackface' is a form of make-up used by non-black performers in the 19th century to represent a black person. "We consider diversity a fundamental value to be fully upheld and respected," Gucci said.

headlines: Nick to feature in 'Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle' sequel
