text: Nick Jonas, who played a pilot named Alex in the 2017 film 'Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle', has confirmed that he will feature in the film's upcoming sequel. "I couldnt be more excited to bring Alex back to the big screen," Nick wrote on Twitter. The film, starring actor Dwayne Johnson, is scheduled to release in December, this year.

headlines: We delete 2 million accounts per month to curb fake news: WhatsApp
text: Facebook-owned messaging platform WhatsApp has said it deletes around two million accounts per month in an effort to curb fake news. The data was released as part of a white paper report on "stopping abuse" launched in India. WhatsApp revealed around 20% accounts were banned at the time of registration itself after analysing data like phone numbers or computer networks.

headlines: 19-year-old builds own prosthetic arm using Lego bricks
text: David Aguilar, a 19-year-old bioengineering student in Spain born without a right forearm, has built himself a robotic prosthetic arm using Lego bricks. "I wanted to...see myself in the mirror like I see other guys, with two hands," Aguilar said, adding that he aims to design affordable robotic limbs. Aguilar is currently using his fourth model of the prosthetic arm.

headlines: Climate change will make Earth look bluer from space: MIT study
text: Earth's blue and green colour will intensify when viewed from space by 2100 owing to climate change, as per an MIT study. Researchers noted ocean colour depends on light reflected by phytoplankton, which contain blue spectrum absorbing chlorophyll. The study suggested that subtropical blue regions will become more blue, reflecting even less phytoplankton, while regions near poles may turn greener.

headlines: $18.5M satellites stop sending signals after crossing Mars
text: NASA's briefcase-sized satellites, collectively called MarCO (Mars Cube One) which were part of an $18.5 million experimental mission have fallen silent in deep space past Mars. They were launched with NASA's Mars lander InSight to send data at each stage of its descent to Martian surface in near-real time. MarCO was the first interplanetary mission using these mini-spacecrafts, NASA said.

headlines: Indian-American entrepreneur Gurinder Khalsa enters politics
text: Gurinder Singh Khalsa, an Indian-American philanthropist and entrepreneur, has decided to run for the City Council of Fishers in the US' Indiana state. He attributed the decision to enter politics to an "interest in public policy...along with the desire to give back to (his) community". Khalsa had led a campaign for the US to change its headgear policy at airports.

headlines: Vatican clarifies Pope's remark on sexual slavery of nuns
text: The Vatican has clarified a comment by Pope Francis on the "sexual slavery" of nuns within a French congregation, saying he was referring to "manipulation or a type of abuse of power that is reflected in sexual abuse". Pope Francis had made the comment while admitting for the first time to the problem of priests and bishops sexually abusing nuns.

headlines: Chinese student jailed for taking pictures of US naval base
text: A Chinese student has been sentenced to a year in prison after he pleaded guilty to illegally taking pictures at the Naval Air Station Key West in US. Zhao Qianli went directly to an area that contains a range of satellite dishes and antennas called the Farm and took videos and multiple photographs of the equipment there, court documents said.

headlines: Fortis Healthcare appoints Ashutosh Raghuvanshi as CEO
text: Fortis Healthcare on Thursday said it has appointed Ashutosh Raghuvanshi as the hospital chain's Chief Executive Officer (CEO) effective March 18. Raghuvanshi is currently serving as the Vice Chairman, Managing Director and CEO of Narayana Hrudayalaya group, the company added. He will be replacing Bhavdeep Singh, who stepped down from the company in November last year.

headlines: Saif Ali Khan sends coffee for photographers waiting for Taimur
text: Saif Ali Khan sent coffee for photographers waiting outside his house to take pictures of son Taimur, revealed photographer Viral Bhayani. "Sometimes Saif gets...upset for the whole Taimur excitement so now most of the paps keep a long distance away from him and click," he wrote. "But yesterday he surprised us by sending coffee for all the paps," Viral added.

headlines: Can't say no to work: Sushant on working with ex-girlfriend Ankita
text: Actor Sushant Singh Rajput, on being asked if he will work with ex-girlfriend Ankita Lokhande, said, "Yes! Kaam ke liye kabhi na nahi kar sakte hai, kisi ke liye bhi." Earlier, Ankita had said if the script is good, she will definitely work with Sushant. The former couple had started dating while working on the show 'Pavitra Rishta'.

headlines: Many parents tell kids 'bandar lag raha hai', it's not racist: Esha
text: Following criticism for sharing a chat wherein her friend called Nigerian footballer Alexander Iwobi a "gorilla", Esha Gupta said, "[I've been] wrongfully accused [of racism]." "I know...many parents who tell their children 'bandar lag raha hai yaar'. It doesn't mean they're saying in...racist undertone," she added. Esha further said people in India "don't know" that such words "mean anything racist".

headlines: KL Rahul donates largest individual amount for Martin's treatment
text: Ex-India cricketer Jacob Martin's family has revealed batsman KL Rahul donated the "largest amount of money" for Martin's treatment but refused to disclose the amount. Martin's wife Khyati said Rahul's team asked about their immediate requirement and the money was transferred into their account the same day. Martin had severely injured his lungs in a road accident in December 2018.

headlines: BC is 'Before Congress', AD is 'After Dynasty' for Congress: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi attacked the Congress party on Thursday while addressing the Lok Sabha in the Budget session. "Our friends in Congress see things in two time periods. BC, which is 'Before Congress', when nothing happened, and the other is AD 'After Dynasty' where everything happened," PM Modi said. He also wished for healthy competition in the upcoming general elections.

headlines: Instacart CEO Apoorva Mehta pays staff using tips, apologises
text: US-based grocery delivery startup Instacart's CEO Apoorva Mehta has apologised after a class-action lawsuit alleged the startup 'maliciously' included customer tips in employees' base salary. However, Mehta said the decision to do so was taken to increase the guaranteed payment for small orders. Adding that tips will be separate, Mehta said affected employees will be retroactively compensated.

headlines: Meditation app Calm worth billion dollars post raising $88mn
text: US-based meditation app Calm has reached unicorn status after raising $88 million in a Series B funding round at a valuation of $1 billion. The funding round was led by TPG Growth and saw participation from investors including Insight Venture Partners and American actor Ashton Kutcher's Sound Ventures. Calm was founded in 2012 by Alex Tew and Michael Acton Smith.

headlines: We're secular: Kerala university denies permission for Saraswati Puja
text: Kerala's government-owned Cochin University of Science & Technology denied North Indian students at its Kuttanad engineering college permission for 'Saraswati Puja'. "Ours is a secular campus and as such, we can't permit religious function/activities of any religion," a notice said. Last year, the campus was shut briefly after North Indian students complained they were served beef cutlets.

headlines: Old jets for warriors, wine for babus: Mirage crash pilot's family
text: The bereaved family of late Squadron Leader Samir Abrol, who died in a Mirage-2000 crash last week, has said, "While the bureaucracy enjoyed its corrupt cheese and wine. We give our warriors outdated machines to fight". The poem, posted by Abrol's brother Sushant on Facebook, stated it's an "unforgiving" job to be a test pilot given the risks it possesses.

headlines: UK man travels 320 kms to see injured mom, reaches before ambulance
text: A 48-year-old UK man named Mark Clements who travelled nearly 320 kilometres on a bus, two tubes and two trains from London to Exmouth, to see his 77-year-old injured mother, reached her before the ambulance. His mother had suffered a broken hip after a fall. The paramedics didn't arrive until seven hours after the initial ambulance call was made.

headlines: Social media is for connecting, not for mob trials: Swara
text: Speaking about the effect social media has had on law and order, Swara Bhasker said, "[It's] a platform for connecting...you cant replace our judiciary with mob trials on social media." "I'm...against this idea of Twitter justice. These days trial and justice both happen on Twitter," the actress added. Swara further said that there should be a procedure to get justice.

headlines: Facebook's head of communications quits after 8 years
text: Facebook executive Caryn Marooney has announced she will step down as the head of communications group after eight years at the social media platform. She did not announce her date of departure but said she will help the company look for her replacement. "What makes this so hard is that I have more faith in Facebook than ever," Marooney said.

headlines: Apps like Hotels.com, Expedia record iPhone screens: Report
text: A few iPhone apps including 'Abercrombie & Fitch', 'Hotels.com' and 'Expedia' are recording screens without user consent, a TechCrunch report claimed. Some app makers embed "session replay" technology into their apps to reportedly send recordings to companies for data analysis. A few of these apps reportedly leaked user data even though they are meant to hide the fields containing it.

headlines: Teen researcher finds macOS bug, refuses details to Apple
text: German teen researcher Linus Henze who found a macOS bug that lets him access stored passwords said he won't disclose details to Apple until they create macOS bug bounty program. Apple reportedly offers an invite-only bug bounty program specifically for iOS. "Finding vulnerabilities...takes time, and I just think that paying researchers is the right thing to do," he added.

headlines: Amazon food arm gets govt nod to sell on India site: Reports
text: Amazon's food retail arm Amazon Retail has reportedly received government clearance to continue to sell on its India website. Earlier on January 4, the Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion had said, "[T]here is no change in the FDI policy on food product retail trading...including through e-commerce". Amazon Pantry has reportedly started selling a few items on its website.

headlines: Macedonia signs accession deal to become 30th NATO member
text: Macedonian Foreign Minister Nikola Dimitrov and NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg on Wednesday signed an accession agreement, clearing the way for the Balkan nation to become the military alliance's 30th member. Each NATO member state now needs to ratify the accession deal. The country is expected to join NATO under the name of the Republic of North Macedonia.

headlines: Special place in hell for Brexit supporters without plan: Tusk
text: European Council President Donald Tusk said British leaders who promoted Brexit without a plan on how to deliver it deserve a "special place in hell". His comments came following talks with Irish PM Leo Varadkar over the Irish backstop issue. "It's a question for Tusk as to whether he considers...that kind of language helpful," British PM Theresa May's office said.

headlines: Nobel winner Arias accused of assault by 4 women in 48 hrs
text: Nobel Peace Prize winner and former Costa Rican President Oscar Arias has been accused of assault by four women in 48 hours. A nuclear disarmament activist was the first to accuse Arias, claiming he assaulted her at his home in 2014. Arias received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1987 for his efforts to end the civil wars in Central America.

headlines: Only one man has seen both 10-wicket hauls live in stadium
text: Englishman Richard Stokes was just 10 years old when he accompanied his father to the 1956 Ashes Test at Old Trafford, where Jim Laker took Test cricket's first-ever 10-wicket haul. On February 7, 1999, Stokes, who was working in India, was also present at the Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium in Delhi when Anil Kumble took all 10 wickets against Pakistan.

headlines: People will now know where Vidarbha is: Umesh Yadav after Ranji win
text: Following Vidarbha's second Ranji Trophy title victory in a row, pacer Umesh Yadav said few years ago people didn't know much about Vidarbha but now they will know Vidarbha is in which part of the country. The 31-year-old picked up 23 wickets in three matches he played for Vidarbha this season. Vidarbha defeated Saurashtra to win the title.

headlines: PM Modi is a darpok, he will run away from debate: Rahul
text: Challenging PM Narendra Modi to a debate on national security and the Rafale deal, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said, "Narendra Modi is a 'darpok' (coward). He will run away from the debate." Claiming he knows the PM as he has been "fighting" him for five years, Rahul added, If someone stands up to him, Modi runs away.

headlines: PM Modi's 56-inch chest has taken a beating: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday took a dig at PM Narendra Modi saying that the reputation of the PM and his "56-inch chest" has taken a beating. Addressing a convention, Rahul said BJP and Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh are scared as the Congress is brave. He said the country belongs to every individual and it's a fight between two ideologies.

headlines: Requested a high-level inquiry: VK Singh on 2012 coup report
text: Union Minister and former Army chief VK Singh on Thursday requested PM Narendra Modi to order a high-level inquiry into the alleged planting of "fallacious" stories in the media. Singh's statement came after the BJP accused the previous government of leaking an inaccurate story about a coup. He said, "You cannot accuse the armed forces of a thing like this."

headlines: CBI forms 10-member team to probe Saradha chit fund scam
text: The CBI has formed a 10-member team to probe the Saradha chit fund scam in West Bengal. The team, led by joint director Pankaj Srivastava, is expected to reach Kolkata on Thursday. Some of its members will also reach Shillong to question Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar, who is accused of destroying evidence in the Saradha chit fund scam.

headlines: 92-year-old Indian priest gets France's highest civilian honour
text: Father François Laborde, a 92-year-old Indian priest, was conferred the insignia of the Officer of the Legion of Honour on Wednesday, France's highest civilian honour. He was awarded in recognition of his work for differently abled children, the destitute and the most deprived sections of the society. Laborde had already been made a Chevalier of the Legion of Honour.

headlines: Enough is enough: SC transfers Muzaffarpur shelter home case
text: The Supreme Court transferred the Muzaffarpur shelter home case to a POCSO court in Delhi, stating the trial should be completed in 6 months. The court criticised the Bihar government for incomplete information on shelter homes in the state, stating, "Enough is enough." Further, it pulled up CBI for violating a court order by transferring the officer probing the case.

headlines: Namaste keeps diseases away, say science meet speakers; criticised
text: Indian scientists have criticised claims like "namaste can keep diseases away" and "sindoor helps in balancing blood pressure", made during a science meet at Bhopal's Regional Institute of Education (RIE). Few speakers claimed that going around a Tulsi plant has a "cooling effect". Scientists said the discussed papers had no scientific basis and should not be allowed in future conferences.

headlines: SC summons Nageswara Rao over officer's transfer in shelter cases
text: Calling it contempt of court, the Supreme Court has summoned senior CBI officer M Nageswara Rao over transfer of officer AK Sharma, who was probing the Bihar shelter home cases. The bench said the transfer amounted to violation of its order. Rao, who took the decision when he was interim CBI director, has to appear in court on February 12.

headlines: Delhi HC asks 2G respondents to plant 15,000 trees as punishment
text: Delhi HC ordered two persons and three firms to plant 3,000 trees each as punishment for seeking more time to file a reply on Enforcement Directorate's appeal against their acquittal in the 2G case. The trees are to be planted in South Delhi's ridge area. They've been asked to appear before the forest officer on February 15 for planting trees.

headlines: 19-year-old Bihar girl raped by 6 youths in front of father
text: A 19-year-old girl was gangraped in front of her father by six youths in a village in Bihar's Kishanganj, police said. The girl filed the complaint and said that the accused entered her home forcibly on Tuesday night and took her and her father to a deserted place. After tying her father to a tree, they raped her, she added.

headlines: B'desh seals Myanmar border amid influx of Hindu, Buddhist refugees
text: Bangladesh has sealed off the border with Myanmar amid the fresh influx of refugees fleeing reported violence in the Rakhine State. Ethnic and religious groups, including Buddhists and Hindus, have been trying to cross into Bangladesh, Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen said. Over 7 lakh Rohingya Muslims fled to Bangladesh following the military crackdown in Myanmar in August 2017.

headlines: Pankaj to play cricket team manager in Ranveer starrer '83
text: Pankaj Tripathi has joined the cast of the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer '83 and will play PR Man Singh, the manager of the Indian cricket team during the 1983 Cricket World Cup. "Its an inspiring story...I leapt at the opportunity to be part of the film," Pankaj said. The film is based on India's first Cricket World Cup victory.

headlines: Farah Khan to direct Rohit Shetty's next action comedy film
text: Director and choreographer Farah Khan has been roped in to direct an action comedy film which will be produced by filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Speaking about the upcoming project, Farah said, "Together with Rohit...I can only promise a mother of all entertainers! Farah has previously directed films like 'Om Shanti Om' and 'Main Hoon Na', among others.

headlines: Facebook to show who uploaded user contact info for targeted ads
text: Facebook in a post to the 'Facebook Advertiser Hub Page' said it will reveal more details including who uploaded user contact information for targeted advertisements starting February 28. The "Why am I seeing this ad?" option will detail when the contact information was uploaded. It will also show whether it was uploaded by the brand or their developer partners.

headlines: BJP thinks they're above nation, will learn in 3 months: Rahul
text: Addressing the national convention of the AICC minority department on Thursday, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "They (BJP) think they are above the nation. In 3 months, they will understand that the nation is above them." He added, "The institutions in India do not belong to any party, they belong to the country and to protect them is our responsibility."

headlines: Small startups to be FDI rules' biggest losers: Binny Bansal
text: Talking about the effects of newly imposed FDI policy on e-commerce, Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal said "fledging startups" will be the biggest losers. Adding, large companies had enough capital to navigate it, he said startups' funding rounds are being put on hold as there isn't any clarity. "[G]overnment should create policy and stick to it...else it creates havoc," he added.

headlines: SpaceX crew rocket's test flight postponed for 3rd time
text: Elon Musk-led SpaceX's first test flight of its Crew Dragon rocket, designed to launch humans to space, has been postponed for the third time. NASA said March 2 is now being targeted for its uncrewed test flight. This will be the first time a commercially built and operated US spacecraft will dock to the space station, NASA added.

headlines: Over 1,700 litres of illicit liquor seized in Bihar, 24 held
text: The Bihar Police have arrested 24 people and seized over 1,700 litres of illicit liquor in Gaya. The 24 people, who are accused of producing and selling illicit liquor, include 23 men and one woman. The police said, "10 people are from Dhansir village, 7 from Sohan Bigha, 4 from Gulzar Bigha, 2 from Khurar and one person from Pathraura."

headlines: Home, car loans to be cheaper as RBI cuts repo rate by 0.25%
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Thursday cut the repo rate by 25 basis points in its bi-monthly monetary policy review, making home and automobile loans cheaper. The cut in repo rate, which is the rate at which RBI lends money to banks, would translate into lower borrowing rate for lenders. The repo rate now stands at 6.25%.

headlines: RBI projects 7.4% GDP growth for 2019-20
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Thursday projected a GDP growth rate of 7.4% for FY20. This is higher than the 7.2% growth estimated for the current fiscal by the Central Statistics Office (CSO). The growth is likely to be influenced by growth in bank credit and overall financial flows to the commercial sectors, the central bank added.

headlines: Asian Paints presents Ultima Protek paint in ad starring Ranbir
text: Apex Ultima Protek infused with Lamination Guard gives your home the protection of lamination with 10-year performance warranty. It defends the walls against the vagaries of weather and excessive dust that comes from rapid urbanisation. Their advertisement portrays Ranbir Kapoor as an aspiring politician whose home goes through ups and downs of his political career with him and shields him.

headlines: Vidarbha beat Saurashtra to win their second Ranji title in a row
text: Vidarbha won their second Ranji Trophy title in a row after beating Saurashtra by 78 runs in the final at Nagpur on Thursday. Vidarbha were helped by 29-year-old spinner Aditya Sarwate, who picked up his maiden first-class 10-wicket haul in the match. Vidarbha's 40-year-old batsman Wasim Jaffer, who was appearing in his 10th Ranji final, won his 10th Ranji title.

headlines: RBI cuts repo rate by 25 bps to 6.25%, 1st cut since Aug 2017
text: The Reserve Bank of India, for the first time since August 2017, has cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6.25% during its bi-monthly monetary policy review. Meanwhile, the reverse repo rate stands adjusted at 6%. This is the first policy review under the newly appointed RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, who took over after Urjit Patel's exit.

headlines: Javagal Srinath bowled wide to help Anil Kumble get 10-wicket haul
text: Ex-India fast bowler Javagal Srinath deliberately bowled wide off the stumps to avoid taking a wicket when the Pakistan team had lost 9 wickets to former leg-spinner Anil Kumble in the Delhi Test on February 7, 1999. Kumble, who ended with figures of 26.3-9-74-10, became only the second bowler in Test cricket history to take 10 wickets in an innings.

headlines: Son asked 'Can't you do anything else as actor?': Ali on female roles
text: Actor-comedian Ali Asgar, while speaking about playing female characters, revealed that his son once asked him, "Dad, can't you do anything else as an actor?" "It was an alarming thing for me. I realised I am stuck within my own success," he added. Ali further revealed his son told him his school friends teased him with his character's name.

headlines: Not hiding or announcing: Shibani on rumours of dating Farhan
text: Speaking about the rumours of her dating actor Farhan Akhtar, singer Shibani Dandekar said, "I don't think we're going out about to hide anything or announce anything." "We're putting out what we put out [on social media]. People are going to take it however they want to," she added. Shibani further said she expects people to understand from the pictures.

headlines: Wanted island wedding but Nick wished to marry in India: Priyanka
text: Priyanka Chopra has revealed she always wanted to get married in a private island "away from everything". "We were like really stressed out about it cause we thought Seychelles, Maldives, Mauritius and nothing was working out," she added. "Nick just said, 'Why aren't we doing this in India? Shouldn't I be taking my bride from her home?'," Priyanka further revealed.

headlines: You are born for better stuff: Shastri told Pandya over controversy
text: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has revealed that he told Hardik Pandya to brush off the controversy that erupted following his comments on women on 'Koffee with Karan'. "I have told him, 'You are born for better stuff'," Shastri said. "Who doesn't make mistakes? He has not made a mistake where you can book him for anything," he added.

headlines: Nobody is good enough to criticise MS Dhoni: Ravi Shastri
text: Talking about ex-India captain MS Dhoni being criticised by ex-players for his batting, Team India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Nobody is good enough to criticise MS Dhoni." "If you talk about him, do you even know anything about cricket?" he added. "Dhoni is like Sachin, Kapil and Gavaskar. These guys come once in 30-40 years," he further said.

headlines: Journos wear helmets to meet BJP leaders after attack on reporter
text: Journalists wore helmets as they went to interview BJP leaders in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Wednesday, after reporter Suman Pandey was allegedly attacked by BJP workers last week. They reportedly wore helmets as a symbolic message to the government. Pandey had claimed that BJP workers thrashed him after he refused to delete the video of a scuffle among some party functionaries.

headlines: BJP questions Cong on 'UPA planted fake story of Army coup' report
text: After a report claimed UPA government leaked, to the media, an inaccurate story about a coup allegedly being plotted by the army in 2012, BJP asked Congress the identity of the minister who leaked the story. The Sunday Guardian reported the UPA government's leadership had informally asked Intelligence Bureau to ascertain if General VK Singh-led army was attempting a coup.

headlines: Chennai filmmaker kills wife, caught by identification of tattoos
text: A 51-year-old filmmaker named Balakrishnan has been arrested for allegedly murdering his wife before chopping her body and dumping the parts in garbage bins across Chennai. The woman was identified by her tattoos, which led the police to Balakrishnan. He claimed he committed the crime as he suspected her fidelity, while the police said the couple had filed for divorce.

headlines: Tamil man murdered after opposing conversion of Dalits
text: A 42-year-old Pattali Makkal Katchi functionary named Ramalingam was allegedly murdered by unidentified men on Tuesday night in Thirubuvanam, Tamil Nadu. Earlier in the day, Ramalingam had an argument with several people, who he claimed were trying to convert some Dalits in the area to Islam. Meanwhile, 250 policemen have been posted in the area over fears of communal unrest.

headlines: 10 Naxals killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
text: At least 10 Naxals were killed on Thursday in an encounter with the Special Task Force (STF) and the District Reserve Guard (DRG) in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur. Bijapur SP Mohit Garg said 11 weapons were recovered from the Naxals' custody. The encounter took place when a joint team of the STF and DRG was out on an anti-Naxal operation, he added.

headlines: School calls in exorcists after principal feels girls are possessed
text: A government school in Nainital allegedly called in exorcists and carried out ancestor worship after the principal felt some school girls were "possessed". The principal said a Class 7 girl started breaking chairs and shouting loudly and her "influence" spread to other girls. He then sought help from village head, adding that 14 girls were possessed by Tuesday.

headlines: Trumps guest Joshua Trump sleeps during his speech, pics go viral
text: Pictures of 11-year-old guest Joshua Trump sleeping during US President Donald Trump's State of the Union speech have gone viral. Joshua, who was invited by the President and First Lady Melania Trump, was seen napping while Trump renewed his promise to build the US-Mexico border. The boy was invited after he was bullied at school because of his surname.

headlines: Stay out of politics: Pakistan Supreme Court tells military
text: Pakistan's Supreme Court has told the military to not meddle in politics, criticising its media wing for commenting on political matters. The top court also ordered Pakistan's intelligence agencies including the ISI, to operate within their mandate. The court's order came while delivering a verdict on the Tehreek-e-Labaik Pakistan's 2017 Faizabad sit-in, after it accused a minister of blasphemy.

headlines: Akash Ambani to marry Shloka Mehta on March 9 in Mumbai: Reports
text: Three months after twin sister Isha Ambani's marriage to Anand Piramal, Mukesh Ambani's son Akash Ambani will marry Shloka Mehta reportedly on March 9 at Mumbai's Jio World Centre. The wedding will be followed by 'Mangal Parv' celebrations on March 10 and reception on March 11. The couple got engaged in June 2018 after Akash proposed to Shloka in Goa.

headlines: Cong hoarding calls Rahul Ram bhakt, Kamal Nath gau bhakt
text: A Congress hoarding portraying party chief Rahul Gandhi as a 'Ram bhakt' and Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath as a 'Hanuman bhakt' and 'gau (cow) bhakt' has come up in Bhopal. The hoarding also states that a Ram Mandir will be constructed in Ayodhya with everyone's consent. Earlier, posters portraying Rahul as Lord Ram had come up in Patna.

headlines: 2 BJP MLAs wear 'NaMo Again' sweatshirts in Himachal Assembly
text: BJP MLAs Vinod Kumar and Surender Shourie wore 'NaMo Again' sweatshirts to the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly during the budget session on Wednesday. After Congress raised an objection, the Speaker asked the MLAs to respect the sanctity of the House and refrain from wearing such clothes to the Assembly again. Meanwhile, Shourie said, "We are proud to wear this sweatshirt."

headlines: Muslim teacher thrashed for not singing Vande Mataram on R-Day
text: A Muslim teacher was thrashed by locals after refusing to sing Vande Mataram following a flag-hoisting ceremony on Republic Day on January 26 in Bihar. He said, "Vande Mataram is against our belief. Nowhere in the Constitution is it written that saying Vande Mataram is necessary." Meanwhile, Bihar Education Minister KN Prasad Verma said, National song's insult is not forgivable."

headlines: Ex-Brazil Prez Lula gets 13-year jail in new corruption case
text: Former Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has been given nearly 13 years in prison in a new corruption conviction. He was found guilty of accepting bribes in the form of a renovation of a farmhouse. He was sentenced to over 12 years in prison last year for accepting an apartment in return for contracts awarded to a firm.

headlines: Great Learning helps learners upskill with its ML & AI programs
text: Professionals can now build a solid foundation in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning by learning from top-ranked academic faculty and industry practitioners working in leading organisations like Flipkart, HSBC, IBM and more. As a part of Great Learning's PGP-AIML, learners work on 12+ hands-on projects to build their Github repository and e-portfolio. The program is rated 4.7/5 by past learners.

headlines: Never take chance with allergies: Sonu Nigam shares swollen eye pic
text: Singer Sonu Nigam on Wednesday revealed he suffered allergy after having seafood and developed a swollen eye, following which he was admitted to the ICU. Sharing his pictures, Sonu Nigam said, "Never ever ever ever take a chance with allergies." "If Nanavati Hospital wasn't nearby, my trachea would have swollen up further and lead to asphyxiation," the singer added.

headlines: Bar out with daggers to kill judiciary: SC on Prashant Bhushan case
text: While issuing notice to senior advocate Prashant Bhushan on a contempt petition filed against him by Attorney General KK Venugopal, the Supreme Court said, "Freedom (to speak) comes with a responsibility. It is the duty of the bar to protect judiciary." "But, now it seems the bar is out with daggers to kill the judiciary," the bench added.

headlines: Jayasuriya had steel in his bat, jokes Ashwin with #90sKidsRumours
text: Spinner Ravichandran Ashwin used the #90sKidsRumours on Twitter and joked that ex-Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya had steel in his bat and his bat was going to be tested. Ashwin was responding to a #90sKidsRumours post which read, "Ponting played with spring bat in...2003 WC finals & hence was able to hit such big sixes. There's going to be...rematch soon."

headlines: China bank programmer exploits ATM bug, withdraws $1 million
text: A 43-year-old programmer at a Chinese bank has been jailed for 10.5 years for allegedly exploiting an ATM bug to withdraw over $1-million cash over a year. Qin Qisheng discovered a loophole in 2016 which enabled unrecorded transactions around midnight. The bank revealed it was aware Qin was testing the loophole, however, the money was transferred to his personal account.

headlines: Dad gave option to run McD outlet or join college: Randi Zuckerberg
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's elder sister Randi Zuckerberg, while talking about their childhood, revealed their father offered them an option to open a McDonald's franchise store instead of going to college. All the four Zuckerberg siblings, Mark, Randi, Donna and Arielle declined their father's offer. Randi added her parents had "mixed feelings" about Mark dropping out of Harvard for Facebook.

headlines: Robert Vadra quizzed for 5 hours by Enforcement Directorate
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi's brother-in-law Robert Vadra on Wednesday was questioned for over five hours by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in its money laundering probe into alleged possession of illegal foreign assets. Vadra, however, has denied allegations of possessing illegal foreign assets. Vadra has alleged that he was being "hounded and harassed" to subserve political ends.

headlines: 2018 was the 4th warmest year on record, confirms NASA
text: Earth's global surface temperatures in 2018 were the fourth warmest since 1880, according to independent analyses by NASA and the US weather agency NOAA. Global temperatures in 2018 were 0.83 ºC warmer than the 1951-1980 mean, ranking behind those of 2016, 2017 and 2015, as per NASA. The past five years are, collectively, the warmest years on record, NASA added.

headlines: Water leaks on space station toilet, crew collects it using towels
text: Astronauts experienced a water leak while installing a 'double stall enclosure' on the $19-million toilet of Tranquility module, US segment of the International Space Station, NASA has revealed. The crew collected the 9.5 litres of leaked water floating in space station using towels, NASA said. The double stall enclosure was being installed to provide privacy, the US space agency added.

headlines: Rape survivor's family told to vacate home given by previous govt
text: The Indore Development Authority (IDA) on Wednesday asked the family of an eight-year-old gangrape survivor to vacate their home provided by the previous government as no official order was issued. The IDA said the family had rented out the house and were living elsewhere. Meanwhile, a Madhya Pradesh minister said the family would not be asked to vacate the house.

headlines: Mahindra babysits grandson, posts cartoon on working women 'reality'
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra, who was helping to babysit his one-year-old grandson for a week, shared a cartoon showing 'stark reality' of working women. "I salute every working woman and acknowledge that their successes required a much greater amount of effort than their male counterparts," Mahindra said. "Hope this encourages other men to babysit too," a person commented.

headlines: Myanmar must show commitment to end anti-Rohingya violence: Jolie
text: While visiting a camp in Bangladesh for Rohingya Muslim refugees, actress and special envoy for the UN refugee agency Angelina Jolie said that Myanmar must "show commitment" to end violence against Rohingya Muslims. "It was deeply upsetting to meet...families who've only known persecution and statelessness," Jolie said. She added that the crisis was a result of decades of discrimination.

headlines: Was embarrassed: Bradley Cooper on Best Director Oscar snub
text: Hollywood actor Bradley Cooper revealed that he felt embarrassed when he wasn't nominated for an Oscar award in the Best Director category for his film 'A Star Is Born'. "I was embarrassed because I felt I hadnt done my job," Bradley explained. The film has been nominated for eight Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Adapted Screenplay.

headlines: WhatsApp to ban political parties if misused ahead of LS polls
text: WhatsApp's Communications head Carl Woog warned Indian political parties against the messaging platform's misuse ahead of the 2019 general elections adding that misuse would "result in bans of our service". He said WhatsApp had engaged with parties to explain it wasn't a "broadcast platform". WhatsApp said it had seen attempts at misuse but didn't disclose the nature of alleged misuse.

headlines: SoftBank Group reports 50% rise in profit for nine months
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank Group on Wednesday said its net profit for the nine months to December rose 52% to over $14 billion. This was largely driven by gains of $7.3 billion from its investment funds, led by SoftBank Vision Fund whose partners include Saudi Arabia. The company's net income stood at $14 billion, a 31% rise from the year-ago period.

headlines: 3D printed rubber that repairs after being cut in half made
text: University of Southern California researchers have 3D printed self-healing rubber materials in form of items including a 'shoe pad'. The team created the material via photopolymerisation process, that uses light to form rigid materials, and increased oxidants to lend it self-healing properties. On being cut in half and heated at 60°C, the material healed completely in two hours, researchers said.

headlines: US supports dictators, butchers & extremists in Middle East: Iran
text: The US' "hostility has led it to support dictators, butchers and extremists" in the Middle East, who have only brought "ruin" to the region, Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif said on Wednesday. Zarif's statement came in response to US President Donald Trump's State of the Union speech where he called Iran "the world's leading state sponsor of terror".

headlines: Why did US women lawmakers wear white to State of the Union?
text: Democratic women lawmakers wore white to US President Donald Trump's State of the Union (SOTU) address on Tuesday to celebrate 100 years of women having the right to vote. It was also a tribute to honour the people who came out to vote in the recent midterm elections that gave the Democrats the majority in the House of Representatives.

headlines: Venezuela seizes shipment of US-made weapons amid ongoing tension
text: Venezuelan authorities on Wednesday seized a shipment of US-made weapons which was likely sent from Miami. The weapons were seized at the Arturo Michelena International Airport in Valencia. This comes after the US said it doesn't rule out military action in Venezuela to address the political crisis that occurred after opposition leader Juan Guaidó declared himself the country's interim President.

headlines: Adding Jonas to my name doesn't take away my identity: Priyanka
text: Speaking about taking her husband Nick Jonas' surname, Priyanka Chopra said, "[It doesn't] take away my identity. He gets added to who I am." "I always wanted to add his name to mine because I feel, like, you know, we're becoming family," she added. "I'm a little traditional and old school like that," Priyanka further said.

headlines: Fortunate my name not in #MeToo despite everything I did: Shatrughan
text: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha has said, "I call myself fortunate...tamam harkate karne kay bawajood, my name hasn't come out in the #MeToo movement". "Behind a successful man's fall is a woman," he added. When asked if he was making fun of #MeToo, Sinha told reporters to take his comments in "humour" and applauded women "who, better late than never, came forward".

headlines: Found Indians who assaulted NZ: Kerala Police troll NZ Police
text: After New Zealand Police jokingly issued a warning against a group of Indians for "badly assaulting" innocent New Zealanders following India's 2-0 ODI series lead, Kerala Police trolled them saying that they've found the group. Sharing a picture of Team India posing with the trophy, Kerala Police said it was a group of men in blue who like Kiwi juice.

headlines: Krunal Pandya accuses NZ batsman of obstructing the field
text: India all-rounder Krunal Pandya got angry and accused New Zealand wicketkeeper-batsman Tim Seifert of obstructing the field during the ninth over in the first T20I. The incident happened after Krunal attempted to take Kane Williamson's catch on his own bowling but non-striker Seifert came in his way. The on-field umpire told Krunal to calm down and continue with his spell.

headlines: India Women go from 102/1 to 136/10, lose 1st T20I vs NZ Women
text: New Zealand Women today defeated India Women by 23 runs in the first T20I at Wellington. Chasing a 160-run target, India were at 102/1 in 11.2 overs but lost the remaining wickets for 34 runs. The match witnessed Smriti Mandhana reach 50 off 24 balls to better her own record of scoring the fastest fifty for India in women's T20Is.

headlines: Team gets all out for 10 in 20-over match; extras top-score with 6
text: South Australia women's team got dismissed for 10 runs in 10.2 overs against New South Wales in a 20-over National Indigenous Cricket Championships match. Nine batters got out for a duck each and only four runs were scored with the bat, all of them by opener Febi Mansell. 'Extras' top-scored with 6, while NSW's R Van-Veen registered figures of 2-1-1-5.

headlines: In no hurry to return to commentary box: Shastri on plans after WC
text: On being asked if he'd continue coaching Team India or return to commentary box after his contract runs out after the 2019 World Cup, Ravi Shastri said he's in no hurry to return to commentary box. "I did it (broadcasting) for 23 years and can do it again for 50 more years, whenever I go back," he added.

headlines: I hated being only woman in the room: Randi Zuckerberg on leaving FB
text: Facebook Co-founder Mark Zuckerberg's elder sister Randi Zuckerberg, while talking about leaving Facebook, said, she "hated being the only woman in almost every room that I was in for 10 straight years." She said she was assigned to work in the then new live streaming department at Facebook. Randi quit Facebook in 2011 to open her own company Zuckerberg Media.

headlines: Manohar Parrikar returns to Goa after treatment in Delhi
text: Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar on Wednesday returned to the state after undergoing a follow-up treatment at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi. Parrikar returned after completing a "scheduled medical review/check-up", his office said in a statement. The Goa CM is suffering from a pancreatic ailment.

headlines: Donald Trump admired PM Modi's governance: Yogi Adityanath
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said before Donald Trump became US President, he had admired PM Narendra Modi for his governance. Addressing a West Bengal rally, Yogi criticised Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee saying she was saving a corrupt officer in Saradha chit fund scam. He added there cannot be a more shameful act than that in a democracy.

headlines: President confers Sangeet Natak Akademi Awards to 42 artistes
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday conferred the Sangeet Natak Akademi Awards 2017 to 42 artistes from fields including Music, Dance, Theatre, Traditional, Folk and Tribal music. A total of 11 artistes were awarded from the field of Music and nine artistes from the Dance category. Ten artistes were awarded in the category of Traditional, Folk and Tribal Music.

headlines: Haven't eaten in 5 days: 4 Punjab youths stuck in Armenia seek help
text: Four people stuck in Armenia have uploaded a video on social media, requesting AAP MP Bhagwant Mann to bring them back to Punjab. They said that they haven't had food in five days and their landlord has asked them to leave the place. They also alleged that their travel agents fraudulently sent them to work in Armenia on tourist visa.

headlines: US man dies days before 25th b'day as e-cigarette explodes in face
text: A 24-year-old Texas man named William Brown died on January 29, days before his 25th birthday, after an e-cigarette exploded in his face and tore his carotid artery. Shrapnel from the exploding pen penetrated his artery in his neck, cutting off blood to his brain. Brown was vaping for the first time with his newly-purchased e-cigarette when the explosion happened.

headlines: Hawaii considering bill to raise legal smoking age to 100 years
text: Hawaii is considering a bill that could raise the legal smoking age to 100 years, effectively banning cigarettes for the majority of people. It suggests the smoking age should go up to 30 in 2020, 40 in 2021, 50 in 2022, and 60 in 2023, until finally in 2024, people would need to be 100 years old to buy cigarettes.

headlines: Don't want complacency to curtail growth: AR Rahman
text: Singer-composer AR Rahman has said while the Indian music industry is happy with the success he has achieved, he doesn't want complacency to curtail his growth. "Complacency...stops you to push the boundary to explore more to enter the international market," he added. He further said more milestones like 'Jai Ho' were needed to make a mark on the world map.

headlines: Ranveer to screen 'Gully Boy' for Deepika, parents: Reports
text: Ranveer Singh will host a screening of his upcoming film 'Gully Boy' for his wife Deepika Padukone, his parents and his in-laws ahead of the film's release, as per reports. The screening of the film will take place next week, reports further suggested. The film, which also features Alia Bhatt and Kalki Koechlin, is scheduled to release on February 14.

headlines: Ariana to skip Grammys following row with producers: Reports
text: Singer Ariana Grande pulled out of performing at the upcoming Grammy Awards and may not attend the ceremony due to disagreements with the show's producers, as per reports. The singer cancelled her performance after the producers insisted on choosing the songs she would perform at the show. The producers initially said Ariana couldn't perform her song '7 Rings', reports suggested.

headlines: Don't think I'll be able to remake my films: Sooraj Barjatya
text: Director Sooraj Barjatya has said that he doesn't think he'll be able to remake any of his films, adding, "That's...part of my life that I've already lived." "If someone is inspired and can give...his or her perspective to (my films), then (it's okay)," he added. Sooraj made his directorial debut with Salman Khan starrer 'Maine Pyar Kiya' 30 years ago.

headlines: Apple disabled old iPhone chargers with iOS update: Lawsuit
text: A California resident has filed a class-action lawsuit against Apple alleging the iPhone maker deliberately disabled old iPhone chargers with an iOS update in 2016. The complainant's iPhone allegedly displayed 'this accessory may not be supported' after a software update in 2017. Apple forced users to either buy new chargers amounting to $5 million or new iPhones, the lawsuit claimed.

headlines: Committed to Indian market: Walmart on Morgan Stanley report
text: Walmart's Regional CEO, Asia and Canada, Dirk Van den Berghe said Walmart's and Flipkart's commitment to India is deep and long-term. This follows a Morgan Stanley report which speculated Walmart may leave Flipkart due to the implementation of the newly revised FDI policy on e-commerce. "We will continue to focus on serving customers...and bringing sustainable benefits to [India]", he added.

headlines: Logistics startup Rivigo raises $35mn at $948mn valuation
text: Gurugram-based surface logistics startup Rivigo has raised around $35.6 million at an estimated valuation of nearly $948 million. The funding came from existing investors, led by US private equity firm Warburg Pincus along with participation from venture capital firm SAIF Partners. The startup had last raised $50 million at a valuation of around $945 million in January 2018.

headlines: Amazon, Flipkart losses to rise on new FDI rules: Morgan Stanley
text: According to a report by Morgan Stanley, e-tailers Amazon and Flipkart may record higher losses due to the newly imposed revised FDI policy on e-commerce. The report expects Flipkart's losses to increase by 20-25%. Further, it expects that the new FDI policy "is likely to lead to increased Amazon India investment and larger losses from restructuring its business operations".

headlines: India becomes world's 2nd largest LPG importer after China
text: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said India has become the world's second-largest importer of LPG after China. Imports of LPG grew 12.5% over the past five years to 12 million metric tons in 2018-19, he added. Under Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY) of providing LPG connections to the poor, over 6.31 crore connections have been provided.

headlines: Woman arrested for starting fire in Paris building that killed 10
text: French authorities have arrested a 40-year-old woman over suspicions of starting a fire in an eight-storey building in Paris, killing at least 10 people and injuring over 30 others. The woman, who is known to have had mental health issues, allegedly started the fire following an argument with her neighbour who is a professional fireman.

headlines: Indian, foreign investors need level-playing field: Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy has said there must be a level-playing field between Indian and foreign investors. Speaking at a technology and entrepreneurship conference, he added, "Today... it's in favour of foreign investors and is somewhat unhealthy for the country." Government policies have not encouraged Indian entrepreneurs to get more domestic capital, he further said.

headlines: 5,000 flights cancelled, rescheduled at Mumbai airport till March end
text: Nearly 5,000 flights in and out of Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport from 11am-5pm have been cancelled or rescheduled on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays between February 7 and March 30, 2019. Further, morning flights that are delayed and can't take off or land before 11am may be grounded or diverted. This is to allow repairs of the two runways.

headlines: Inzamam once got out obstructing field as 'he didn't know rules'
text: Inzamam-ul-Haq got out obstructing the field during an ODI against India on February 6, 2006, and later claimed that he did not know the exact rule. Haq was given out after India appealed following him blocking a Suresh Raina throw at the striker's end. Haq became the second Pakistani batsman to get out obstructing the field in an ODI.

headlines: Footballers who survived air crash played after 13 days
text: Manchester United players Bill Foulkes and Harry Gregg, who survived the Munich air disaster on February 6, 1958, played a match 13 days after the crash, which they won 3-0. Foulkes captained the team, comprising new signings and reserve players as eight senior players had died in the crash. Nearly 60,000 spectators attended the match at United's home Old Trafford.

headlines: Only 1 batsman has higher average for Australia than Bradman
text: All-rounder Albert Trott, who was born on February 6, 1873, had a Test batting average of 102.50 for Australia, which is more than cricket legend Don Bradman's 99.94. Trott's average remains the highest Test batting average for Australia. He played three Tests for Australia and later went on to play two matches for England.

headlines: Saw many weddings in 2018, can chill: Alia on plans to marry Ranbir
text: Actress Alia Bhatt, on being asked about her wedding plans with boyfriend Ranbir Kapoor, said, "We have had two beautiful weddings last year." "I think we can chill now, watch movies, work in movies, and rest can be seen later," she added. Earlier, reports said Alia will tie the knot with Ranbir this year.

headlines: Karthik tosses ball inside fence, dives back in to take catch
text: Dinesh Karthik pulled off a boundary line catch during the first New Zealand-India T20I match at Wellington on Wednesday. Karthik first caught the ball with both his hands and threw it up before losing balance and going outside the fence. The 33-year-old ran back inside and dived to complete the catch to dismiss debutant Daryl Mitchell for 8(6).

headlines: How about ironing uniform: Rohit to Chahal over motivational post
text: Team India stand-in captain Rohit Sharma trolled leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal after the latter shared a picture of himself and Kuldeep Yadav with a motivational caption reading, "Think big, believe big, act big, and the results will be big!" "How about ironing your uniform," Rohit commented on Chahal's Instagram post. "My big brother trying to troll me...nice try bhaiya," Chahal responded.

headlines: Jyotiraditya Scindia takes charge as AICC General Secretary
text: Senior Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Wednesday took charge as the All India Congress Committee (AICC) General Secretary in-charge for Uttar Pradesh West. Scindia said that he resolves to strengthen the Congress party in the state. Soon after assuming the new charge at the Congress headquarters, Scindia performed a 'Ganesh pooja'.

headlines: I stand by my husband: Priyanka drops Robert Vadra at ED office
text: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Wednesday accompanied husband Robert Vadra to the Enforcement Directorate office where he had been summoned over his alleged money laundering case. "I stand with my husband. We will fight this (political) witch hunt," Gandhi told reporters. Priyanka then went on to take charge as General Secretary for Uttar Pradesh (East) at Congress headquarters in New Delhi.

headlines: BJP won't stop till Mamata's misrule ends: Shivraj Chouhan
text: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday said that the BJP would not stop till Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress' misrule ends in West Bengal. He added, "The more you (Mamata) try and stop us, more often shall we come to Bengal." The BJP leader further mocked the 'Mahagathbandhan' (grand alliance), calling it "Bina dhulhe ki barat".

headlines: Working pen drive found in Antarctic seal's year-old frozen poop
text: A functioning USB stick "full of photos" was found in faeces of a leopard seal, after which New Zealand has launched a hunt for its owner. "It's very worrying that these amazing Antarctic animals have plastic like this inside them," said researcher Jodie Warren. Warren made the discovery on analysing the faeces, frozen in the lab for over a year.

headlines: Nepal makes work permit mandatory for Indians
text: The Nepalese government has made it mandatory for Indian citizens who come to work in Nepali industries to take necessary work permit. Nepal had earlier directed all its labour offices to finalise the actual number of Indian workers working in different sectors across the country.

headlines: 500 Indian fishermen believed to be in Pakistan's custody: Govt
text: More than 500 Indian fishermen and over 1,050 fishing boats are believed to be in Pakistan's custody, Minister of State for External Affairs, VK Singh, said. The government has secured the release and repatriation of 1,749 Indian prisoners, including 1,725 fishermen from Pakistan's custody since 2014, he added. A total of 4,705 Indian nationals are in prisons in Gulf countries.

headlines: There are 20 judges per 10 lakh people in India: Government
text: The Law Ministry on Wednesday said there are 20 judges per 10 lakh people in the country as compared to 17 in 2014. The sanctioned strength of judges of high courts has increased from 906 judges in 2014 to 1,079 judges in 2018, it added. It said the working strength of Supreme Court judges is 28 against the sanctioned 31.

headlines: Cognizant appoints Vodafone executive Brian Humphries as CEO
text: Cognizant on Wednesday said it has appointed Vodafone Business' head Brian Humphries as the company's new Chief Executive Officer (CEO). This is the first time the US-based IT services company has selected an outsider to be at the helm of the company. Humphries will replace Francisco D'Souza, who co-founded Cognizant and has served as its CEO since 2007.

headlines: I'm not racist: Liam Neeson on 'wanted to kill black man' remark
text: Responding to the criticism he faced for admitting that he once set out to kill a black person, actor Liam Neeson denied being racist. Liam earlier said that 40-years-ago he walked the streets with a weapon to seek revenge for his friend who was raped by a black man. Liam said he wanted his comments to initiate conversations about racism.

headlines: May allow users to edit tweets in 30 secs: CEO Jack Dorsey
text: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey has said the micro-blogging platform is considering to allow users to edit tweets by introducing a 5-30 second delay in sending the tweet. "Going longer than that...takes real-time nature of the conversational flow out," Dorsey added. "When you send a text, you can't take it back," said Dorsey, noting Twitter was built on the SMS format.

headlines: Reddit to raise up to $300mn at about $3bn valuation: Report
text: Online discussions platform Reddit may raise $150-300 million at an estimated post-money valuation of nearly $3 billion as part of a Series D funding round, according to a report. The funding round will reportedly be led by Chinese conglomerate Tencent. Earlier in 2017, Reddit had raised $200 million at a valuation of nearly $1.8 billion.

headlines: Hindu temple, sari, auto among 230 emoji to debut in 2019
text: The Unicode Consortium has approved 230 emoji including Hindu temple, diya, sari and autorickshaw to debut later this year. These emoji will include 59 new emoji along with 171 variants for gender and skin tone. The list also includes emoji depicting people with disabilities like 'woman and man in motorised wheelchair', service dogs and a yawning face.

headlines: Will continue 30% cut on Play Store app sales: Google CEO
text: In an earnings call with investors, Google CEO Sundar Pichai said the technology giant will continue to take a 30% cut from developers for Play Store app sales. Pichai explained, "Thousands of developers rely on [Play Store] to safely and seamlessly distribute their game to billions of Android users worldwide". "I think theres a value exchange there," he added.

headlines: Burberry ex-CEO quits as Apple retail head, 3rd in 7 years
text: Apple has announced that 30-year company veteran Deirdre OBrien will replace former Burberry CEO Angela Ahrendts in April to become the third Senior VP for Retail in seven years. The first to head the division, Ron Johnson, had quit in 2011, following which Ahrendts joined in 2014. OBrien will also continue with her existing role of Senior VP for People.

headlines: Milky Way is twisted, not flat: Astronomers make new 3D map
text: Macquarie University and Chinese Academy of Sciences astronomers claim to have built the first 'accurate' 3D map of the Milky Way galaxy that shows it is "warped and twisted" and not flat. The team plotted the locations of 1,339 stars called classical Cepheids to create the outline. They found that the galaxy's outer gas disk has an S-like, warped shape.

headlines: Air India CMD Kharola appointed Civil Aviation Secretary
text: The government on Wednesday appointed Air India Chairman and Managing Director Pradeep Singh Kharola as the Civil Aviation Secretary. He will take over from Rajiv Nayan Choubey who had retired last month. Kharola, who is a 1985-batch Indian Administrative Service officer of Karnataka cadre, was named Chairman of the national carrier in November 2017.

headlines: Will build a human wall at Mexico border if necessary: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that his country will build a 'human wall' along the border with Mexico if necessary by deploying troops to the border. His remarks come after the US announced last week that 3,750 additional soldiers were being sent to the Mexico border, bringing the total number to over 4,300.

headlines: Russia to develop new missile systems after nuclear treaty exit
text: Russia has said it is planning to develop new missile systems by 2021 after both Russia and the US suspended their involvement in the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty which banned both countries from stationing short and intermediate-range, land-based missiles in Europe. After suspending the treaty last week, Russia has said it'll exit the deal in six months, following the US.

headlines: Why were Man Utd players killed in crash called Busby Babes?
text: 'Busby Babes' is the name given to Manchester United footballers who were part of club's youth team in the early 1950s and won the English first division under Matt Busby's management. The average age of the championship winning team in 1955-56 and 1956-57 was just 22. Eight of the players died in the Munich air crash on February 6, 1958.

headlines: Took Sridevi, Aamir, Salman for their 1st concert: Big B on old pic
text: Amitabh Bachchan took to social media to share an old picture from his concert at Wembley Stadium in the UK and pointed out that it was the 'first time' an Indian had performed there. He added, "I took Sridevi, Aamir and Salman for their first concert...70,000 people...historic!!" "This is the Wembley Stadium before it was rebuilt and altered," he wrote.

headlines: Never felt objectified, did them willingly: Malaika on item songs
text: Speaking about doing item songs, Malaika Arora said she has never felt objectified in any of the songs and added, "I have done all the songs willingly." "But if anybody does feel objectified with the songs then it's important for them to come forward and speak," she added. Malaika further said one shouldn't tag these songs as 'item songs'.

headlines: People need to know: Priyanka as fans ask who took her pic with Nick
text: After fans trolled a picture shared by Priyanka Chopra showing her sleeping next to husband Nick Jonas, the actress responded by commenting on the picture. Fans had asked who had taken the photograph. Revealing it was taken by her stylist, Priyanka wrote, "Lol. I guess people need to know. Thank you for capturing me sleeping through the super bowl @divya_jyoti."

headlines: No one smells leather in defence better than Pujara: Ravi Shastri
text: Praising Cheteshwar Pujara for his Man of the Series performance in the Test series against Australia, Team India head coach Ravi Shastri said that no one smells the leather (ball) in defence better than the 31-year-old. "You can ask him if it is Christian Dior or Armani," he jokingly added. He further called Pujara a "quintessential professional".

headlines: Even my kids said it was cringey: YouTube CEO on YouTube Rewind video
text: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki has revealed even her kids told her that the YouTube Rewind 2018 video was "cringey". The video, which was widely criticised by people, became the most disliked video in YouTube history, getting more dislikes than Justin Bieber's 'Baby'. "[One] record we definitely didn't set out to break was the most disliked video," Susan said.

headlines: Flipkart CEO dismisses Morgan Stanley report on Walmart exit
text: Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy in a letter to employees dismissed Morgan Stanley report which said Walmart may likely exit Flipkart due to India's new FDI rules for e-commerce. "The report couldn't be further than the truth," said Krishnamurthy. "Walmart remains extremely confident about the potential of the Indian market and in Flipkart's ability to lead the e-commerce space," he added.

headlines: Implantable device powered by heartbeats invented in US
text: US-based engineers at Dartmouth College have invented a coin-sized device that turns the kinetic energy of the heart into electricity. The invention works by adding a thin piece of polymer piezoelectric film to devices such as pacemakers and could help patients avoid battery replacement surgery, performed every 5-10 years. The team has completed its first round of animal studies.

headlines: Woman who entered Sabarimala returns home, family moves out
text: The husband of Kanakadurga, the woman who entered the Sabarimala temple, has reportedly left their home along with their two children to stay at a rented accommodation. He reportedly made the move just before Kanakadurga reached her home following a court order. Earlier, she was allegedly assaulted and refused entry by her in-laws after her trek to Sabarimala.

headlines: Amrita Singh wins legal battle in Dehradun property row
text: A Dehradun court accepted the plea of actress Amrita Singh and her aunt Tahira to dismiss a property case filed by them against Tahira's brother Madhusudan, who died last month. Amrita and Tahira were embroiled in a property dispute with Madhusudan over a 1,70,000 sq ft property in Dehradun. Amrita reportedly earlier approached Dehradun police claiming rights over the property.

headlines: China apps with over 50L users to have office, exec in India
text: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has proposed a draft regulation to moderate Chinese apps with user-generated content like TikTok and Helo. The draft proposes apps with over fifty lakh Indian users to set up local office and appoint a senior executive. The government doesn't want apps to be a vehicle of unlawful activities, a MeitY official said.

headlines: New Google Chrome extension to tell users if password hacked
text: Google has announced a new extension for its Chrome web browser to detect and inform users if their credentials have been leaked online. The 'Password Checkup' tool matches the username-and-password combination on a database with over 4 billion leaked credentials. "We built Password Checkup so that no one, including Google, can learn your account details," Google said in its blog.

headlines: NDMC removes posters of Rahul, Priyanka outside Congress HQ
text: The NDMC has removed the posters of Congress President Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and her husband Robert Vadra that were put up outside the Congress headquarters in Delhi. "Kattar soch nahi, yuva josh (Youthful energy, not extreme views)," their tagline had read. Meanwhile, referring to Rahul and Vadra, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said the posters were of "two criminals".

headlines: Sign affidavit that you won't join 'corrupt' parties: Tejashwi to PM
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has issued an open "challenge" to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP chief Amit Shah to sign an affidavit stating their party will never form an alliance with opposition parties and leaders in the future. Tejashwi issued the challenge stating, "PM Modi Ji & Co. says all parties and leaders in opposition alliance are corrupt."

headlines: Twitter reacts to US Speaker's clap during Trump's speech
text: Following US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's clap for President Donald Trump during his State of the Union speech, a Twitter user wrote, "Pelosi the Gawd with the most pettiest and sarcastic clap possible." While one user tweeted, "Is this what the kids mean when they keep talking about a clap back?", another wrote, "Iconic picture for the ages."

headlines: Jubilant FoodWorks parent withdraws royalty bid within hours
text: Jubilant Enpro, the parent of Domino's Pizza India's operator Jubilant FoodWorks (JFL), backtracked on charging a royalty from subsidiaries for using its brand name within hours after announcing the decision. This came after it sparked concerns about rewarding promoters at the expense of shareholders. Shares of Jubilant FoodWorks were down as much as 5.18% on Wednesday.

headlines: Rustomjee set to redefine luxury real estate in South Mumbai
text: Rustomjee has introduced a palatial gated estate in Prabhadevi with 3,4 and 5 bedroom luxury residences, spread over 5.75 acres. This gated estate is replete with 60+ lifestyle amenities, from tropical pools to idyllic spas. It features two 68 storey towers and one 65 storey tower with a floor to ceiling height of up to 11.9 ft.

headlines: New Zealand hand India their worst ever defeat in T20I cricket
text: New Zealand defeated India by 80 runs in the first T20I of the three-match series at Wellington today to hand them their worst defeat (by runs) in T20I history. India's previous worst T20I defeat had come on May 7, 2010, when Australia defeated them by 49 runs in a World T20 match. The second T20I will take place on Friday.

headlines: Facebook Messenger now lets users unsend messages within 10 mins
text: Facebook Messenger has globally rolled out "Remove for everyone" feature to delete messages within 10 minutes of sending. However, the recipient will see "[First name] removed a message" and can report it. Earlier, it was reported that some messages from CEO Mark Zuckerberg had been removed from recipients' inboxes after which Facebook announced it would release the feature for all.

headlines: Esha writes apology letter to footballer on friend's gorilla remark
text: Actress Esha Gupta has written an apology letter to Nigerian footballer Alexander Iwobi regarding a chat, wherein her friend had called him a 'gorilla'. "I am extremely sorry for my ignorant action...I cannot begin to imagine how much I have hurt your sentiments," she wrote. "I promise to be very responsible from here on," the letter further read.

headlines: Jennifer Lawrence gets engaged to boyfriend Cooke Maroney
text: Hollywood actress Jennifer Lawrence got engaged to her boyfriend, art director Cooke Maroney after over six months of dating, her representative has confirmed. The actress was reportedly spotted wearing a diamond ring on her ring finger during a dinner with Maroney on Monday. "They seemed like they were celebrating and people were talking about it," reports added.

headlines: SC sends notice to Prashant Bhushan over tweets on CBI interim head
text: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to senior advocate Prashant Bhushan on the contempt plea filed by Attorney General KK Venugopal over his comments against CBI interim chief M Nageshwar Rao. Venugopal said Bhushan "willfully and deliberately" made false statements on Twitter. Bhushan had alleged that the government misled the court and submitted fabricated minutes of the panel's meeting.

headlines: Hardik, Krunal Pandya 2nd brother duo to play for India in a T20I
text: All-rounders Hardik Pandya and Krunal Pandya have become the second pair of brothers to feature together for Team India in a T20I, achieving the feat against New Zealand in the first T20I on Wednesday. The first pair of brothers to feature together for Team India in T20Is was Irfan Pathan and Yusuf Pathan, who played eight T20Is together.

headlines: Sonia Dhawan's husband granted bail in Paytm extortion case
text: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to Paytm owner Vijay Shekhar Sharma's personal secretary Sonia Dhawan's husband, Rupak Jain, in the case related to alleged money extortion from Sharma. Jain's lawyer argued that there wasn't sufficient evidence against him, no money was transferred to his account and he wasn't employed with Paytm. Sonia's bail plea is still being heard.

headlines: Hindu Mahasabha leader arrested for firing at Gandhiji's effigy
text: The UP police have arrested Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha leader Pooja Pandey and her husband Ashok Pandey for allegedly firing at an effigy of Mahatma Gandhi on January 30, his death anniversary. Following the arrest, Pooja said, "No regrets. We have not committed any crime. We have used our constitutional right." Earlier, five others were arrested for burning Gandhiji's effigy.

headlines: Over 20 lakh Uttar Pradesh government employees go on strike
text: Over 20 lakh Uttar Pradesh government employees went on a strike on Wednesday to demand the restoration of the old pension scheme. The strike comes notwithstanding the invocation of the Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA) by the government on Monday for six months. The act has been invoked keeping in mind the upcoming general elections and state board examinations 2019.

headlines: Woman who entered Sabarimala temple gets court order to return home
text: Kanakadurga, the Kerala woman who entered the Sabarimala temple on January 2, has returned home after a Malappuram court allowed her to stay at her in-law's house. She was allegedly assaulted and refused entry by her in-laws after her trek to Sabarimala. "I could not see my children today, but I hope I can see them next time," she said.

headlines: Pope admits nuns kept as sex slaves by priests
text: Pope Francis for the first time admitted to sexual abuse of nuns by Catholic priests and bishops, including sexual slavery. He added that his predecessor, Pope Benedict XVI, shut down an entire congregation of nuns who were being abused by priests. His remarks came after a magazine claimed that in some cases nuns were forced to abort priests' children.

headlines: Nawazuddin is not part of Ranveer starrer '83: Spokesperson
text: Nawazuddin Siddiqui is not part of the cast for the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer '83, the actor's spokesperson confirmed. Earlier, reports suggested Nawazuddin had been roped in to play the coach in the film, which is based on India's win in the 1983 cricket World Cup. Ranveer Singh will play former Indian cricket team captain Kapil Dev in the film.

headlines: SC reserves judgment on challenge to Rao's appointment
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday reserved its verdict on the validity of M Nageswara Rao's appointment as interim director of the CBI. IPS officer Rishi Kumar Shukla recently took over as CBI director from Rao, who had stepped in when former chief Alok Verma was removed from the post. The petitioners have alleged a "lack of transparency" in Rao's appointment.

headlines: Hardik announces plans to contest upcoming Lok Sabha polls
text: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel has announced plans to contest the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. Amid reports of Congress offering him two seats, state party president Amit Chavda said there has been "no official dialogue" on the issue. Hardik, who is likely to contest from Amreli, was not of eligible age to contest the Lok Sabha elections held in 2014.

headlines: India successfully launches its 40th communication satellite
text: India successfully launched its 40th communication satellite, GSAT-31, on Wednesday onboard European launch services provider Arianespace's rocket from French Guiana. The satellite, weighing around 2,536 kg, is designed to last around 15 years and will provide continuity to operational services on some of the in-orbit satellites, ISRO said on its third mission for the year 2019.

headlines: India gets consular access to 117 of 129 students detained in US
text: India has obtained consular access to 117 of the 129 Indian students detained in the US in a 'pay-to-stay' visa scam, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. The students are being assisted in obtaining legal advice, the MEA added. The students are accused of enrolling at a fake university to maintain their student visa status to obtain work permits.

headlines: SIT set up to probe 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Kanpur
text: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday constituted a four-member Special Investigation Team to probe the 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Kanpur. The SIT, which will have a six-month tenure, will examine FIRs lodged during the riots and cases wherein the accused had got relief from the court. At least 125 people were killed in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Kanpur.

headlines: Not allowed to join cousin's baraat, 15-yr-old girl ends life
text: A 15-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide by setting herself ablaze in UP on Monday. The police said she was upset as her father hadn't allowed her to join her cousin's baraat (wedding procession). Notably, two months ago, she was harassed by a man who was later arrested, but her family has claimed her suicide is not related to the incident.

headlines: BJD MP Ladu Kishore Swain passes away at the age of 71
text: BJD lawmaker Ladu Kishore Swain passed away on Tuesday at the age of 71 following kidney-related complications. Swain, who won the 2014 Lok Sabha elections with the highest margin of votes in Odisha, is survived by his wife and children. He had quit working as a school headmaster and gone on to become a sarpanch and a Zilla Parishad president.

headlines: Saudi gave US-made weapons to al-Qaeda-linked groups: Report
text: Saudi Arabia and the UAE transferred US-made weapons to al-Qaeda-linked groups, hardline Salafi militias, and other factions fighting the war in Yemen, according to a CNN report. The Saudi-led coalition used US-manufactured weapons "as a form of currency to buy the loyalties of militias", the report added. Iran-backed Houthi rebels got hold of US-made Mine Resistant Ambush Protected vehicles.

headlines: 4th person dies in 'menstruation hut' in Nepal this year
text: A 21-year-old woman has become the fourth person to die in Nepal this year after she was forced to stay in a 'menstruation hut' during her period under the practice of chhaupadi. She died due to smoke inhalation and suffocation as she closed the door of the windowless hut and lit a fire for warmth during the night, authorities said.

headlines: Renault India launches all-new Kwid with enhanced safety features
text: Renault India has launched the new Kwid range with a host of enhanced features for 2019. It comes with new safety additions like the driver airbag, ABS, anti-lock brakes, seat belt reminder and overspeed alert. Moreover, it features reverse parking camera, traffic assist mode, Apple CarPlay & Android Auto, along with a high ground clearance and the best-in-class boot space.

headlines: 80+ universities from 11 countries at Edwise World Education Fair
text: Edwise is hosting India's Largest World Education Fair offering a golden opportunity to meet delegates from 80+ top universities from 11 countries and have all your queries related to the application process, courses, coaching, financial assistance, campus facilities, accommodation, visas and others answered personally. Visitors will also be eligible for application fee waivers, spot offers and scholarships based on merit.

headlines: Trump to meet Kim Jong-un for 2nd summit in Vietnam on Feb 27-28
text: US President Donald Trump has confirmed that he'll hold his second summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un in Vietnam on February 27 and 28. "If I had not been elected president of the United States, we would right now, in my opinion, be in a major war with North Korea," Trump said during the State of the Union Address.
