headlines: I go to sleep when he wakes up: SRK on not working with Akshay
text: Shah Rukh Khan, on being asked if he'd like to collaborate with Akshay Kumar, jokingly said, "What do I say to this? I go to sleep when Akshay [wakes] up." "His day starts early. By the time I start working, he's packing up," he added. Shah Rukh further said, "Not many people are fond of shooting at night like me."

headlines: Acid attack survivor Laxmi & Deepika have uncanny similarity: Meghna
text: Filmmaker Meghna Gulzar, who will be making a film titled 'Chhapaak' on acid attack survivor Laxmi, starring Deepika Padukone has said there is an "uncanny similarity between the survivor and Deepika". "You won't be seeing Deepika, you know. You will be seeing a disfigured Deepika," she added. Deepika had earlier called the film "a story of trauma and triumph".

headlines: Posters of Rahul, Priyanka, Robert Vadra put up outside Congress HQ
text: Posters of Congress President Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and her husband Robert Vadra have been put up outside Congress party headquarters in Delhi. "Kattar Soch Nahi, Yuva Josh (Youthful energy, not extreme views)," the tagline on the posters read. This comes after Priyanka was allotted an office at the headquarters adjacent to her brother Rahul's office.

headlines: Cong starts 'Apni Baat, Rahul ke Saath' as new outreach programme
text: Congress has started a new outreach programme 'Apni Baat, Rahul ke Saath', in which party President Rahul Gandhi interacts with different sections of society. Rahul also tweeted a video of him interacting with students from across India at dinner as part of the programme. "I learnt a lot from the wonderful exchange of ideas and perspectives," he wrote on Twitter.

headlines: Pic shows women priests conducting wedding, dad refuses kanyadaan
text: A post has gone viral on the social media, mentioning about a wedding in Kolkata wherein female priests performed the rituals. Moreover, the bride's father refused to do 'kanyadaan' or give away the bride and instead gave a speech stating that his daughter is "not property to give away". The wedding also had the mother's name taken before the father's.

headlines: Man attacked by mountain lion, fights back & suffocates it to death
text: A man who was attacked by a mountain lion while running on a northern Colorado trail in US fought back and killed the animal by suffocating it, wildlife officials said. The lion, less than a year old, bit him on his face and wrist. The man was hospitalised with serious injuries and is expected to make a full recovery.

headlines: CEO dies holding only passwords to customers' $145-mn cryptocurrency
text: Digital-asset exchange QuadrigaCX can't retrieve around $145 million in Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ether and other cryptocurrencies held for its customers after its CEO Gerald Cotten, the only person with access to passwords, died. Cotten died aged 30 on December 9 from complications of Crohn's disease. To avoid being hacked, Cotten had moved majority of digital coins into cold storage.

headlines: Case against Pandya, KL Rahul, Johar for comments on women
text: A case has been registered against cricketers Hardik Pandya, KL Rahul and filmmaker Karan Johar in Jodhpur for their comments on women on the talk show 'Koffee With Karan' in an episode which aired in December. The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) had earlier suspended the players. The suspension was later lifted by the BCCI.

headlines: Instagram to add 'sensitivity screens' after UK teen suicide
text: Instagram head Adam Mosseri said the platform will hide self-harm imagery of 'cutting' behind 'sensitivity screens' following 14-year-old British girl Molly Russell's suicide. Molly's parents believe she took her life after viewing graphic images of self-harm on Instagram and Pinterest. We let people "share that they are struggling", but remove posts that promote such activity, Mosseri added.

headlines: Apple to pay $571 mn in back-dated taxes to France: Reports
text: Technology giant Apple has reached an agreement to pay nearly $571 million to French authorities to settle back-dated taxes, reports said. Apple confirmed the agreement but did not disclose the amount to be paid. In 2016, the European Union directed Apple to pay about $15 billion to Ireland, citing that the company received illegal tax benefits from the Irish government.

headlines: What type of CM is Mamata, she must resign: Yogi on SC order
text: Referring to WB CM Mamata Banerjee during a public rally, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said, "What type of a CM is she?...She has no right to remain in the chair, she should resign on moral grounds." He made the statement after the Supreme Court ruled that Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar cannot be arrested but should cooperate with CBI.

headlines: SC's police chief verdict a 'big slap' for WB govt: BJP
text: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra has called the Supreme Court verdict, which ruled that Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar cannot be arrested but should cooperate with the CBI, a "big slap" in the face of the West Bengal government. He called the dharna launched by West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee a "drama" and a "political battle" that has been exposed.

headlines: Officer summoned by CBI for questioning found dead in MP
text: A 45-year-old Gun Carriage Factory junior works manager, who was summoned by the CBI in connection with the alleged supply of Chinese parts for production of Dhanush artillery guns used by the Army, was found dead in Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday. The police suspect he committed suicide as a blade was found near his body, although his family suspects murder.

headlines: Australia deploys military to tackle 'once-in-a-century' floods
text: Australia's military has been deployed after 'once-in-a-century' floods hit the state of Queensland last week following heavy rains. Two people have died in the floodwaters and thousands of residents in Townsville were without power and cut off by flooded roads. Around 400 residents in Townsville have sought shelter at nearby military barracks.

headlines: 4 women killed every day in Brazil this year: Report
text: Four women have been killed every day so far this year in Brazil, the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (IACHR) said. IACHR called the rate "alarming" and called upon the Brazilian government to take more steps to prevent and prosecute femicides. Femicide is the killing of a woman by a man because of her gender.

headlines: I said 'Shakal dekhi hai': Tahira on Ayushmann wanting to be actor
text: Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap has revealed when her husband told her he wanted to be an actor, she ridiculed him by saying, "Ae shakal dekhi hai? (Have you seen your face?)" "I was very brutal...and wasn't even shocked, I laughed," she added. VJ-turned-actor Ayushmann made his Bollywood debut with 'Vicky Donor' in 2012, nearly four years after his wedding.

headlines: I was 16 when I first met Shahid at family friend's house: Wife Mira
text: During a Q&A session on Instagram, Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput revealed she was 16 years old when she first met him. "We were at a common family friend's house for a concert by a Sufi singer. Both our dads love that kind of music," she added. Mira wrote meeting him was "just like meeting anyone for the first time".

headlines: Sala's sister shares picture of his dog waiting for him to return
text: Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala's sister Romina took to Facebook to share a picture of Sala's dog Nala staring into the distance and captioned it, "Nala's waiting for you too." The 28-year-old forward was travelling to Wales' Cardiff from France's Nantes when his plane disappeared over English Channel on January 21. The plane's wreckage and a body were discovered on Sunday.

headlines: People laughed at us when we made Yo-Yo test compulsory: Shastri
text: India head coach Ravi Shastri, in a recent interview, said people laughed when Yo-Yo test was made compulsory for India selection. "What they missed was that was a very important part," he added. Citing Mohammad Shami's example, Shastri said he was dropped for failing Yo-Yo test for England ODIs and no one performed better than him after he cleared it.

headlines: I've nothing to do with Delhi restaurants, pubs in my name: Gambhir
text: Ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to clarify that he has nothing to do with the restobars, restaurants and pubs using his name in central and west Delhi. "In fact I've no such establishment in my name anywhere in the world," Gambhir added. In 2017, Gambhir had sought to restrain a Delhi-based restobar chain from using his name.

headlines: Neymar breaks down on 27th b'day, wishes for new metatarsal bones
text: World's most expensive footballer Neymar, who is currently recovering from a foot injury, broke down during a speech to his friends and family during his 27th birthday celebrations in Paris. "What I wanted...the most as a birthday present today is a new metatarsal so I could be on the field fighting and doing what I love the most," he said.

headlines: Kuldeep is our frontline number one overseas spinner: Ravi Shastri
text: India head coach Ravi Shastri has said Chinaman Kuldeep Yadav is now India's frontline number one overseas spinner. "Going ahead, if we have to play one spinner [in Tests], he is the one we will pick. There is a time for everyone," he added. Shastri revealed that he was "very impressed" with the way Kuldeep bowled in the Sydney Test.

headlines: BJP using government agencies to blackmail people: Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday alleged that the BJP is using central agencies like the CBI to "blackmail" people. She added, "Once you join the BJP, then there will be no cases." She further said that there will be no CBI, no ED, no I-T (Income Tax Department) against a person if he/she joins the BJP.

headlines: No regrets: Statistician who quit over delay in job statistics report
text: PC Mohanan, 63-year-old former acting Chairman of National Statistical Commission (NSC), who quit from his post on January 28 in protest over a delay in releasing a new set of jobs statistics, said he has "no regrets". Three days after he quit, reports claimed India's unemployment rate during 2017-2018 rose to 6.1%, the highest in at least 45 years.

headlines: I will initiate appeal process: Mallya after UK clears extradition
text: After the UK Home Secretary cleared his extradition to India, beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya tweeted, "After the decision was handed down on December 10, 2018, by the Westminster Magistrates' Court, I stated my intention to appeal." "I could not initiate the appeal process before a decision by the Home Secretary. Now I'll initiate the appeal process," he added.

headlines: Malayalam actor Thulasi surrenders over anti-women remark
text: Malayalam actor Kollam Thulasi surrendered before the police on Tuesday and has been arrested for his remarks against women's entry in Sabarimala. A case was filed against the actor after he said that women who try to enter Sabarimala should be ripped apart. The actor surrendered almost a month after Kerala High Court rejected his appeal for anticipatory bail.

headlines: Liam Neeson criticised for comment on wanting to kill black man
text: Actor Liam Neeson is facing criticism for revealing he wanted to "kill a black man" nearly 40 years ago after his friend was raped. "My immediate reaction was I asked, 'Did she know who it was?' No. 'What color were they?' She said it was a black person," the 66-year-old actor said. "It was horrible...that I did that," Liam added.

headlines: Chris Evans, Jennifer Lopez to present awards at Oscars 2019
text: 'The Avengers' actor Chris Evans and singer Jennifer Lopez will present awards at the upcoming Oscars ceremony. 'Crazy Rich Asians' stars Awkwafina and Constance Wu, as well as actress and comedian Tina Fey will also be presenting. Actor Daniel Craig, best known for his portrayal of the fictional British spy James Bond, has also been named as a presenter.

headlines: Would be great to star with Ranveer in gay film: Rajkummar
text: While speaking about acting in a 'gay film', Rajkummar Rao said, "I think Ranveer would be a great choice to star opposite." "He's a great friend and also the way his career graph is going and how he has come up as an actor, I'm a huge fan," he added. Rajkummar further said he shares a "great rapport" with Ranveer.

headlines: Govt committed to completing NRC on time: Rajnath Singh
text: After the Supreme Court hit out at the government for "not cooperating" in NRC process, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said the government is committed to complete the process within the stipulated time. SC on Tuesday turned down Centre's plea seeking suspension of NRC exercise during General elections as central armed police forces in Assam had to be withdrawn for polls.

headlines: Shackled Bahraini footballer in Thailand upsetting: Aus PM
text: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison said on Tuesday he was "disturbed" to see Bahraini refugee footballer Hakeem Al Araibi in shackles in Thailand. Araibi, who fled Bahrain in 2014 before being granted permanent residence in Australia, has said he would face torture if sent back to Bahrain for his criticism of the royal family.

headlines: Mourinho fined for tax fraud in Spain in lieu of jail time
text: Former Real Madrid manager Jose Mourinho has accepted a one-year prison sentence for defrauding the Spanish state of 3.3 million, a Spanish court filing showed on Tuesday. The 56-year-old Portuguese, who will not serve any jail time, has agreed to exchange the 12-month prison sentence with a daily fine of 250 for 24 months.

headlines: We were not underdogs: Shastri on India's series win in Aus
text: Giving the reason behind comparing India's Test series win in Australia to India's 1983 World Cup-triumph, Ravi Shastri said, "Test cricket is the purest form and we came to Australia as heavyweight champions... home and away." "We were not favourites... But we were not underdogs to come and surprise them [Australia] either," Shastri added.

headlines: McGregor and 18-month-old son wear purple suits at Super Bowl
text: MMA fighter Conor McGregor and his 18-month-old son Conor Jr wore matching purple suits while attending the Super Bowl LIII at the Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta. They were allowed onto the field before the start of the match. The father-son duo was seen passing a football around before the start of the game.

headlines: Flickr deletes photos of free accounts going over new limit
text: Photo and video-hosting platform Flickr on Tuesday started deleting photos and videos of free account users that cross its newly imposed storage limit of 1,000 items. The platform, which previously offered storage capacity of 1TB to free account users, will reportedly be deleting items starting from the oldest first. Flickr was acquired by US-based photo storage service SmugMug in 2018.

headlines: Mamata Banerjee architect of federal front: Chandrababu Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday described his West Bengal counterpart Mamata Banerjee as the "architect" of the federal front. Naidu, who joined Banerjee's "Save the Democracy" sit-in protest, added that Banerjee is the main pillar of the opposition. He further said she will be in a decision making position at the national level after the general polls.

headlines: Mamata a super nautanki master: Union Minister Giriraj Singh
text: Commenting on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's dharna following the standoff between CBI officials and Kolkata Police, Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Tuesday called Mamata a "super nautanki master". "She knew everything...did this drama to give a jolt to opposition groups," he added. He further said that a CM on dharna with a police commissioner is "misfortunate" for India's democracy.

headlines: Six injured after bus falls into drain in Rajasthan
text: At least six people were injured after a Rajasthan Roadways bus fell into a drain in Rajasthan's Chaksu, 40 km from Jaipur, on Tuesday. A crane and a boat were used to take the bus out of the drain, as per reports. All the 25 passengers have been rescued and the injured have been admitted to a nearby hospital.

headlines: What's the story behind egg pic that broke Kylie's Instagram record?
text: Instagram account that broke Kylie Jenner's record of most-liked Instagram picture with an egg's picture is made by London's 29-year-old advertising professional Chris Godfrey to spread awareness about causes including mental health. A video showed the egg cracking and saying, "The pressure of social media's getting to me." It takes viewers to several mental health support websites across nations.

headlines: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee ends dharna against CBI after 3 days
text: After three days, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday called off the dharna (protest) in Kolkata against the CBI over action against Kolkata Police chief Rajeev Kumar regarding Saradha chit-fund scam. She called the dharna "a victory for the Constitution and democracy". Earlier, the Supreme Court ordered Kumar can't be arrested but he must cooperate in the investigation.

headlines: Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde joins Congress
text: Actress Shilpa Shinde, who won Bigg Boss 11 last year, joined the Congress party on Tuesday. The 41-year-old, known for playing the role of 'Angoori Bhabhi' in 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai', joined the party in the presence of Mumbai Congress chief Sanjay Nirupam. Shilpa will reportedly contest for the party in the upcoming Assembly elections.

headlines: I starved myself a day before my Oscar win to look thin: AR Rahman
text: Singer-composer AR Rahman has revealed on the eve of his Oscars win in 2009, he was "starving to look thin for the ceremony". Rahman won two Oscar awards, one for Best Original Song and another for Best Original Score, for his work in 'Slumdog Millionaire'. Rahman was the first Indian to win two Oscar awards in a single night.

headlines: MMA fighter who escaped police van found hiding in dustbin
text: A mixed martial arts fighter suspected of two murders, who had escaped from Texas police, was found hiding in a rubbish bin. Cedric Marks had escaped from a prison transport vehicle after it stopped at a McDonald's in Conroe, near Houston. He was being transferred to Temple, Texas to face charges on Sunday when he fled.

headlines: Bad dream: Missing footballer's father after plane wreckage found
text: After wreckage from the plane carrying 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala was found around two weeks after the plane disappeared over the English Channel, Emiliano's father Horacio said that he can't believe it. "This is a dream. A bad dream. I am desperate," he added. Both Sala and 59-year-old pilot David Ibbotson are missing presumed dead.

headlines: Option of going with SP-BSP open: Om Prakash Rajbhar
text: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Monday said the option of going with the SP-BSP alliance in the general elections was open to the party. Speaking on Kolkata issue, he questioned the CBI action saying how the agency could go there without any order. He said the Supreme Court has already called the CBI a "caged parrot".

headlines: Fadnavis meets Anna Hazare, asks him to call off fast
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday met social activist Anna Hazare and requested him to call off his fast. Hazare, who began his indefinite fast on January 30 over the appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta (anti-corruption watchdogs), has lost around 4.30 kg weight in the last seven days, doctors said. Fadnavis met Hazare in his native village in Ahmednagar.

headlines: Indian Coast Guard evacuates ill baby in Maldives' Gan Island
text: Indian Coast Guard pilots successfully evacuated a critically ill infant in the Maldives' Gan Island on Monday. "The noble efforts of the Indian technical team, in collaboration with the Maldives National Defence Force Air Wing, are truly valued," Chief of Defence Force of the Maldives, Major General Abdulla Shamaal said.

headlines: Father of US man killed in Andaman blames 'extreme Christianity'
text: The father of John Chau, a missionary allegedly killed by Andaman's Sentinelese tribe last year, has blamed "extreme Christianity" for the death of his son. "John is gone because the Western ideology overpowered my [Confucian] influence," he said. Chau illegally travelled to the North Sentinel Island to convert the tribe to Christianity.

headlines: No inclination to join politics: Malayalam actor Mohanlal
text: Malayalam actor Mohanlal has said he has "no inclination" to join politics or contest elections. Politics is not my cup of tea. I always want to remain an actor. I enjoy the freedom I have in this profession," he added. This comes after multiple BJP leaders in Kerala publicly offered Mohanlal a ticket to contest the upcoming Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Supermodel Tyra Banks to open tech-based attraction
text: American supermodel-turned-entrepreneur Tyra Banks on Tuesday announced plans to open a technology-driven attraction named 'Modelland' in California, later this year. The 21,000-square-foot attraction will reportedly feature AR and VR-based interactive entertainment. 'Modelland' is the "genesis for people with all types of different beauty to feel seen and validated," Tyra said.

headlines: India has bid to host the Hockey World Cup in 2023
text: The International Hockey Federation (FIH) announced on Tuesday that India is among the group of six countries that have presented bids to host the next edition of the Hockey World Cup. India has proposed to conduct the event for either men or women in the January 13 to 29, 2023 window. India has hosted the men's World Cup thrice.

headlines: Chahal, Kuldeep would struggle against Rohit, Dhawan: Harbhajan
text: Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh claimed that Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav would have a tough time bowling to Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan as they both are very good players of spin bowling. "Most of the overseas batsmen, if you see, are trying to read wrist spinners after pitching and that's dangerous," Harbhajan added.

headlines: Pakistan skipper Sarfaraz Ahmed denies talks of rift with Malik
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed denied talks of a rift with Pakistan's stand-in captain Shoaib Malik. "There is no truth to the claim people who play under Shoaib bhai don't want to play under me. All the boys are very good and support each other. I don't think there's anything about that," the 31-year-old said.

headlines: Google parent Alphabet stocks fall despite 22% revenue rise
text: Google's parent company Alphabet's shares on Tuesday plunged over 3% in after-hours trading despite delivering fourth-quarter revenue of $39.27 billion, a 22% rise from the year-ago period. This comes as the company's capital expenditures rose 80% to $6.85 billion during the quarter. The rise was largely due to building and running data centres and offices, Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat said.

headlines: Haven't denied any permission: Mamata on BJP's rallies in WB
text: Two days after chopper of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath was denied landing for a rally in West Bengal, state CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I haven't denied any permission." "He (BJP President Amit Shah) was unwell, yet he came and addressed rallies," she added. "Then why are they claiming that we aren't letting them hold rallies," she further said.

headlines: SC's order has put TMC and BJP in their place: Yechury
text: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said the Supreme Court's order on Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar has put BJP and TMC "in place". He further accused the two parties of sharing spoils of chit fund scams. SC on Tuesday said that CBI can't arrest Kumar and also directed Kumar to appear before CBI and "cooperate" with it.

headlines: Tesla buys energy storage company Maxwell Technologies for $218 mn
text: Elon Musk-led automaker Tesla has agreed to acquire American energy storage company Maxwell Technologies in an all-stock deal valued at about $218 million. The acquisition is reportedly aimed to help the electric automaker improve its batteries and lower its vehicle prices. The merger is expected to be completed in the second quarter of 2019, Maxwell Technologies aid.

headlines: Trump to pick Treasury's Malpass to lead World Bank: Reports
text: President Donald Trump will reportedly pick senior Treasury official David Malpass as the US nominee to lead the World Bank. The 62-year-old is known to have earlier criticised the World Bank and other multilateral institutions for growing "intrusive" and "entrenched". World Bank's former President Jim Yong Kim stepped down on February 1 to join private equity firm Global Infrastructure Partners.

headlines: Galaxy 12.9 billion light-years away is named after Ronaldo
text: Cosmos Redshift 7 or CR7, a galaxy 12.9 billion light-years away from the Earth, is named after five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, who is known as CR7. The galaxy, discovered in 2015, is considered to be one of the oldest and the brightest galaxies in the universe. Ronaldo, who also has an airport named after him, turns 34 today.

headlines: Ronaldo had surgery for heart issue at 15 to save his career
text: Five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, who joined Juventus from Real Madrid, had to undergo laser surgery for heart problem when he was just 15. Ronaldo, who was playing for Sporting CP at that time, had an irregular heartbeat even when he was resting. Ronaldo's mother revealed she was worried as "there was the possibility of him giving up football".

headlines: Ranveer Singh jumps into a crowd at event, hurts people
text: Ranveer Singh, who was at an event on Sunday to promote 'Gully Boy', jumped into a crowd of people after completing his performance. However, he ended up hurting a few people, who were recording his performance on their phones. Sharing a news clipping of the incident, a Twitter user wrote, "Grow up Ranveer Singh and stop your childish antics."

headlines: Home Ministry trying to destroy process: SC on Assam citizen's list
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said, "The Home Ministry is coming up with all sorts of excuses to delay the NRC (National Register of Citizens) process in Assam. The entire effort of the Home Ministry is to destroy the process". Talking about the elections, which are due by May, the bench said the polls and NRC can go on simultaneously.

headlines: MHA asks WB govt to take disciplinary action against Rajeev Kumar
text: Home Ministry has asked West Bengal government to initiate disciplinary proceedings against Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar for sitting on dharna with political parties. This comes after Supreme Court said CBI cannot take any coercive action against Kumar in connection with chit fund scams. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee started the dharna to protest CBI's move to raid Kumar's residence.

headlines: SP-BSP MLAs throw paper balls, planes at UP Governor in Assembly
text: Members of Samajwadi Party and BSP threw paper planes and paper balls at Uttar Pradesh Governor Ram Naik during his speech in the state Assembly on Tuesday. Naik was giving the speech on the first day of the Budget Session, when the opposition members raised slogans like "Rajyapal Wapas Jao (Governor Go Back)". CM Yogi Adityanath has condemned the act.

headlines: RSS most secular and inclusive organisation: Maharashtra Guv
text: Maharashtra Governor C Vidyasagar Rao on Tuesday said RSS is one of the most secular and inclusive organisations. He added RSS has always respected the right of individuals to practice their own faith and religion. Speaking at an event, the governor added that the journey of the Sangh has been spectacular as well as tough.

headlines: Pope Francis becomes first Pope to visit Arabian Peninsula
text: Pope Francis reached the UAE on Sunday for the first-ever visit by a head of the Catholic Church to the Arabian Peninsula. Pope Francis and Sheikh Ahmed al-Tayeb, the Grand Imam of Egypt's Al-Azhar mosque, signed a 'Document on Human Fraternity for World Peace and Living Together'. The UAE said Pope's visit reflects its history as a "cradle of diversity".

headlines: Sushmita dances to her song 'Chunari...' at nephew's wedding
text: A video shows Sushmita Sen dancing to her song 'Chunari Chunari' from 1999 film 'Biwi No. 1' with her nephew at his wedding in Delhi. Sharing the video on social media, Sushmita wrote, "This seems to be one of Shiv Chopra's [nephew's] favourite songs for he knows all the steps!!!" The original song features Sushmita and Salman Khan.

headlines: Grateful that people still accept me with open arms: Juhi
text: Juhi Chawla has said she's grateful that even after three decades in the film industry the audience still accepts her with open arms. "Acting is all I know. I don't know what I'd be doing other than this," Juhi added. The actress further said that she's "always excited" to work with a director who has a good story to tell.

headlines: Rapper 21 Savage faces deportation from US
text: Rapper 21 Savage faces deportation from the US after authorities claimed he is British and staying in the US illegally. The rapper, whose real name is Sha Yaa Bin Abraham-Joseph, was arrested over accusations that he had overstayed his visa by more than a decade. He was convicted on felony drug charges in the US state of Georgia in 2014.

headlines: Kapil meets ex-PM Manmohan Singh and his wife, shares pics
text: Kapil Sharma recently met the former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his wife Gursharan Kaur. Sharing the pictures on social media, he wrote, "Was an honour meeting such a humble and simple statesman like you, and receiving blessings from ma'am." "Thank you...for the warmth, hospitality and a heart to heart conversation about our roots in Amritsar," Kapil further wrote.

headlines: Waited for women to be liberated in B'wood: Sneha on comeback
text: Sneha Ullal, while talking about her comeback in Bollywood, said, "I was so waiting for this time to come where women are free, liberated to do anything in the business, not only acting but filmmaking, producing everything." "When I started in 2005, things were very different," said Sneha, who made Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's 'Lucky: No Time for Love'

headlines: Ambati Rayudu will go to the 2019 World Cup: Ganguly
text: Former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly said that Ambati Rayudu will most definitely travel to the ICC World Cup 2019 as part of the Indian squad. Rayudu finished the India-New Zealand ODI series as the highest run-getter, scoring 190 runs in five matches. "Rayudu played well. He fizzled out in the middle but has played well overall," Ganguly said.

headlines: Crazy not to pick Smith, Warner: Australia coach Langer
text: Australian team's coach Justin Langer said that Australia would be "crazy" not to pick Steve Smith and David Warner for their World Cup defence. "We've got to keep working on how they are with their elbows first," Langer said after both players underwent elbow surgeries last month. Smith and Warner will be available for international selection again on March 29.

headlines: Yogi has no place to stand in UP, so roaming in WB: Mamata
text: Talking about Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said, "He doesnt have a place to stand in UP thats why he's roaming around in Bengal." "He should take care of UP first," she added. This comes after the West Bengal government denied permission for Yogi's chopper to land at Balurghat.

headlines: Alka Lamba wants to quit party, finding reasons: AAP
text: AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj on Tuesday said that AAP MLA Alka Lamba wants to leave the party and is finding reasons for the same. This comes after Lamba on Sunday claimed that AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal unfollowed her on Twitter. If I do not get the respect I deserve...I will stop working for the party, Alka had said.

headlines: CBI should do its job in a non-political manner: Patnaik
text: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday said that CBI should do a professional and non-political job. Further, he added, No one from TMC has been in contact with us for...a year. This comes after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said she will consult Patnaik and other leaders before calling off her dharna opposing CBIs action against Kolkata Police chief.

headlines: Denied permission for rally in WB's Murshidabad: BJP Leader
text: BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain said that the West Bengal government has denied the party permission to hold a rally in Murshidabad which was scheduled for Tuesday. However, Hussain said that he will still go to Murshidabad for the rally. This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's chopper was denied permission to land in the state ahead of a rally.

headlines: Priyanka allotted office next to Rahul's at Congress headquarters
text: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has been allotted an office at the Congress headquarters in New Delhi. Her office, which is adjacent to the office of her brother and Congress President Rahul Gandhi, was earlier occupied by Rahul when he was Congress Vice-President. Previous occupants of Priyanka's office include Janardan Dwivedi and Sushil Kumar Shinde.

headlines: Two-thirds of Himalayan glaciers could melt by 2100: Report
text: As per Hindu Kush Himalaya Assessment, two-thirds of the Himalayan glaciers could melt by 2100 if current rates of global warming and greenhouse gas emissions aren't cut. The Hindu Kush Himalaya region, spread across eight nations, inhabits 240 million people, the report said. Impacts could range from worsened air pollution to increase in extreme weather events, a report editor said.

headlines: IIT Madras team generates lasers from alcohol-cooked carrots
text: A team of IIT Madras researchers has found that biocompatible lasers could be generated from carrots cooked in ethanol (alcohol). The team found that optically active pigments carotenoids present in carrots gave them lasing properties. A carrot's carotenoid concentration was increased by cooking it in alcohol and light was then pumped through it to produce laser, a researcher said.

headlines: Anna loses over 5 kg of weight as hunger strike enters day 7
text: Social activist Anna Hazare, whose hunger strike entered its seventh day on Tuesday, has lost over 5 kg of weight, said a doctor attending to him. The doctor added, "He is in a critical condition...We have advised him to call off the strike as soon as possible." Anna is fasting to press for the appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta.

headlines: Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde may join Congress: Reports
text: Television reality show Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde may join Congress, several reports citing sources from the party said on Tuesday. However, the 41-year-old actress refused to comment on the reports. Shilpa Shinde's father Satyadev Shinde was a High Court judge, who reportedly passed away in 2013.

headlines: Not an atom of dad's character changed post Oscar: Rahman's daughter
text: AR Rahman's daughter Khatija, while praising him on the occasion of ten years of 'Slumdog Millionaire' winning Oscars, said, "Not an atom of your character has changed ever since you won Oscars." "Though the world knows you for your music...your humility matters the most for me," she added. Rahman won Oscars for Best Original Score and Best Original Song.

headlines: My wife scolded me a day before Slumdog Millionaire won Oscars: Anil
text: Actor Anil Kapoor revealed he got "a lot of firing" from his wife Sunita Kapoor a day before 'Slumdog Millionaire' won eight Oscars in 2009. "For family, Oscar doesn't matter. My wife and I were discussing Sonam the night before Oscars," said Anil. "I said 'let me sleep now' and she said 'leave Oscar, listen to me first'," he added.

headlines: Michael Schumacher's son asks media to remove fake family photos
text: Seven-time Formula One champion Michael Schumacher's son Mick Schumacher took to Twitter to clarify that three widely circulated images supposedly showing him or his sister Gina with their father, are fake. The 19-year-old tweeted that the pictures don't feature him or Gina and appealed to "all media" to remove them. "I'm sorry for the people in these photos," he wrote.

headlines: Sarfaraz Ahmed to captain Pakistan in 2019 World Cup, PCB confirms
text: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has confirmed Sarfaraz Ahmed will remain Pakistan's captain till World Cup 2019, which will be staged in England and Wales from May 30 to July 14. Sarfaraz, who returned to Pakistan from South Africa after being banned by ICC for four matches over racist remarks, said he's delighted the PCB has reassured its confidence in him.

headlines: PM waving at imaginary friends in J&K: Mufti on his Dal Lake video
text: After PM Narendra Modi was seen waving in a video of his Dal Lake boat ride, former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti said, "The wave is for BJP's countless imaginary 'friends' in Kashmir." "This camera person has done the Hon PM a huge disservice...there's no way the PM would be waving at an empty lake," National Conference's Omar Abdullah tweeted.

headlines: BJP, Amit Shah 'most corrupt' in India: Chandrababu Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Monday alleged the BJP and its President Amit Shah are most corrupt in India. He added, "It's under their rule that [people] like Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi escaped after looting the banks of our country." He further said opposition parties are not against PM Narendra Modi but are against his "policies and behaviour".

headlines: Walmart may exit Flipkart due to new FDI rules: Morgan Stanley
text: US-based brokerage firm Morgan Stanley has said the US-based retail giant Walmart's exit from Flipkart is "likely, not completely out of the question" with India's new FDI norms for e-commerce. "We estimate that Flipkart derives 50% of its revenue from high-selling electronics category," said Morgan Stanley. "It could face meaningful disruption and top-line pressure in the near term," it added.

headlines: It's all in past, I've moved on: Binny Bansal on exiting Flipkart
text: More than two months after he resigned as Flipkart Group CEO over "an allegation of serious personal misconduct", Binny Bansal broke silence and said, "Now, it's all in the past. I've moved on." "I'm looking forward to the next chapter of my life," the 37-year-old added. Binny said he's focused on xto10x Technologies, a new startup co-founded by him.

headlines: Ex-Chattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi, son booked over bypoll fixing
text: An FIR has been registered against five people, including former Chhattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi, his son Amit and former PWD Minister Rajesh Munat, in connection with the Antagarh tapes case. The audio tapes had purportedly revealed that the 2014 Antagarh assembly bypoll, which was won by BJP, was fixed. The FIR was filed following a complaint by a Congress leader.

headlines: Delhi policeman arrested for being drunk on duty in Bihar
text: Delhi Police head constable Mukesh Kumar was arrested for allegedly being drunk during a raid in Bihar on Monday. Kumar was part of a team that went to Bihar to arrest a 19-year-old man who eloped with a 17-year-old girl. He reportedly created a ruckus at the house where the teenagers were found, following which the Excise Department was informed.

headlines: Explosives recovered from train coach, Assam railway station
text: Explosives including 600 gelatin sticks and 1,200 detonators were recovered from the Guwahati Railway Station and Avadh-Assam Express in Assam's Morigaon district on Monday. A bag was found abandoned at the railway station, while another unclaimed bag was recovered from the train coach. The items were seized and a case was registered.

headlines: 4 female friends, including minor, commit suicide together in Guj
text: Four female friends, including a minor, have allegedly committed suicide by jumping into Narmada canal in Gujarat's Banaskantha. Police said according to their suicide note, one friend said she was suffering from a heart ailment and the second said she was not happy with her marriage. The other two took the step as separation from friends was unbearable for them.

headlines: Trainee aircraft crashes near Pune, pilot injured
text: A trainee aircraft of Carver Aviation, a pilot training institute, on Tuesday crashed near Indapur in Maharashtra's Pune. The incident has left a trainee pilot injured and the aircraft was completely damaged after the incident. The pilot was immediately rushed to the nearby hospital in Baramati.

headlines: Those not giving birth responsible for falling population: Japan Dy PM
text: Japan's Deputy Prime Minister Taro Aso has said that those who "didn't give birth" are to be blamed for the country's declining population. "There are lots of strange people who say the elderly are to blame, but that is wrong," he added. In 2017, around 9.5 lakh babies were born while the number of deaths rose to around 13 lakh.

headlines: I'm going to shoot up a school: US boy tells Siri; gets list of schools
text: A middle school student in Indiana, US got a list of schools after he told Apple's digital assistant Siri, "I am going to shoot up a school." The 13-year-old, who took a screenshot of Siri's response and posted it on social media, was arrested and charged with intimidation. His friends on social media had alerted the police.

headlines: 11-year-old, bullied for last name 'Trump', invited to Prez's speech
text: Joshua Trump, an 11-year-old who has been bullied in school for his last name, will be one of US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump's guests at the State of the Union Address, the White House announced. "He said he hates himself, and he hates his last name...as a parent that's scary," Joshua's mother Megan Trump Berto said.

headlines: Was told I'd lose everything if I took 6-month break: Nargis
text: Actress Nargis Fakhri revealed that when she said she was taking a break from films for six months, people around her told her that she would "lose everything". "I was told...people will get ahead of me. They'll forget about me. They put all those things in my head," the actress further said. "I said I don't believe that," Nargis added.

headlines: There was no domination by Kangana: Manikarnika actor Zeeshan
text: Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, who played the role of 'Sadashivrao Bhau' in Kangana Ranaut's 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', said, "There was no arm-twisting or domination from her [Kangana's] end...Things were under control." "Kangana had clearly told me what my role would be, so I knew exactly what to expect," added Zeeshan, who was cast in film after Sonu Sood's exit.

headlines: Rishabh Pant is an asset for Team India: Shikhar Dhawan
text: Speaking about Rishabh Pant, Indian opener Shikhar Dhawan said, "He's an aggressive batsman and he can take away the game from the opposition in a jiffy. He's a great asset for our team." The 21-year-old is a part of the Indian T20I squad for the three-match series against New Zealand, which is set to start on February 6.

headlines: Liverpool's lead cut to 3 points after draw against West Ham
text: Liverpool's lead at the top of the Premier League was cut to three points after being held to a 1-1 draw by West Ham on Tuesday. Liverpool were playing without captain Jordan Henderson and midfielder Georginio Wijnaldum. Manchester City have a chance to take the top spot in the EPL in their next EPL fixture against Everton on Thursday.

headlines: B'desh board to build stadium after PM Sheikh Hasinas name
text: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has decided to build an international cricket stadium in the country after the name of the current Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina. The stadium will be built in Dhaka's Purbachal area over the next three years. The board also thanked the PM for allocating nearly 38 acres in Purbachal for the new cricket stadium complex.

headlines: SC verdict on police chief a moral victory for CBI: Prasad
text: Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday termed the Supreme Court verdict on Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar a "moral victory for CBI". "Lakhs of small investors were cheated [in the scams]. Is it not our moral obligation for an investigation?" he added. The apex court on Tuesday directed Rajeev to appear before CBI and cooperate with it.

headlines: After LS polls, people will close doors for BJP: Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said, "After the general elections, the people of India will close the doors for the BJP." Naidu said this in reference to BJP President Amit Shah's statement that "all doors to the NDA are closed for Naidu." Who asked him to open that door? Did I ask him or beg him?" Naidu further said.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi more worried about his own employment: Bihar CM
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi "is more worried about his own employment. I would like to ask what prevented the UPA government from granting central university status to Patna University," Nitish further said. This comes a day after Rahul promised to grant central university status to Patna University if UPA comes to power.

headlines: 13k killed in Maha road accidents in 2018; highest in 3 years
text: As many as 13,059 people were killed in road accidents in Maharashtra in 2018, the highest in last three years, state Transport Minister Diwakar Raote said. Of these, 80% or around 11,000 deaths were caused due to human error, he added. Pedestrians, two-wheeler riders and cyclists together comprised 66% of the fatalities, Raote further said.

headlines: 15 Thai election candidates change names to those of former PMs
text: Fifteen election candidates in Thailand have changed their names to those of former Prime Ministers in a bid to remain memorable to voters. While 10 men have legally changed their names to Thaksin, after former PM Thaksin Shinawatra, five women have changed their names to Yingluck, after the country's first female PM, Yingluck Shinawatra.

headlines: Comparisons to PM Modi are an insult to Indira Gandhi: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has called comparisons between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi "an insult to Indiraji." Rahul said, "My grandmother's decisions came from love and affection... Modi's decisions come from anger and hatred and his decisions divide the country." He further claimed that unlike PM Modi, Indira had cared for the poor in India.

headlines: UP CM to travel to WB by road after not allowed to land chopper
text: Two days after he was denied permission to land his chopper in West Bengal's South Dinajpur district for addressing political rallies, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has decided to travel by road to the state. "How is the 'khauf' (fear)?" BJP leader Mohsin Raza said in an apparent dig at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on CM Yogi's visit.

headlines: WB CM Mamata holds Cabinet meeting in traffic outpost amid dharna
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday held a Cabinet meeting to pass the state budget in a traffic outpost on a pavement in Kolkata. The full cabinet comprising over 50 ministers huddled in the room. This comes amid the dharna she has staged to protest the CBI's move to raid Kolkata Police chief in connection with chit fund scams.

headlines: Spent last 10 yrs in a jail: IAS topper Shah Faesal on his tenure
text: In his first public meeting in Jammu and Kashmir after quitting the services, 2009 IAS topper Shah Faesal on Monday said, "To tell you honestly, I spent the last 10 years in a jail." He asserted that despite being a senior government officer, he used to feel helpless seeing "atrocities and injustices". Faesal resigned last month to protest Kashmir killings.

headlines: Passenger finds cockroach in Air India meal; airline apologises
text: A passenger of Air India's Bhopal-Mumbai flight on Saturday complained that he found a cockroach in idli-vada-sambar he was served during the flight. Following the complaint, the airline on Monday apologised to the passenger and said it has initiated "corrective action internally". "Our senior officials are in touch with the aggrieved passenger," Air India tweeted.

headlines: 19-yr-old girl held for raping another woman with sex toy in Delhi
text: Delhi Police have arrested a 19-year-old girl on charges of 'raping' another woman with a sex toy, under Section 377. It's reportedly the first such case after the 377 verdict in September last year. The accused was produced in Karkardooma Court where the police were granted a day to interrogate her and was sent for judicial custody in Tihar jail.

headlines: Indian media barred from event addressed by Pak minister in UK
text: Indian media was not allowed entry into the 'International Conference on Kashmir' event addressed by Pakistani Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi at the UK House of Commons complex on Monday. India registered "strong" opposition over the matter, following which the UK government responded stating Qureshi was not an official guest as he was on a private visit to Britain.

headlines: Man sets himself on fire in auto while travelling with 2 others
text: A 24-year-old man in Delhi allegedly set himself on fire after pouring petrol on himself while travelling in an auto-rickshaw with his cousin and a co-passenger. Police said it appears he took the step after he fought with his girlfriend over phone. He suffered 70% burns and his cousin sustained 20% burns while the third passenger escaped with minor injuries.

headlines: UP police get adoption requests for rape survivor's newborn baby
text: Days after a 15-year-old rape survivor gave birth to a boy in Meerut, several couples have approached the police seeking to adopt the baby. The police said the girl will take a decision on the adoption requests, even as her family expressed displeasure over them. She had used her baby as evidence against her rapist in court.

headlines: Don't overburden Iraq with your own issues: Iraq President to Trump
text: After US President Donald Trump said he would ask US troops stationed in Iraq to "watch" Iran, Iraqi President Barham Salih said, "Don't overburden Iraq with your own issues." Salih added US troops in Iraq are there as part of an agreement between the two countries with a specific mission of combating terrorism and that they should stick to that.

headlines: UN monitors say North Korea protecting nuclear missiles
text: UN monitors have said North Korea is protecting its nuclear and ballistic missiles, adding that sanctions against the nation were proving ineffective. This comes ahead of the second summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. North Korea has said it'll never unilaterally give up its nukes unless the US first removes any threat to it.

headlines: I can make jeans and a T-shirt look like couture: Kareena
text: Kareena Kapoor Khan said that most of the time she wears jeans and a T-shirt, adding, "I can make jeans and a T-shirt also look like couture." "I know I have that...I can...It's just that I don't like dressing up," she further said. Kareena also said that her sister Karisma Kapoor is "more of a fashion icon" between the two.

headlines: You're my husband's numero uno: Sonali wishes Abhishek on b'day
text: Wishing Abhishek Bachchan on his 43rd birthday on Tuesday, Sonali Bendre retweeted her husband Goldie Behl's tweet and wrote, "You're my husband's numero uno! After all these years, I've come to terms with it." "Happy birthday, AB! Thanks for always having our backs," she further wrote. Goldie had shared a black and white picture with Abhishek while wishing him.

headlines: Salman and Sooraj Barjatya to collaborate for a family drama
text: Salman Khan and Sooraj Barjatya will collaborate for a family drama. Confirming the news, Sooraj said, "It will have all the necessary ingredients that a Rajshri production has - emotions, drama and a lot of music." Sooraj and Salman earlier collaborated for films like 'Maine Pyar Kiya', 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!', 'Hum Saath-Saath Hain' and 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo'.

headlines: Can't see anyone but Shahid in 'Kabir Singh': Kiara Advani
text: Kiara Advani, who is starring opposite Shahid Kapoor in their upcoming film 'Kabir Singh', said, "After completing an entire schedule with [Shahid], I can definitely say that I can't see anyone but him in the titular role." "It's a pleasure to work with someone who brings so much to a scene," Kiara added while talking about her co-actor.

headlines: Sonu's contract terminated, shouldn't speak on Manikarnika: Kangana
text: Talking about her film 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi' and Sonu Sood who was earlier part of the film, Kangana Ranaut said, "He shouldn't be speaking about the film as his contract was terminated." Kangana added that Sonu doesn't hold "any sort of participation" in the film, so he shouldn't "malign" the film. "These people have deep-rooted agendas," she said.

headlines: Out of love we call Siddaramaiah our leader: K'taka Cong Prez
text: Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee chief Eshwar Khandre on Monday said that it is "out of love" that the party considers former CM Siddaramaiah as their leader. "We've already clarified that HD Kumaraswamy is the CM," he added. This comes after Kumaraswamy recently threatened to step down when asked about Congress MLAs' comments that Siddaramaiah was their CM.

headlines: Its our moral victory: Mamata on SC order on police chief
text: After the Supreme Court on Tuesday said that CBI cannot arrest Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar in connection to the chit fund scams, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "Its our moral victory." Nobody is the big boss of this country, democracy is the big boss of this country, she further said. This comes amid Mamata's dharna against CBI action.

headlines: Yogi's Bankura rally scrapped over delay in chopper permit
text: West Bengal BJP has cancelled a public rally of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Bankura as the district administration was delaying in giving permission for the chopper landing. However, Yogi's Purulia rally will take place as per schedule, BJP state president Dilip Ghosh said. On Sunday, West Bengal government had denied permission for Yogi's chopper to land at Balurghat.

headlines: Disproportionate overreaction: Jaitley on Mamata's dharna
text: After WB CM Mamata Banerjee sat on a dharna to protest CBI action in Kolkata, Union Minister Arun Jaitley called her actions a "disproportionate overreaction". In a Facebook post titled 'The Kleptocrat's Club', Jaitley wrote, "She did it to defocus from other opposition aspirants for the highest office and to project herself as the nucleus of India's opposition."

headlines: Govt moves SC against Delhi HC order over Oxytocin ban
text: The government has approached the Supreme Court contesting Delhi High Court's decision which set aside government's notification imposing a ban on manufacture and sale of Oxytocin by private companies. The Delhi High Court had in December 2018 quashed the Centre's decision calling it "arbitrary and unreasonable". Oxytocin is a drug which induces labour and controls bleeding during childbirth.

headlines: Anything can happen till polls are declared: Bihar CM on WB row
text: Talking about the confrontation between CBI and Kolkata police, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said, "Till the Election Commission announces the dates of elections, anything can happen in the country." He added, "These things can only be explained by people who are doing it." "Nobody is concerned about the country. All are interested in votes," he further said.

headlines: Bhima-Koregaon accused moves Bombay HC for anticipatory bail
text: Activist Anand Teltumbde, an accused in the Bhima-Koregaon case, on Monday moved the Bombay High Court seeking anticipatory bail. This comes after Teltumbde was arrested on Saturday after a Pune sessions court rejected his anticipatory bail plea. However, the sessions court later ordered his release, terming the arrest "illegal" since Teltumbde was given interim protection till February 11.

headlines: 20-year-old Andhra woman killed by father following argument
text: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by her father following a heated argument in Prakasam district, Andhra Pradesh. The police said, "Her father had been unhappy at something she did, but when she refused to listen to him, he strangled her in a fit of rage." Her father has been absconding since the incident.

headlines: Match 50% EVM votes with paper trails: Opp'n parties to EC
text: Leaders of several opposition parties on Monday demanded the Election Commission to ensure that 50% of EVM results are matched with Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trails (VVPATs). The leaders also told the poll panel that people doubted the efficacy of EVMs and this issue needs to be redressed. The poll panel had earlier reiterated that it won't revert to ballot papers.

headlines: HDFC Life presents an inspiring #BounceBack story
text: HDFC Life in its latest video showcases the story of Darpan Inani, India's highest rated visually impaired chess player as of January'19. Darpan became a chess champion despite losing his sight at the age of 3. The film highlights how a strong will to fight and the right financial support can help you bounce back from life's biggest challenges.

headlines: I was crazy, insecure, pregnant: Tahira on low phase of marriage
text: Opening up on the low phase of their marriage, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said, "I was this crazy, insecure, pregnant person when 'Vicky Donor' happened. That was the worst phase." "I [was] crazy on my hormones because I was pregnant," she added. Earlier, Ayushmann revealed the onscreen kiss in 'Vicky Donor' caused trouble in his marriage for three years.

headlines: I felt like worst captain on planet: SA's Miller on 2nd T20I vs Pak
text: South Africa stand-in captain David Miller has said that he felt like "the worst captain on the planet" during Pakistan's chase in the second T20I on Sunday. "I didn't know what to do, to be honest," he added. Chasing a target of 189, Pakistan were 147/1 at one stage and eventually lost by seven runs despite Babar Azam scoring 90(58).

headlines: Kid has become a man: Kaif on player who played despite mom's death
text: Reacting to 22-year-old Windies pacer Alzarri Joseph, who played against England in the second Test just hours after his mother passed away, former India batsman Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "Young kid has grown into a man." "Real grit from Alzarri Joseph...Youngsters standing up has been most vital in making of this new Windies, which is great for Test cricket," he added.

headlines: Modi govt clears one more step to get Mallya extradited: Jaitley
text: After UK Home Secretary signed an order clearing beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya's extradition to India, Union Minister Arun Jaitley tweeted, "Modi Government clears one more step to get Mallya extradited while Opposition rallies around the Saradha Scamsters." Jaitley's tweet came amid opposition parties extending support to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee in ongoing protest against CBI.

headlines: Dont need certificate of courage from you: Gadkari to Rahul
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday took a dig at the Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying he doesn't need a certificate of courage from Rahul. His comment came after Rahul said Gadkari is the "only one in the BJP with some guts". Gadkari said he was surprised to see Rahul referring to twisted media reports to attack the BJP.

headlines: Kolkata Police wanted info on our probe plan: CBI official
text: A senior CBI official on Monday claimed the Kolkata Police wanted information on the "investigation plan" of the agency officials, who were detained for a few hours at a city police station. He added the police kept pressurising the CBI team. The CBI couldn't complete the proceedings and had to return due to forceful obstruction by the police, he said.

headlines: Tejashwi Yadav, DMK's Kanimozhi join WB CM Mamata's dharna
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and DMK's Kanimozhi on Monday extended their support to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by sharing the stage where she has been sitting on 'Save the Democracy' dharna. Mamata is protesting against the CBI's move to raid Kolkata Police chief in connection with chit fund scams. Ready to give life but will not compromise, Mamata said.

headlines: Intelligent data platform fleetx raises pre-Series A funding
text: Gurugram-based intelligent fleet management and predictive analytics platform fleetx has raised pre-Series A funding from India Quotient, LetsVenture's Angel Fund and others. Last year, fleetx raised angel funding from Travel Boutique Online Founders Ankush Nijhawan and Gaurav Bhatnagar, Mediology Co-founder Manish Dhingra, and others. The startup was founded in 2017 by IIT, NIT and Purdue alumni.

headlines: Owl enters cockpit of Jet Airways aircraft parked in Mumbai
text: A barn owl was found inside the cockpit of a Jet Airways aircraft on Monday when it was parked at the Mumbai airport. The owl was later handed over to Fire Department of Mumbai International Airport for release, reports said. The Mumbai airport has slums in its vicinity that makes easier for birds to enter the area.

headlines: Man buys flat in MP, finds 6-month-old dead body hidden in bed box
text: A man found a body hidden in a bed box in a flat that he had bought in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The flat was locked since June last year and the owners from whom the man had bought the flat have not been seen since that time. Forensic officials said the body had been lying there for six months.

headlines: Kareena Kapoor to appear in a song in 'Dabangg 3': Reports
text: Kareena Kapoor Khan, who had appeared in the song 'Fevicol Se' from Salman Khan's 'Dabangg 2', will reportedly be appearing in a song in 'Dabangg 3'. Arbaaz Khan, who will be producing the film, recently revealed that Salman will start shooting in April. Actress Sonakshi Sinha had earlier confirmed that she will be starring in the film opposite Salman.

headlines: Martin Guptill set to miss T20I series against India
text: New Zealand batsman Martin Guptill is set to miss the three-game T20I series against India starting February 6. The 32-year-old sustained a back injury ahead of the final ODI against India in Wellington. The 28-year-old all-rounder Jimmy Neesham, who scored a 32-ball 44 in the final ODI against India was named as Guptill's replacement.

headlines: Archery board not in list of recognised national federations
text: The Archery Association of India (AAI) does not figure in the Sports Ministry's list of recognised national federations after the annual renewal despite the AAI holding fresh elections under a new constitution. The AAI's elections were initially not recognised by its international parent body, World Archery, but the results were later accepted by them.

headlines: Paks Sana Mir becomes the 2nd Asian to feature in 100 T20Is
text: Pakistan woman cricketer Sana Mir became only the second Asian cricketer to feature in 100 T20I matches. Mir achieved the feat when she stepped onto the field in Pakistan's third T20I against the Windies in Karachi on Sunday. Earlier, Pakistan's Shoaib Malik had become the first Asian cricketer to feature in 100 T20I matches.

headlines: FBI conducts sting on Huawei in Vegas burger outlet: Report
text: As per a report, the FBI conducted a sting operation on Huawei for possible intellectual property theft in a Prime Burger outlet in Las Vegas. Huawei had reportedly taken a prototype of US company Akhan Semiconductor's "Miraj Diamond Glass" and returned it heavily damaged, with three shards missing. Diamond coatings could potentially be used in laser weapons, the report said.

headlines: Cruel to stop govt use of face recognition tech: Microsoft Prez
text: Microsoft President Brad Smith in an interview said a sweeping ban on all government use of facial recognition technology "risks being cruel in its humanitarian effect". He added researchers used the technology to find rare, genetic disease in Africans, Asians and Latin Americans. "Why should we stop a government from helping identify patients who need medical care?" he further said.

headlines: Ready to give my life but won't compromise: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, who is on a dharna following the confrontation between CBI officials and Kolkata Police, has said she is ready to give her life but won't compromise. "I didn't take to streets when you touched TMC leaders," she added. "But I'm angry when they tried to insult the chair of Kolkata Police Commissioner," she further said.

headlines: Swiggy acquihires Bengaluru-based AI startup Kint
text: Food delivery startup Swiggy has acquihired Bengaluru-based AI startup Kint.io for an undisclosed amount. As part of the deal, Kint.io's founding members Pavithra Solai Jawahar and Jagannathan Veeraraghavan will join the Swiggy team, Swiggy said in a statement. Founded in 2014, Kint.io specialises in applying deep learning and computer vision for object recognition in videos.

headlines: Ericsson allowed to file objection over RCom insolvency plea
text: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Monday allowed telecom equipment maker Ericsson India to file its objection over Reliance Communications' (RCom) plea to proceed with insolvency process. This comes after RCom moved NCLAT to withdraw its appeal to settle Ericsson's dues to pursue a debt resolution plan in NCLT. RCom shares fell 35% after the firm approached NCLT.

headlines: UK government clears Vijay Mallya's extradition to India
text: UK Home Secretary Sajid Javid has signed an order to extradite beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya to India. Mallya has 14 days from now to appeal against the extradition order. Earlier, the Westminster Magistrates' Court had sent the case of Mallya to the Home Secretary for a decision on his extradition.

headlines: Went for Aamir's film trials, but no one has time for me: Kangana
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut has said many of her contemporaries don't support her work, but when it comes to promoting their films, they call her "shamelessly". She added, "When Aamir called me for Dangal, Secret Superstar, I went all the way to Ambani's house," she added. "But they don't have time for any of my film screenings," Kangana further said.

headlines: Girls like Alia send me their trailers, don't return favours: Kangana
text: Kangana Ranaut has said many of her contemporaries don't support her work, but when it comes to promoting their films, they call her "shamelessly". "These girls send me their trailers like Alia (Bhatt) sent me the trailer of 'Raazi' and said, 'Please watch it'," she added. Kangana further said when it was their turn, there was no response from anyone.

headlines: Chirag Patil to play father Sandeep Patil in Ranveer starrer '83
text: Actor Chirag Patil will play his father and ex-India cricketer Sandeep Patil in Kabir Khan directorial '83, based on India's first World Cup victory in 1983. "The man who played '83 World Cup with broken ribs will be played by his son," a post on the film's Twitter handle read. Ranveer Singh will play ex-captain Kapil Dev in the film.

headlines: SL batsman 2nd in history to hit 2 double tons in a 1st class match
text: Sri Lankan side Nondescripts Cricket Club captain Angelo Perera has become the second player in history to smash two double hundreds in a single first-class match. The 28-year-old achieved the feat against Sinhalese Sports Club by slamming 201(203) in the first innings and 231(268) in the second. Late Kent batsman Arthur Fagg was the first player to achieve the feat.

headlines: Jacob Martin's wife requests people to contribute for his treatment
text: Ex-India cricketer Jacob Martin's wife Khyati has requested people of India to make "generous contribution" for her husband's ongoing treatment, saying the hospital bill has overshot the total donation. Martin, who had severely injured his lungs in a road accident in December 2018, was scheduled to be discharged on Monday but developed complications and could remain admitted for another week.

headlines: Dhoni runs away from Yuzvendra Chahal to not appear on 'Chahal TV'
text: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was seen chasing wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni to get him to appear on his chat show 'Chahal TV', which is regularly uploaded on the BCCI's official website, following India's 4-1 ODI series victory. However, Dhoni ran away from Chahal, waved him goodbye and went towards the dressing room. Chahal then interviewed Rohit Sharma for this show.

headlines: Mamata Banerjee gives away police awards near dharna site
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday handed over awards to police officers on a stage adjacent to her 'Save the Democracy' dharna site. The function was the Investiture ceremony of annual awards for the state and Kolkata police. The CM is sitting on dharna after a huge showdown between the Kolkata Police and officials of the CBI on Sunday.

headlines: Parrikar surviving on God's blessings, ailment has no cure: Lobo
text: BJP legislator and deputy speaker of the legislative assembly, Michael Lobo on Monday said that Goa CM Manohar Parrikar is surviving on "Gods blessings" in combating the ailment that "has got no cure." Goa will plunge into a political crisis the day Parrikar steps down as CM, Lobo added. The 63-year-old Goa CM is suffering from a pancreatic ailment.

headlines: CJI-led SC bench to hear CBI's plea against WB govt on Feb 5
text: Supreme Court's three-judge bench headed by CJI Ranjan Gogoi will hear CBI's pleas on February 5. The CBI on Monday has filed pleas against West Bengal government and Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar for alleged non-cooperation in a case connected with Saradha chit fund scam. Justice Deepak Gupta and Justice Sanjiv Khanna will be part of the bench.

headlines: Dekh bhai, promise not to take bribe: PM's mom when he became Guj CM
text: PM Narendra Modi in an interview to 'Humans of Bombay' revealed that his mother Heeraben Modi said, "Dekh bhai...I dont understand what you do...but promise me you'll never take bribe," after he became Gujarat's CM in 2001. "Those words really impacted me," said PM. "A woman...who has lived in poverty her entire life...asked me to not take bribe," he added.

headlines: Small plane crashes into a house in US' California; 5 killed
text: A small plane crashed into a single-family home in US' California on Sunday, killing the male pilot, who was the only person in the plane, and all four occupants of the house. The plane had caught fire mid-flight before crashing into the two-storey house. An aviation accident investigator said that debris was scattered over four blocks.

headlines: 50-yr-old flight attendant walks on 2-seater aircraft's wing midair
text: A United Airlines flight attendant walked on a wing of a 2-seater aircraft to celebrate her 50th birthday. "I knew I'd to do it...This will live on in my memory until my last day," Sabrina Swenson, who was tied to a harness, said. Swenson took training at Mason Wing Walking Academy in Washington before she and her pilot took off.

headlines: Karthik could be reserve opener for India in WC: Gavaskar
text: Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar said that India could use Dinesh Karthik as a reserve opener for the ICC World Cup 2019. Gavaskar also picked wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant for the five-match ODI series at home against Australia next month. Speaking about the Indian team featuring three wicket-keepers, Gavaskar said, "If the team has three wicket-keepers, so be it."

headlines: Indian-origin NZ player collapses to death on-field during match
text: New Zealand cricketer Hareesh Gangadharan passed away after he collapsed on the field during a match on Saturday. Gangadharan, a cricketer of Indian ethnicity, was a member of Green Island Cricket Club's Second Grade team. "Early indications are that the player has had a heart attack," New Zealand Cricket's manager of public affairs Richard Boock said.

headlines: BJP used me to win 2014 elections: Anna Hazare
text: Social activist Anna Hazare, on the sixth day of his hunger strike, said that the BJP "used" him in the 2014 elections. "Everybody knows that it was my agitation for Lokpal that catapulted the BJP and also the AAP to power," he added. Hazare is fasting to press for the appointment of Lokpal, Lokayukta and resolution of farmers' issues.

headlines: Those who steal are afraid, but why is Mamata? Oil Minister
text: Talking about West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's dharna following confrontation between CBI and Kolkata Police, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "What is she so scared of? Only those who steal are afraid." "It was after the Supreme Courts direction in 2013 that an inquiry began," he added. "If Mamata is so fearless, why is she opposing it?" he further said.

headlines: Bengal situation like Emergency days: Former PM Deve Gowda
text: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said the situation in West Bengal is similar to that of the Emergency days. He added, "I am shocked learning about the CBI rushing to arrest the Police Commissioner and subsequent developments in West Bengal." He further said that the country has faced similar kind of "unconstitutional methods" during the Emergency.

headlines: Ola, Uber created over 2 million jobs: NITI Aayog CEO Kant
text: The government think tank NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant said ride-hailing startups Ola and Uber have created about 2.2 million jobs in India. This comes after a Business Standard report quoted an unreleased government survey as saying India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% during 2017-2018. In 2017-18 transport sector raised almost 3.4 million jobs, Kant added.

headlines: Koenigsegg aims to make completely CO2 neutral supercar: CEO
text: Swedish automaker Koenigsegg's CEO Christian von Koenigsegg in a recent interview said the automaker's "ambition" is to make its upcoming 'slightly lower priced' hybrid supercar "completely CO2 neutral". "[W]e can...cold-start the car on pure alcohol, down to -30°C, so theres no need for any fossil fuel mix", he said. Car will combine automaker's combustion engine technology with electrification.

headlines: Rajinikanth's daughter confirms 2nd wedding a week before marriage
text: Actor Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya Rajinikanth took to social media to confirm her second wedding to actor and businessman Vishagan Vanangamudi on February 11, which will be held in Chennai. Sharing a picture of herself, Soundarya wrote, "#OneWeekToGo #BrideMode #Blessed." She was earlier married to industrialist Ashwin Ramkumar and they got divorced in 2017 after six years of marriage.

headlines: Social media users liken US singer Julia Michaels to Anushka Sharma
text: Several social users on Twitter and Instagram are likening American singer-songwriter Julia Michaels to actress Anushka Sharma. A user commented, "@juliamichaels looks more like @AnushkaSharma than Anushka herself!" "Never knew you had a twin sister in India," another user wrote. Meanwhile, another comment read, "Julia Michaels must be wondering what just happened. Why she's getting so much attention."

headlines: ICC bans WI captain for slow over-rate, Warne criticises decision
text: Windies captain Jason Holder has been banned for one Test and fined 40% of his match fee by the ICC for maintaining a slow over-rate during the second Test against England, which Windies won on the third day on Saturday. Cricketer-turned-commentator Shane Warne criticised the decision, tweeting, "The Test didn't go 3 days...What a ridiculous decision...where's the common sense here?"

headlines: Body found in wreckage of plane carrying Argentine footballer
text: A body has been found in the wreckage of plane carrying missing 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala and 59-year-old pilot David Ibbotson, Air Accidents Investigation Branch has confirmed. The wreckage of the missing plane was found in the English Channel on Sunday, hours after underwater search was launched. The plane had vanished over the English Channel on January 21.

headlines: Modi government playing with fire in WB: Shatrughan Sinha
text: Rebel BJP leader Shatrughan Sinha on Monday took a dig at the PM Narendra Modi-led central government accusing it of playing with fire by targeting West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. He added that the BJP has almost lost the credibility and people are not accepting whatever the party is saying. He said, "Let's not get into knee jerk panic action-reaction".

headlines: Not 51, only 2 women entered Sabarimala temple: Kerala govt
text: Kerala Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran has informed the state assembly that the government has confirmation about only two women in the 10-50 age group offering prayers at the Sabarimala temple. Earlier, it was reported that around 51 women had managed to enter the temple for prayers. The minister was responding to question raised by Congress MLAs in the state assembly.

headlines: 9 EU nations recognise Guaidó as Venezuela's interim President
text: Nine European Union nations including the UK, France and Germany have recognised Juan Guaidó as Venezuela's interim President after the country's President Nicolás Maduro failed to meet an ultimatum calling for elections within eight days. Spain, Sweden, Denmark, Austria, the Netherlands and Latvia are among the nine EU nations. Earlier, the US recognised Guaidó as Venezuela's interim leader.

headlines: Pentagon sending 3,750 extra US forces to border with Mexico
text: The US Department of Defence is sending 3,750 additional US forces to the southwest border with Mexico for three months to support border agents. The deployment will raise the total number of active-duty forces supporting Customs and Border Protection agents there to about 4,350. "We will continue to evaluate the force composition required to secure the border," the Pentagon said.

headlines: Shami was ranked 56th before Aus, NZ series, now ranked 30th
text: Indian pacer Mohammad Shami, who was ranked 56th after the last ODI he played before the ODI series in Australia and New Zealand, is now ranked 30th following his performances in Australia and New Zealand. Shami was named the Player of the Tournament in the recently-concluded ODI series against New Zealand after he picked up nine wickets in the series.

headlines: Dont see light at the end of tunnel for SL: Marvan Atapattu
text: Following Sri Lanka's Test series loss to Australia, Marvan Atapattu said, "I would say there have been bad times. But we always could see a light at the end of the tunnel... [W]hat I see now, there's nothing like that." "[I]t's something to do with people outside waiting to come into the [Sri Lankan] board," Atapattu added.

headlines: Facebook agrees to share user chat details with Delhi Police
text: Facebook has agreed to share 'Messenger' chat details in sensitive cases, especially those involving women and children, Delhi Police said. Police personnel told Facebook that while probing some kidnapping for ransom cases, they need to scan victim's chats to gather clues, an officer said. Facebook was also requested to provide IP register, mobile numbers and emails, as per officials.
