headlines: Naidu a U-turn CM, won't take him back in NDA: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday called Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu a "U-turn chief minister". "When Atal Bihari Vajpayee became the PM, Naidu joined the NDA, but left it in 2005 after the NDA government fell in 2004," he added. Shah further said that "all doors to the NDA are closed for Naidu. We will not take him back".

headlines: BJP gone from MP, yet oppression prevails: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Sunday said, "Government oppression still prevails in [Madhya Pradesh]." "The people are feeling relieved now as the BJP government has gone from here. However, initial functioning of the newly formed Congress government isn't satisfying people either," she added. Congress had won the recent Assembly elections in the state after BSP lent its support.

headlines: Father of slain Army soldier Aurangzeb joins BJP
text: Mohammad Hanief, the father of Army soldier Aurangzeb, who was abducted and killed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama last year, joined the BJP on Sunday. "I have joined BJP for its pro-poor policies," Hanief said. "PM Modi-led government is the best in the country which thinks about the poor unlike the previous governments," he added.

headlines: Gadkari only one in BJP with some guts: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Monday took to Twitter to praise Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, saying, "You are the only one in BJP with some guts." Rahul said this in reference to Gadkari's statement "one who cannot take care of home, cannot manage the country". He further asked Gadkari to comment on Rafale scam, destruction of institutions and farmers' distress.

headlines: Paytm Mall cuts down cashbacks by over 80% across categories
text: Paytm's e-commerce unit 'Paytm Mall' has cut down cashbacks by over 80% across categories to build "stronger O2O (online-to-offline) business model". Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said they would direct cashbacks from warehouses to physical stores. He said, "Most brands...are well distributed across thousands of cities...while warehouse inventory...is concentrated in top 20 to 30 cities only".

headlines: Over 2,100 startups served 'angel tax' notices: Report
text: Over 2,100 startups that raised angel funding have received 'angel tax' notices from I-T Department, a survey by Indian Private Equity & Venture Capital Association (IVCA) and LocalCircles showed. Around 73% of the 2,883 respondents received the notices. The startups said the notice was slapped for raising capital over the "fair market value" or for raising capital from unknown sources.

headlines: Amazon suspends grocery service after revised e-comm rules
text: E-commerce major Amazon has suspended its grocery service 'Amazon Pantry' in India for an undisclosed duration of time. This development follows the February 1 implementation of the revised FDI rules on e-commerce that prohibit e-tailers from selling products of companies in which they have a stake. Amazon also had to remove numerous products including floor cleaners from its India website.

headlines: 251 sedition cases filed in Assam since May 2016
text: Assam government has registered as many as 251 sedition cases since May 26, 2016, the Assembly was informed on Monday. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Chandra Mohan Patowary said that these cases have been filed against militant groups such as Dima Halam Daogah and Zeliangrong United Front, among others. Such cases were also registered against several individuals, Patowary added.

headlines: Team India always gets Josh of nation super high: Vicky Kaushal
text: Sharing BCCI's video of India's 'How's the Josh?' celebration after their ODI series victory over New Zealand, actor Vicky Kaushal tweeted, "Our...cricket team always gets...Josh of the nation super high." BCCI had shared the video with the caption, "Looks like the 'Josh' in the squad is 'High Sir'." In the video, Kedar Jadhav was asking the team, "How's the Josh?"

headlines: Ayushmann's wife shares picture of her breast cancer surgery scar
text: To mark World Cancer Day on Monday, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap shared a bare-back picture of herself taken by photographer Atul Kasbekar, showing her breast cancer surgery scar. "I truly embrace all my scars as they're my badges of honour," she wrote. "I want to celebrate not the disease but the spirit with which I endured," Tahira added.

headlines: Refugee footballer pleads for Thailand to not send him to Bahrain
text: Refugee footballer Hakeem al-Araibi, who was arrested on November 27, 2018 in Bangkok when he arrived for a honeymoon with his wife, has urged Thailand to not send him to his home country Bahrain. Hakeem, who was granted a refugee status in Australia in 2017, has been given 60 days to prepare a defence against Bahrain's attempt to extradite him.

headlines: There may be constitutional breakdown in WB: Rajnath Singh
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday said there may be a constitutional breakdown in West Bengal in the wake of the Kolkata Police-CBI face-off. He added it was "unprecedented" the way the CBI was stopped from performing its duty in Kolkata. He said the Centre has the power to take action to maintain normalcy in any part of the country.

headlines: BJP trying to intimidate Opposition through CBI: Akhilesh
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav on Monday accused the Modi government of trying to scare and intimidate the Opposition by using government agencies like the CBI. Referring to the confrontation between CBI and Kolkata Police in West Bengal, he added similar things were heard from other states as well. He also accused the Modi government of "politicising institutions".

headlines: If Kolkata police chief mulls destroying evidence, he'll regret: SC
text: CJI Ranjan Gogoi has said, "If Kolkata Police Commissioner even remotely thinks of destroying evidence, bring the material before this Court. We will come down so heavily on him that he will regret." Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar is alleged to have destroyed evidence in the Saradha chit fund cases. The SC will hear CBI's plea against Rajeev on Tuesday.

headlines: Human mind can overcome any disease: Parrikar on World Cancer Day
text: To mark the World Cancer Day on Monday, Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar tweeted, "Human mind can overcome any disease #WorldCancerDay." The 63-year-old is suffering from a pancreatic ailment and is currently admitted at the Institute Rotary Cancer Hospital at AIIMS, New Delhi. Parrikar was diagnosed with a pancreatic ailment in February last year.

headlines: You'll leave White House stained with blood: Venezuela Prez to Trump
text: Stating that Donald Trump is pursuing a "dirty" imperialist conspiracy to overthrow him, Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has said that the US President will leave the White House "stained with blood". "Stop. Stop, Trump! Hold it right there! You are making mistakes," Maduro added. Notably, the US has recognised Venezuela's opposition leader Juan Guaidó as interim President.

headlines: Gay girl is still regular girl: Sonam on 'Ek Ladki...' role
text: Sonam Kapoor, while talking about her character in 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga', said, "It was important to show her as simple and ordinary because a gay girl is still a regular girl." Sonam added that the makers didn't want to stereotype her character. The film revolves around the relationship between a father and a daughter.

headlines: There's more to cancer than being called a survivor: Sonali
text: Sonali Bendre, on the occasion of World Cancer Day on Monday, shared her picture and wrote, "There's more to cancer than being emotional or weak or even being called a fighter or a survivor." "I urge you all to take the time to understand it...find out what works for you and to be diligent about your treatment," she further wrote.

headlines: Interim Budget has never meddled with tax rates: Chidambaram
text: Criticising the Interim Budget 2019-20, senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "Never has an Interim Budget tinkered with the tax rates." He further accused the government of meddling with income-tax laws and added the Budget violated both convention and the spirit of an Interim Budget. The Budget was like "allowing the camel's nose in the tent", he further said.

headlines: Real Madrid's 18-yr-old Vinicius scores 1st La Liga goal
text: Real Madrid's 18-year-old attacker Vinicius Jr scored his first La Liga goal as Real Madrid cruised to a 3-0 win over Alaves on Sunday. The match also saw Karim Benzema score his sixth goal in four games. The was Real Madrid's fifth consecutive win, helping them reach within two points of second-placed Atletico Madrid.

headlines: Pathan brothers' cricket academy opens 15th academy in Ranchi
text: The Cricket Academy of Pathans, a cricket academy run by Indian cricketers Irfan and Yusuf Pathan, opened its 15th academy in Ranchi, Jharkhand on Sunday. The Pathan brothers had launched these academies over 2 years ago. Yusuf, who serves as the Director at the Cricket Academy of Pathans, said, "We are providing every possible assistance to the aspiring cricketers."

headlines: Ex-NZ captain Brendon McCullum calls time on BBL career
text: Former New Zealand captain Brendon McCullum announced that he is set to end his Big Bash League (BBL) career and that Friday's match against Melbourne Stars might be his last BBL match. "I'll continue to play T20 cricket in 2019 in various competitions around the world and will then look to transition into a coaching career," said Brisbane Heat's McCullum.

headlines: Starc registers 10-wicket-haul as Australia win Test series 2-0
text: Mitchell Starc registered a ten-wicket-haul in the match as Australia won the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka by winning the second Test by 366 runs on Monday. Tim Paine received the Warne-Muralitharan Trophy from former Australia batsman Michael Hussey. Australia will now play Test cricket in August, when they will travel to England for the Ashes series.

headlines: Aguero scores three as Man City beat Arsenal 3-1
text: Sergio Aguero scored his 14th hat-trick for Manchester City as they closed the gap on Premier League leaders Liverpool to only two points after a 3-1 victory over Arsenal on Sunday. With the loss, Arsenal have dropped down to the sixth place in the EPL table after Manchester United's latest win at Leicester City.

headlines: Mamata Banerjee is like demoness Taadka: Haryana Minister
text: Haryana Minister Anil Vij on Sunday took to Twitter to compare West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to demoness Taadka from Ramayana. He tweeted "saints used to perform Yagya and Taadka used to interrupt them. Mamataji is doing the same." This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's chopper was denied permission to land in the state ahead of a rally.

headlines: BJP to meet CEC over WB govt blocking its rallies: Reports
text: A BJP delegation will reportedly meet the Chief Election Commissioner on Monday to protest against West Bengal government for blocking its rallies in the state. Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will reportedly be part of the delegation. This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's chopper was denied permission to land at Balurghat, where he was scheduled to address a rally.

headlines: Before PM Modi, PMs sat in last row at int'l platforms: Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that before PM Narendra Modi, those holding the prime ministerial post sat in the last row at international platforms and "just clapped". "However, today PM inaugurates...programmes in presence of the US President and gives inaugural speeches," he added. He further said that 2014 onwards, both India and UP have witnessed "unprecedented development".

headlines: Opp'n is divided by regions, united by corruption: Javadekar
text: Talking about Opposition parties supporting West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's dharna, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Monday said that the Opposition is "divided by regions and united by corruption". "Who are these people? They are out on bail...The corrupt are standing together," he added. Mamata on Sunday went on an indefinite dharna to protest CBI action in Kolkata.

headlines: Maharashtra Cabinet approves 10% general category quota
text: The Maharashtra Cabinet on Monday approved the 10% reservation in government jobs and educational institutes for the economically weaker section in general category in the state. Maharashtra has become the seventh state to approve the implementation of the bill. The Constitution (124th Amendment) Bill, 2019 was approved by President Ram Nath Kovind on January 12.

headlines: Came to Mumbai at 16, got rejected in Boogie Woogie auditions: Rao
text: Rajkummar Rao has revealed he first came to Mumbai at the age of 16 when he was in the tenth standard. "I always wanted to be a dancer and came here for the auditions of 'Boogie Woogie' where I got rejected," he added. "I was very disheartened...but today I'm...glad...I got rejected. It got me to a better career," said Rao.

headlines: Kareena Kapoor walks the ramp at Lakmé Fashion Week grand finale
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan walked the ramp for designers Shantanu and Nikhil during the grand finale of Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019 on Sunday. She wore a black off-shoulder gown with thigh-high slits for the event. This was the first time that the designer duo featured at the fashion week's grand finale.

headlines: Real surprise: Jadhav on Dhoni advising him in Marathi during ODI
text: Team India's Kedar Jadhav took to Twitter to reveal that it came to him as a "real surprise" when MS Dhoni advised him in Marathi during fifth ODI against New Zealand. "Pudhe nako bhau...gheun taak (Don't bowl full...get him)," Dhoni was heard telling Jadhav. "You always feel at home on foreign tours when @msdhoni is behind the stumps," Jadhav tweeted.

headlines: Jason Roy pulls off one-handed diving catch near boundary
text: Sylhet Sixers' Jason Roy pulled off a one-handed diving catch near the boundary rope to dismiss Chittagong Vikings' Yasir Ali for 27(27) in their Bangladesh Premier League 2019 match on Friday. Ali pulled a delivery from Alok Kapali in the eight over with an aim at clearing deep midwicket but Roy plucked the ball with his outstretched left hand.

headlines: Wreckage from missing plane carrying Argentine footballer found
text: The wreckage from the plane carrying 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala has been discovered, two weeks after it disappeared from radar over English Channel. A search boat hired privately by Sala's family located the wreckage after an official search operation was called off on January 24. Sala and 59-year-old pilot, Dave Ibbotson, were travelling to Wales' Cardiff from France's Nantes.

headlines: Marriage has been a lucky charm: Saina Nehwal
text: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal, who won Indonesia Masters title last week, has said marriage has been a lucky charm for her. "Everything is falling in place. It's like a dream run. I never thought...after marriage, I would go on to win my first title after two years," added the 28-year-old, who married fellow shuttler Parupalli Kashyap in December last year.

headlines: Will quit politics when PM Modi decides to retire: Smriti Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday said, "The day 'pradhan sevak' Narendra Modiji decides to hang his boots, I'll also leave Indian politics." "I take pride in the fact that I got an opportunity to work with charismatic leaders like Atal Bihari Vajpayeeji and Modiji," she added. She asserted that PM Modi will stay in politics for many more years.

headlines: Who is Kolkata police chief for whom Mamata Banerjee sat on dharna?
text: Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar, for whom West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee sat on a dharna, is a 1989-batch IPS officer. Mamata began the 'Save the Constitution' dharna after CBI officials arrived at Kumar's residence in connection with the agency's probe into the Saradha and Rose Valley Ponzi scams. Kumar headed the SIT that was looking into both the scams.

headlines: 4-yr-old picks gun kept under mattress by father, shoots pregnant mom
text: An eight-month pregnant mother was shot in the face by her four-year-old son in the US state of Washington. The child found the loaded unsecured gun under a mattress after his father hid it there because he was afraid of a recent crime in the neighbourhood. She was taken to a hospital with life-threatening injuries, however her condition has improved.

headlines: Helen aunty's grace is unmatched: Sonakshi on recreating Mungda
text: Sonakshi Sinha, who will be recreating Helen's 'Mungda Mungda' song for her upcoming film 'Total Dhamaal', said, "Helen aunty's grace and charm are unmatched, and it would be foolish to even try to copy her." Sonakshi added that the recreated version of the song will be "nothing like the original song" which was a part of the 1977 film 'Inkaar'.

headlines: Really like Karan Johar, he's in your face whatever he is: Kangana
text: Kangana Ranaut, who had called Karan Johar the "flagbearer of nepotism" and a "movie mafia" on a 'Koffee With Karan' episode in 2017, has said, "I really like [Karan], he is in your face whatever he is." In response to Kangana's "flagbearer of nepotism" statement, Karan had said that she should leave the film industry if it is so bad.

headlines: I hope I make 'Munna Bhai 3' this year: Vidhu Vinod Chopra
text: Vidhu Vinod Chopra, while talking about the third instalment of 'Munna Bhai' has said, "I haven't yet made my next 'Munna Bhai' because I didn't get a proper script...hope I make it this year." The 2003 film 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.' and the 2006 film 'Lage Raho Munna Bhai' was directed by Rajkumar Hirani who was recently accused of sexual allegations.

headlines: So much to love about Hardik Pandya the cricketer, tweets user
text: Reacting to Hardik Pandya's hat-trick of sixes and his 22-ball 45 in the fifth ODI against New Zealand, a user tweeted, "So much to love about Hardik Pandya the cricketer." "Excellent burst from Pandya. He hits boundaries from shapes and positions that others may not be able to. Brilliant timer," tweeted commentator Harsha Bhogle.

headlines: Bernard Tomic deliberately damaging Australian tennis: TA head
text: Tennis Australia (TA) chief Craig Tiley has said that Australian tennis player Bernard Tomic is 'deliberately trying to damage [the] culture' of Australian tennis. "We expect players to be respectful of the sport and each other... Bernard does not meet the standards of behaviour and commitment to himself, the team or the sport," Tiley added about Tomic.

headlines: Marcus Rashford helps Man United maintain winning run
text: Manchester United have registered five successive away victories after Marcus Rashford's goal proved to be the match-winner for his side in the EPL fixture against Leicester City on Sunday. With the win, United have extended their unbeaten run under interim manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to 10 games. Rashford's goal was his 10th goal of the season.

headlines: South Africa clinch T20I series after Pak fall short by 7 runs
text: South Africa took an unassailable lead in the three-match T20I series against Pakistan after the visitors fell short by seven runs in the second T20I on Sunday. South Africa's stand-in captain David Miller won his second consecutive Player of the Match award after scoring an unbeaten 29-ball 65. The series' final match will be played at Centurion on Wednesday.

headlines: If US Prez threatens a person, we'd take action: Twitter CEO
text: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in an interview said if a public leader like the US President makes a "violent threat" to an individual, Twitter would take action. Talking about US President Donald Trump's tweets 'threatening' North Korea, he added, "If you...look at President Obama...[he made] threats surrounding the same country". US presidents have used "similar language" across mediums, he said.

headlines: Leaving Facebook for a month made users happier: Study
text: A study conducted by NYU and Stanford University researchers has found that Facebook users, who deactivated their accounts for a month, self-reported "improvements" in happiness. Users also reduced time spent on other social media platforms and increased their offline activity like socialising with family, the study added. However, deactivation reduced users' factual news knowledge.

headlines: Philippines tops daily internet use in world at 10 hrs: Report
text: The Philippines has topped the global internet usage index with an average of ten hours and two minutes spent on the internet across devices per day, according to a report by HootSuite and We Are Social. India reportedly recorded an average daily internet use of nearly eight hours. The worldwide average usage was over six hours, the report added.

headlines: Over 12 lakh new voters added to UP electoral roll
text: According to Uttar Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer L Venkateshwarlu, over 12 lakh new voters have been added to the electoral roll in the state. "The total number of voters in the state is 14.40 crore," he added. "As many as 16.75 lakh voters fall in the age group of 18-19," he further said.

headlines: Will return Padma Bhushan if promises not fulfilled: Hazare
text: Social activist Anna Hazare on Sunday said, "If this government doesn't fulfil its promises...in the next few days, I will return my Padma Bhushan." "If the country...is in this condition, then why should I keep that?" he added. Hazare is currently on a hunger strike against the delay in appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta, and for resolution of farmers' issue.

headlines: CBI has got to do its job or not: Sitharaman to Opposition
text: Taking a dig at the Opposition, Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "CBI has got to do its job or not?" "When CBI does its job, opposition parties call it a political vendetta, when it doesn't, they call it a caged parrot," she added. This comes after Kolkata Police detained the CBI team that raided Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar's residence.

headlines: 7.4cr have bathed in Sangam during Kumbh till Feb 3: UP govt
text: Around 7.49 crore people have taken bath in Sangam at Prayagraj till Sunday during the Kumbh Mela, the Uttar Pradesh government said. It added that 2.25 crore people bathed in the Sangam on the first day of Kumbh Mela. It further said that an average of 5-7 lakh devotees took a dip in Sangam every day between January 21-30.

headlines: Trump says use of military force in Venezuela 'an option'
text: Amid the political crisis in Venezuela, US President Donald Trump has said that military intervention in the country is "an option". Trump added he turned down a meeting with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro several months ago due to the "really horrible things" that had been happening in the country. The US recognised Venezuela's opposition leader Juan Guaidó as interim President.

headlines: Yuvraj meets Shakti Kapoor at airport, makes him say 'Aaoo Lolita'
text: Indian all-rounder Yuvraj Singh met actor Shakti Kapoor at Mumbai airport and shared a video of their meet on Instagram. Yuvraj called Shakti "an all-time rockstar" and asked him to say his "epic dialogue" after which the actor said, "Aaoo Lolita". Shakti added that he loves Yuvraj and wants to see him hit six sixes in an over again.

headlines: We haven't met since, it isn't bitter: Sidharth on breakup with Alia
text: Actor Sidharth Malhotra on 'Koffee With Karan' revealed he hasn't met actress Alia Bhatt after their breakup and that their relationship is civil and not bitter. "I have known her for much longer even before we dated," said Sidharth. "There is a reason why two people decide not to be together. There were lots of ups and downs," he added.

headlines: Shami India's standout performer in last 5 months: Ravi Shastri
text: Head coach Ravi Shastri has said that fast bowler Mohammad Shami has been Team India's standout performer in the last five months. "He got a kick up the backside after failing the yo-yo test. He went back, did the hard yards, came back fit and hasn't broken down since. He has been outstanding, that too across all formats," Shastri added.

headlines: Never leave crease with Dhoni behind: ICC to Yoko on 'life advice'
text: Late singer John Lennon's widow and artist Yoko Ono asked her Twitter followers to give advice that would make "our lives heal and shine". Responding to Yoko Ono's tweet, the ICC wrote, "Never leave your crease with MS Dhoni behind the stumps!" Earlier today, New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham was run-out by an MS Dhoni direct hit in the fifth ODI.

headlines: Got positive vibes from PCB that I'll captain Pak in WC: Sarfaraz
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, who was banned for four matches over his 'Abey Kaale' remark on South Africa's Andile Phehlukwayo, said he has got "positive vibes" from PCB that he will captain Pakistan in 2019 World Cup. "My nature won't ever change...I do captaincy like that, I talk a lot behind the stumps," he added.

headlines: Black cat stops play for 2 minutes in Wolves' PL match vs Everton
text: The Premier League match between Everton and Wolves at Goodison Park on Saturday was stopped for over two minutes after a black cat invaded pitch. It entered the field just after Wolves scored their third goal in 66th minute and charged from one end to the other before leaving. No player or official tried to help it escape the field.

headlines: In team, name on front more important than one on the back: Jadhav
text: Following India's 4-1 ODI series victory against New Zealand, batting all-rounder Kedar Jadhav took to Twitter to share an article on him asking the team 'How's the josh?' during celebrations. "As they say, when you work as a team, name on the front is more important than name on the back...How's the josh?...Right Vicky Kaushal, MS Dhoni," he wrote.

headlines: CBI team detained outside Kolkata Police chief Kumar's house
text: Kolkata Police on Sunday detained the CBI team that raided the Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar's residence over allegations of his involvement in chit fund scams in West Bengal. The CBI investigators were also not allowed to enter the residence of Kumar. TMC MP Derek O'Brien called the raid a 'constitutional coup' and 'unabated destruction of institutions' by the BJP.

headlines: CBI gets govt nod to prosecute Chidambaram in INX Media case
text: The Law Ministry on Sunday gave its nod to the CBI to prosecute former Finance Minister P Chidambaram in the INX media case. The CBI on January 25 had told the Delhi High Court that custodial interrogation of Chidambaram was required in the case. "We want to exercise our statutory right to investigate the case," Solicitor General told the court.

headlines: Mamata sits on 'dharna' to protest CBI action in Kolkata
text: Protesting CBI action in Kolkata, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Sunday went on an indefinite 'dharna' in front of the Metro Channel Control Post, Kolkata. She said her agitation was to "save democracy, Constitution and the country". She added that on Monday proceedings in the state assembly will take place where she will hold a meeting.

headlines: Hyderabad's Mayor fined for parking in restricted zone
text: Hyderabad Mayor Bonthu Rammohan was fined by the city traffic police for parking his car in a 'No Parking' zone. A local of the city took a photo of the car and uploaded it on social media drawing the attention of the traffic police, reports said. Following this, the police issued a challan and Rammohan paid the penalty.

headlines: Pandya a natural talent and a match winner: Ravi Shastri
text: Praising Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya, Indian cricket team coach Ravi Shastri said, "He's a natural talent, he is a match-winner. And he showed what he can do today with the bat." "Those 20-30 runs made all the difference today," Shastri added. Pandya scored a 22-ball 45 which included five sixes and also picked up two wickets during New Zealand's chase.

headlines: Dhoni third in list of players with most ODI matches for India
text: MS Dhoni reached the third spot in the list of cricketers with the most number of ODI appearances for India. The list is being led by Sachin Tendulkar with 463 ODIs and Rahul Dravid with 340 ODIs is occupying the second spot. Dhoni's appearance in the fifth ODI against New Zealand was his 335th for India in ODI cricket.

headlines: Next time, elect CM who can speak Odia: Amit Shah in Odisha
text: Addressing a rally in Odisha, BJP President Amit Shah urged the people to elect a CM who can speak Odia language. "It's a matter of respect for Odia language," he added. Further, taking a dig at CM Naveen Patnaik, Shah said, "If the CM doesn't even know the language, does he have the right to govern the state?"

headlines: SoftBank fund may put $1.5bn in China used car site Guazi: Report
text: SoftBank Vision Fund is reportedly in talks with Chinese used car trading platform Guazi.com to invest up to $1.5 billion at a valuation of $8.5 billion before investment. The report added the fund had also held talks with Guazi.com rival Renrenche, backed by Chinese ride-hailing platform Didi Chuxing. Guazi.com counts Tencent Holdings and Sequoia Capital China among its backers.

headlines: NASA's Hubble 'accidentally' finds 13-bn-yr-old dwarf galaxy
text: Astronomers using NASA's Hubble Space Telescope "accidentally" found a 13-billion-year-old dwarf galaxy, while trying to photograph globular star cluster NGC 6752. The galaxy, located 30 million light-years away from Earth, is one-thirtieth the diameter of the Milky Way galaxy and is roughly a thousand times dimmer than it. The dwarf spheroidal galaxy has been named Bedin 1.

headlines: Insulin-producing cells to help cure type 1 diabetes grown
text: University of California, San Francisco researchers have claimed to be the first to turn human stem cells into mature, insulin-producing cells that could help develop cure for type 1 diabetes. The lab-grown cells act like pancreatic beta cells that produce insulin in humans, a researcher said. Type 1 diabetes destroys insulin-producing pancreas cells thus potentially causing severe organ damage.

headlines: Three, including 2-year-old, die as roof collapses in Thane
text: As many as three people, including a two-year-old girl, were killed after roof of a five-storey building collapsed in Thane's Ulhasnagar on Sunday. "The second floor collapsed onto the first floor which in turn...crashed onto the ground floor where a clinic was situated," an official said. Three others were injured in the incident and are undergoing treatment, another official said.

headlines: NCLT proposal to be same as previous asset sale plans: RCom
text: Reliance Communications (RCom) has said it will propose a similar debt resolution plan to NCLT as it had pursued with creditors. The Anil Ambani-led firm added the key elements of the plan, including the sale of telecom infrastructure assets and spectrum, will remain unchanged. This comes after RCom opted for insolvency proceedings at NCLT as it failed to repay lenders.

headlines: Didn't see my mom for 3 yrs while I was working in India: Nargis
text: Actress Nargis Fakhri has revealed she did not see her mother for three years while she was working in India. "I only worked all the time. I didn't even have my friends and family around... If you don't have the support system, it's detrimental to your health," she added. Nargis further said acting as a job is "super emotionally demanding".

headlines: Was so consumed with work mom used to mail 'Are you alive?': Nargis
text: Actress Nargis Fakhri has revealed during the time she was working in India, she was so consumed with work that her mother used to mail her 'Are you alive?' "I only worked all the time. I didn't even have my friends and family around," she added. "I value my work but now also I value my regular life," said Nargis.

headlines: I consider Kedar Jadhav a proper spinner: Rohit Sharma
text: Rohit Sharma, who was the stand-in captain in the last two ODIs against New Zealand, has said he considers Kedar Jadhav as a proper spinner. "Every game...he bowls at least four-five overs...and gets a wicket...at the crucial time," Rohit added. The 31-year-old further said when Team India plays four seamers, Jadhav gives the balance by being the second spinner.

headlines: MS Dhoni runs NZ batsman out while appealing for LBW against him
text: India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni ran New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham out while appealing for LBW against him in the 37th over in the fifth ODI on Sunday. Neesham was hit on the pads while trying to sweep a Kedar Jadhav delivery. The ball rolled behind to Dhoni and he under-armed it onto the stumps while appealing along with Jadhav.

headlines: Kedar Jadhav asks team 'How's the josh' during trophy presentation
text: During the trophy presentation ceremony following India's 4-1 ODI series victory over New Zealand, batsman Kedar Jadhav quoted the dialogue from 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and asked the team 'How's the josh?' repeatedly. Players including Mohammed Siraj, Khaleel Ahmed and stand-in captain Rohit Sharma responded to Jadhav saying, 'High sir'. The series victory was India's biggest in New Zealand.

headlines: WI captain dedicates win to Joseph who played despite mom's death
text: Windies captain Jason Holder dedicated the victory against England in the second Test to 22-year-old fast bowler Alzarri Joseph, who played just hours after his mother's death on the third day of the Test on Saturday. "To see him in tears...was hard, and we came together in the huddle and we just wanted to do it for him," Holder added.

headlines: Interim Budget a 'jumla' by the BJP govt: CPI Gen Secy Reddy
text: CPI General Secretary S Sudhakar Reddy on Sunday said that the Interim Budget placed by the BJP-led central government is a "jumla". He added that the BJP government is "destroying" all the institutions in the country. He said "even the Parliament does not function properly" and people's issues are not raised inside the Parliament.

headlines: 15 held for stealing 1000 kg 'Nandi' idol from Andhra temple
text: The police on Saturday arrested 15 people in connection with the theft of a 1000 kg 'Nandi' idol from an ancient Shiva temple in Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district. The culprits had stolen the granite idol believing rumours that it had diamonds in it. They dismantled the idol in the outskirts of the district but found no precious stones.

headlines: Kolkata Police chief among 'best in world': Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said the Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar, wanted for questioning by the CBI, is among the "best in the world". She added, "He is working 24x7, and was on leave for only one day recently." The BJP is misusing power to take control of the police and destroy all institutions, she said.

headlines: Chinese Prez surprises people at eatery, says 'just passing through'
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping recently surprised diners at a small Beijing restaurant and chatted with deliverymen ahead of next week's Lunar New Year holiday. As diners stood up to take pictures, he told them not to stop eating on his account and said, "I'm just passing through." He later visited policemen and made dumplings with residents in a courtyard dwelling.

headlines: Police constable shoots himself to death on 26th birthday in Chennai
text: A police constable named K Manikandan posted on night duty allegedly shot himself at around 2 am on his 26th birthday on Sunday in Chennai. He was serving in the Armed Reserve wing and was posted at the Inspector General of Police's office gate. A BSc graduate, Manikandan was reportedly serving in the police for seven months.

headlines: Tulsi Gabbard, 1st Hindu in US Congress, launches prez campaign
text: Tulsi Gabbard, the first-ever Hindu elected to the US Congress, officially launched her 2020 presidential campaign on Saturday. The 37-year-old launched her candidacy in the US state of Hawaii, where she has served as a congresswoman since 2013. A Samoan-American, Gabbard is an Iraq war veteran and a member of the Democratic Party.

headlines: Mom & my boyfriend friends, have anti-Keshav club: LaLiT's co-owner
text: LaLiT Hotels' co-owner Keshav Suri said his mother Jyotsna Suri became best friends with his boyfriend Cyril Feuillebois on meeting him and they even have an 'Anti-Keshav Club'. "Like any mom...mine checked out Cyril from head to toe and asked him about his family," Keshav said on introducing Cyril to his mother. "Our families were more than supportive," he added.

headlines: India 3rd team to beat NZ in 4+ ODIs in a bilateral series in NZ
text: India became only the third team to defeat New Zealand in four or more ODIs in a bilateral series in New Zealand. India managed their only second bilateral ODI series win in New Zealand after the MS Dhoni-led Indian side had registered a 3-1 series win in 2009. India will now play a three-match T20I series against New Zealand.

headlines: Tendulkar praises Indian team's ability to be competitive
text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar praised the Indian cricket team's ability to be competitive "in any part of the world and on any surface". Speaking about India's chances at the upcoming ICC World Cup in England and Wales, Sachin said, "As far as our chances are concerned, I will not hesitate in saying that we are the favourites."

headlines: Windies beat England in a Test series for 1st time in 10 yrs
text: The Windies beat the visiting English side in the second Test to clinch the Test series, their first against England after a gap of ten years. Kemar Roach, who finished with match figures of 8/82, was named Player of the Match. Both the teams are set to play the third and final Test of the series from February 9.

headlines: Messi's brace against Valencia salvages draw for Barcelona
text: Lionel Messi scored a brace to help Barcelona secure a 2-2 draw in Saturday's La Liga match against Valencia. This was the ninth consecutive La Liga match in which Messi scored. Barcelona are set to face Real Madrid in the Copa del Rey on Wednesday. Barcelona are six points ahead of Atletico Madrid in the La Liga points table.

headlines: Irish regulator warns FB of app integration's privacy risks
text: An Irish regulator has asked Facebook Ireland for an "urgent briefing" over privacy risks concerning the proposed integration of WhatsApp, Instagram and Facebook. The regulator seeked assurances adding that previous proposals to share data between Facebook companies had led to data protection concerns. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg recently said the integration would be "good for user experience".

headlines: All will be revealed: Viral Instagram account posts new egg pic
text: The Instagram account that broke American TV personality Kylie Jenner's record of most liked picture by posting an egg's picture, has posted another such picture. The picture features a cracked brown egg with football laces. The post's caption read, "The wait is over. All will be revealed this Sunday following the Super Bowl (American football championship)."

headlines: US student jailed for 10yrs for stealing $5M by SIM swapping
text: American college student Joel Ortiz, who stole over $5 million in cryptocurrency through SIM swapping, pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 10 years in prison. Ortiz is the first person to be sentenced for SIM swap fraud, authorities said. SIM swapping consists of tricking an operator into transferring a user's phone number to a SIM card controlled by the hacker.

headlines: PM Modi inaugurates first-ever university in Ladakh
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated University of Ladakh, the first-ever university in the Ladakh region of Jammu and Kashmir. The university will be a cluster university comprising of degree colleges of Leh, Kargil, Nubra, Zanskar, Drass and Khaltsi. It will have its administrative offices in Leh and Kargil, PM Modi said during the launch.

headlines: Difficult for govt to meet fiscal deficit of 3.4%: Moodys
text: US-based rating agency Moody's has said the government will find it difficult to meet fiscal deficit target of 3.4% of GDP in 2019-20 due to higher spending and low revenue growth. It added the government's debt is "stubbornly high" as a percentage of GDP. It could be brought down only if government sticks to fiscal consolidation path, it further said.

headlines: Ayushmann's wife Tahira walks the ramp at Lakmé Fashion Week
text: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap walked the runway at Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. Tahira shared a picture from the event and wrote, "I got the instructions to not to smile too much, but couldn't control...first time and super fun!" She had revealed in September last year that she has been diagnosed with breast cancer.

headlines: Bored of playing female characters as I've nothing new to offer: Ali
text: Actor-comedian Ali Asgar has said he's now bored of playing female characters because he has nothing new to offer to it. He added, "Now drag is taken for granted. That just because a man is doing a female character, it's funny. It's not! "You can't say 'sir you are experienced, you'll pull it off'...It doesn't work like that," he said.

headlines: Chris Hemsworth wishes Shamita on her b'day, actress shares video
text: Actress Shamita Shetty, who turned 40 on Saturday, took to Instagram to share a video of Hollywood actor Chris Hemsworth wishing her on the occasion of her birthday. She wrote in the caption, "Ok this really made my bday!!!" The video was originally shared by child actor Rudhraksh Jaiswal, who has worked with Hemsworth in the web series 'Dhaka'.

headlines: WI's Darren Bravo takes 342 minutes to score 3rd slowest Test fifty
text: Windies batsman Darren Bravo recorded the third slowest fifty (by time) in 142-year Test history by taking 342 minutes to reach the 50-run mark during the first innings of the second Test against England. The 29-year-old took 215 balls to score the half-century and was stumped on his 216th delivery. Bravo hit two fours and a six during his knock.

headlines: BJP hates Muslims, natives of UP, Bihar: Arvind Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said the BJP hates Muslims and people from eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. "The BJP conspired and deleted...names of 30 lakh voters in Delhi from...electoral roll," he added. He claimed out of the 30 lakh voters 15 lakh belong to UP and Bihar, while eight lakh are Muslims and four lakh are 'baniya'.

headlines: Four BJP men held for thrashing journalist in Chhattisgarh
text: Four BJP functionaries, including the Raipur unit chief, were arrested for allegedly thrashing a local journalist at the party office in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, police said. The journalist had gone to cover a meeting the BJP had called to review their defeat in Raipur city in recent Assembly elections. Journalists had staged a protest demanding the arrest of the four accused.

headlines: Man jailed for life for tying concrete to wife, throwing her in lake
text: A US man who killed his estranged wife in 2016 by tying a massive chunk of concrete to her neck and throwing her off a bridge into a lake has been sentenced to life in prison. Rodolfo 'Rudy' Arellano pleaded guilty to capital murder earlier this week. The 36-year-old could have faced death penalty if convicted at trial.

headlines: My 1st reaction to something I can't get is aggression: Sidharth
text: Sidharth Malhotra, on TV show 'Koffee With Karan', revealed that his first reaction to something that he can't get is aggression, adding, "I just become quiet and aggressive." He further said, "If I didn't have the drive and the aggression, I wouldn't have made it because there are millions of kids just like us who want to become actors."

headlines: I am where I am today because of my modelling career: Diana
text: Diana Penty, who began her modelling career in 2005, has said that she will always be grateful for it, adding, "I'm where I'm today because of my modelling career." "It was through the various magazine covers and TV commercials I was doing at the time that I was spotted and offered my first film 'Cocktail'," she further said.

headlines: Filmmaker Aribam returns Padma Shri to protest Citizenship Bill
text: Manipur filmmaker Aribam Syam Sharma on Sunday returned the Padma Shri award to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016. On January 8, the Lok Sabha passed the bill which seeks to give citizenship to Hindus, Sikhs, Jains, Buddhists, Christians and Parsis from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh. The veteran director received the award in 2006.

headlines: Jaitley likely to skip Budget debate in Parliament: Report
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley has said his return to India in time for the Budget debate in Parliament will depend on when his doctors allow him to leave. He had missed presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 as he had to fly to the US for treatment. "As of present... Piyush Goyal will be replying [to the Budget debate]," he added.

headlines: Vijay Shankar gets run-out after mix-up with Ambati Rayudu
text: Indian all-rounder Vijay Shankar got run-out after getting into a mix-up with Ambati Rayudu during the fifth ODI against New Zealand on Sunday. Shankar hit the ball towards mid-on and tried taking a single, but non-striker Rayudu was looking at the ball and did not respond to Shankar's call. Shankar fell short of his maiden international half-century by five runs.

headlines: Google removes 29 apps that steal pics, show porn: Report
text: Google has reportedly removed 29 apps from Play Store, which stole users' images, showed pornographic content via ads and redirected users to phishing websites. As per Trend Micro, the apps, disguised as beauty and camera apps, could access remote ad configuration servers to carry out malicious activities. These apps were downloaded millions of times, particularly in India, Trend Micro said.

headlines: Mallikarjun Kharge is a regular 'dissenter': Arun Jaitley
text: Senior BJP leader Arun Jaitley on Sunday termed Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge a regular "dissenter". "He dissented when Shri Alok Verma was appointed, dissented when Shri Alok Verma was transferred and has now dissented when Shri RK Shukla has been appointed," he added. Jaitley further said that Kharge made the appointment of CBI Director look like a "political battle".

headlines: BJP wants Ram Temple, other parties clarify your stand: Shah
text: Stating that BJP's stand on Ram Temple issue is clear, party President Amit Shah on Sunday asked other political parties to clarify their stand on it. "I request opposition...not to be an obstacle in the case," he added. "We've decided to return the land belonging to Ram Janmabhoomi Nyas that was acquired in 1993...It's a historic step," he further said.

headlines: Gandhi family should be named as 'bail family': BJP
text: Talking about Congress, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Saturday said, "Gandhi family...should be named as the 'bail family'." "Such is the credibility of the family that most of the family members are out on bail," he added. This comes after Congress chief Rahul Gandhi's brother-in-law Robert Vadra was granted interim bail in a money laundering case on Saturday.

headlines: Uber Co-founder's cloud kitchen firm may enter China: Report
text: Uber Co-founder Travis Kalanick is reportedly considering to bring Los Angeles-based venture 'CloudKitchens', led by him, to China. Kalanick is working with Co-founder of Chinese bike-rental startup Ofo, Zhang Yanqi, to execute it, the report added. CloudKitchens offers kitchen space to delivery-only restaurants that do not have a dining facility.

headlines: Goa CM Parrikar's health condition is stable: AIIMS sources
text: The health condition of Goa CM Manohar Parrikar, who is admitted in AIIMS Delhi for a routine check-up, is stable, sources at the hospital said on Saturday. He is admitted at the Institute-Rotary Cancer Hospital at AIIMS under the observation of oncologist Atul Sharma. Parrikar was diagnosed with a pancreatic ailment in February last year.

headlines: WWI grenade found in potato shipment for Hong Kong crisp factory
text: A World War One-era German hand grenade has been found among a delivery of potatoes shipped from France to a crisp factory in Hong Kong. The grenade was safely detonated on site by bomb disposal officers. "The grenade was likely to have been left behind, dropped by soldiers there during the war," a historian said.

headlines: Venezuela Prez Maduro proposes early elections amid political crisis
text: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has proposed early elections for the National Assembly, which is dominated by the opposition and led by Juan Guaido, who proclaimed himself legitimate head of state last week. Maduro said the government-controlled Constituent Assembly would debate calling elections early for the National Assembly. The parliamentary elections are scheduled for 2020.

headlines: Chairman of TVS Group's Sundaram Brake Linings passes away
text: TVS Group's K Mahesh, who was the Chairman of the group's Sundaram Brake Linings, passed away in Chennai on Saturday. He was the grandson of the automobile group's Founder TV Sundaram Iyengar and the younger brother of TVS & Sons' Chairman Suresh Krishna. The 75-year-old had been working at TVS Group for over five decades.

headlines: India win 4 matches in an ODI series in New Zealand for first time
text: India defeated New Zealand by 35 runs in the fifth ODI at Wellington on Sunday to win the five-match ODI series 4-1. This was the first time India won four matches in an ODI series in New Zealand. India's previous best performance in an ODI series in New Zealand had come in 2009, when they won the five-match series 3-1.

headlines: Ending life logical: IIT Hyd student wrote to friends before suicide
text: Anirudhya Mummaneni, a 21-year-old student of IIT Hyderabad allegedly committed suicide by jumping off the seven-storey hostel building on the campus, police said. The student had also mailed his friends before committing suicide, saying, "The decision to end my life is purely logical...Life holds no intrigue anymore." "The daily grind is becoming more difficult with time," his mail further read.

headlines: Intent of extorting money: Salman Yusuff Khan on molestation claims
text: Bollywood choreographer and Dance India Dance season 1 winner Salman Yusuff Khan has denied the molestation allegations against him. "Wrong allegations with vested interests...intent of extorting monies [money]...have complete faith in judiciary...truth with prevail INSHA ALLAH," he wrote. The woman alleged Salman "touched her inappropriately" and said "such things happen in Bollywood" when she objected.

headlines: Wife didn't talk to me for 3 days after I told her GoT ending: Kit
text: Actor Kit Harington, who portrays 'Jon Snow' in 'Game of Thrones', has said he revealed the show's ending to his wife Rose Leslie. "I told my wife last year how it ended, and she wouldn't talk to me for about three days. And she had asked that," he added. Rose Leslie earlier played his love interest 'Ygritte' on the show.

headlines: Why was Hardik Pandya's double converted into single in 49th over?
text: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took a double off the 49th over's fourth delivery in the fifth ODI against New Zealand. Trent Boult suspected that Pandya didn't cross the crease and appealed to umpires. The double was converted into single after replays confirmed Pandya's hands weren't touching his bat when he threw it into the crease while taking the first run.

headlines: Hardik Pandya smashes 3 successive sixes in an ODI for 4th time
text: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya smashed three straight sixes off New Zealand spinner Todd Astle in 47th over in the fifth ODI on Sunday. This was the fourth time that the 25-year-old smashed three consecutive sixes in an over in ODI cricket. He had achieved the feat thrice in 2017 against Australia's Adam Zampa, and Pakistan's Shadab Khan and Imad Wasim.

headlines: Ex-policeman used police database to look up Tinder dates; jailed
text: A former Australian police officer has been jailed for six months for illegally accessing the personal details of almost 100 women to determine if they were "suitable" Tinder dates. Adrian Moore, once a nominee for police officer of the year, has also been fined AU$2,000 for possessing videos and images of women engaged in sexual acts with dogs and horses.

headlines: Over 2,000-year-old tomb with 50 mummies uncovered in Egypt
text: Egyptian archaeologists have uncovered a Pharaonic tomb containing 50 mummies dating back more than 2,000 years in Egypt's Minya city near Cairo, the antiquities ministry said. The mummies, of which 12 were children, were found in four burial chambers 30-ft deep in the Tuna el-Gebel archaeological site. "We have not found names written in hieroglyphics," Supreme Council of Antiquities said.

headlines: Ranveer, Alia shot for Gully Boy in slums for 25 days: Report
text: Actors Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt have shot in the slums of Mumbai for around 25 days for their upcoming film 'Gully Boy', as per reports. "All the combined sequences of Ranveer and Alia have been shot at the open area of slums in Mumbai," stated reports. Directed by Zoya Akhtar, the film also stars Kalki Koechlin and Ali Asgar.

headlines: Sonam has made herself, worked hard to become what she is: Anil
text: Anil Kapoor, while talking about his daughter and actress Sonam Kapoor, said, "She has made herself. She has worked hard to become what she is." Anil added that Sonam is the kind of person who gives a lot of love and affection. He further said, "[Giving love and affection] comes very naturally to her. She is a very sensitive person."

headlines: Most difficult thing is to play your own self on screen: SRK
text: Shah Rukh Khan has said that the most difficult thing is to play "your own self" on the silver screen. "Characters are quite different from roles. I feel nice when people make me do what I can't," he added. "People ask [me], 'Did you ever think you would reach this level of stardom' and I say, 'never'," he further said.

headlines: Being back on set after major sabbatical is surreal: Sonali
text: Sonali Bendre, who is currently in Mumbai, shared her photo and video on Instagram and wrote, "Being back on a set after a major sabbatical...is a surreal feeling." "After all this...I'm so grateful to be back in action," wrote Sonali who has been undergoing treatment for 'high grade' cancer in New York for the last few months.

headlines: Kharge tried to manipulate CBI chief selection: Union Min
text: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Saturday claimed that Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge "tried to manipulate the objective criteria, based on independent and impartial assessment, to select CBI Director." "He wanted to include some officers of his preference in the short-list of candidates, he added. Kharge was part of PM Narendra Modi-led panel which selected the new CBI Director.

headlines: Parma salvage draw against Juventus after Ronaldo's brace
text: Parma's Gervinho completed his brace after scoring his side's equaliser in the 93rd minute in the Serie A match against Juventus on Saturday. Earlier in the match, Cristiano Ronaldo had scored a brace. Following the 3-3 draw, Juventus' lead at the top of Serie A has now been cut to nine points after second-placed Napoli's 3-0 win against Sampdoria.

headlines: Cong to file FIRs on derogatory attacks on Priyanka Gandhi
text: All India Mahila Congress (AIMC), Congress' women's wing, will file FIRs on Monday against "derogatory" statements targeting Priyanka Gandhi's entry into politics. "One of the reasons why few women join politics is that they are not treated well," AIMC president Sushmita Dev said. This comes after Bihar minister Vinod Jha said that Priyanka has no other quality than being beautiful.

headlines: Yogi has no idea about laptop, how will he give it: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday said, "Our CM (Yogi Adityanath) is baba, he has no idea about laptop, how would he give it?" "We have distributed a large number of laptops in Kannauj...if they have given any bigger laptop, they should tell us," he added. Akhilesh had launched free laptop scheme for 12th pass students in 2013.

headlines: 3 golden crowns missing from Tirupati temple; probe underway
text: Three golden crowns belonging to the processional deities at Sri Govindaraja Swamy Temple in Tirupati went missing on Saturday evening. "Doors of the temple were closed after the evening ritual...When the doors were re-opened half-an-hour later, the crowns were found missing, a Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams official said. Police are suspecting one of the temple staffers to be involved, he added.

headlines: Electoral reforms pending due to lethargy: Ex-CEC Quraishi
text: Former Chief Election Commissioner SY Quraishi said, "Electoral reforms are long pending due to...lethargy." In the introduction of 'The Great March of Democracy: Seven Decades of India's Elections', he further said that it is "imperative to be mindful of some shortcomings in our system." He added that several reforms have come due to the intervention of judiciary.

headlines: We have left behind culture of delays: PM Modi
text: Inaugurating a number of projects in Jammu and Kashmirs Leh, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said, Our government believes in working faster. The country has left behind the culture of delays." "Whatever project we begin, we try our level best to finish it within the stipulated time, he added. The PM also announced opening of five new trekking routes.

headlines: Russian efforts for disarmament not supported by partners: Putin
text: Stating that Russia has "suggested frequently and regularly conducting substantial talks on almost all aspects of disarmament", President Vladimir Putin said, "We have seen that our initiatives are not supported by our partners." Putin said this after he announced that Russia would withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with the US within six months.

headlines: Queen Elizabeth to be evacuated in case of Brexit unrest: Reports
text: British officials have reportedly revived Cold War emergency plans to relocate Queen Elizabeth II should there be riots in London if Britain suffers a disruptive departure from the European Union next month. Notably, Prime Minister Theresa May's government is struggling to get parliamentary support for a Brexit transition agreement with the EU before the departure date of March 29.

headlines: upGrad learner switches to Data Science with a 50% salary hike
text: upGrad and IIIT-Bangalore's PG program in Data Science has over 5,500 learners upskilling through the program. Through their 1-1 mentorship and career support, learners from HR, Mechanical, Manufacturing, IT and Consulting backgrounds have successfully transitioned to Data science. One such learner, Sagar Tekwani transitioned from a Software Engineer to Data Analyst at Swiggy with a 50% salary hike.

headlines: 6 killed as 9 coaches of Seemanchal Express derail in Bihar
text: Six people were killed and several others were injured after nine coaches of the Delhi-bound Seemanchal Express derailed in Bihar on Sunday. The superfast train was reportedly running at full speed when the accident occurred. A team of doctors has been sent to the site and an accident relief train has also moved for carrying out relief and rescue operations.

headlines: Celebrations are unstoppable: Kapil shares pic from Delhi reception
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Twitter to share a picture of himself and his wife Ginni Chatrath from their wedding reception in Delhi on Saturday. "Celebrations are unstoppable.. need ur blessings," Kapil captioned the picture. Kapil and Ginni tied the knot in Jalandhar on December 12 and had earlier hosted receptions in Mumbai and Amritsar.

headlines: Do heroines think revealing attire will bring work? Balasubrahmanyam
text: Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam, while criticising actresses for wearing 'revealing' clothes, questioned, "Should their behaviour be taken as an act of innocence? Or do they think that only if they wear revealing outfits will heroes and directors give them opportunities?" "These days, actresses don't know what kind of dress they should wear for film events...We've reached an all-time low," he added.

headlines: When people tell me to exercise, I want to say f**k you: Vidya Balan
text: Vidya Balan has revealed that she has suffered from hormonal problems since childhood, saying, "There was a period when the more I'd work out, the more I'd put on." "When people tell me why don't you start exercising, I want to say f**k you!" added Vidya. The actress further said she has worked hard at accepting her body despite criticism.

headlines: WI pacer bats hours after mother's death, gets standing ovation
text: Pacer Alzarri Joseph came out to bat for Windies on third day of the second Test against England on Saturday, just hours after his mother Sharon passed away due to a prolonged illness. Players of both teams wore black armbands as a mark of respect and the crowd gave the 22-year-old a standing ovation when he came out to bat.

headlines: Japan footballers clean dressing room after Asian Cup final
text: Following their 1-3 defeat in the final of Asian Cup 2019 against Qatar, Japan national football team players cleaned the dressing room and left a "Thank You" message in English, Arabic and Japanese. "Japan leave the Asian Cup 2019 dressing room spotless," organisers tweeted. Japanese players had done the same following their 2018 FIFA World Cup exit.

headlines: Shopping without wife a disaster: Rohit shares pic from supermarket
text: India stand-in captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share a picture of himself shopping in a supermarket in New Zealand, writing, "Supermarket shopping without the wife is a disaster, one of the many reasons I miss her." Reacting to the post, Rohit's wife Ritika Sajdeh commented, "aaawww." "That's a lot of eggs...Rohit..you baking a cake!" The Bharat Army commented.

headlines: Going to Assembly with pipe in nose doesn't suit Goa CM: Cong MLA
text: Goa Congress legislator Reginaldo Lourenco has said that CM Manohar Parrikar should honourably resign and take care of his health. "Don't go to the Assembly like that...where you have a pipe in your nose...things coming out of your pocket (catheters). It does not suit you," Lourenco added. Meanwhile, BJP replied, "It's the frustration of Congress that government is doing well".

headlines: 71 Bengaluru policemen transferred after women's assault in station
text: Bengaluru City Police transferred 71 personnel from the Kumaraswamy Layout Police Station after a video of an Assistant Sub-Inspector of Police (ASI) assaulting women in the station went viral. The ASI and a constable who recorded the video have also been suspended till further orders. "We want a new environment...new culture at the...station," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (South).

headlines: Video: Biker injured after TN policeman hits motorcycle with lathi
text: A man in Tamil Nadu's Thiruvallur was injured after a policeman hit his bike with a lathi after he reportedly failed to stop for a check on Friday. CCTV visuals showed the man losing control and falling off his bike. The biker didn't file a complaint as the officers on duty received punishment from the department, a police official said.

headlines: Jailed former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif shifted to hospital
text: Pakistan's jailed former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was shifted to the hospital on Saturday, his daughter Maryam Nawaz said. Pakistan's Punjab government ordered to move Sharif to the hospital "in view of (his) multiple co-morbidities and complex cardiac history". The order came following the recommendation by a six-member medical board to shift the former Prime Minister to hospital.

headlines: Prisoners in freezing US jail cells bang on windows for help
text: Inmates at a federal jail in US have been banging on the windows of their cells to get attention from people on the street as they suffer below-freezing temperatures in their cells. The jail has had limited power and heat for at least a week. However, authorities said inmates have hot water and medical services continue to be provided.

headlines: Protecting Rani Lakshmi Bai in real life: Ankita on Kangana
text: Ankita Lokhande, who plays Rani Lakshmi Bai's chief commander Jhalkari Bai in 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi', said that she's protecting the film's star and co-director Kangana Ranaut in real life too. "I've loved Kangana for what she is. Most of my scenes have been shot by her," she added. She further said she respected Kangana for co-directing the film.

headlines: Would love to play mom's part in 'Aaina', 'Chameli Ki...': Sara
text: Talking about the roles of her mother and actress Amrita Singh that she would love to play, Sara Ali Khan said, "I would love to play her role in 'Chameli Ki Shaadi'...[and] 'Aaina'." "I don't think I can do anything that mom has done...[In 'Aaina'] she wasn't the leading lady, [but] she was so damn powerful," added Sara.

headlines: Higuain Chelsea's 1st in 19 yrs to score brace on EPL home debut
text: Gonzalo Higuain became the first Chelsea player in 19 years to score a brace on a home league debut after he helped his side register a 5-0 win over Huddersfield Town on Saturday. Eden Hazard also scored a brace in the match which witnessed N'Golo Kanté provide two assists. Earlier in the day, Tottenham salvaged a 1-0 win over Newcastle.

headlines: IPL a gateway only for T20 format: Indian selector MSK Prasad
text: Indian cricket team selector MSK Prasad has said that the selection committee picks players from the Indian Premier League only for the T20 format. "After being picked from the IPL, it's up to the players on how keen they are in learning the tricks of the trade," Prasad said about selection into the Indian team from IPL.

headlines: Changed mindset, self belief key to Saurashtra's rise: Unadkat
text: Saurashtra Ranji team captain Jaydev Unadkat said, "We have started to believe we can win against the big teams... I have been with teams where the mind-set was just not to lose badly against a big team." "No one would have thought of a Ranji trophy final between Saurashtra and Vidarbha 10 years ago," Unadkat added.

headlines: SBI fixes glitch that may have exposed banking data of users
text: State Bank of India has said that a "misconfiguration" in the services of telecom providers has been fixed and denied of any data breach from its end. "Customer data is safe and secure and SBI is fully committed to ensuring this," SBI added. This comes after TechCrunch reported SBI had secured a passwordless server "overnight" after it alerted the bank.

headlines: Consider PIL seeking transparency at petrol pumps: SC to Centre
text: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre and petroleum ministry to consider a plea seeking direction for the government to ensure transparency at petrol pumps across the country. The plea, filed last month, had alleged that fuel stations are installing "microchips" to speed up the pulse meter to give lesser fuel to customers.

headlines: Stones thrown at India's fastest train in 2nd such incident
text: India's fastest train, Vande Bharat Express, was pelted with stones on Friday while it was on its way to New Delhi station, from where it was to begin its trial run to Prayagraj. "Second coach from the front was hit near [Delhi's] Sadar area," officials said. In December, stones were pelted during the train's trial run between Delhi and Agra.

headlines: Over 100 girls rescued from trafficking in Manipur
text: Over 100 girls suspected to be trafficked from Nepal were rescued by police in separate raids conducted in Manipur, police said on Saturday. In one of the raids, nearly 40 Nepali girls were rescued and a suspected trafficker was arrested. The operations were conducted based on inputs by some NGOs, police sources added.

headlines: Retiring German Chancellor Angela Merkel quits Facebook
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel, who will leave politics following the end of her term in 2021, has announced that she is closing her Facebook account as she's no longer the head of the CDU party. In a video message, Merkel thanked her 2.5 million followers and invited them to continue following the government's official Facebook page and her Instagram account.

headlines: I don't think anyone can even touch them: Rajkummar Rao on Khans
text: Rajkummar Rao has said it would not be right to compare his stardom with that of Shah Rukh Khan, Aamir Khan and Salman Khan. "I don't think anybody can even touch them. They've been here for many, many years. I love them immensely," he added. "We're very new and we have a long way to prove ourselves," he further said.

headlines: New CBI chief lacks experience: Cong leader in PM panel dissents
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who was part of PM Narendra Modi-led panel which selected Rishi Kumar Shukla as the new CBI Director on Saturday, has sent a dissent note saying the 1983-batch IPS officer lacks experience in anti-corruption investigations. Kharge previously disagreed on Alok Verma's removal as CBI chief and asked PM Modi to make the CVC probe documents public.

headlines: SA's Miller wins Man of the Match for 4 catches and 2 run-outs
text: South Africa batsman David Miller was named Man of the Match in the first T20I against Pakistan for taking four catches and effecting two run-outs. The 29-year-old became the second cricketer to win the award without taking a wicket or scoring over 10 in a T20I. Pakistan lost while chasing for the first time since 2016 T20 World Cup.

headlines: Smriti Mandhana becomes world number one women's ODI batter
text: Indian women's cricket team opener Smriti Mandhana has become the top-ranked batter in women's ODI cricket, as per the latest rankings released by the ICC. The 22-year-old moved up three spots in the batters' rankings to reach the top spot. In the 15 ODIs Smriti has played since the beginning of 2018, she has scored two centuries and eight half-centuries.

headlines: SpaceX 'almost succeeds' to catch $6M rocket nose using boat
text: Elon Musk-led SpaceX has tweeted a video of its boat, Mr. Steven, 'almost succeeding' in catching its rocket's nose. The nosecone equipped with a parachute can be seen falling into the boat's net before bouncing off it and falling into the water. Musk once tweeted, "Imagine you had $6 million cash flying through air. Would you try to recover? Yes".

headlines: 73 Indians arrested in Sri Lanka this year for visa violations
text: A total of 73 Indians have been arrested in Sri Lanka this year for staying beyond their visa term, Sri Lankan officials said. While 49 Indian nationals were arrested on Saturday from a factory in Matugama, 24 Indians were arrested last month. Those arrested would be sent back to India after completing necessary formalities, officials added.

headlines: India issues demarche to US embassy on Indian students' detention
text: India on Saturday issued a demarche to the US embassy over the detention of Indian students in the US and sought immediate consular access to them. "We've urged the US side to share full details and regular updates of the students...to release them at the earliest and not to resort to deportation against their will," the External Affairs Ministry said.

headlines: Gautam Gambhir urges Army to help war veteran begging in Delhi
text: Ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir urged Army and Defence Ministry to help Peethambaran, who claimed to have served in the Army during 1965 and 1971 wars and now begs on Delhi streets. Gambhir shared two pictures of Peethambaran and tweeted, "He claims due to technical reasons he can't get support from d Army. I'd urge [Army and Defence Ministry] to intervene.

headlines: Video shows men pushing pillars, damaging Vishnu temple in Hampi
text: A video showing three men pushing a pillar and allegedly damaging ruins of Vishnu temple in Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has gone viral. Many locals have reportedly demanded the authorities to step up security. Meanwhile, an Archaeological Survey of India official claimed the video is of an old incident and a police complaint was filed in the case.

headlines: Wadhawan sells Aadhar Housing Finance to US' Blackstone
text: Wadhawan Global Capital has agreed to sell its 70% stake in affordable housing finance company Aadhar Housing Finance to American private equity giant Blackstone. Dewan Housing Finance, Wadhawan's flagship entity, will also offload its 9.15% stake in Aadhar Housing as part of the transaction. Dewan lost half its value this week after allegations that it diverted funds to shell companies.

headlines: Banks try to seize 2 superyachts, 27 cars from Vijay Mallya
text: Indian banks trying to recover money from Vijay Mallya have moved a London court seeking documents that would reveal "true ownership" of assets including 2 superyachts and 27 cars. Mallya said the items are held by trusts that he doesn't control. The banks said there are many "valuable assets" held through "complex ownership structure comprising offshore companies and discretionary trusts".

headlines: Varun injures knee on sets of Remo D'souza's film: Reports
text: Actor Varun Dhawan injured his knee while shooting for choreographer-turned-filmmaker Remo D'souza's upcoming dance film in Punjab, as per reports. The injury occurred while the actor was performing a dance step called the knee drop for a dance sequence in the film, reports further suggested. Varun is reportedly recovering from the injury and is undergoing physiotherapy in Mumbai.

headlines: Comedian Seinfeld sued for selling fake $1.5-mn vintage car
text: A company sued comedian Jerry Seinfeld for allegedly selling them a 1958 Porsche 356 A 1500 GS/GT Carrera Speedster, a vintage car worth $1.54 million, which turned out to be fake. The lawsuit states Seinfeld intentionally misrepresented the authenticity of the car. It further claims that Seinfeld promised to pay the company back but never followed through with the refund.

headlines: Batting collapse in 4th Ind-NZ ODI was an aberration: Bangar
text: Batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that Team India's batting collapse in the fourth New Zealand-India ODI was an 'aberration' and that India's middle-order has delivered in the past. "We know we played well below our potential and our expected levels, the boys realise it and we just need to put that game behind and look to...next game," Bangar added.

headlines: You haven't won the game until you have got Dhoni out: Neesham
text: Speaking about India's middle-order batsman MS Dhoni, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham said, "[W]hen you're bowling to him, you know you haven't won the game till you've got him out." "Some noise was made especially from Indian media about whether he should be there in their World Cup squad or not... [H]is record speaks for itself," Neesham added.

headlines: Ex-India coach Greg Chappell set to exit Cricket Australia
text: Former Indian team coach Greg Chappell is set to exit Cricket Australia where he currently serves as a selector and national talent manager following the Ashes against England later this year. Chappell's first stint as a selector with the board stretched between 1984 and 1988, the second from 2010 to 2011 and the third and final from 2016 till date.

headlines: Karunaratne out of hospital after blow to neck from Cummins
text: Sri Lankan opener Dimuth Karunaratne has been released from hospital after he was stretchered off the ground after a bouncer from Pat Cummins hit him on the back of the neck in the Canberra Test. Karunaratne immediately fell to the ground after getting struck and was given medical attention from the medical staff of both the teams.

headlines: Associated Press, Snopes stop fact-checking for Facebook
text: Two US-based agencies Associated Press and Snopes have ended their fact-checking partnerships with Facebook. "AP constantly evaluates how to best deploy its fact-checking resources...that includes ongoing conversations with Facebook", an AP spokesperson said. Snopes said it needed to "determine...that [their] efforts to aid any particular platform are a net positive for...online community".

headlines: Apple Siri head steps down as VP after 7 years: Report
text: Apple's Vice President for its voice-enabled assistant Siri, Bill Stasior, has stepped down from his role after seven years, according to a report. Stasior, who was hired in 2012 reportedly after two of Siri's creators left, will continue to work in Apple in a different role, the report added. Stasior worked in Amazon's A9 retail search team before joining Apple.

headlines: YouTube seeks creator feedback over 'dislike' button misuse
text: YouTube has asked for feedback from video creators to curb misuse of its 'dislike' button by "dislike mobs". YouTube's Director of Product Management, Tom Leung, suggested removing the 'dislike' button, making likes and dislikes invisible or adding checkbox for users to state the reason for disliking a video. "Dislike mobs" purposely 'dislike' videos in organised attacks to harm video creators.

headlines: Tenure ends in a month but PM not prepared to go: Mamata
text: Hitting out at PM Narendra Modi, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday said that though PM Modi's "tenure will end in a month, he isn't mentally prepared to go". "In true fascist style, he is trying to encircle everyone with agencies," she added. This comes after PM Modi said, "Why fear if you haven't done anything wrong [Mamata]?"

headlines: Why scared if you have done nothing wrong: PM Modi to Mamata
text: PM Narendra Modi has said the Mamata Banerjee-led West Bengal government is so perturbed by his "anti-corruption" actions, that it isn't allowing probe agencies to come to Bengal. "Didi is afraid...If you haven't done anything wrong, there is no reason to be afraid," he added. "The ground below her feet...moves even if BJP president comes to Bengal," he further said.

headlines: Lord Ram doesn't belong to any party: Baba Ramdev
text: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev on Saturday said that the Hindu God Ram doesn't belong to a single party but to the entire nation. "Hence, all saints must unite and show their devotion towards Lord Ram," he added. "I request all...revered saints that there should be no divide in the nation in the name of Ram," he further said.

headlines: Pune court orders release of Bhima-Koregaon accused activist
text: Pune sessions court on Saturday ordered the release of activist Anand Teltumbde hours after he was arrested in connection with the Bhima-Koregaon case, and called the arrest "illegal". "As per the Supreme Court order, Teltumbde has interim protection till February 11," the court said. The court also said that Teltumbde can approach the competent authority for regular or pre-arrest bail.

headlines: US stops all aid to Palestinians in West Bank and Gaza
text: The US Agency for International Development has stopped all financial assistance to Palestinians in the occupied West Bank and Gaza. It will end about $60 million in US aid for the Palestinian security forces.
