The aid cut requested by the Palestinian Authority, is linked to a new American legislation under which foreign aid recipients could be sued under anti-terrorism lawsuits.

headlines: Iran unveils long-range cruise missile on revolution anniversary
text: Iran has unveiled a surface-to-surface missile with a range of more than 1,350 kilometres during celebrations marking the 40th anniversary of the 1979 Islamic revolution. The missile named Hoveizeh is from the Soumar family of cruise missiles, which were unveiled in 2015, Iran's Defence Minister Amir Hatami said during the unveiling ceremony.

headlines: Jobs, not josh; Budget missed elephant in the room: Shashi Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has said acting Finance Minister Piyush Goyal's one-hour-45-minute speech was the longest interim budget speech on record but "missed the elephant in the room". Citing a report which claimed unemployment in India rose to a 45-year high, Tharoor said that one must ask the PM Narendra Modi-led government, "Where are jobs?" instead of "Where's the josh?".

headlines: Why were you so serious: Amit Shah to Opp'n after Interim Budget
text: Taking a dig at the Opposition after the Interim Budget was presented in the Parliament, BJP President Amit Shah said, "I didn't understand why you were so serious. You were not able to smile." "Congress President's (Rahul Gandhi) face lost its glow during the budget presentation," Shah added. He also praised the budget as being "all-inclusive".

headlines: Virat Kohli is an unbelievable sportsman: Sunil Chhetri
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri has said Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli is an unbelievable sportsman. "It is not easy to do what he is doing. What Virat is doing is unbelievable. He's also different from others in person," he added. "He actually puts a lot of energy and time on being a better player," he further said.

headlines: Google CEO Pichai's rating goes down in annual staff vote: Report
text: Google's annual internal survey has shown growing dissent for CEO Sundar Pichai among the company's 90,000-strong workforce, as per Wired magazine. On being asked if employees had confidence in Google's future under Pichai, 74% said 'yes', 18 percentage points less than 2017's poll. A vote on Pichai's decisions and strategies saw a 75% positive response, as opposed to previous 88%.

headlines: Don Ravi Pujari lived with new identity, ran restaurants in Africa
text: Underworld don Ravi Pujari, who was arrested in Sénégal, took a new identity as Antony Fernandez and had got Burkina Faso passport for himself, his wife and children, Karnataka Police said. Pujari also ran a chain of restaurants in partnership in several West African countries. Police said he ran away from Burkina Faso, fearing his identity might get exposed.

headlines: 7-year-old girl kidnapped, gangraped in Rohtak railway yard
text: A seven-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gangraped by four men in the Rohtak railway yard in Haryana on Thursday night. The minor, who was left bleeding profusely, managed to reach home and narrated the ordeal to her parents. One of the accused has been identified by name, and three police teams have been constituted to nab the men.

headlines: 1-month-old leopard cub seized from passenger at Chennai airport
text: Customs officials at Chennai airport have seized a one-month-old leopard cub from the baggage of a passenger who arrived from Thailand. The officials heard some faint sounds from the checked-in baggage of the passenger, identified as 45-year-old Kaja Moideen. The cub will be rehabilitated at Chennai's Arignar Anna Zoological Park, while the passenger was handed over to the forest department.

headlines: Amazon, Walmart lose $50 bn value after India applies new rules
text: Amazon and Walmart together lost over $50 billion in market value on Friday after Indias revised e-commerce rules came into effect. E-commerce marketplaces are now barred from selling products through sellers in which they have a stake, and from making deals to sell exclusively on their platforms. Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart were forced to remove numerous products from their websites.

headlines: Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper to perform at 91st Academy Awards
text: Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper will be performing their Oscar-nominated song 'Shallow' from their film 'A Star Is Born' at the 91st Academy Awards [also known as the Oscars] that will be held on February 24. Reports had earlier stated that The Academy Awards will be held without a host for the first time in 30 years.

headlines: Arbaaz to make Kannada film debut with Patralekhaa: Reports
text: Actor Arbaaz Khan will make his debut in the Kannada film industry with actress Patralekhaa with the action-comedy film 'Where is my Kannadaka?', as per reports. The actor will reportedly essay the role of a security chief in the film. Arbaaz has previously featured in several Telugu films, including 'Jai Chiranjeeva' and 'Kittu Unnadu Jagratha'.

headlines: Wrong of Krish to attack me: Kangana on 'Manikarnika' row
text: Addressing the controversy surrounding the direction credits for her film 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi', Kangana Ranaut said it was wrong for the film's co-director Krish to "attack" her. "If he has any issues with the film, then he should talk to the producers," the actress added. Kangana was credited as co-director of the film after Krish left the project.

headlines: 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas' is evident in the Budget: PM Modi
text: Talking about the Interim Budget 2019-20, PM Narendra Modi said that the BJP's vision of "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas" is evident in the budget. "It has something for every section of the society," he added. "The Budget will empower the poor, give a boost to farmers and an impetus to economic growth," PM Modi had said.

headlines: India crash out of Davis Cup after 1-3 loss to Italy
text: India crashed out of the Davis Cup after losing to Italy 1-3 in the World Group Qualifiers knockout stage in Kolkata on Saturday. India's only win of the tie came when Rohan Bopanna and Divij Sharan beat Matteo Berrettini and Simone Bolelli in the doubles match. This was the sixth time that India faced Italy in the Davis Cup.

headlines: India-Aus 1st T20I shifted to Vizag due to security concerns
text: The first India-Australia T20I has been moved from Bengaluru to Visakhapatnam due to security concerns raised by Karnataka's state association. Bengaluru will now host the second T20I on February 27 after the KSCA and Andhra Cricket Association decided to swap the T20Is. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be visiting Bengaluru on the day the match was set to be held.

headlines: Twitter bug mislabels retweets, confuses users: Report
text: A Twitter bug caused users to view retweets on their timelines which appeared to be from users they didn't follow, according to TechCrunch. Twitter reportedly confirmed the bug was mislabelling "social proof" tag on retweets due to which users viewed retweets from those they did follow as unfamiliar. Twitter's support handle hasn't responded to users about the bug as yet.

headlines: Indonesia's Go-Jek raises $1 bn from Google, Tencent: Report
text: Indonesian ride-hailing startup Go-Jek has reportedly raised around $1 billion in a funding round led by Google, Tencent Holdings and JD.com. The funding, which is part of the Jakarta-based startup's Series F round, reportedly values it at $9-10 billion. Founded in 2010, Go-Jek offers motorbikes and taxis on demand, along with services like grocery delivery and mobile payments.

headlines: 3D printer that uses light to turn liquids into objects made
text: UC Berkeley researchers including PhD scholar Indrasen Bhattacharya, have created a light-powered 3D printer that can transform liquids into detailed objects within minutes. The researchers first created a video of a 3D model's images, which was beamed to a rotating container with a light-sensitive liquid. The liquid then hardened in reaction to the light rays to produce the 3D model.

headlines: Will use tech to seal B'desh border at WB, Assam: Rajnath
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that the Centre will use technology to seal the international borders of West Bengal and Assam with Bangladesh. He said that a comprehensive integrated border management system will be used for the same. The Centre has sought land from West Bengal to erect fencing to seal the borders, the minister added.

headlines: PM shortens speech after stampede-like situation at WB rally
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday had to cut short his speech at a rally in West Bengal's Thakurnagar after a stampede-like situation broke out. People outside the venue tried to barge into the rally ground and after the commotion, PM Modi ended the speech saying he has another rally to attend. Several women and children were injured, police said.

headlines: Boko Haram kills at least 60 in Nigeria attack
text: The Boko Haram militant group has killed at least 60 people in an attack in the Nigerian town of Rann, human rights group Amnesty International said. Militants on motorcycles drove through the town near the Cameroon border, setting houses on fire and killing people left behind. The attack came a day after the military abandoned the region, Amnesty quoted witnesses.

headlines: Extreme cold kills over 20 in US polar vortex
text: More than 20 people have been killed in the extreme cold since the polar vortex hit the US earlier this week. Over 200 cases of frostbite and hypothermia have been reported in the country. Businesses and schools were closed and rail and air services were affected as a result of the polar vortex.

headlines: Indian-origin Harris' campaign launch best opening so far: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump, a Republican, has said that the campaign launch of Indian-origin Democratic Senator Kamala Harris is "the best opening so far" in 2020 presidential race. Trump added that Harris' campaign launch event had "a better crowd, better enthusiasm". "Some of the others were very flat," Trump said about other Democratic presidential aspirants.

headlines: Dance India Dance winner Salman Yusuff Khan booked for molestation
text: A molestation case has been filed against Bollywood choreographer Salman Yusuff Khan, Dance India Dance season 1 winner, at a Mumbai police station. The victim alleged that Salman, along with his brother, tried to misbehave with her on two separate occasions. According to the FIR filed, Salman "touched her inappropriately" and said "such things happen in Bollywood" when she objected.

headlines: Budget mentions 'village', 'middle class' more than previous years
text: The Interim Budget 2019 speech by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal mentioned the words 'village' and 'middle class' 10 times and 13 times respectively, more than the previous three years. Goyal mentioned the word 'job' or 'employment' only 17 times, against 29 in the previous year. The words 'development,' 'manufacturing,' 'growth' and 'infrastructure' found fewer mentions than previous three years.

headlines: SL opener gets hit on neck by 142-kmph bouncer, rushed to hospital
text: Sri Lanka's left-handed opener Dimuth Karunaratne fell down after being hit in the back of the neck by a 142-kmph delivery from Australia's Pat Cummins during the second day of the second Test in Canberra on Saturday. The 30-year-old was attended to by both teams' medical staff and immediately stretchered off the ground and sent to a hospital.

headlines: US biologist who criticised China gene-edited babies editing embryos
text: A Columbia University cell biologist who called the birth of gene-edited babies in China "genome vandalism" has said he's trying to repair DNA mutations in human embryos. Dr Dietrich Egli, who is also using the award-winning CRISPR gene-editing method, said his experiments are intended to determine the procedure's safety. Egli claimed to destroy embryos after just one day of development.

headlines: India handed over 1st US-built Chinook helicopter, to get 14 more
text: India has officially been handed over its first CH-47F Chinook transport helicopter at Boeing's facility in US' Philadelphia. India will receive the remaining 14 Chinook helicopters this year, order for which was placed in 2015. Chinook, which is an advanced multi-mission helicopter that can help in delivering heavy payloads to high altitudes, will boost Indian Air Force's helicopter fleet.

headlines: Welfare of 129 students detained in US top priority: Sushma Swaraj
text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj has assured that "welfare" of the 129 Indian students detained in the US is the "highest priority" for her team. The US authorities arrested Indians in an undercover operation and called it a "pay-to-stay" scheme, where foreign students knowingly enrolled in a fake school to falsely maintain their student visa and illegally obtain work permits.

headlines: Swedish guards drag 8-month pregnant woman out of train over ticket
text: A video showing a woman, believed to be 8 months pregnant, being dragged out of the Stockholm metro by two guards has surfaced online. The woman, who was with her daughter, was caught without a ticket, officials said. She was later rushed to hospital for treatment and the two guards have been suspended pending an inquiry.

headlines: In tit-for-tat move, Russia suspends nuclear arms treaty with US
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the country will follow US example and withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty within 6 months. He added that Russia will design new intermediate-range weapons. The 1987 arms control pact bans both the US and Russia from stationing short- and intermediate-range land-based missiles in Europe.

headlines: 45 meetings with banks in 12 months couldn't resolve anything: RCom
text: Reliance Communications (RCom) said that 100% approval of 40 banks had been "impossible to achieve" on any matter despite 45 meetings in over 12 months, driving the company to the bankruptcy court for resolution. RCom said lenders received zero proceeds from the asset monetisation plans. The company added its "overall debt resolution process is yet to make any headway".

headlines: 'How's the josh?!' is no more a line, it's an emotion: Vicky
text: Vicky Kaushal, while talking about the dialogue 'How's the josh?!' from his film 'Uri: The Surgical Strike', said that it is not just a line anymore, it's an emotion. In an Instagram post, the actor wrote, "I get so many 'How's the josh?!' videos from you all every day, each one made with so much love and passion."

headlines: SRK approached for Bhandarkar's 'Inspector Ghalib': Reports
text: Shah Rukh Khan has been approached to star in filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar's upcoming film 'Inspector Ghalib', as per reports. Earlier reports suggested that actor Sushant Singh Rajput will be starring in the forthcoming film. The film, which will be set in Uttar Pradesh, follows the story of a policeman who takes on the sand mafia.

headlines: We're trivialising #MeToo movement, need to be careful: Sonam
text: Sonam Kapoor, while talking about #MeToo movement, said, "We are definitely trivialising it...We need to be a little more careful about the accusation and articles." "If you have to, you have to do it with a lot of thought...because it's become watered down now. It's all gone and unfortunately, it is the way it is," the actress added.

headlines: Vani Kapoor becomes first Indian to earn Australian LPGA card
text: Indian golfer Vani Kapoor became the first Indian to earn a card for the Australian Ladies PGA Tour (LPGA) after coming through its first-ever qualifying tournament at Australia's Ballarat Golf Club. Other Indians in the Australian LPGA qualifying tournament were Diksha Dagar, Ridhima Dilawari and Astha Madan. Vani had finished tied-12th with three others at the qualification event.

headlines: London 2012 gold-winner among 12 Russians banned for doping
text: London 2012 Olympic Games high jump champion Ivan Ukhov is among 12 Russian track and field athletes to be handed doping bans by the Court of Arbitration for Sport. Ukhov and Svetlana Shkolina, who won high jump bronze in 2012 and gold at the 2013 world championships, were given four-year bans on Friday and will be stripped of their medals.

headlines: Alphabet to make shoes that can detect wearer's fall: Report
text: Google parent Alphabet's life sciences division Verily has reportedly been seeking partners to co-develop smart shoes that could detect its wearer's fall. The sensor-equipped shoes will measure user movement and weight, the report added. Last year, Apple added fall detection feature to its Watch Series 4 that calls emergency services if it detects no movement for a minute after fall.

headlines: I'm for Ram Mandir, what is Rahul Gandhi's stand: Amit Shah
text: Addressing BJP workers during his Dehradun visit, BJP President Amit Shah said, "(Congress President) Rahul Gandhi should clear his stand on Ayodhya. I can say without a doubt that Ram Mandir will be built there." Accusing Congress of trying to stall the case whenever it goes to court, Shah added, "Don't have any doubts, we'll make the temple in Ayodhya."

headlines: Now I know why Didi resorts to violence: PM Modi thanks large crowd
text: Referring to a large number of people present at his rally in Thakurnagar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "I now understand why Didi (West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee) has resorted to violence. She's scared because of your love for us." Thanking the crowd "for turning out in large numbers," he added, "I am confident West Bengal wants to see change."

headlines: Can't work with BJP, will join Cong: JD(U)'s Rishi Mishra
text: Janata Dal (United) leader Rishi Mishra on Saturday announced that he will join Congress, saying that it was getting very difficult to work in JD(U). "I don't have issues with Nitish ji (CM of Bihar) but I can't work with BJP," he added. "The 58,000 people who voted for me in the previous election were anti-NDA," he further said.

headlines: BJP to instigate riots on February 21: SBSP President
text: BJP ally Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party's (SBSP) President OP Rajbhar on Friday said that an "American intelligence agency" has reported that "BJP will instigate riots on February 21". "No politician dies in riots, only innocents die in riots," he added. "We don't want riots, we want to maintain peace...among Hindus and Muslims," he further said.

headlines: Man murders wife, 3-yr-old daughter with lover's help; held
text: A Mumbai-based man and his girlfriend have been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and three-year-old daughter. The man slit the throats of his wife and daughter, while his lover burned the bodies with cooking oil, police said. To give the murder an impression of suicide, the lover texted the man, "We're going forever," from the wife's phone, police added.

headlines: Won't settle for anything less than a grand Ram Temple: RSS
text: Speaking at the 'Dharam Sansad' event on Friday, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said they won't settle for anything less than a grand temple at Ayodhya. "This is our demand. It is up to the government how it meets it," he added. "We should involve in public awakening so that construction of the Temple begins at the earliest," he further said.

headlines: Russia won't deploy missiles anywhere as long as US doesn't: Putin
text: After announcing that Russia would withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with the US within 6 months, President Vladimir Putin said, "Russia won't deploy missiles anywhere as long as US doesn't." Adding that doors for negotiations with US are open, Putin asked Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu to not initiate talks on the issue.

headlines: I want my old life back: German woman who joined ISIS at 15
text: A German woman who joined militant group Islamic State at the age of 15 has said, "I want to go back to Germany to my family, because I want my old life back. Now I know that it was a big, big mistake." Leonora, who fled the jihadists' last bastion in eastern Syria, added, "I was a little bit naive."

headlines: Syria was loaded with ISIS until I came along: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday said, "Syria was loaded with ISIS until I came along", adding that he "inherited a total mess in Syria and Afghanistan". "We'll soon have destroyed 100% of (ISIS) but will be watching them closely. It is now time to start coming home after many years", he said defending the withdrawal of American troops.

headlines: Sushmita's boyfriend competes as her daughter's father in race
text: Sushmita Sen took to Instagram to share a video showing boyfriend Rohman Shawl competing as her daughter Alisah's father in a school race. "What a MAN!!! Better yet, THAT'S MY MAN!!!...wins the #100mts gold (by a mile) for Alisah in the father's race!!!...I AM SOOOOOOO HAPPY & PROUD of my little shona & my Rooh!!!" she captioned the video.

headlines: Please get well soon: Angad Bedi to journalist who fat shamed Neha
text: Actor Angad Bedi questioned Pakistani journalist Hina Khurram's upbringing for highlighting his wife and actress Neha Dhupia's weight gain after pregnancy. "A woman to fat shame another woman who...just delivered a baby throws a lot of light on your upbringing. Please get well soon," he tweeted. "Fashion Central...this is the maximum mileage you'll ever get," he further wrote.

headlines: Women are naughtier and hotter after 40: Vidya Balan on turning 40
text: Vidya Balan, while speaking to 'Filmfare' about turning 40, said women are "naughtier and hotter after 40". She added, "Generally, we're taught to be...coy and not enjoy sex. But...reason they say women get better with age is because you care less and less, it's more about you." "When you don't care, you've the most amount of fun," Vidya further said.

headlines: Piyush Goyal is the first Chartered Accountant to present a Budget
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday became the first Chartered Accountant (CA) to present a Budget. The 54-year-old, who's also the Union Minister of Corporate Affairs, Railways and Coal, was an all-India second-rank holder CA and second-rank holder in Law from Mumbai University. Goyal has been an investment banker and also served on boards of SBI and Bank of Baroda.

headlines: Don't be sad, 7 runs don't matter: Pujara's dad told him after 193
text: India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has revealed when he got out for 193 in Sydney Test against Australia, his father Arvind told him not to be sad as seven runs didn't matter much. "Later that evening my dad told me that the double-hundred was just a number and the job I had done for the team meant a lot," Pujara said.

headlines: Apple apologises for FaceTime bug, thanks 14-yr-old for finding it
text: Apple on Friday issued a statement apologising for a FaceTime bug that allowed users to listen in on people before they picked up the group video call. Apple also thanked 14-year-old American boy Grant Thompson's family for reporting the bug. The iPhone maker added it will issue a software update to re-enable the Group FaceTime feature for users next week.

headlines: Mamata's posters put over PM Modi's banners in WB before his rally
text: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's rally in West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee's posters were put over PM Modi's banners informing people of his visit. Criticising the incident, BJP National Secretary Rahul Sinha on Saturday said, "This shows there is no democracy in the state." Meanwhile, BJP activists alleged that TMC workers were behind the act.

headlines: Why send notices to those serving tea, Mamata asks PM Modi
text: After her close aide Manik Majumdar was quizzed by CBI, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee claimed Prime Minister Narendra Modi was "compelling" his officers to send notices to humiliate opposition leaders. Accusing the Centre of making the fight personal, she added, "These people...only carry out instructions." She further asked, "How can you send notices to even those who serve tea?"

headlines: SP leader Azam Khan booked for allegedly defaming RSS
text: An FIR was lodged against Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan on Friday for allegedly misusing the government letterhead and stamp for "maligning" the RSS when he was a minister in the previous government. The FIR, filed by a social worker, also accuses Khan of insulting religious leader Kalbe Jawad and his secretary.

headlines: Goa minister 'compares' CM Parrikar to Jesus, apologises later
text: Congratulating Goa CM Manohar Parrikar for new cable bridge Atal Setu, Goa minister Vijai Sardesai said, "Jesus built bridges not walls. You need to build bridges. Manohar Parrikar is a person who builds bridges." Later, Congress criticised Sardesai for comparing Parrikar to Jesus and "hurting religious sentiments". He then apologised saying, "I seek pardon from people whose sentiments are hurt."

headlines: Terrorists execute J&K woman, share video on social media
text: Terrorists shot dead a 25-year-old woman and circulated a video of the act, Jammu and Kashmir Police said. The body of the woman, who was reportedly closely related to Al-Badr commander Zeenat-ul-Islam, was found alongside a letter claiming she worked with security forces. The 10-second video, which showed her pleading for mercy with folded hands, was shared widely online.

headlines: Man seeks permit for human sacrifice, says engineer son will be 1st
text: A tantrik in Bihar has sent an application to Begusarai authorities seeking permission for human sacrifice to appease his deity. In a circulated video, the occultist purportedly said human sacrifice is not a crime and he's first going to sacrifice his engineer son, who refused to give financial aid for his temple. A probe has been launched into the case.

headlines: Video shows Brazil dam collapse that killed 115 people
text: A video shows the exact moment a dam collapsed in Brazil on January 25. The dam collapsed at an iron ore mining complex operated by a mining firm, killing at least 115 people, with 248 others listed as missing. In the video, vehicles can be seen driving around desperately trying to escape as a gush of mud approaches.

headlines: UK man who had sex with corpse in funeral home jailed for 6 years
text: A UK man who broke into a funeral home and had sex with a corpse has been sentenced to six years in jail. A court heard how he lifted the lids of several coffins inside the funeral home in Great Barr, Birmingham, before selecting his victim. "The offences you have committed offend all human sensibility," the court said.

headlines: China to provide $2.5 billion loan to Pakistan: Report
text: China will provide a loan of $2.5 billion to Pakistan to boost its foreign exchange reserves, a local media report quoting Pakistan government officials said. China had last year deposited $2 billion in the State Bank of Pakistan, according to reports. Pakistan has also secured financial assistance from Saudi Arabia and the UAE.

headlines: Would love to do masala film, but story has to be there: Rao
text: Rajkummar Rao has said that he is "very open" to being a part of masala films, adding, "I want to do films which are...larger than life but the story has to be there...You can't compromise the story." "The definition of masala-entertainer is also changing now...would love to be a part of films [like 'Simmba'] which have a story," added Rao.

headlines: Feel lost how we got only six wickets vs Windies: Stuart Broad
text: After the Windies finished the second Test's second day at 272/6, registering a lead of 85 runs, England pacer Stuart Broad said that he felt a bit lost as to how England took only six wickets. "We've put everything into it. Heart and soul has gone into that day," Broad further added about the ongoing second Test.

headlines: Saha still in our scheme of things for Tests: MSK Prasad
text: Speaking about the competition for the wicket-keeper spot in India's Test team, selector MSK Prasad said, "Wriddhiman Saha has been our number one wicket-keeper till he got injured... Saha is still in our scheme of things for [Tests]." Speaking about Rishabh Pant, Prasad said that following Saha's injuries Pant was given an opportunity which he has 'grabbed with both hands.'

headlines: Posters depicting Rahul as Lord Ram vandalised in Patna
text: A group of unidentified miscreants on Friday vandalised posters depicting Congress President Rahul Gandhi as Lord Ram in Patna. The incident occurred hours after a complaint was filed against Rahul and several others for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. The posters were captioned, "They'll keep chanting Ram's name! While you live like Ram!!"

headlines: Pune Police arrests activist accused in Bhima-Koregaon case
text: Pune Police on Saturday arrested activist Anand Teltumbde in the Bhima-Koregaon case for his alleged Maoist links. He was arrested despite a Supreme Court order which granted him interim protection from arrest for four weeks from January 14. This comes after a Pune sessions court on Friday rejected his anticipatory bail saying there is enough evidence to prove his involvement.

headlines: Tiger that mauled 3 people to death captured in Karnataka
text: Karnataka forest department officials on Friday captured a tiger suspected to have mauled a 60-year-old man to death a day ago. A senior official said, "We had spotted the animal in one of our camera traps and successfully tranquillised it." The tiger, which is suspected to have killed three people since December 23, is being relocated to a zoo.

headlines: Citizenship bill won't violate Assam Accord: Assam CM
text: Talking about the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal on Friday said that the Assam Accord will not be violated if the bill was implemented. "It is not right to unnecessarily create social disturbance" over the bill, he added. The...bill is for entire nation, not only Assam...Then why unnecessary fear is being created among people?" he further said.

headlines: Ban on Students Islamic Movement of India extended for 5 yrs
text: The Centre on Thursday banned the Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI) for a period of five more years starting February 1 under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. It said the organisation was indulging in activities prejudicial to the security of the country and disturbing peace and communal harmony. The Home Ministry also listed 58 cases where SIMI members were involved.

headlines: With 290% growth in blockchain jobs, IIIT-B launches PG Program
text: India houses the second largest pool of blockchain developers in the world with over 20,000 developers while the blockchain industry is witnessing a 290% increase in job growth rates with salary hikes of around 50-100%. Learners can now become a certified blockchain developer with IIIT-Bangalore & upGrad's PG Certification in Blockchain Technology taught by experts from IBM, BankChain, SpringRole, SquadX.

headlines: Anil Ambani's RCom moves bankruptcy court to resolve debt burden
text: Reliance Communications on Friday said it will seek fast track resolution through National Company Law Tribunal in Mumbai for its debt crisis. The Anil Ambani-controlled company owed banks $7 billion as of March 2017, when it last made its debts public. Last September, Anil Ambani had announced that RCom would shut its telecom business to focus on real estate.

headlines: Australian cricketer bowled underarm to save 7 off last ball in ODI
text: Former Australian captain Greg Chappell instructed his brother Trevor Chappell to bowl an underarm delivery as New Zealand needed seven runs off the final delivery in Melbourne on February 1, 1981. The Kiwi batsman threw away his bat in frustration after defending the delivery. The laws of the game were later changed to make underarm bowling illegal in cricket.

headlines: 'Fiji Water Girl' sues Fiji Water for using her image on cutouts
text: Model Kelleth Cuthbert, also known as 'Fiji Water Girl' after photo bombing celebrities while carrying a tray of Fiji Water on the Golden Globes red carpet, has sued the company for using her image on cardboard cutouts without her authorisation. Cuthbert alleged the company attempted to pressure her into signing a "fake document" authorising the use of her image.

headlines: People called me s**t performer in the beginning: 'Baby Doll' singer
text: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who has sung songs like 'Baby Doll' and 'Chittiyaan Kalaiyaan', said that at the beginning of her career, people said on her face that she's a 'sh** performer'. "I performed live on stage, I was a bad live performer," said Kanika. "I don't have any ego to listen to criticism, I learn something from there," she added.

headlines: Every dog has its day: ICC CEO Richardson on NZ's win over India
text: Reacting to New Zealand's eight-wicket victory against India in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday, ICC CEO David Richardson said, "Every dog has its day." India were bowled out for 92 runs, while New Zealand chased down the target with 212 balls remaining. India lead the five-match series 3-1, with the final match scheduled to take place on Sunday.

headlines: Qatar defeat Japan to win their first-ever Asian Cup title
text: Qatar defeated four-time champions Japan 3-1 in the final on Friday to win their first ever Asian Cup. Qatar forward Almoez Ali broke the record of most goals in a single Asian Cup after netting his ninth goal with an overhead kick, breaking Ali Daei's 1996 record. This was the first time that Japan lost in an Asian Cup final.

headlines: Dravid proposes plan to train players for alternate career options
text: India Under-19 coach Rahul Dravid has reportedly proposed a plan to BCCI to help young cricketers get training and jobs for life and career outside cricket. Dravid discussed a programme aimed at improving life skills of young cricketers. "We are working towards formulating a structure before it is sent to...BCCI to get things going," NCA COO Tufan Ghosh said.

headlines: Toll staffer shares video of being shot at, says it was by police
text: A Nainital toll plaza employee named Nandan Singh has filed a complaint alleging a police constable fired at him after asking him the whereabouts of another employee who was not present. Singh, who submitted CCTV footage showing he narrowly escaped the bullet, further claimed the constable threatened him to keep quiet. The police have ordered an investigation into the incident.

headlines: Indian embassy opens hotline for 129 students detained in US
text: The Indian embassy in the US has opened a 24/7 hotline and appointed a nodal officer to assist 129 Indian students who were arrested in a "pay-and-stay" university visa scam. Following Indian authorities' intervention, some of the students were released. The students are accused of enrolling at a fake university to maintain their student visa status to obtain work permits.

headlines: Pune man jailed for raping 3 daughters, wife also imprisoned
text: A Pune court has sentenced a 45-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping his three daughters, one of whom was a minor at the time. It sentenced the girls' mother to seven years' imprisonment for abetting the crime. When the girls had complained of the abuse to their mother, she told them he was under the influence of black magic.

headlines: 129 Indian 'students' arrested in US 'pay-to-stay' immigration scam
text: US authorities have arrested 129 Indian nationals enrolled at a fake university in a "pay-to-stay" immigration scam as of Thursday. Prosecutors said the students knew the programme was not approved by the government and intended to fraudulently maintain their student visa status to obtain work permits. The individuals would be kept in custody and face deportation pending immigration court verdict.

headlines: US firm fined $1mn over fake eyelashes with materials from N Korea
text: A US cosmetics firm has been fined nearly $1 million for importing fake eyelashes containing materials from UN-sanctioned North Korea. The firm's compliance program and its supplier audits failed to discover that approximately 80% of the fake eyelash kits contained materials from North Korea. Sanctions have been imposed on North Korea over its nuclear and ballistic missile programs.

headlines: Sinkhole in Florida turns out to be secret tunnel leading to bank
text: A sinkhole in Florida, US turned out to be a 46-metre secret tunnel leading to a local bank, said the FBI. It wrote in a tweet that it was treating the case as an "attempted bank burglary." "The only thing I've ever seen like this is in the movies. This is truly a unique case here," an FBI agent said.

headlines: Happy birthday to my hero: Tiger on dad Jackie's birthday
text: Tiger Shroff took to Instagram to share a picture of his father Jackie Shroff on the occasion of his 61st birthday. "Happy birthday to my...handsome father/friend/love/hero! Love you daddy," the actor wrote. Tiger's 'Student Of The Year 2' co-star Ananya Panday shared an old picture with Jackie and wrote, "Happy birthday to the coolest there is and ever will be!"

headlines: Mani Ratnam wanted me to do 'Raavan': Shah Rukh Khan
text: Revealing that he was offered Mani Ratnam's 2010 film 'Raavan', Shah Rukh Khan said, "[Mani] wanted me to do 'Raavan'. But I was caught up then. Also, it was bilingual. I found it difficult to do that." 'Raavan' eventually starred Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. The film also starred Govinda, Ravi Kishan, Vikram and Nikhil Dwivedi.

headlines: Don't shed crocodile tears for farmers: Jaitley to Opposition
text: Hitting out at the Opposition over its remarks on the Interim Budget, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said they shouldn't shed crocodile tears for farmers. Adding that the agricultural sector isn't just Centre's responsibility, he said, "Opposition also has...governments, let them announce similar schemes." "Loan waiver isn't a long-term solution. Income support still is," he further said.

headlines: Budget like surgical strike, silenced Opp'n: Sushil Modi
text: Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi on Friday called the Interim Budget a "surgical strike type Union Budget", which has "silenced the speech of Opposition". "In the all-inclusive budget of PM Narendra Modi...care has been taken of farmers, labourers," he added. He further said that most benefit will go to states like Bihar "where 91% of small and marginal farmers are".

headlines: Bihar Cabinet approves 10% general category quota
text: The Bihar Cabinet on Friday approved the 10% reservation in government jobs and educational institutes for economically weaker section in the general category in the state. The government would table a new bill regarding the implementation of the quota in the coming budget session. The cabinet meeting chaired by CM Nitish Kumar also passed 58 agendas placed before it.

headlines: 12-yr-old accidentally shoots self while playing with pistol
text: A 12-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow accidentally shot herself in the head while playing with her father's pistol. "The girl placed the barrel of the pistol on her right temple and was enacting suicide attempt when the trigger was accidentally pulled," a police official said. She was immediately taken to a nearby hospital where she died during treatment.

headlines: 3 dead after avalanche hits snow-clearance team in J&K
text: At least three people were killed on Friday after an avalanche hit a snow-clearance team in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam area. The incident reportedly happened after their snow clearing machine was buried under the avalanche. While two of them were declared brought dead, the third person succumbed to his injuries later.

headlines: Ireland says it won't leave European Union and join UK
text: Republic of Ireland's Europe Minister, Helen McEntee, has said the country won't leave the European Union (EU) and join the UK. She added that 92% of the country's population voted last year to remain in the EU. The border between the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland (part of the UK) has been a major issue in the Brexit negotiations.

headlines: Uzbekistan lifts ban on teaching Political Science
text: Uzbekistan has lifted the ban on teaching Political Science, according to a decree issued by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. The subject was entirely banned in 2015 under the regime of President Islam Karimov reportedly on the grounds that it is a western pseudoscience that does not take into account the "Uzbek model" of development.

headlines: US suspends Cold War-era nuclear arms treaty with Russia
text: The US has suspended its obligations under the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with Russia effective February 2, US State Secretary Mike Pompeo announced on Friday. The US has accused Russia of violating the Cold War-era pact by deploying a ground-based cruise missile. The INF treaty required the elimination of both US and Russia's land-based nuclear missiles from Europe.

headlines: Walking into wedding reception 100047: Nick on pic with Priyanka
text: Singer Nick Jonas took to social media to share a picture with his wife, actress Priyanka Chopra, and captioned it, "Walking into wedding reception 100047 like... Haha just kidding." The picture is from the Learning Lab Ventures Winter Gala that the couple attended. Nick and Priyanka, who got married in December 2018, had hosted four wedding receptions.

headlines: Logistical nightmare: BCCI official on players taking families to WC
text: A BCCI official has said it'd be a 'logistical nightmare' if families of Indian cricketers travel with them during the 2019 World Cup in England. "If the team is travelling with less number of members...it's easier to manage," he added. He further said there is also the problem of arranging match tickets for families and it has to be regulated.

headlines: I had 2000 lambs, I'm vegan not due to love for animals: Chhetri
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri has said he has gone vegan not because of his love for animals. "After eating 2,000 lambs I can't say...[I turned vegan due to love for animals], but at my age, it helps in recovery," he added. The 34-year-old admitted his camaraderie with Virat Kohli helped him realise the fitness benefits of going vegan.

headlines: 17-yr-old Nepalese becomes youngest to score fifty in T20I cricket
text: Nepal batsman Sundeep Jora has become the youngest cricketer to score a fifty in T20I cricket, achieving the feat aged 17 years and 103 days on his debut against UAE on Thursday. Jora slammed 53*(46) including three fours and a six. The previous record was held by Canada's Hiral Patel, who scored a fifty aged 18 years and 177 days.

headlines: Asked Kohli what was wrong with him after he ordered idli: Chhetri
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri has revealed he used to make fun of Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli for going vegan. "[Once], he ordered some idli and I asked him what was wrong with him," Chhetri added. "What he eats, how he trains, he is different from others. He actually trains like a footballer," Chhetri further said.

headlines: Mithali has missed just 13 ODIs since her debut 20 years ago
text: Indian women's ODI cricket team captain Mithali Raj, who became the first woman to play 200 ODIs on Friday, has missed just 13 ODIs since making her debut on June 26, 1999. India have won 115 ODIs and lost 81 when Mithali has been part of the playing XI. Overall, India Women have played 263 ODIs.

headlines: Man lives with 17-yr-old girl in forest for 23 days, held for rape
text: Kerala police have arrested a 21-year-old man and charged him with abducting and raping a 17-year-old girl, with whom he was hiding in forests for 23 days. The search operation began on January 6 when the girl's family reported her disappearance. The man reportedly told police that he planned to elope with the girl after she threatened to kill herself.

headlines: IIT Hyderabad student falls 7 floors while talking on phone, dies
text: A 22-year-old final year engineering student of IIT Hyderabad died when he accidentally fell from the terrace of his seven-storied hostel building while talking on his phone on Friday. "His father M Rajan, a businessman, is in a state of depression because Anirudhya was his only son. The boy's elder sister got married to a doctor only recently," police said.

headlines: Detained refugee who wrote book using WhatsApp wins top prize
text: Behrouz Boochani, a refugee in Papua New Guinea (PNG), has won Australia's top literary prize for his book 'No Friend But the Mountains: Writing from Manus Prison', which he wrote on his mobile phone and delivered it to a translator through WhatsApp. Under Australia's policy, asylum seekers who come by boat are processed at offshore centres in PNG and Nauru.

headlines: Won't have time to direct George Fernandes biopic: Shoojit
text: Filmmaker Shoojit Sircar said he will not have time to direct 'Thackeray' writer Sanjay Raut's upcoming biopic based on former Defence Minister George Fernandes, who passed away on Tuesday. "I'm currently very busy with...prep work on my next projects," Shoojit explained. While announcing his plans to make the biopic, Sanjay Raut had said he wanted Shoojit to direct the film.

headlines: Rohit Shetty's 'Sooryavanshi' is not a remake: Spokesperson
text: Addressing reports that suggest filmmaker Rohit Shetty's upcoming film 'Sooryavanshi' is a remake of a Tamil film, the filmmaker's spokesperson said, "The news is completely untrue and baseless." "Sooryavanshi...is an original story and not inspired from any film, his spokesperson added. Earlier, reports stated that 'Sooryavanshi' would be a remake of the Tamil film 'Theeran Adhigaaram Ondru'.

headlines: Govt gave nothing to Andhra even in its last budget: CM Naidu
text: Expressing discontentment over the Interim Budget, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Friday said, "Nothing is assured to the state even in [BJP-led Centre's] last budget." "I...kept calling PM Narendra Modi. But he didn't pay heed", he added. On Friday, TDP observed 'Black Day', demanding special category status for Andhra Pradesh and fulfilment of other promises made to the state.

headlines: It's a budget of desperation, has no value: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday said the Interim Budget has "no value" as the BJP-led government's term will end soon. Mamata added "it's a budget of desperation" which won't be implemented as new government will decide the new budget. "This government has no moral authority...to place...budget for five years when they'll not be in power," she further said.

headlines: Budget is for new India, will energise the citizens: PM Modi
text: Calling the Interim Budget 2019-20 a budget for "new India", PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that it will "help energise the 130 crore citizens in achieving the new India's goal". "The unorganised labour force hasnt ever received any help from previous governments," he added. "The beneficiaries will [now] get assured monthly pension after reaching...60 years," he further said.

headlines: India won't be easy to beat in World Cup: ICC CEO David Richardson
text: Talking about chances of teams in the 2019 Cricket World Cup, ICC CEO David Richardson said that it is extremely difficult to pick a winner. "England have got their best ODI team in many years. South Africa have also performed. But the progress India have made in the recent years, it will be exceptionally difficult to beat them," he added.

headlines: 11-year-old boy seeks ban on PUBG, moves Bombay High Court
text: An 11-year-old boy on Thursday moved the Bombay High Court, seeking a ban on online multi-player game PUBG. The boy said that the game promotes violence, aggression and cyber-bullying. "The petition has also sought a direction to the central government to form an Online Ethics Review Committee for periodical checking of such violence-oriented online content, the petitioners lawyer said.

headlines: Why no major protest in 5 years: Jaitley on unemployment report
text: Talking about the unemployment data report circulated in media, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said if the claims were true, there should've been "great social unrest in the country". "Past five years have passed...without a...major protest", he added. As per a Business Standard report, an unreleased government survey found that India's unemployment reached a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-2018.

headlines: EU rules Gibraltar is 'colony' of Britain
text: The European Union (EU) has ruled in a proposed regulation that Gibraltar is a "colony of the British Crown" following Spain's insistence. Spain has long been in dispute with Britain over the control of Gibraltar. The proposed EU regulation allows British citizens visa-free travel to EU, even if Britain leaves the bloc without a deal.

headlines: Catholic Church in Texas names 300 priests accused of sex abuse
text: The Roman Catholic Church in Texas, US, has released the names of around 300 priests who have been accused of sexually abusing children. "The Bishops of Texas have decided to release the names because it's right and just and to offer healing and hope to those who have suffered", President of US Conference of Catholic Bishops, Cardinal Daniel DiNardo said.

headlines: Who are the key officials who worked on Interim Budget 2019-20?
text: Subhash Chandra Garg, Department of Economic Affairs Secretary, is responsible for Finance Ministry's coordination with regulators like the RBI, SEBI and World Bank. Revenue Secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey oversees the revenue receipts, while Financial Services Secretary Rajiv Kumar is responsible for functioning of 21 state-run banks. Atanu Chakraborty has the task of meeting the government's disinvestment target.

headlines: Support removing Hirani's name from 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha...': Rajkummar
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he supports the revoking of filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani's credit from the film 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga' amid the sexual harassment allegations levelled against Hirani. The director has been accused of sexually assaulting a woman on 'Sanju' sets. Rao said he feels sad for the woman and hopes an investigation is conducted.

headlines: It was my decision to give Kangana 1st credit: Manikarnika producer
text: 'Manikarnika' producer Kamal Jain, while criticising co-director Krish over the controversy surrounding the direction credits, said, "It was mine and studio's collective decision to give credits the way they are." "To attack Kangana who stood by the film from beginning to end is very sad," he added. Krish is trying to claim credit for something he doesn't deserve, said Kamal.

headlines: This budget is just a trailer of what is to come after polls: PM
text: Speaking about the Interim Budget, PM Narendra Modi on Friday said, "This is an Interim Budget. This is just a trailer of the budget which, after elections, will take India on the path to development." "From middle class to labourers, from farmers' growth to the development of businessmen...everyone has been taken care of in this Interim Budget," PM Modi added.

headlines: Started planning for WC after CT final loss vs Pakistan: MSK Prasad
text: Team India chief selector MSK Prasad has revealed that the committee started preparing for 2019 World Cup after the Champions Trophy final defeat to Pakistan in 2017. "We analysed our shortcomings after that game, and we started working to fulfil those shortcomings. We tried certain new combinations and I feel we have fairly succeeded in what we wanted," he added.

headlines: Tesla patents open for all, our competition is gasoline cars: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday reiterated that the company's patents were open to all for the advancement of electric vehicle technology and sustainable transport. "Our true competition is not the small trickle of non-Tesla electric cars being produced, but the enormous flood of gasoline cars pouring out of the world's factories every day," tweeted Musk.

headlines: Why did Columbia spacecraft carrying Kalpana Chawla crash in 2003?
text: Space Shuttle Columbia carrying seven crew members including India-born astronaut Kalpana Chawla exploded upon reentering Earth's atmosphere on February 1, 2003. During the launch of its 28th Earth-orbiting mission, a piece of insulating foam broke off and struck the left wing. On re-entry, the damaged wing allowed superheated gases to penetrate, breaking the orbiter apart and killing the crew.

headlines: US boy calls 911 to ask 'what is 3/4 + 1/4', gets help
text: A US boy who was having trouble solving 3/4 + 1/4 called 911 to find the answer. Emergency dispatcher Antonia Bundy, who responded to the call, helped the boy with his math homework. The boy, who told Bundy that he was "bad at fractions", later said, "I'm sorry for calling you, but I really needed help."

headlines: US court orders Syria to pay $302 million over journo's death
text: A US court has found Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's government liable for the death of American war correspondent Marie Colvin and ordered the regime to pay $302.5 million in damages. Colvin and French photographer Rémi Ochlik were killed in Syria in 2012 when the building they were living and working in was targeted by rockets.

headlines: Artist sues Ariana Grande for copying imagery in music video
text: An artist named Vladimir Kush sued singer Ariana Grande over the imagery used in the music video for her song 'God is a Woman'. Kush alleged that visuals from the video, where a woman's silhouette is seen inside a flame, were copied from two of his paintings. Kush is also suing Freenjoy, the production company behind the video.

headlines: Govt will launch National Artificial Intelligence Portal: FM
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday announced that the government will soon launch a National Artificial Intelligence Portal. Presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 in the Lok Sabha, Goyal added that nine priority areas have been identified for the development of the AI sector in the country. Reportedly, about 200 AI startups in India are creating AI-based solutions for various industries.

headlines: Apple temporarily blocks Google's internal iOS apps: Report
text: Apple on Thursday briefly blocked Google's employee-only iOS apps after it was reportedly found to be in violation of Apple's app distribution policy. Early versions of Google Maps, Hangouts, Gmail, and other pre-release beta apps also stopped working. This comes after Apple revoked similar permissions for Facebook when it was found that a 'Facebook Research' app was downloading user data.

headlines: JNU writes to VP Naidu, LS Speaker over MPs' protest
text: The JNU administration has written to Vice President Venkaiah Naidu and Lok Sabha speaker Sumitra Mahajan alleging that two MPs violated Delhi High Court orders. "JNU Teacher's Association office-bearers mislead the MPs and brought them to protest at administration building which has been prohibited," it said. The two had joined a protest to resist dilution of reservations in public education.

headlines: 4 dead, 1 injured in explosion at firecracker factory in UP
text: As many as four people were killed and one was injured after an explosion at a firecracker factory in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district on Thursday. The two-storey factory, which was being run at the residence of its owner, collapsed after the explosion, a police official said. An investigation is underway to ascertain if the factory had a licence, police added.

headlines: Wont let RSS, govt meddle in gurdwara affairs: SGPC chief
text: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) President Gobind Singh Longowal on Thursday said that they won't let the government and RSS meddle in Sikh affairs. This comes after RSS affiliate Rashtriya Sikh Sangat said that Shiromani Akali Dal is controlling all the gurdwaras. "The management of gurdwaras is run only by SGPC which is the elected body of Sikhs," Longowal added.

headlines: Accenture's former CEO passes away weeks after stepping down
text: Global consulting firm Accenture on Thursday said its former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Pierre Nanterme has passed away, weeks after stepping down from the company due to health reasons. He had been diagnosed with colon cancer in 2016. Nanterme, who took the helm in January 2011, had been with Accenture for 36 years.

headlines: Sensex ends 213 points higher after Interim Budget 2019-20
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex on Friday ended 213 points higher at 36,469 following the Interim Budget session for 2019-20. Auto stocks Maruti Suzuki and Hero MotoCorp were the biggest gainers in the Sensex, ending up to 7% higher. The broader Nifty 50 index ended 63 points higher at 10,893.65.

headlines: Sonam, Anil starrer 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh...' hits the theatres
text: Sonam Kapoor and Anil Kapoor starrer 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga', which released today, is an "important, well-intended entertainer," wrote Times Now. Firstpost called the film "a warm ode to loving and living". The "film is a whiff of fresh air with daring vision," said NDTV. It has been rated 3.5/5 (Times Now), 3/5 (Firstpost) and 4/5 (NDTV).

headlines: Kya josh tha: Piyush Goyal praises 'Uri' during Interim Budget
text: While presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal praised Vicky Kaushal starrer 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and said, "I had the opportunity to watch the film recently. Kya josh tha, kya mahaul tha." The film is based on the 2016 surgical strike carried out by the Indian Armed forces on terror hubs in Pakistan.

headlines: Budget unquestionably pro-growth, pro-farmer, pro-poor: Arun Jaitley
text: Complimenting Finance Minister Piyush Goyal for delivering an "excellent" budget, Union Minister Arun Jaitley said, "The budget is unquestionably pro-growth, fiscally prudent, pro-farmer and pro-poor." "The budget expands spending while pragmatically sticking to fiscal prudence," Jaitley said. "Between 2014-19, every budget has given significant relief to the middle class," he added.

headlines: It was Account for Votes, not Vote-on-Account: Chidambaram
text: Reacting to the Interim Budget presented in the Parliament on Friday, Congress MP and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram tweeted, "It was not a Vote-on-Account. It was an Account for Votes." Vote-on-Account is a provision by which the government obtains Parliament's approval for funds sufficient to incur expenditure till a full budget is presented after formation of new government.

headlines: Pandya has abundance of talent which he needs to realise: MSK Prasad
text: Talking about Hardik Pandya, who recently returned to India playing XI after being suspended over his comments on Koffee with Karan, chief selector MSK Prasad said Pandya "definitely" adds huge strength to team's balance. "He brings in...additional strength to all three departments...He has an abundance of talent, which he needs to realise and convert into match-winning performances," he added.

headlines: Jharkhand govt exposes Aadhaar data of 1,66,000 employees: Report
text: A web system used to record attendance of Jharkhand government employees was left without a password since 2014, exposing names, job titles, and partial phone numbers of 1,66,000 workers, a TechCrunch report has claimed. The Aadhaar numbers were not directly listed, but the filenames of the photos contained the 12-digit identity number, TechCrunch said. The website has been pulled offline.

headlines: Let's have another demonetisation: Chidambaram on revised GDP rate
text: Taking a dig at the government after it revised GDP growth rate upwards from 7.1% to 8.2% for 2016-17, the year of demonetisation, Congress MP P Chidambaram tweeted, "The demonetisation year was the best year of growth (8.2%) under Mr Modi." "So, let's have another round of demonetisation. This time let's demonetise 100 rupee notes," he added.

headlines: Woman techie booked for kidnapping carpenter who stalked her
text: Hyderabad Police has booked a 24-year-old woman software engineer on charges of assaulting and kidnapping a carpenter who had allegedly been stalking her. He harassed her by sending messages and calling her on phone. The woman then asked him to come near a college, from where, she and her five friends took him to an isolated place and thrashed him.

headlines: Trump ready to end Korean War: US envoy
text: US President Donald Trump is ready to end the Korean War, US envoy Stephen Biegun said. "(It's) time to move past 70 years of war in the Korean Peninsula...We're not going to invade North Korea. We're not seeking to topple the regime", he added. His remarks come ahead of the second summit between Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.

headlines: Dabur's longest-serving CEO Sunil Duggal steps down after 17 years
text: Packaged consumer goods giant Dabur India on Thursday announced that Mohit Malhotra will replace the company's longest-serving CEO Sunil Duggal from April 1. The 62-year-old Duggal joined the New Delhi-based company in 1995 and became the CEO in 2002. Malhotra, who currently heads the company's India business, joined Dabur as a management trainee in 1994.

headlines: Swara Bhasker to produce and star in Krishna Sen biopic
text: Swara Bhasker, who recently launched her production house Kahaaniwaaley along with her brother Ishan, will produce and star in a biopic on Krishna Sen. Talking about the project, Ishan said, "Krishna Sen's real-life story is the perfect choice to portray a mysterious real-life character as well as bring a strangely true story to life on the big screen."

headlines: This is a historic Budget, says Rajnath Singh
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh has called the Interim Budget presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal "a historic budget." He added, "This will enable the common man to stand on his feet and all the sections of the society will benefit from it." Meanwhile, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said the Budget "will help achieve the dream of a New India."

headlines: Thank you for copying Congress: Chidambaram on Budget
text: Reacting to the Interim Budget 2019-20, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "Thank you Interim FM for copying the Congress declaration that the poor have the first right to the resources." "It was not a Vote on Account. It was an Account for Votes," he added. Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal presented the BJP-led government's budget on Friday.

headlines: Woman kills daughter with lover's help to hide affair; held
text: A woman and her lover have been arrested for allegedly killing her 11-year-old daughter in Haryana's Karnal. The woman, who had separated from her husband, feared that her daughter may tell the husband about her affair, police said. Following the alleged murder, the body of the deceased was put in a plastic bag and dumped near a canal, police added.

headlines: EU Parliament recognises Guaidó as Venezuela's interim Prez
text: The European Parliament has recognised Juan Guaidó as Venezuela's interim President and called upon European Union member states to do the same until there were "new free and credible elections". While the US recognised Guaidó, the UK, Germany, Spain and France said on January 26 that they would recognise Guaidó unless President Nicolás Maduro held new elections within eight days.

headlines: Jet accepts Etihad bailout plan, Goyal may resign: Reports
text: Cash-strapped Jet Airways has agreed to most of the conditions set by its second-largest shareholder Etihad for its revival, as per reports. Both the airlines are set to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) within days, reports added. This would result in Jet Airways Founder and Chairman Naresh Goyal stepping down from the airline's board of directors, reports further said.

headlines: Govt implemented new FDI norms in haste: Flipkart
text: US retail giant Walmart-owned Flipkart has said it is disappointed with the government's decision to implement the revised e-commerce rules in "haste". The company added that it remains committed to compliance "despite the significant work required to change supply chains and systems". The company remains confident that it will continue to serve its customers and sellers well, it further said.

headlines: India attracted FDI worth $239 billion in last 5 years: FM Goyal
text: India received Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) worth $239 billion in the last five years on account of a stable and predictable regulatory regime, growing economy and strong fundamentals, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said while delivering Interim Budget 2019-20. "This period also witnessed a rapid liberalisation of the FDI policy allowing most FDI to come through the automatic route," he added.

headlines: Income Tax refunds to be processed in 24 hrs, released immediately
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal, while delivering the Interim Budget speech, said that Income Tax refunds will be processed in 24 hours and released immediately. Goyal also said that within the next 2 years, returns chosen for scrutiny will also be processed digitally with anonymity. "India has now moved to a moderate tax regime with high tax collection," he added.

headlines: Humne kamar tod mehengai ki kamar tod di: FM Piyush Goyal
text: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20 on Friday, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said, "Humne kamar tod mehengai ki kamar tod di." When we took over inflation was as high as 10.1%, we brought it down to 2.19%, Goyal added. He further said that the country had witnessed the fastest GDP growth in the last five years.

headlines: I don't consider Anu Malik family: Nephew Amaal on #MeToo claims
text: Singer Amaal Mallik, while speaking about the sexual harassment allegations against his uncle, singer-composer Anu Malik, said, "My family is first my four people. Beyond that, I don't count anyone as a family. He has his own family." "It was a tough time for them," he added. "When it happened, it was obviously a little humiliating," Amaal further said.

headlines: Having Anu Malik as uncle must be trauma enough: Sona to Amaal Mallik
text: After singer Amaal Mallik said he doesn't consider his uncle Anu Malik as family, in light of sexual harassment allegations against him, Sona Mohapatra tweeted, "Having [him] as...uncle must be trauma enough." Reacting to his statement that women should go to court instead of making allegations on social media, Sona added, "These are our 'personal stories' too...Don't go around judging."

headlines: Modi govt devoted to dreams of poor, farmers, youth: Shah on budget
text: After the Interim Budget was presented in the Parliament, BJP President Amit Shah said, "Today's budget has re-certified that the Modi government is a government devoted to the dreams and aspirations of the poor, farmers and youth of the country." "For this all-inclusive budget, I congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji and his entire government," he added.

headlines: Reliefs without risking economy's bankruptcy: Mahindra on Budget
text: Reacting to the Interim Budget 2019-20 presented on Friday, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "I'm just grateful that the reliefs to the key middle class & farmer segments were delivered in a measured way without risking bankruptcy of the economy." "I was bracing for a populist, profligate budget driven by election panic," he added.

headlines: Not too worried about his form: Dravid on KL Rahul's golden duck
text: After India A batsman KL Rahul got out for a golden duck in the fifth one-day against England Lions on Thursday, coach Rahul Dravid said he isn't too worried about Rahul's form. "I have no doubt that he has got quality and ability. He's a proven performer," Dravid added. Rahul scored 55 runs in 3 one-day matches against England Lions.

headlines: It's absolutely huge: Murray on 'get well soon' teddy bear gift
text: Three-time Grand Slam champion Andy Murray took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with a 'get well soon' teddy bear, which was gifted to him by fellow tennis players Stanislas Wawrinka and Donna Vekic. "It's absolutely huge...my kids will be fighting over this when I get home!" wrote Murray, who is recovering from a hip resurfacing surgery.

headlines: Underworld don Ravi Pujari arrested in West Africa: Report
text: Underworld don Ravi Pujari, who allegedly made extortion demands to Bollywood personalities between 2009 and 2013, has reportedly been arrested from West African country of Sénégal. The gangster, who has been on the run for over a decade, is wanted in India in a number of cases including extortion, kidnapping and murder.

headlines: Paris policemen who raped tourist inside police HQ jailed for 7yrs
text: Two police officers have been sentenced to seven years in jail after being found guilty of raping a Canadian tourist at a Paris police headquarters in 2014. The woman said she was invited to tour the headquarters after meeting some officers in a bar, but when she went there she was gang-raped. However, officers said she had consented to sex.

headlines: Not true: Rajkummar on replacing SRK in Rakesh Sharma biopic
text: Denying the reports that said Rajkummar Rao will be replacing Shah Rukh Khan in Rakesh Sharma's biopic titled 'Saare Jahaan Se Achcha', Rao said, "There's no truth to that...haven't heard anything like that." Earlier, there were reports that Shah Rukh opted out of the biopic for Farhan Akhtar's 'Don 3'. Reports also claimed Vicky Kaushal was considered for the role.

headlines: Priyanka to play Osho disciple Ma Anand Sheela in H'wood film
text: Priyanka Chopra will be portraying Osho disciple Ma Anand Sheela in upcoming Hollywood film. Talking about the project on 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show', Priyanka said, "We are developing it [from the viewpoint of] Sheela who was with this guru who originated from India. She was [Osho's] right-hand woman." The film will be directed by 'Rain Man' director Barry Levinson.

headlines: 22nd AIIMS will be set up in Haryana: Piyush Goyal
text: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said that the 22nd All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) will be set up in Haryana. Currently, 21 AIIMS are operating or being established, 14 of which have been announced since 2014, he added. Talking about Ayushman Bharat, he further said that it has benefitted 10 lakh patients.

headlines: Interim Budget will achieve the dream of a New India: Yogi
text: Discussing the Interim Budget, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Friday, "This Budget will help achieve the dream of a New India." He added, "All sections of the society, including farmers, middle class, poor and women have been mentioned." Meanwhile, BJP chief Amit Shah said the government is devoted to the dreams and aspirations of the poor, youth and farmers.

headlines: 34 crore Jan Dhan bank accounts opened in last 5 years: FM
text: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said 34 crore Jan Dhan Yojana bank accounts were opened in last five years. This comes after President Ram Nath Kovind stated that almost every family is now connected to the banking system. Goyal further said Aadhaar has been universally implemented, ensuring the poor and middle class receive government benefits directly.

headlines: Ben Affleck confirms quitting his role as 'Batman'
text: Hollywood actor Ben Affleck has confirmed that he has quit the role of superhero character 'Batman'. He shared an article titled 'Ben Affleck passes the torch to next generation of Bruce Wayne'. "Excited for #TheBatman in Summer 2021 and to see [director] Matt Reeves' vision come to life," Affleck tweeted.

headlines: Indian filmmakers will now get single window clearance for shoot
text: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that Indian filmmakers will now get single window clearance for ease of shooting films. This facility was so far available only to foreign filmmakers. Additionally, anti-camcording provision will be introduced to Cinematography Act to combat film piracy, he added.

headlines: India fastest highway developer, 27 km highway built each day: FM
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 on Friday said that India is the world's fastest highway developer with 27 kilometres of highway being built each day. The Sagarmala project will help faster handling of import and export cars, added Goyal. The domestic passenger traffic has increased two-fold in the last five years, he further said.

headlines: Govt sources leaked budget pointers to media: Cong's Manish Tewari
text: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Friday alleged government sources were sending budget pointers to media houses since morning. "If these pointers are there in Finance Minister's speech then it tantamounts to a leak. It would be a serious issue of breach of secrecy," added Tewari. He also shared a series of pointers which he claimed were leaked by government sources.

headlines: No human interference in tax verification and scrutiny in 2 yrs: FM
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 said that almost all assessment and verification of income tax returns will be done without any human interference within nearly two years. The returns will be assessed electronically by an anonymised tax system, Goyal said. The move will end any intervention by tax officials in filed returns, he added.

headlines: Poised to be $5 tn economy in 5 yrs, aspire for $10 tn in 8 yrs: FM
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said, "We are poised to become a $5 trillion economy in the next five years." "We aspire to become a $10 trillion economy in the next eight years," Goyal added. The Finance Minister further mentioned that an 18% increase in direct tax collections was registered in 2017-18.

headlines: You would spend 35-40% more if govt didn't contain inflation: Goyal
text: While presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said, "Our families would be spending 35-40% more today on basic necessities if the government didn't contain inflation." The inflation in December 2018 was just 2.1%, down from the double-digit seen during the previous government, he added. Inflation has been brought down to 4.1%, Goyal further said.

headlines: Pilot dies after Mirage trainer jet crashes at B'luru's HAL airport
text: A pilot died after Mirage 2000 trainer fighter aircraft of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) crashed at the HAL Airport near Bengaluru on Friday. The two pilots inside the aircraft had ejected, but one of them died as he had reportedly landed on the wreckage of the aircraft. HAL has confirmed that the jet developed a technical snag.

headlines: Kalank's wrap-up felt like a big loss: Aditya Roy Kapur
text: Aditya Roy Kapur, while talking about his upcoming film 'Kalank', said that the film's wrap-up felt like a "big loss". "It doesn't happen with every film but on this one, Varun [Dhawan], Alia [Bhatt], Sonakshi [Sinha] and I got along well," added Aditya. Directed by Abhishek Varman, the film also stars Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay Dutt.

headlines: Sonam Kapoor to star opposite Akshay in Sooryavanshi: Report
text: Sonam Kapoor will star opposite Akshay Kumar in Rohit Shetty's 'Sooryavanshi', as per reports. Earlier, there were reports that Pooja Hegde and Katrina Kaif had been approached to star opposite Akshay who will reportedly be seen portraying the character of an Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) officer in the film. Rohit had later denied the reports of Katrina starring in the film.

headlines: Govt revises FY19 fiscal deficit target at 3.4% of GDP
text: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday revised the fiscal deficit target to 3.4% of GDP for 2018-19 in the Interim Budget speech. The government had earlier pegged fiscal deficit target for the year at 3.3% of GDP. Fiscal deficit is the difference between the total revenue and total expenditure of the government.

headlines: Over 5.4 lakh villages declared Open Defecation Free
text: Delivering the Interim Budget on Friday, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said over 5.4 lakh villages have been declared Open Defecation Free and more than 98% rural sanitation coverage has been achieved as part of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan. Goyal also called Swachh Bharat Abhiyan the "world's largest behavioural change movement" and said it was initiated as a tribute to Mahatma Gandhi.

headlines: 1 lakh 'digital villages' to be created in 5 years: Govt
text: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the government aims to build over 1 lakh 'digital villages' in the coming 5 years. Common Services Centres, which is an initiative of the Electronics and Information Technology Ministry, will be tasked with the creation of digital infrastructure in the villages.

headlines: Three state-owned banks out of RBI's corrective action list
text: The RBI on Thursday said it has removed state-owned Bank of India, Bank of Maharashtra and Oriental Bank of Commerce out of Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework. The banks have provided a written commitment that they'd comply with minimum regulatory capital, net bad loans and leverage ratio norms, RBI added. Under PCA, restrictions are placed on banks' lending and expansion.

headlines: Sonam Kapoor confirms sister Rhea is dating Karan Boolani
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor has confirmed that her sister Rhea Kapoor is dating Karan Boolani, while also denying reports of the couple getting married this year. "They've been dating for 10 years, they've not gotten married yet. When the happy news is there, it'll all be announced," she added. Boolani is reportedly a director by profession.

headlines: 4th ODI defeat vs NZ was India's worst in terms of balls remaining
text: New Zealand defeated India in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday by eight wickets and with 212 balls to spare. This was India's worst loss in their 960-ODI history in terms of balls remaining. India's previous worst ODI defeat in terms of balls remaining had come on August 22, 2010, when Sri Lanka defeated them with 209 balls remaining.

headlines: Mithali Raj becomes 1st woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs
text: India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj has become the first woman cricketer to feature in 200 ODIs, achieving the feat in the third ODI against New Zealand on Friday. The 36-year-old, who made her ODI debut on June 25, 1999, has played 200 of India Women's 263 ODIs. With 6,622 runs, she is the highest run-scorer in women's ODI cricket.

headlines: Amazon removes many products from India site over new e-comm rules
text: Amazon was forced to remove numerous products including certain batteries and floor cleaners from its India website as new e-commerce rules came into effect from Friday. New e-commerce investment rules bar online retailers from selling products via vendors in which they have an equity interest. They are also barred from making deals with sellers to sell exclusively on their platforms.

headlines: 300-metre-tall cavity in Antarctic glacier surprising: NASA
text: NASA scientists were "surprised" to discover a 300-metre-tall cavity in the bottom of West Antarctica's Thwaites Glacier, indicating acceleration in rising sea levels in response to climate change.
