The hole is big enough to contain 14 billion tonnes ice, the space agency added. The melting glacier is currently responsible for about 4% of global sea level rise, NASA further said.

headlines: Punjab brother, sister get married, forge documents to get Aus visa
text: Punjab Police is looking for a brother-sister duo, who allegedly forged documents and got married to each other in order to get an Australian visa. "The brother was already a permanent resident of Australia and documents were forged to give his sister the identity of their cousin," police said. The siblings' cousin, whose name they used, had approached the police.

headlines: Drug trafficker evades capture for 15yrs using fingerprint implants
text: A drug trafficker who managed to evade capture for 15 years by cutting and burning the skin of his fingertips and having it replaced with micro-implants has been arrested by Spanish police. Police officials said he also had a hair transplant to avoid being recognised, adding he had used very sophisticated methods to alter the fingerprints of both hands.

headlines: Indonesian teenagers flogged for cuddling in public
text: Two teenagers were whipped publicly in Indonesia's Aceh province on Thursday after they were caught cuddling in public. The two teenagers were flogged 17 times each outside a mosque and had also served time in prison before the punishment on Thursday. This comes despite the provincial government's decision to hold flogging indoors.

headlines: Robert Swan becomes seventh CEO in Intel's 50-year history
text: US chipmaker Intel on Thursday named Robert Swan as the seventh Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in its 50-year history. The 58-year-old has been serving as Intel's interim CEO for seven months and as Chief Financial Officer since 2016. Swan's predecessor Brian Krzanich left the company after the board was informed that he had an affair with an employee.

headlines: Can die peacefully as both my babies have their babies: Jeetendra
text: Talking about the birth of his daughter Ekta Kapoor's son Ravie Kapoor, Jeetendra said, "I can die peacefully now as both my babies have their own babies." "Was a dada earlier. Now, I have become a nana. My life's complete," he added while referring to his son Tusshar Kapoor's son Laksshya. Ekta's son was born via surrogacy on January 27.

headlines: Kapil, Ginni to host wedding reception in Delhi on February 2
text: Kapil Sharma and his wife Ginni Chatrath will host their third wedding reception on February 2 in New Delhi. The couple, who got married on December 12 in Jalandhar, hosted their first wedding reception in Amritsar on December 14. They also hosted their second reception on December 24 at JW Marriott in Mumbai for their telly and film industry friends.

headlines: Only jumlas will come out: Congress leader on Interim Budget
text: Ahead of the Interim Budget being presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday morning, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said, "Only jumlas will come out today." He added, "Budgets they have presented so far have not really benefitted the general public. They have only 4 months, when will they implement the schemes?"

headlines: What is vote-on-account and when is it presented?
text: The Centre is likely to present a vote-on-account with the Interim Budget, according to reports. Through a vote-on-account, the government takes the Parliament's approval for essential expenditure for a limited period during an election year. A vote-on-account is a special provision that allows it to incur expenses for a short period of time or until a full Budget is passed.

headlines: Interim Budget's copies checked by sniffer dog in Parliament
text: The printed copies of the Interim Budget were checked by a sniffer dog as part of a security check ahead of the Budget being presented at 11 am on Friday. It will be presented by Piyush Goyal, who was recently assigned temporary additional charge of the Finance and Corporate Affairs ministries in the absence of Arun Jaitley.

headlines: Facebook loses permission to run staff-only iOS apps: Report
text: Social media giant Facebook has reportedly lost permission to build or run employee-only applications on Apple's iOS. This comes after a TechCrunch report found Facebook paid some users up to $20 a month to access their private data through 'Facebook Research' app. Facebook had allegedly exploited a loophole in Apple's approval system to bypass the rules that banned data harvesting.

headlines: China probe wakes after 1st lunar night, records -190ºC temp
text: Chinese probe Chang'e 4, the first to land on the Moon's far side, has woken up after its first lunar night, China's space agency said. The probe had switched to dormant mode during lunar night due to lack of sunlight, according to Chinese state media. It recorded temperatures as low as -190ºC on the lunar surface, lower than previously expected.

headlines: Punjab govt to allot over 1.32 lakh plots to rural homeless
text: Punjab government on Thursday said that it will provide over 1.32 lakh plots of five-marla each to homeless people in rural areas. CM Amarinder Singh had on January 22 directed all Deputy Commissioners to launch the scheme after identifying requisite land for this purpose. Singh asked for the allotment of at least 10 plots to homeless families in every village.

headlines: 3 killed, 1 missing in state-owned coal mine collapse in WB
text: At least three villagers were killed and one other went missing after a coal mine collapsed in West Bengals Bankura district on Thursday. As many as six villagers had gone down the mine which belongs to West Bengal Power Development Corporation Limited. This incident comes days after 15 people went missing in a flooded coal mine in Meghalaya.

headlines: Unemployment on rise due to PM Modi's 'pakordanomics': Sibal
text: Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Thursday said, "rate of unemployment...has increased" because of "(PM Narendra) Modiji's pakordanomics". "In other countries we have heard people being encountered, but in our country data is being encountered," he added. This comes after two members of National Statistical Commission resigned, saying government withheld release of employment survey data, 2017-18.

headlines: Venezuela to ship $840 million gold to Russia: Report
text: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's administration is planning to ship 20 tonnes of gold worth nearly $840 million to Russia amid the political crisis, lawmaker José Guerra claimed. He added a Russian jet arrived from Moscow to take away the gold reserves. This comes after the US imposed sanctions on Venezuela's state-run oil company to put pressure on the Maduro regime.

headlines: Ex-Axis Bank CEO Shikha Sharma joins Dr Reddy's as director
text: Pharma major Dr Reddy's Laboratories on Thursday said it has appointed Axis Bank's former MD and CEO Shikha Sanjaya Sharma as the company's independent additional director for a period of five years. Sharma served as Axis Bank's head from June 2009 to December 2018. She was replaced by Amitabh Chaudhry who previously headed HDFC Standard Life Insurance Company.

headlines: Huawei Mate20 Pro wins 2 awards at TOI Gadgets Now Awards
text: Huawei Mate20 Pro has won two awards at the Times of India Gadgets Now Awards. It was awarded the honorary titles of the 'Best Innovative Smartphone of the year' and 'Best Camera Smartphone of the Year' under the Jury and People Choice category respectively. Additionally, it has won over 11 awards across outlets like 91mobiles, Digit, Stuff, MKBHD, Android Headlines.

headlines: Pujara challenges 'coolest chachu' Unadkat to babysit his daughter
text: Cheteshwar Pujara jokingly challenged Saurashtra captain Jaydev Unadkat to babysit his daughter Aditi after the latter asked him if he was her "coolest chachu (uncle)". Unadkat had posted a picture with Aditi on Twitter, writing, "Chachu to my Laddoo! Growing cuter everyday...Probably the coolest chachu ever." "Will only agree if you manage to babysit her for...couple of hours!" Pujara responded.

headlines: Co-creator of painkiller ibuprofen Dr Stewart Adams dies at 95
text: British chemist Stewart Adams, who discovered that painkiller ibuprofen worked when he cured his own hangover has died aged 95, his family said. Dr Adams studied pharmacy at the University of Nottingham before joining Boots Pure Drug Company in 1952. His team trialled various compounds over the next 10 years, before discovering 2-(4-isobutylphenyl) propionic acid, licensed in 1969 as ibuprofen.

headlines: 8-mths pregnant woman saves her 4 kids before dying in house collapse
text: A 27-year-old woman named Fatima, who was eight months pregnant, managed to save her four kids before being killed in a house collapse triggered by a fire in Ghaziabad on Thursday. She saved her children by throwing them from the balcony onto the street below, locals said. Fatima fainted before she could escape the building which collapsed soon after.

headlines: World's fourth richest person gets $4.3 billion richer in a day
text: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH's Chairman Bernard Arnault, the world's fourth-richest person, added $4.3 billion to his fortune on Wednesday. Shares of his Paris-based luxury-goods maker surged 6.9%, the most since mid-2016, after its fourth-quarter profit beat estimates. Arnault's wealth has surged $8.3 billion since the start of the year and now stands at $76.9 billion, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: Akash, I were born via IVF 7 yrs after parents' marriage: Isha Ambani
text: Mukesh Ambani's 27-year-old daughter Isha Ambani said she and her twin brother Akash Ambani were born through IVF process, seven years after their parents' marriage. "When my mother (Nita Ambani) finally had us she wanted to be a full-time mum initially," said Isha. "She resumed work when we were five, but she was still a tiger mom," Isha added.

headlines: Kartik not approached for Rakesh Sharma biopic: Spokesperson
text: Kartik Aaryan hasn't been approached to star in 'Saare Jahaan Se Achcha', a biopic based on astronaut Rakesh Sharma, the actor's spokesperson said. Earlier reports suggested that Kartik was being considered for the role along with Vicky Kaushal after Shah Rukh Khan opted out of the biopic. Shah Rukh had left the project to work on 'Don 3', reports said.

headlines: As an actor, I deserved a lot more than I got: Shekhar Suman
text: Speaking about his career in the film industry, actor and producer Shekhar Suman said, "As an actor, I think I deserved a lot more than what I got." "It's definitely surprised me why the...better roles didn't come my way," Shekhar added. He further said that while he accepted his destiny with "grace and dignity", he hopes things will change.

headlines: New phase in Ekta's life: Tusshar on nephew Ravie's birth
text: Opening up about the birth of his sister Ekta Kapoor's son Ravie, actor Tusshar Kapoor said, "This marks the beginning of a new phase in [Ekta's] life." "Ekta is a very family-oriented person and has been like a mother to my son Laksshya," the actor added. Ekta's son was born via surrogacy on January 27.

headlines: Ben Affleck no longer starring in 'The Batman': Reports
text: Hollywood actor Ben Affleck will no longer star in Warner Bros and DC Entertainment's upcoming film 'The Batman', which is scheduled to release in 2021, as per reports. Affleck earlier stepped down as director for the film in 2017 and was replaced by filmmaker Matt Reeves. Affleck debuted as Batman in the 2016 film 'Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'.

headlines: UAE used 'Karma' tool to spy on rivals' iPhones: Report
text: Some former US government intelligence operatives working for the UAE hacked into iPhones of activists, diplomats and rival foreign leaders by exploiting an Apple iMessage flaw with 'Karma' tool, Reuters reported. The flaw reportedly allowed for implantation of malware through iMessage, even if the phone's owner didn't use it. 'Karma' hacked targets with a single text message, the report said.

headlines: Bangkok deploys water-spraying drones to curb air pollution
text: Bangkok on Thursday deployed 50 water-spraying drones in order to reduce harmful PM2.5 particles, which had accumulated in the city's atmosphere. The drones, equipped with sprinklers, could reportedly carry 5-10 litres of water and fly over a two-square-kilometre area for 15-20 minutes on one charge. "If we do nothing, people will criticise us", Bangkok's Governor said.

headlines: Congress, BJP, BJD looting country: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the Congress, BJP and BJD were looting the country. He added that even after 70 years of independence, crores of people were still poor in the country and most of them were from Odisha. He said despite the large pool of talent, India had not developed due to the loot by political parties.

headlines: No one who cheats India can hide anywhere in world: Jaitley
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Thursday said no one who cheats India can hide anywhere in the world and escape. His statement comes against the backdrop of Dubai-based businessman Rajiv Saxena and corporate aviation lobbyist Deepak Talwar (both accused in AgustaWestland scam) getting deported to India. He added Prime Minister Narendra Modi has introduced a culture of honesty in governance.

headlines: Healthtech firm Medlife acquires IIT alumni's startup MedLabz
text: Bengaluru-based healthtech firm Medlife has acquired Mumbai-based digital healthcare platform and diagnostics startup MedLabz for an undisclosed amount. Medlife stated it plans to consolidate its diagnostics business through this acquisition. Founded in 2015 by six IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi alumni, MedLabz offers diagnostic services using its AI-based symptom-to-disease search engine.

headlines: Swiggy tests grocery delivery, to launch in Gurugram: Report
text: Online food delivery startup Swiggy is internally testing its grocery delivery service 'Swiggy Dash', which will launch in a few weeks, a report said. Swiggy has tied up with some stores in Gurugram and will reportedly work with partnership model similar to its food delivery. It will offer free deliveries up to four kilometres from the store, the report added.

headlines: Remains of '1st British beer' dating back over 2,000 years found
text: Remains of the first beer believed to be brewed in the UK, dating back over 2,000 years, has been discovered by road workers in Cambridgeshire, England. Fragments of charred residues from the beer-making process revealed signs of the 'Iron Age brew' from around 400 BC. The beer residues were found along with those of bread and porridge, experts revealed.

headlines: Plastics found in all 50 washed up sea animals studied in UK
text: University of Exeter and Plymouth Marine Laboratory researchers have found microplastics in the guts of all 50 marine animals including seals and whales that washed up on Britain's shore. About 84% of particles found in them were synthetic fibres from items like clothes and toothbrushes. "It's shocking...but not surprising...that every animal had ingested microplastics," a researcher said.

headlines: Canada cuts Cuba embassy staff by half after mystery illness
text: Canada will cut its embassy staff in Cuba by up to half after another worker fell ill with mysterious symptoms, Canadian authorities said on Wednesday. A total of 14 Canadians have been affected by the mystery illness which causes dizziness, nausea and hearing loss, among others. Canada recalled the families of diplomatic staff over the mystery illness in April 2018.

headlines: Russian MP arrested in Parliament for double murder
text: Russian Senator Rauf Arashukov was arrested on Wednesday on the floor of the Parliament over his suspected role in ordering at least two contract killings. He was detained after the Senate voted to strip him of immunity from prosecution. Arashukov attempted to flee through the Parliament gallery but later surrendered to the authorities.

headlines: Won't extend Feb 1 deadline for new e-commerce norms: Govt
text: The government has said it will not extend the February 1 deadline for the implementation of revised Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) norms for the e-commerce sector. The decision to not delay the rules was taken after "due consideration", it added. The move comes amid lobbying by Walmart-owned Flipkart and Amazon to get an extension to the deadline.

headlines: Mom was upset over inviting just 200 guests at my wedding: Priyanka
text: Priyanka Chopra, during her appearance on 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show', revealed her mother Madhu Chopra was upset about inviting just 200 guests at her wedding with American singer Nick Jonas. Priyanka added, "She was like, 'I need to have another party for the other 1,50,000 people that I know!" "Usually Indian weddings [have] a thousand people," Priyanka explained to Ellen.

headlines: Aapna time aayega: 19-yr-old Prithvi Shaw on recovery from injury
text: Opener Prithvi Shaw, who is recovering from an ankle injury, took to social media to share a few lines inspired from 'Apna time aayega' rap from upcoming Bollywood film 'Gully Boy'. "Aapna time aayega...Injury se fit hoke...Mein aur run banayega...Aapna time aayega," he wrote. The 19-year-old had sustained the injury in the tour match in Australia in November last year.

headlines: If anyone can come close to Sachin and Virat, it's Shaw: Sreesanth
text: Banned fast bowler Sreesanth, while commenting on a Twitter post by Prithvi Shaw, said that if anyone can come close to Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli, it's the 19-year-old batsman. "Keep working hard and never ever give up," he added. Shaw had posted a few lines inspired by 'Apna time aayega' rap song from upcoming film 'Gully Boy'.

headlines: Batsman collides into partner, breaks his helmet and gets run-out
text: BBL side Sydney Thunder's Jonathan Cook got run-out after colliding into his partner Gurinder Sandhu while running between the wickets against Melbourne Renegades. The collision happened after pacer Harry Gurney moved towards the ball and ended up unsighting the batsmen, who were converging on the same side. A part of Cook's helmet broke and he was left stranded.

headlines: Clothes are adjectives, I like me naked: Aus Open semi-finalist
text: Australian Open 2019 semi-finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas, who defeated Roger Federer during the tournament, shared a picture of himself bare-chested on social media and used a quote by Indian-American supermodel Padma Lakshmi as caption. "I like me better naked...Clothes are adjectives, they're indicators. When you don't have...clothes on...it's just you...raw, and you can't hide," the caption read.

headlines: Messenger, WhatsApp, Instagram integration good for users: FB CEO
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said integrating WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger and Instagram will be a "long-term project" and "good for user experience." "The first reason that I'm excited about this is moving more to end-to-end encryption by default in more of our products," said Zuckerberg. "People tell us they want to be able to message across the different services," he added.

headlines: Tesla's new CFO joined the firm 2 yrs before he earned Harvard MBA
text: Tesla on Wednesday said the company's VP of Finance Zach Kirkhorn will take over as Chief Financial Officer (CFO), replacing Deepak Ahuja. Kirkhorn, who earned his MBA from Harvard in 2013, had joined the carmaker in March 2010, when he was 25. Tesla CEO Elon Musk joked that he didn't think the few years Kirkhorn spent at Harvard were necessary.

headlines: India says it's in talks with US to extend Iran sanctions waiver
text: India is in talks with the US to extend a waiver on sanctions imposed on Irans crude oil exports, Sunjay Sudhir, Joint Secretary (International Cooperation), oil ministry said. "We are talking to the US on energy-related aspects...It is a continuous process," he added. The US has temporarily allowed eight importers, including India, to continue buying Iranian oil.

headlines: Self-styled godman arrested for allegedly raping 2 girls
text: Self-styled godman Manmohan Saheb was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping two sisters at his ashrams in Bihar and Punjab. The elder sister, now aged 20, alleged she has been sexually abused since 2016, adding her 19-year-old sister has been sexually exploited since 2010. The Ludhiana-based survivors said they came forward after Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim's conviction.

headlines: Chicago sets train tracks on fire to keep trains moving in -30°C
text: America's Chicago is setting its rail tracks on fire with gas-fed heaters running alongside the tracks to keep them warm and keep trains moving amid temperatures as low as -30°C. The extreme cold shrinks the metal and the rails may pull apart from each other. The fire expands the metal until two rails can be put back together again.

headlines: Report saying unemployment at 45-yr high not finalised: NITI Aayog
text: NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar has said the jobs data report cited in the media is a draft report and hasn't been finalised by the government. Citing a government survey, the Business Standard reported that India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high during 2017-2018. "Data is still being processed, hence it wasn't released by the government," Kumar added.

headlines: Govt revises growth for demonetisation year from 7.1% to 8.2%
text: The government on Thursday revised the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate upwards from 7.1% to 8.2% for 2016-17, the year of demonetisation. The new data released by the Statistics Ministry also shows the GDP growth at 7.2% in 2017-18, up from 6.7% estimated earlier. Notably, the government had pegged the growth rate for the ongoing financial year at 7.2%.

headlines: Javed Tamilus Killingam: Siddharth on Javed misspelling film name
text: Responding to a tweet by lyricist Javed Akhtar where he misspelt the name of Tamil film 'Sarvam Thala Mayam' as "Sarvam Thalamus Maryam", actor Siddharth wrote, "'Javed Tamilus Killingam' achha naam hai." Apologising for the error, Javed responded, "This is how I feel when someone murders Hindi or Urdu." "I've punished myself by writing...title again and again," Javed added.

headlines: Thackeray writer to make biopic on ex-Defence Minister Fernandes
text: Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena leader and writer of the film 'Thackeray', said he will make a biopic based on former Defence Minister George Fernandes, who passed away on Tuesday. The film will focus on the role Fernandes played in national politics in the period between the 1950s and 1970s, Raut revealed. The film will reportedly be directed by Shoojit Sircar.

headlines: It disturbs me: Fatima on link-up rumours with Aamir
text: While addressing link-up rumours with her 'Dangal' co-star Aamir Khan, actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said, "It disturbs me because I dont want people to assume wrong things." "People reading it assume that Im not a good person," the actress added. Fatima further said that while she's learnt to ignore the rumours, they still affect her sometimes.

headlines: Was never good at academics, more to life than exams: Akshay
text: Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to share a video from PM Narendra Modi's 'Pariksha Par Charcha 2.0', and revealed that while he was never good at academics, with hard work and his "parents' blessings", he "managed pretty well". "With exams around the corner, Id like to reiterate to students and parents, theres more to life than just exams," he wrote.

headlines: BJP wins by-polls in Haryana's Jind by over 12,000 votes
text: BJP candidate Dr Krishan Lal Middha on Thursday won Haryana's Jind by-polls with a margin of over 12,000 votes. "There were big leaders in the contest as well, but we have defeated them too," Middha said. He added that the party will follow the schemes launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and take them forward.

headlines: Goa CM Parrikar to be shifted to AIIMS for examination: CMO
text: Ailing Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar will be shifted to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi for a medical check-up, his office said on Thursday. "He is expected to be admitted there for the next four days," a senior official said. His medical review/check-up was pending due to state Legislative Assembly session, the CMO added.

headlines: Fadnavis rules out simultaneous Assembly, LS polls in Maharashtra
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday ruled out the possibility of simultaneous Assembly and Lok Sabha elections in the state. Fadnavis may "reluctantly agree" for simultaneous polls to keep the BJP's alliance intact with the Shiv Sena, claimed the Congress. The Maharashtra Assembly's term ends in November and elections are likely to be held in October.

headlines: No major communal riot in BJP-ruled states: Amit Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Thursday said no major communal riot has occurred in states where his party is in power. Shah added the BJP is committed to the welfare of the people irrespective of their religion. Speaking at a convention, he said the school dropout rate of Muslim girls has fallen to 32% from 72% under the BJP rule.

headlines: Tesla reports 1st back-to-back profitable quarters in 15 yrs
text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has reported back-to-back profitable quarters for the first time ever in the 15-year history of the electric carmaker. Tesla reported a profit of around $139.5 million, or $0.78 a share, for the fourth quarter. The carmaker had reported a profit of $312 million for its third quarter in 2018, after reporting losses for seven consecutive quarters.

headlines: Hero MotoCorp sets up new R&D centre in Germany
text: Two-wheeler major Hero MotoCorp on Wednesday announced the setting up of its Research and Development (R&D) centre in Germany. The centre will operate in tandem with Hero's Global R&D hub in Jaipur, the company said. It would be under the direct supervision of Hero MotoCorp's Chief Technology Officer Markus Braunsperger, the company added.

headlines: Black hole jets create negative-energy particles: Study
text: Using new simulations US-based researchers have united two theories related to black holes to reveal 'negative-energy' particles are created on black hole jet emissions. The theory that electric currents around a black hole twist magnetic fields into forming jets was united with another theory that particles passing through it's point of no return (event horizon) appear to carry negative energy.

headlines: UN court judge quits over interference from US
text: A judge has resigned from the UN's International Criminal Court (ICC) citing "shocking" interference from the US and Turkey. The judge, Christoph Flügge, alleged Turkey used its veto to end the tenure of a Turkish judge. He further cited threats by the US, particularly NSA John Bolton, who had warned the judges against investigating alleged US war crimes in Afghanistan.

headlines: Ajai Kumar named Yes Bank interim CEO till Gill takes charge
text: Yes Bank on Thursday announced it has appointed director Ajai Kumar as interim MD and CEO of the lender. Kumar will take charge on February 1 for one month or till Ravneet Singh Gill assumes office as MD & CEO. The RBI had asked Rana Kapoor to step down as Yes Bank's MD and CEO by January 31.

headlines: Ekta Kapoor confirms birth of baby boy Ravie via surrogacy
text: Producer Ekta Kapoor has confirmed she has become a mother to a baby boy via surrogacy. "Everything in life doesn't go the way you want it to but there are always solutions to those hiccups. I found mine and today I feel immensely blessed to become a parent," she wrote. The 43-year-old revealed that the baby has been named Ravie.

headlines: OnePlus India poses question for Siri on social media
text: OnePlus India on Wednesday took to social media platforms to pose a question to Apple's voice-controlled personal assistant Siri after OnePlus emerged as the No.1 premium smartphone brand in India for Q4 2018 in research by Counterpoint. The post read, "Hey Siri, which is India's No.1 Premium Smartphone?", carrying the caption "iDare you".

headlines: Your lies making things worse: Krish to Kangana on Manikarnika row
text: Criticising Kangana Ranaut for taking first credit for 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', co-director Krish said, "Please realise your lies are making things worse." He posted screenshots of WhatsApp chats with technicians and other members stating that 85% of the film was shot by him. This comes after Kangana's sister shared screenshots of messages reportedly sent by Kangana to Krish.

headlines: It's a lie: Vishal Dadlani criticises PM's claim of hanging rapists
text: Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani criticised PM Narendra Modi's statement claiming rapists are "hanged within three days, seven days, 11 days and a month" under his administration. "LIE! Name one rapist who has been hung in your term, Sir. Nirbhaya's rapists...even Unnao child-rape-accused BJP MLA Sengar are...alive and well," he wrote. PM Modi made the comment at a Surat youth conclave.

headlines: Stop discussing my penis on TV: Murray to anchor showing X-ray pic
text: After journalist Piers Morgan discussed tennis player Andy Murray's X-ray showing his penis on television, Murray messaged him, "Can you stop discussing my genitals on national TV?" "I was heavily medicated at the time of posting," added Murray, who underwent hip surgery. The X-ray was posted by Murray on Tuesday, who captioned it, "I now have a metal hip."

headlines: Snake found in khichdi served to govt school students in Maharashtra
text: Students of a government primary school in Maharashtra's Nanded were served khichdi with a snake in it, officials said on Thursday. The school staff members saw the snake in a large vessel while serving khichdi to around 80 students studying in Classes I to V. Nanded District Education Officer (DEO) Prashant Digraskar said that a probe has been ordered.

headlines: God wanted Trump to become President: White House
text: White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders has said God "wanted Donald Trump to become (US) President", adding that "God calls all of us to fill different roles at different times". "That's why he's there and I think he has done a tremendous job in supporting a lot of the things that people of faith really care about," she added.

headlines: Founders tell me 'Madam, please don't send us to court': SBI MD
text: India's largest lender SBI's Managing Director (MD) Anshula Kant has said the first thing company founders tell when they come to the bank is, "Madam, please don't send us to NCLT". If the founder is "genuine we don't want him to lose the company", Kant added. She also said that one-time settlements are a "preferred choice" if founders have funding.

headlines: My biggest fear is becoming mundane, doing boring films: SRK
text: Shah Rukh Khan revealed that his biggest fear is becoming "mundane" and taking up "boring" films. "I hope the day never comes when...I tell myself that it's okay to do just a regular film which...[becomes] a box office hit and I can buy myself a new car and be happy," the actor said. "That thought scares me," he added.

headlines: Feels like I'm back home: Sonakshi on working in 'Dabangg 3'
text: Speaking about teaming up with Salman Khan to work in the third instalment of the 'Dabangg' film franchise, Sonakshi Sinha said, "It feels like I'm back home because that's where I started my career." "My life changed completely after that film, it's how I found my calling," she added. Sonakshi made her acting debut opposite Salman in 'Dabangg' in 2010.

headlines: 2nd Apple worker arrested over self-driving car secret theft
text: The FBI has arrested Apple employee Jizhong Chen for allegedly stealing secrets from its self-driving car unit and trying to sell it to a Chinese competitor. An employee reportedly saw Chen taking photos in a sensitive work area, after which an investigation was conducted. Former Apple employee Xiaolang Zhang was arrested in July 2018 for the same.

headlines: MIT researchers train robot arm to play 'Jenga' game
text: MIT researchers have developed a robot arm that can play the 'Jenga' game by combining the abilities of both sight and touch. The robot, equipped with a force sensor on its wrist and an external camera, probed the blocks to understand which are harder or easier to move. It grouped outcomes of about 300 attempts to learn to play 'Jenga'.

headlines: NoMo jobs: Rahul on report claiming unemployment at 45-yr high
text: Referring to a report claiming an unreleased government survey found India's unemployment reached a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-2018, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "NoMo Jobs...Time for NoMo2Go." Rahul added, "The Fuhrer (a term associated with dictator Adolf Hitler) promised us 2 Cr jobs a year. 5 years later, his leaked job creation report card reveals a National Disaster."

headlines: Grab raises $200 million from Thai retailer Central Group
text: Southeast Asian ride-hailing startup Grab has raised $200 million in funding, to be invested in its Thailand unit, from Thailand's retail conglomerate Central Group. As part of the deal, Central Group will acquire a "significant non-controlling stake" in the startup. Founded in 2012, the Singapore-based startup has raised a total of $7.3 billion in funding till date.

headlines: I want Tesla cars to call tow truck if issues detected: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said he wants to add a feature that enables Tesla cars to automatically call a tow truck as soon as they detect issues like a flat tire. Users will be able to cancel the call through the in-dash display. However, Musk has not provided with a timeline as to when the feature might get launched.

headlines: Elon Musk's Tesla to begin Model Y production by end of 2020
text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has said it'll "start tooling" to begin production of its Model Y car by 2020 end. Model Y production cost is expected to be lower than Model 3 as it will share 75% of its components with the Model 3, Tesla said. Model Y will likely be produced in Tesla's Gigafactory 1 in Nevada, US, it added.

headlines: India summons Pakistan envoy over call to separatist leader
text: India on Wednesday summoned Pakistan's High Commissioner, Sohail Mahmood, to protest against Pakistan Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi's phone call to separatist leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq from the All Parties Hurriyat Conference. Qureshi's "actions are tantamount to direct interference in the internal affairs of its neighbour", the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said in a statement.

headlines: Pakistan lifts travel ban on Asia Bibi
text: Pakistan has said that Asia Bibi, the Christian woman acquitted of blasphemy, has the right to travel anywhere inside the country or abroad. This came after Pakistan's Supreme Court upheld her acquittal, rejecting a petition by hardline Islamists. Pakistan had barred Bibi from travelling abroad following a deal with the Islamists who had opposed her acquittal and demanded her execution.

headlines: Sri Lanka halts imports of J&J baby powder pending tests
text: Sri Lankan officials said the country has halted imports of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder until the company proves the product is free from cancer-causing asbestos. Stocks of the talc already in the country can still be sold. This comes after reports suggested J&J knew that asbestos was present in its product, leading to tests in several countries including India.

headlines: RBI removes two banks from corrective action list: Reports
text: A Reserve Bank of India (RBI) panel has reportedly decided to remove Bank of India and Bank of Maharashtra from its Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework. The move follows improvements in the asset quality and capital ratios of both banks, reports added. State-run banks with high levels of bad debt and inadequate capital are brought under the PCA framework.

headlines: Shahid Afridi once bit ball during ODI, claimed he was smelling it
text: During an ODI against Australia on January 31, 2010, Pakistan's stand-in captain Shahid Afridi was caught by cameras biting the ball which led to umpires changing the ball. Afridi, after the match, claimed that he was just trying to smell the ball. However, Afridi later pleaded guilty to ball tampering and was banned for two T20Is.

headlines: Pakistan captain once called bird instead of head or tail in toss
text: The coin toss in the Pakistan-Zimbabwe Test at Harare on January 31, 1995, was done twice as Pakistan captain Saleem Malik called 'bird' instead of heads or tails. The coin had an eagle, the national bird of Zimbabwe, inscribed on one side. Malik won as the 'bird' turned up but referee ordered a re-toss which came out in Zimbabwe's favour.

headlines: Bohra gets new passport on being detained in Russia, thanks Swaraj
text: Actor and Bigg Boss contestant Karanvir Bohra took to Twitter to thank External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj for helping him get a temporary passport to gain entry into Russia, after he was detained in Moscow due to passport damage. Earlier, he tweeted the authorities were contemplating deporting him back to India. Karanvir is in Moscow to attend a film festival.

headlines: Sensex rises 665 points a day before Interim Budget
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex recorded its best single-day gains of 2019 a day ahead of Interim Budget, rising 1.87% or 665 points to 36,257 on Thursday. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank and Infosys were among the top gainers. This will be the last Budget presented by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government before the general elections.

headlines: Last we saw fast extradition it was Batman, now it's PM Modi: BJP
text: BJP has compared PM Narendra Modi to Batman after extradition of AgustaWestland scam accused Deepak Talwar and Rajeev Saxena from Dubai. "Last time we saw such swift extradition, it was Batman extraditing Lau from Hong Kong and delivering him to Jim Gordon. 'Everything's impossible until somebody does it'. This time it's PM Narendra Modi," the party tweeted.

headlines: All Muslims should've been sent to Pak during Partition: BJP MP
text: Claiming our ancestors "made a mistake" during Partition, BJP MP Giriraj Singh said, "Each and every Hindu should have been brought back to India and each and every Muslim should have been sent back to Pakistan." He claimed the Ram Mandir issue would've been resolved earlier if India's first Home Minister Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was the country's first PM instead.

headlines: Haryana CM delivers speech in Tamil amid Pongal celebrations
text: A video showing Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar delivering a speech in Tamil during Pongal celebration in the state has gone viral on social media. BJP Tamil Nadu youth wing vice-president SG Suryah, who shared the video, mentioned Tamil was Haryana's second official language for 40 years but in 2010 Congress CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda replaced the language with Punjabi.

headlines: Army Chief Rawat meets Parrikar to enquire about his health
text: Indian Army Chief General Bipin Rawat on Thursday met Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar at the state Assembly complex in Panaji. After the meeting, Rawat said, "I had come here to enquire about the health of Parrikar. It was just a courtesy visit." Parrikar has been suffering from a pancreatic ailment.

headlines: Deepak Ahuja to retire as Tesla CFO after 11 years at the company
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced that CFO Deepak Ahuja would be retiring but would stay as a senior advisor for "probably years to come". "There is no good time to make this change," said Ahuja, noting Tesla achieved two back-to-back profitable quarters. "Super appreciate Deepak's 11 year history building Tesla & wish him greatest of happiness in retirement!" Musk tweeted.

headlines: What is polar vortex, setting temperatures in US below Antarctica?
text: The polar vortex is a large area of low pressure and cold air surrounding both of the Earths poles. The current of the northern polar vortex has been disrupted and is now pushing south, bringing temperatures in the US Midwest lower than parts of Antarctica. Over 200 million Americans are expected to be affected by the cold weather phenomenon.

headlines: SC dismisses PIL against Asthana's appointment to aviation body
text: The Supreme Court has dismissed a petition against the appointment of former CBI Special Director Rakesh Asthana as Director General of Bureau of Civil Aviation Security when an FIR is still pending against him. The apex court told the petitioner, lawyer Manohar Lal Sharma, "Your PIL... made little sense. Everything cannot be rolled in under one sky into a petition."

headlines: India's unemployment rate hit 45-year high in 2017-18: Report
text: India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% during 2017-2018, the Business Standard reported quoting an unreleased government survey. It reportedly showed that joblessness stood at 7.8% in urban areas compared with 5.3% in rural areas. Notably, two remaining independent members of the National Statistical Commission quit Wednesday allegedly due to the non-publication of jobs data.

headlines: 8 held for helping foreigners stay illegally in US as students
text: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement has arrested eight persons, all of whom are either Indian nationals or Indian-Americans, on charges of fraudulently facilitating hundreds of immigrants to illegally remain in the US as students. The accused, in exchange of cash, helped the foreigners in illegally obtaining immigration documents from a university and creation of false student records.

headlines: Hindu temple vandalised in US in hate crime
text: A Hindu temple has been vandalised in Kentucky, US, in what authorities called a hate crime. Vandals sprayed black paint on the deity, wrote hateful messages on temple walls and broke windows at the temple. A knife was also left stabbed into one of the chairs in the main room of worship at the temple.

headlines: Yami Gautam trips during her ramp walk at Lakmé Fashion Week
text: Actress Yami Gautam nearly tripped during her ramp walk at the Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. The actress, who was the showstopper for designers Gauri and Nainika, was wearing a tulle gown. When asked about how she managed, the actress said after the show, "It just comes from the fact that you can know it can happen with anyone."

headlines: Google Chrome testing feature to warn of 'lookalike URLs'
text: Google Chrome is testing a feature to warn users of "lookalike URLs" that may look similar to existing ones and help redirect users to the site they were trying to visit. The feature has been in testing phase since the release of 'Chrome Canary 70' browser. It can be enabled in the stable version of Chrome as an experimental feature.

headlines: Apple to use laser-based 3D cameras in 2020 iPhones: Report
text: According to a Bloomberg report, Apple plans to introduce laser-powered cameras, designed to scan and create three-dimensional reconstructions of objects, within its new iPhones, expected to launch in 2020. The rear-facing camera will reportedly work up to 15 feet away from the device. The report added the camera will be used to enhance AR on the iPhone.

headlines: CM Manohar Parrikar skips morning session of Goa Assembly
text: Goa CM Manohar Parrikar on Thursday skipped the morning proceedings of the ongoing budget session of the state Assembly. While presenting the state budget in the House on Wednesday, Parrikar said, "I'm presenting the budget in josh. The josh that is too high, very high, and fully in hosh". The three-day-long budget session of the state Assembly will end today.

headlines: No one should test the patience of Hindus: Giriraj Singh
text: Claiming people who talk about intolerance in India are actually part of an "intolerance gang", Union Minister Giriraj Singh said, "No one should test the patience of Hindus." He also asked people who are opposed to the construction of Ram Mandir and claim there is intolerance in India to go to Pakistan and "see what kind of democracy they have."

headlines: Triple Talaq bill gives our Muslim daughters equality: Prez
text: Highlighting steps taken for women during a joint session of Parliament on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "Our Muslim daughters were living under constant fear. The Triple Talaq bill gives them equality, lets them live without fear." He claimed the government had generated jobs for women and increased maternity leave, making it easier for young mothers to keep working.

headlines: Naxals set ablaze six vehicles in Maharashtra
text: Naxals on Thursday allegedly torched six vehicles in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, a police official said. A group of around 12 Maoists set four tractors and two JCB machines on fire which were brought for construction work in Korchi tehsil, the official added. They also blocked a road by cutting trees and placing branches on the way, the official further said.

headlines: Sultan Abdullah crowned Malaysia's 16th King
text: Sultan Abdullah Sultan Ahmad Shah was on Thursday crowned Malaysia's 16th King, nearly a month after Sultan Muhammad V's abdication. The 59-year-old took the oath of office in a nationally televised ceremony at the national palace in Kuala Lumpur. The Malaysian King is elected on a rotational basis from the sultans of the country's nine states for a five-year term.

headlines: Saudi ends crackdown on corruption that saw princes being detained
text: Saudi Arabia has announced an end to its crackdown on corruption, launched in 2017, that saw more than 200 princes, ministers and businessmen being detained. The kingdom said it recovered over $100 billion in cash, property and other assets. Among the prominent detainees were Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's cousins, including billionaire investor Prince Alwaleed bin Talal.

headlines: upGrad learner switches to career in ML & Al with 90% salary hike
text: Saurav Kant, an alumnus of upGrad and IIIT-B's PG Program in Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence, was a Sr Systems Engineer at Infosys with almost 5 years of work experience. The program and upGrad's 360-degree career support helped him transition to a Data Scientist at Tech Mahindra with 90% salary hike. upGrad's Online Power Learning has powered 3 lakh+ careers.

headlines: Delhi techie wins free food from Swiggy for one year on CRED
text: Kunal Shah's credit card bill payment platform, CRED, gave users a chance to win free food from Swiggy for one year. Pranav Kaushik, a Delhi techie, bagged this reward after spending 2000 CRED coins. Users get one CRED coin per rupee of bill paid, which can be used to avail rewards from brands like Ixigo, BookMyShow, UberEats, Cult.Fit and more.

headlines: New Zealand end Rohit Sharma-led India's 12-match winning streak
text: New Zealand defeated India by 8 wickets in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday to win their first match of the five-match ODI series. India lost an international match under Rohit Sharma's captaincy after 12 consecutive victories dating back to March 2018. The match witnessed India getting all out for 92, their seventh lowest total in ODI cricket history.

headlines: Rahat Fateh Ali Khan denies getting notice for smuggling currency
text: Pakistani singer Rahat Fateh Ali Khan has denied receiving any notice from the Enforcement Directorate over allegedly smuggling foreign currency out of India. "It would have been better if the authorities would have served the notice first if any and then publicised this," reads a press release issued on behalf of Rahat. The statement further called the allegation "bizarre".

headlines: Have known Hirani for yrs, what if MeToo claims are not true: Sonam
text: Speaking about the sexual harassment allegations against Rajkumar Hirani, Sonam Kapoor said, "I've known Hirani for many years...What if it's not true, the [#MeToo] movement will get derailed." "In the #MeToo movement, I always believe a woman. But in this case, we need to reserve our judgment," she added. Hirani has been accused by an assistant who worked in 'Sanju'.

headlines: India get all out for 92, their lowest ODI total in New Zealand
text: India recorded their lowest ODI total in New Zealand after getting all out for 92 runs in 30.5 overs in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday. Seven of India's batsmen were dismissed for single-digit scores, while their number ten batsman Yuzvendra Chahal top-scored with 18*(37). India's previous lowest ODI total in New Zealand was 108.

headlines: Rahul is now into hallucinating conversations: Smriti Irani
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi claimed Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar told him he had nothing to do with the new Rafale deal, Union Textiles Minister Smriti Irani posted on Facebook, "He is now into hallucinating conversations." Calling Rahul a "congenital liar," Irani added, "It is dangerous to even maintain social contact with him in terms of basic political courtesies."

headlines: Called PM Modi 'sir' 10 times to satisfy his ego: Andhra CM
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu has said, "When I met then US President Bill Clinton, I addressed him as Mr Clinton, not as 'sir'. (PM Narendra) Modi is my junior in politics...I addressed him as sir 10 times." "I did this...to satisfy his ego in the hope that he will do justice to the state," he added.

headlines: UP cousins fed human excreta for friendship with boys
text: Two minor cousins in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur were allegedly repeatedly burnt with tongs and forced to eat human excreta by their family for being friends with two boys from the same school. The cousins revealed their ordeal to the police and Child Welfare Committee after being brought back to Gorakhpur from Nepal, where they had fled to escape the torture.

headlines: Ram, Krishna didn't smoke, why should we: Ramdev to sadhus at Kumbh
text: Urging saints and seers at the Kumbh Mela to quit smoking, Yoga guru Ramdev said, "We follow Ram and Krishna who never smoked in their life then why should we?" Making them take a pledge to quit tobacco, he collected chillum (clay pipe) from several sadhus. He said he will deposit the chillums for display at a museum he'll build.

headlines: 81-yr-old woman conducts physical training in J'khand schools
text: Isha Ghosh, an 81-year-old member of Bharat Scouts and Guides (BSG), has been imparting physical and mental training to schoolchildren in Jharkhand for several decades. Chaibasa-based Ghosh reportedly walks seven kilometres daily and spends eight hours conducting physical training, apart from climbing and yoga sessions. She says, "One should do something for society till one's last breath."

headlines: Pharma exec gave doctor a lap dance to sell medicine in US: Witness
text: Former stripper and regional sales director of a pharmaceutical company, Sunrise Lee, gave a doctor a lap dance in a nightclub to persuade him to prescribe an addictive fentanyl spray in 2012, the company's sales representative told a US court. She said she saw Lee "sitting on [doctor's] lap, kind of bouncing around." Lee has been accused of bribing doctors.

headlines: I only cried at my 'bidaai' as I felt peer pressure: Isha Ambani
text: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani, who got married last month, said she only cried at her 'bidaai' because she felt peer pressure as everyone was crying, especially her parents. "I was emotional too but everyone around me would cry all the time," she added. "It was a very emotional affair for everyone in my family," said Isha.

headlines: Louis Vuitton owner to stockpile 4 months of wine, spirits in UK
text: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH, which makes high-end beverages like Moët & Chandon champagne and Hennessy cognac, said it's stockpiling four months' worth of wine and spirits in UK in preparation for Brexit. "We're ready for worst case scenario if there are difficulties with deliveries," the French luxury giant said. The UK is scheduled to leave the EU on March 29.

headlines: Karan Johar, Tabu turn showstoppers on opening night of LFW
text: Filmmaker Karan Johar and actress Tabu turned showstoppers for Gaurav Gupta on the opening night of Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. While Johar wore a red sequinned jacket with black pants, Tabu walked the ramp in a grey embellished gown. The fashion show, which began on January 29, will continue till February 3.

headlines: Those on bail will go to jail: PM Modi takes jibe at Rahul
text: In a jibe at Congress President Rahul Gandhi, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those on "bail will have to go to jail." PM Modi added, "He is out on bail and his associates too are facing charges...I know they will be convicted one day." The PM claimed he'd waged a war on corruption because he's from a common household.

headlines: How long can I tolerate Congress leaders' potshots: K'taka CM
text: Days after he threatened to step down from his post if Congress MLAs continue "crossing the line," Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy accused them of taking potshots and asked, "How many more days can I tolerate such stuff?" Kumaraswamy, who made the statements after a Congress MLA demanded that Siddaramaiah be made CM again, said, "Power is ephemeral."

headlines: I think the opposition even dreams about me: PM Modi
text: Claiming there is a dearth of ideas among opposition parties, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said, "The opposition talks only about Modi the whole day, I suspect they even dream about me." PM Modi, who was addressing the New India Youth Conclave in Surat, added that the opposition parties have only one agenda which is "Modi".

headlines: Odisha CM Patnaik controls mining mafia: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday claimed the illegal mining mafia in Odisha operates under the control of CM Naveen Patnaik and state Congress chief Niranjan Patnaik. He added, "The time has come for the people of Odisha to put a full stop to their activities...The time has come for us to ask for an explanation from this corrupt government."

headlines: 12 killed, 170 injured in Saudi Arabia floods
text: At least 12 people have been killed and 170 others have been injured in Saudi Arabia this week due to flooding from heavy rain. The emergency services rescued 271 people from the flooded areas, more than half of them in Tabuk. Heavy rains hit mainly western and northwestern parts of Saudi Arabia, near its border with Jordan.

headlines: Isha Ambani features on February cover of Vogue magazine
text: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani has featured on the cover of the February edition of Vogue India. She's dressed in a white shirt dress and black ruffled skirt by Australian designer Toni Maticevski, while accessorising her look with a Misho ring. In the cover story on her, Isha has spoken about her work and life after marriage.

headlines: Indian Oil looking for annual deal to buy crude from US
text: Indian Oil Corporation on Wednesday said it's looking for an annual deal to buy US crude as it seeks to broaden oil purchasing options. This comes amid uncertainties over Iran imports. The US had in November granted a six-month waiver to India from sanctions against Iran and restricted the country's monthly intake of Iranian oil to 3,00,000 barrels per day.

headlines: Pacer once took 7 wickets for just 1 run in 32 balls in a Test
text: Former Windies fast bowler Curtly Ambrose dismissed seven Australian batsmen within a span of 32 balls giving away just one run, in a Test match on January 30, 1993. Ambrose's spell helped his team bowl out Australia for 119 in the first innings, after being 85 for 2 at one point. Ambrose ended with first-innings figures of 18-9-25-7.

headlines: 19-year-old Shubman Gill becomes India's 227th ODI cricketer
text: Batsman Shubman Gill has become the 227th cricketer to represent India in ODI cricket, achieving the feat against New Zealand in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday. The 19-year-old received his maiden ODI cap from former captain MS Dhoni. Notably, Shubman was named Player of the Under-19 World Cup in New Zealand last year.

headlines: Rohit Sharma becomes 14th Indian cricketer to play 200 ODIs
text: Stand-in captain Rohit Sharma has become the 14th Indian cricketer to play 200 ODIs, achieving the feat after taking the field against New Zealand in fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday. The 31-year-old had made his ODI debut on June 23, 2007, against Ireland in Belfast. Rohit scored 7,799 runs in his first 199 ODIs at an average of 48.14.

headlines: 2 seat cushions from 'missing plane carrying footballer' found
text: Investigators searching for a lost plane carrying Argentine forward Emiliano Sala found two seat cushions on French coast that "likely" belonged to the aircraft. The investigators said they'll now launch an underwater seabed search for aircraft wreckage. The Cardiff City footballer was travelling from France's Nantes to Wales' Cardiff when his plane disappeared over English Channel on January 21.

headlines: SBI left banking data of millions of users unprotected: Report
text: A TechCrunch report has claimed that Indias largest bank SBI secured a passwordless server "overnight" on being alerted it allowed anyone to access phone numbers, bank balances, and transactions of millions of its customers. The Mumbai-based server was containing two months of data from SBI Quick, an SMS and call-based system used to request basic information about accounts, TechCrunch revealed.

headlines: CM Parrikar under pressure from PM after our Goa meet: Rahul
text: Rahul Gandhi has replied to Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's letter, which accused the Congress President of using his "visit to an ailing man for political gains". "He's under immense pressure from the PM after our meeting and needs to demonstrate his loyalty by attacking me," Gandhi wrote in his letter. Parrikar had clarified he didn't discuss Rafale deal with Rahul.

headlines: AgustaWestland scam accused Rajiv Saxena extradited to India
text: AgustaWestland chopper scam co-accused Rajiv Saxena was extradited to India from UAE on Wednesday. He had been evading the Enforcement Directorate's summons claiming he was suffering from leukaemia but had moved an anti-money laundering court for anticipatory bail in December, stating he had never been summoned at his Dubai address. Saxena's lawyers alleged he had been "illegally extradited".

headlines: Pakistan holds 'keys to war': Afghanistan
text: Afghan President Ashraf Ghani has said the "keys to war" are in Pakistan's Islamabad, Quetta and Rawalpindi, accusing the country of providing safe havens to militants, including those belonging to the Taliban. Ghani added the "key to peace was in Afghanistan". His comments came amid the talks between the US and the Taliban to end the 17-year war in Afghanistan.

headlines: Insurance agent 'Lord Voldemort' jailed for threatening clients
text: A Singapore-based insurance agent has been jailed for two years and five months for threatening to harm his clients unless they paid him in bitcoins. The 36-year-old set up an email account, and signed the messages as 'Lord Voldemort', a fictional character from the Harry Potter series. Ye Lin Myint targeted about 33 people, including those who cancelled insurance policies.

headlines: Shocked, hurt by ICICI's decision, truth will prevail: Kochhar
text: Ex-ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar said she's "utterly disappointed, hurt and shocked" by the bank's decision to terminate her. Kochhar said she served ICICI for 34 years with utmost honesty and integrity and that ultimately truth will prevail. Adding that she hasn't been given a copy of the independent probe report, Kochhar said none of ICICI's credit decisions are unilateral

headlines: Fashion brand H&M hires Facebook data scandal whistleblower
text: Swedish multinational fast-fashion brand Hennes & Mauritz AB (H&M) has hired Christopher Wylie, the whistleblower who exposed Facebook's Cambridge Analytica data scandal. Wylies focus will be to help get better insights on customers, products and markets and support work on sustainable and ethical artificial intelligence, H&M spokesperson said. Wylie is a former employee of Cambridge Analytica.

headlines: Samsung builds world's first 1TB storage chip for smartphones
text: Samsung has started mass producing its one terabyte 'embedded Universal Flash Storage (eUFS) 2.1' technology for "use in next-generation mobile applications", which it claims is the industry's first such eUFS. The company added the new eUFS will let smartphones store 260 10-minute videos shot in 4K UHD format. It'll be sized the same as the previous 512GB version, Samsung said.

headlines: People with 'negative mindset' quizzing pro-poor schemes: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the people with 'negative mindset' are questioning him and his government for floating pro-poor schemes. He added negative mindset people are raising doubts about schemes such as building toilets and providing free gas connections to the poor. He further said that negative mentality laced with a vested interest still exists in the country.

headlines: 13 booked for firing air shots at Mahatma Gandhi's effigy
text: The police on Wednesday registered cases against 13 persons, including a woman leader of Hindu Mahasabha, in Aligarh for firing at an effigy of Mahatma Gandhi with an air pistol. "The incident took place in a house in Naurangabad locality of the city," Senior Superintendent of Police said. The video of the event went viral on social media, he added.

headlines: Railway police rescues woman with leg stuck in train toilet
text: Railway police has rescued a woman travelling on a train in Chennai who got her leg stuck inside the commode of a toilet. After being caught inside the commode hole, she struggled to remove her leg and following failed attempts, she shouted for help, reports said. Railway police used a cutter to pry open the commode and freed her leg.

headlines: US begins sending back asylum seekers to Mexico
text: The US on Tuesday began returning asylum seekers to Mexico, sending back a migrant from a Central American nation and called the move a "response to the illegal migration crisis" faced by it. Under its Migrant Protection Protocols policy, the US will return certain migrants who cross into the country illegally back to Mexico while their asylum requests are processed.

headlines: Boeing sales cross $100bn for 1st time in its 102-yr history
text: US-based Boeing on Wednesday reported annual sales worth $101.12 billion in 2018, the first time the planemaker's sales crossed the $100-billion mark in its 102-year history. The company said it expects to deliver between 895 and 905 commercial aircraft in 2019. Boeing retained its position as the world's largest planemaker for the seventh straight year, delivering 806 aircraft in 2018.

headlines: OnePlus named bestselling premium smartphone brand of 2018: Report
text: OnePlus has emerged as India's best-selling premium smartphone brand of 2018, as per a report by Counterpoint. It captured 36% of the market share in the premium segment, in Q4 2018. Further, its OnePlus 6 emerged as the highest selling premium smartphone of 2018 followed by OnePlus 6T.

headlines: Can never look at female body, even if naked, in vulgar way: Pooja
text: Filmmaker Pooja Bhatt, while talking about the presentation of women in her films, said, "I can never look at a female body, even if it's naked, in a vulgar manner." "Our audience can say...the women in my films are bold or sensual, but never ever vulgar," she added. Pooja further said her censor board is her "own heart and mind".

headlines: Kangana made fake promises to cast: 'Manikarnika' actress Mishti
text: Actress Mishti, who has featured in 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', has said the film's co-director Kangana Ranaut made false promises to the cast. "Kangana had said, 'I want dates because all characters look jumbled up...I'm trying my best to give everybody a prominent space on screen.' After watching the movie, there is no scope for other characters," Mishti added.

headlines: Banned for 4 matches, Sarfaraz shares 'log hai na' poem for critics
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, who has been banned for four matches over racist remarks, took an apparent dig at his critics by sharing a video of a child reciting 'log hai na' poem on Twitter. "Pyaar karna hai to khud se kar...dushmani karne ke liye log hai na," the poem read. "This is how the world is," Sarfaraz wrote.

headlines: Confessed to spot-fixing to escape police torture: Sreesanth to SC
text: Banned cricketer Sreesanth has told Supreme Court he initially confessed to Delhi Police about his alleged involvement in 2013 IPL spot-fixing scandal to escape continuous police torture. Sreesanth further said the bookie tried dragging him into spot-fixing but he didn't fall for it. Citing Sreesanth not informing BCCI about fixing approach, the apex court said Sreesanth's conduct "wasn't good".

headlines: Woman rejects job after CEO bullies her in interview; he apologises
text: A 22-year-old writer turned down a job offer, claiming she was bullied to the point of tears during her two-hour interview by a UK company's CEO. Olivia Bland added the "brutal" interview brought back painful memories of her abusive relationship. "I am so sorry that anyone has been hurt, it is never my intent," Web Applications CEO Craig Dean replied.

headlines: US intelligence naive and wrong, should go back to school: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday called his country's top intelligence chiefs "naive" and "wrong" on Iran and added that they should perhaps "go back to school". Trump claimed Iran is testing rockets, calling the country "a source of potential danger and conflict". Top US intelligence officials on Tuesday said that Iran isn't currently taking steps towards building nuclear weapons.

headlines: Qatar to invest $200 million in Airtel Africa
text: Airtel on Wednesday said that Qatar's sovereign wealth fund Qatar Investment Authority will invest $200 million through a primary equity issuance in Airtel Africa. India's second-largest telecom operator's Africa unit recently raised $1.25 billion from six investors. Airtel Africa, the holding company for Airtel's operations in 14 African countries, is preparing for an initial public offering.

headlines: Rohit Shetty still working on script for Golmaal 5: Shreyas
text: Actor Shreyas Talpade said that 'Golmaal' filmmaker Rohit Shetty is still working on the script for the fifth instalment of the 'Golmaal' film franchise. "He was telling us the other day that he...cracked some story. Once he's done with the...scripting, he'll take a call, the actor added. The series features Shreyas along with Ajay Devgn, Arshad Warsi and Tusshar Kapoor.

headlines: Yami Gautam felicitated by BSF for performance in 'Uri...'
text: Yami Gautam was felicitated by Border Security Force (BSF) in Amritsar for her performance in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'. "BSF is the first line of defence of our country and it gives me...pride to have met them," Yami said. The film, which also stars Vicky Kaushal, is based on the Indian Army's surgical strike operation which took place in 2016.

headlines: Facebook hires its privacy critic as privacy policy manager
text: Social media giant Facebook has hired privacy critic Nate Cardozo, formerly the top legal counsel for US privacy watchdog EFF, as a privacy policy manager for WhatsApp. Cardozo had called Facebook a "faceless corporation" whose business model depends on user's confusion and indifference about privacy, in October 2015. Facebook has also hired attorney Robyn Greene as its privacy policy manager.

headlines: Apple to cut some iPhones' prices outside US over strong dollar
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook said the company plans to lower some iPhones' prices in markets with currencies that weakened against the US dollar in the past year. "Weve decided to go back to (iPhone prices) more commensurate with...local prices...a year ago," Cook added. The price cuts, in hopes of increasing sales, are reportedly occurring for second time in 12 years.

headlines: Twitter testing news-first timeline feature on Android
text: Micro-blogging platform Twitter is testing a new feature on Android to put news on the top of a user's timeline. "With this update, were making it easier for people to see news and stories their followers have been discussing," Product Manager Walter Gurzynski said. The feature comes alongside a prompt saying, "Catch up on what's happened while you were away."

headlines: Scientists test wetsuit to protect wearer after shark attack
text: Scientists in Australia's Flinders University are testing a wetsuit prototype that could protect its wearer after a shark attack. The suit, made of synthetic material similar to the material used in bulletproof vests, could help reduce blood loss after a shark attack. "The majority of fatalities from shark bites is due to blood loss...shock from blood loss," a scientist said.

headlines: Come armed with sticks for PM Modi's rally in WB: BJP leader
text: BJP National Secretary Rahul Sinha on Wednesday asked the party workers in West Bengal to come armed with sticks to PM Narendra Modi's rally in the state on February 2. His statement came a day after clashes broke out following BJP chief Amit Shah's WB rally. Sinha added the TMC is indulged in violence as they're afraid of BJP's strength.

headlines: '4B' for Opposition is 'Bua-Bhatija-Bhai-Behen': Amit Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday took a dig at the Opposition parties saying that the 'mahagathbandhan' for the Opposition is 4B - "Bua-Bhatija-Bhai-Behen". He added that 4B for the BJP meant "Badhta Bharat, Banta Bharat". He said Opposition's government cannot take the country ahead and "only Modiji can provide a 'mazboot' (strong) government".

headlines: Volkswagen retains top spot in global sales, beats Toyota
text: German automaker Volkswagen Group has retained the car industry's top spot in global sales, beating its Japanese rival Toyota. Volkswagen's sales, including its MAN and Scania heavy trucks and buses, rose 0.9% to 10.83 million in 2018, the company had said. Toyota came second with around 10.6 million deliveries, including its affiliated brands Daihatsu and Hino, in 2018.

headlines: Plot, treason by Nissan executives led to my arrest: Ghosn
text: Ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn has said his arrest over alleged financial misconduct was led by "plot and treason" by the Japanese carmaker's executives who opposed its deeper integration with Renault and Mitsubishi. Ghosn added he had discussed the integration plans with Nissan's CEO in September, a month before his arrest. He further said he wouldn't flee if granted bail.

headlines: Govt cuts customs duty on electric vehicle parts to 10-15%
text: The government has cut down customs duty on import of parts and components for electric vehicles to 10-15%, down from the previous 15-30%. The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs said disassembled parts will attract 10% duty, whereas 15% will be levied on pre-assembled packs. However, fully built electric vehicles will continue to attract 25% import duty.

headlines: Swine flu outbreak kills 76 in Rajasthan
text: Government officials on Wednesday said that a swine flu outbreak has killed 76 people this year in Rajasthan. Colder weather has worsened the seasonal outbreak of the H1N1 virus in the country, officials added. Rajasthan recorded more than a third of all swine flu deaths in India with Jodhpur being the worst affected area in the state, officials said.

headlines: N Korea unlikely to give up nuclear weapons: US intelligence chief
text: North Korea is "unlikely to completely give up its nuclear weapons and production capabilities", Director of US' National Intelligence, Daniel Coats, said. "North Korean leaders view nuclear arms as critical to regime survival," he added. His statements come despite North Korea's agreement with the US at the Singapore summit last year to denuclearise the Korean Peninsula.

headlines: Jet Airways denies being told to ground aircraft
text: Jet Airways on Wednesday denied it was directed by GE Capital Aviation Services to ground its aircraft due to non-payment of dues. The airline said it's in the process of delivering three aircraft to lessors due to the expiry of lease terms. Further, three aircraft have been temporarily grounded to carry out an engine normalisation exercise, it added.

headlines: ICICI fires Chanda Kochhar, to take back bonuses paid in last 9 yrs
text: Retired Justice Srikrishna's enquiry panel has found that ex-CEO Chanda Kochhar violated ICICI Bank's code of conduct. The bank said it'll treat Kochhar's exit as termination and will take back all bonuses paid to her from April 2009 until March 2018. The CBI recently filed a case against Kochhar, her husband, and Videocon MD in the ICICI-Videocon loan case.

headlines: Malinga's wife targets Perera on Facebook, he seeks board's help
text: Sri Lanka all-rounder Thisara Perera has written to Sri Lanka Cricket CEO Ashley de Silva, asking the board to intervene after ODI captain Lasith Malinga's wife Tanya targeted him on Facebook. Tanya accused Perera of meeting country's Sports Minister to secure his place in the team. "We've become laughing stock of whole country...because of one person's personal vendetta," Perera wrote.

headlines: Ex-cricketer Martin out of ICU after being on ventilator for a month
text: Ex-India cricketer Jacob Martin has been shifted to general ward from the ICU after being on a ventilator for nearly a month following a road accident, wherein he severely injured his lungs. Martin's wife Khyati mentioned there are chances that Jacob will be in hospital for two more months. BCCI, CSK and various cricketers provided financial assistance for Martin's treatment.

headlines: Don't use visit to ailing man for political gains: Goa CM to Rahul
text: Goa CM and ex-Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar has written a letter to Congress President Rahul Gandhi over his claim that Parrikar told him he has nothing to do with new Rafale deal. Parrikar wrote, "Kindly do not use your visit to an ailing person to feed political opportunism." In their five-minute meeting, they didn't discuss anything about Rafale, he added.

headlines: PM Modi stops speech after cameraman faints, asks officers to help
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stopped his speech at the inauguration of the new terminal building at Surat airport after observing that a cameraman had fainted. PM Modi then asked his officers to urgently arrange for an ambulance for the cameraman. "It's good that PM was paying attention to his surroundings during his speech," the cameraman later said from a hospital.

headlines: Couple divorces minutes after marriage as families fight over lunch
text: A couple got divorced minutes after their wedding ceremony got over in Gujarat's Gondal as a disagreement broke out and relatives from both sides started throwing dishes at each other during lunch. The advocates representing both sides arrived at the marriage hall and got the couple divorced within minutes. The couple even reportedly returned the gifts exchanged during the ceremony.

headlines: Minister praises rape-convict Asaram over Matru-Pitru Divas
text: Gujarat Education Minister Bhupendrasinh Chudasma has written a congratulatory message to a yoga ashram run by rape-convict Asaram's organisation for observing February 14 as "Matru-Pitru Pujan Divas" (Mother-Father worship day). After the Congress termed the letter as "unfortunate", saying it "shows the nexus between BJP and godman", Chudasma clarified, "All I have done is sent best wishes."

headlines: Vatican priest handling sex abuse cases quits over alleged sex abuse
text: A senior priest at the Vatican who handled cases of sexual abuse has quit after being accused of sexual abuse by a former nun. The accused priest claimed he is innocent and said he would consider taking legal action. The Vatican said in a statement that a Church investigation of the case was underway.

headlines: 1,000 kg banned plastic seized from Saravana Bhavan in Chennai
text: Tamil Nadu food safety officials on Wednesday raided and seized 1,000 kgs of banned plastic items from Hotel Saravana Bhavan in Chennai's Vadapalani. Officials began a surprise check in the branch at 8 am. The state government had banned single-use plastics from January 1 and said the banned items should be handed over at the offices of the city corporation.

headlines: Whoever invented marriage was creepy as hell: Sushmita posts joke
text: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram to share a joke on the subject of marriage. "Whoever invented marriage was creepy as hell. Like I love you so much Im gonna get the government involved so you cant leave," Sushmita's post read. "This is an insult to [the] beauty of marriage," an Instagram user commented on her post.

headlines: Actress Patralekhaa to make her Kannada film debut
text: Actress Patralekhaa will make her debut in the Kannada film industry with the action-comedy film 'Where is my Kannadaka?' "I can definitely say that its a kind of role that I havent portrayed on screen so far and that makes it special for me," the actress said in a statement. Shooting for the film will reportedly begin in April.

headlines: Actor Karanvir Bohra detained in Russia over passport damage
text: Television actor Karanvir Bohra, who flew to Russia on Tuesday to attend a film festival, has been detained in Moscow due to passport damage. "They [are] contemplating to deport me back to India," the actor wrote on Twitter. The Indian embassy in Russia's capital responded to his tweet and said that they were looking into the issue.

headlines: If I don't get an award, that award is at loss: SRK
text: While speaking about winning awards for his films, Shah Rukh Khan said, "If I don't get an award, that award is at a loss." "Sometimes, the prestige of an award increases when I receive it," the actor jokingly added. Shah Rukh further said that he was "extremely ambitious" but in a "fair manner".

headlines: Trolling has become the norm on social media: Vaani
text: Actress Vaani Kapoor said that trolling has become a norm on social media, adding, "There's no one who hasn't got trolled on social media." "Everybody is out there to pull the other person down but it'll only bother [you] if you let it bother you," Vaani added. She further said, social media offers a platform "where people enjoy belittling everybody".

headlines: Shamita Shetty abused, driver slapped after accident: Report
text: Actress Shamita Shetty was verbally abused and her driver was slapped in an incident of road rage in Mumbai on Tuesday, as per reports. The incident reportedly took place after a motorist who was accompanied by two friends, rammed his vehicle into Shamita's car. The men allegedly manhandled and threatened Shamita's driver when he stepped out to inspect the damage.

headlines: Gmail faces temporary global outage, users face '404 error'
text: Gmail on Tuesday faced a global outage, which also affected India, wherein certain users complained they faced a '404 error' message while trying to sign-in to their accounts.
